_meta.description: World of Darkness Nature/Demeanor Archetypes - merged from all gamelines
_meta.nature: The character's true inner self; determines Willpower recovery
_meta.demeanor: The face shown to the world; may differ from Nature
_meta.note: All archetypes can be used in any WoD game. Some originated in specific gamelines but are universally applicable.

Architect.description: You seek to create something of lasting value. You build legacies.
Architect.willpower: Regain when you create or establish something of lasting importance.

Autocrat.description: You must be in charge. Power and control define your existence.
Autocrat.willpower: Regain when you achieve a position of significant leadership or authority.

Bon Vivant.description: Life is for pleasure and enjoyment. You live in the moment.
Bon Vivant.willpower: Regain when you truly enjoy yourself and can express that pleasure.

Bravo.description: Strength is all that matters. Might makes right.
Bravo.willpower: Regain when you achieve a goal through force or intimidation.

Capitalist.description: Everything has a price. Money and resources are power.
Capitalist.willpower: Regain when you close an important deal or acquire valuable resources.

Caregiver.description: You protect and comfort others. You need to be needed.
Caregiver.willpower: Regain when you successfully protect or nurture someone.

Celebrant.description: Your passion consumes you. Whether art, battle, or study, enthusiasm sustains you.
Celebrant.willpower: Regain when you pursue your passion and achieve something meaningful.

Chameleon.description: You adapt to every situation, becoming whoever you need to be.
Chameleon.willpower: Regain when you successfully adopt a necessary new persona.

Child.description: You are immature in personality, preferring to have others care for you.
Child.willpower: Regain when someone takes care of you or protects you.

Competitor.description: Every situation is a challenge. You live for victory.
Competitor.willpower: Regain when you win a significant competition.

Conformist.description: You follow the strongest leader. You support others' causes.
Conformist.willpower: Regain when your group achieves a goal due to your support.

Conniver.description: Others exist to do your work. Why get your hands dirty?
Conniver.willpower: Regain when you trick someone into doing what you want.

Creep Show.description: You shock and disgust others with transgressive behavior.
Creep Show.willpower: Regain when you successfully shock or horrify someone.

Curmudgeon.description: Everything is flawed and people are fools. You criticize everything.
Curmudgeon.willpower: Regain when someone follows your cynical advice and it proves correct.

Deviant.description: You reject mainstream morality. You don't fit in and don't want to.
Deviant.willpower: Regain when your unconventional approach succeeds.

Director.description: You organize and direct, bringing order from chaos.
Director.willpower: Regain when you organize a group to accomplish a goal.

Enigma.description: Your actions are bizarre and inexplicable to everyone except yourself.
Enigma.willpower: Regain when someone discovers purpose in your strange behavior.

Explorer.description: You must see what's over the next horizon.
Explorer.willpower: Regain when you discover something new and significant.

Eye of the Storm.description: Chaos follows you despite your calm appearance.
Eye of the Storm.willpower: Regain when you survive a crisis you inadvertently caused.

Fanatic.description: Your cause consumes your existence. The end justifies any means.
Fanatic.willpower: Regain when you accomplish something that advances your cause.

Gallant.description: You live for attention and glory. You're always center stage.
Gallant.willpower: Regain when you impress someone or are the center of attention.

Guardian.description: You protect those who cannot protect themselves.
Guardian.willpower: Regain when you protect someone from danger.

Guru.description: You have wisdom to share. Others should benefit from your enlightenment.
Guru.willpower: Regain when someone benefits significantly from your advice.

Idealist.description: You believe the world can be better and work to make it so.
Idealist.willpower: Regain when your idealistic actions make a real difference.

Innovator.description: You create new things and ideas. Novelty drives you.
Innovator.willpower: Regain when you create something genuinely new or find a novel solution.

Jester.description: Life is absurd, so laugh at it. Humor is your weapon.
Jester.willpower: Regain when you lighten a tense situation with humor.

Judge.description: You seek to improve systems through rational analysis and fair judgment.
Judge.willpower: Regain when you solve a problem rationally or unite dissenting parties.

Leader.description: You command and others follow. Leadership is your calling.
Leader.willpower: Regain when your leadership results in achieving a significant goal.

Loner.description: You walk alone by choice. You need no one.
Loner.willpower: Regain when you accomplish something significant on your own.

Martyr.description: You suffer so others don't have to. Sacrifice defines you.
Martyr.willpower: Regain when you sacrifice yourself for your beliefs or others.

Masochist.description: You test yourself through pain and hardship.
Masochist.willpower: Regain when you endure significant hardship for your cause.

Monster.description: You are inhuman and embrace it. Your nature is dark.
Monster.willpower: Regain when you horrify others with your monstrous nature.

Pedagogue.description: You must teach and help others learn.
Pedagogue.willpower: Regain when you teach someone something significant.

Penitent.description: You have sinned and must atone. Guilt drives you.
Penitent.willpower: Regain when you make amends for a past transgression.

Perfectionist.description: Nothing is good enough unless it's flawless.
Perfectionist.willpower: Regain when you accomplish something with flair or complete a task perfectly.

Rebel.description: You defy authority for the sake of defiance.
Rebel.willpower: Regain when your rebellion against authority is successful.

Rogue.description: You look out for number one. Others are tools or obstacles.
Rogue.willpower: Regain when your self-interested approach achieves a significant goal.

Sage.description: You seek knowledge above all else.
Sage.willpower: Regain when you learn something important or share valuable knowledge.

Scientist.description: You understand through methodical study and experimentation.
Scientist.willpower: Regain when a hypothesis is confirmed or you make a discovery.

Soldier.description: You follow orders and fulfill your duty.
Soldier.willpower: Regain when you fulfill a difficult order or complete your mission.

Survivor.description: No matter what, you endure. You will not give up.
Survivor.willpower: Regain when you survive a dangerous situation through tenacity.

Thrill-Seeker.description: You live for danger and excitement.
Thrill-Seeker.willpower: Regain when you succeed against overwhelming odds.

Traditionalist.description: The old ways are best. Change is dangerous.
Traditionalist.willpower: Regain when tradition proves its worth or you preserve something important.

Trickster.description: Laughter heals all wounds. You use humor to make points.
Trickster.willpower: Regain when your prank or joke makes a meaningful impact.

Visionary.description: You see a future others cannot. You work toward that goal.
Visionary.willpower: Regain when you convince others to follow your vision.

Archivist.description: You collect and preserve valuable information and resources.
Archivist.willpower: Regain when you acquire, preserve, or catalog something of value.

Consolidator.description: You unite disparate elements into coherent wholes.
Consolidator.willpower: Regain when you successfully merge or unify competing interests.

Consumer.description: You acquire and consume. Possession is meaning.
Consumer.willpower: Regain when you acquire something desirable or indulge significantly.

Entrepreneur.description: You create value through ventures and enterprises.
Entrepreneur.willpower: Regain when a venture succeeds or you create new value.

Hoarder.description: You keep everything. You never know what might be useful.
Hoarder.willpower: Regain when something you hoarded proves valuable.

Mogul.description: You build empires. Scale is everything.
Mogul.willpower: Regain when your holdings or influence expand significantly.

Nepotist.description: Family and inner circle come first. Loyalty is rewarded.
Nepotist.willpower: Regain when you advance a family member or close ally.

Steward.description: You manage and preserve what's entrusted to you.
Steward.willpower: Regain when you successfully preserve or grow something in your care.

Dilettante.description: You dabble in everything but master nothing by choice.
Dilettante.willpower: Regain when your broad knowledge proves unexpectedly useful.

_meta.description: World of Darkness Core Abilities - shared across all gamelines
_meta.allocation: Prioritize categories as Primary (13), Secondary (9), Tertiary (5)
_meta.note: All WoD 20th Anniversary games use these 30 primary abilities

talents.description: Intuitive abilities that cannot be taught, only learned through practice. No penalty for untrained use.

Alertness.description: Noticing things that go on around you, even when not actively looking

Athletics.description: Basic athletic ability, training in sports or rigorous activities

Awareness.description: Instinctual reaction to the presence of the supernatural

Empathy.description: Understanding the emotions and motivations of others

Expression.description: Getting your point across clearly through conversation, writing, or art

Intimidation.description: Coercing others through threats, force of personality, or physical presence

Leadership.description: Inspiring and directing others, presenting yourself as someone to follow

Streetwise.description: Understanding urban environments, crime, and underground culture

Subterfuge.description: Concealing your own motives and uncovering others' hidden agendas

skills.description: Abilities learned through training and practice. +1 difficulty if no rating in a Skill.

Animal Ken.description: Understanding animal behavior, training and calming beasts

Drive.description: Operating vehicles including cars, motorcycles, and boats

Etiquette.description: Knowing proper behavior in social situations

Firearms.description: Using guns and ranged weapons effectively

Larceny.description: Physical manipulation associated with criminal activity

Performance.description: Artistic endeavors like singing, dancing, acting, or playing instruments

Stealth.description: Avoiding detection while hiding or moving

Survival.description: Living off the land and enduring harsh conditions

knowledges.description: Academic and intellectual pursuits requiring study. +1 difficulty if no rating in a Knowledge.

Academics.description: General education in humanities, social sciences, and liberal arts

Computer.description: Programming, hacking, and understanding computer systems

Finance.description: Understanding money, markets, and economic systems

Investigation.description: Finding clues, analyzing evidence, and solving mysteries

Law.description: Understanding legal systems, codes, and procedures

Medicine.description: Understanding how bodies work, healing, and diagnosis

Occult.description: Knowledge of mysticism, curses, magic, folklore, and supernatural lore

game_notes.W20: Spirit Lore, Garou Lore, Wyrm Lore

Politics.description: Understanding political systems and power structures

Technology.description: Understanding electronics, hardware, and sophisticated devices

_meta.description: World of Darkness Universal Backgrounds - shared across all gamelines
_meta.allocation: 5 dots for most characters; M20 mages get 7 dots
_meta.note: These backgrounds appear in all WoD 20th Anniversary games with identical or near-identical mechanics

Allies.description: Mortals or supernaturals who aid and support you

levels.2: Two allies or one influential ally
levels.3: Three allies or one powerful ally
levels.4: Four allies or two powerful allies
levels.5: Five allies or major support network

Allies.note: Allies have their own motivations and may not always be available

levels.1: One minor contact in one area
levels.2: A small network in one area
levels.3: Multiple areas or one major contact

Contacts.note: Contacts provide information, not direct assistance

Fame.description: Recognition and renown in mortal society
Fame.note: Fame can be a double-edged sword, making anonymity difficult

Influence.description: Pull within mortal institutions and organizations

levels.3: Broad influence or major pull in one area
levels.4: Vast influence or control of one area

Mentor.description: An experienced teacher who guides and advises you

levels.1: Mentor is available occasionally, of modest power
levels.4: Mentor is usually available, very powerful
levels.5: Mentor is nearly always available, elder/archmage level

Mentor.note: Higher-level mentors may have more demands or expectations

extended_levels.note: M20's Rich Bastard's Guide allows Resources 6-10 (XP only)

game_notes.M20: Retainers may be acolytes or consors
game_notes.C20: Retainers may be enchanted mortals or Kinain

_meta.description: True Faith mechanics shared across World of Darkness gamelines
_meta.acquisition: True Faith is rare and cannot be purchased with freebies or XP initially. It must be acquired through roleplay or with Storyteller permission as a Merit.
_meta.note: True Faith represents genuine, profound religious conviction - not mere belief

ratings.1: Strong faith - can sense supernatural evil, +1 to resist supernatural mental control
ratings.2: Deep faith - can ward a room against supernatural creatures for a scene
ratings.3: Devout faith - can repel supernatural creatures (contested Willpower)
ratings.4: Holy conviction - can cause supernatural creatures to flee, presence damages some
ratings.5: Saintly faith - miracles become possible, devastating to supernatural evil

general_effects.ward: Can ward an area with prayer (difficulty based on creature's power)
general_effects.resist: Add True Faith rating to rolls to resist supernatural mental influence
general_effects.sense: Can sense the presence of supernatural evil (Perception + True Faith)
general_effects.repel: Contested Willpower vs creature to force them to retreat
general_effects.damage: At high levels, presence may cause actual damage to some creatures

effects: Vampires must make Willpower roll (diff 9) to approach
Brandished holy symbol forces vampires to flee (Courage roll, diff = Faith rating + 3)
Rating 4+: Touch causes 1 aggravated damage per turn to vampires
Rating 5: May gain actual miraculous powers
Reduces effectiveness of Gifts targeting the faithful
Can perceive and resist Wyrm corruption
May affect Banes and spirits of corruption
High Faith can ward against spiritual possession
Functions as a form of Countermagick against some effects
Can resist Mind and Spirit effects
May perceive Resonance related to religious matters
Acts as mystical protection against some supernatural creatures
Can sense and resist wraith powers
Wards may prevent wraith entry
Can assist in exorcisms
High Faith provides protection against possession
Can perceive chimerical reality
Provides resistance to some Arts
May affect Thallain and dark fae
Faith-based cold iron effects may be enhanced

general: True Faith requires genuine belief - hypocrisy weakens or destroys it
Faith is tested by the Storyteller through moral challenges
Killing, even in self-defense, may require atonement
Faith must be actively practiced through prayer, ritual, etc.
incompatibilities: Generally incompatible with being a supernatural creature (vampires, werewolves, mages, etc.)
Ghouls and other 'half' supernaturals may have limited access
Faith that conflicts with one's nature creates dramatic tension

acquisition_notes.at_creation: Requires Storyteller approval and compelling backstory
acquisition_notes.in_play: May be earned through profound religious experiences and consistent roleplay
acquisition_notes.loss: True Faith can be lost through immoral actions, crisis of faith, or failure to practice

_meta.description: World of Darkness Core Attributes - shared across all gamelines
_meta.allocation: Prioritize categories as Primary (7), Secondary (5), Tertiary (3)
_meta.note: All WoD 20th Anniversary games use identical attributes

physical.description: Raw physical capabilities - strength, agility, endurance

Strength.description: Raw physical power: lifting, carrying, pushing, punching

Stamina.description: Toughness, endurance, and ability to absorb damage

Charisma.description: Natural charm, leadership, and social grace

Manipulation.description: Ability to convince, deceive, or influence others

levels.0: Hideous: Nosferatu, some Samedi, Harbingers of Skulls

game_notes.V20: Nosferatu, Samedi, Harbingers of Skulls have Appearance 0
game_notes.W20: Crinos form imposes social penalties regardless of Appearance
game_notes.Wr20: Wraiths may have varying Appearance based on death circumstances

Wits.description: Quick thinking, reaction, and common sense

_meta.description: World of Darkness Umbral Structure - unified cosmology across all gamelines
_meta.note: The Dreaming (C20) is connected but separate from this structure

overview.description: The Umbra is the spirit world that exists alongside material reality. Different games focus on different regions.
overview.structure: Three major Umbrae plus peripheral realms, all connected through the Gauntlet/Shroud

middle_umbra.description: The realm of spirits, nature, and concepts. Most spirits dwell here.

penumbra.description: The reflection of the physical world. Urban areas show Weaver influence; wilderness shows Wyld.

near_realms.description: Distinct pocket dimensions with their own rules.

CyberRealm.note: Same place as M20's Digital Web

Pangaea.theme: Prehistoric Earth, ancient beasts, primordial nature

Malfeas.theme: Heart of corruption, domain of Maeljin Incarnae

Arcadia Gateway.theme: Border of the Dreaming, fae connection

deep_umbra.description: The vast darkness between realms. Dangerous and alien.

high_umbra.description: The realm of thought, concept, and abstraction. Ideas have substance here.

vulgate.description: The 'surface' of the Astral, shaped by mortal dreams and beliefs

courts.description: Organized realms of specific concepts or philosophies

epiphamies.description: Pure conceptual realms beyond normal comprehension

spirit_naming.note: High Umbra spirits may use different rank names

dark_umbra.description: The realm of the dead. Where ghosts dwell and Oblivion waits.

shadowlands.description: The reflection of the living world as seen by the dead. Gray, cold, decaying.

tempest.description: The storm between worlds. Nihils open into it; Spectres dwell within.

far_shores.description: Realms created by belief in afterlives. Heavens, hells, and everything between.

labyrinth.description: The deepest layer before Oblivion itself. Where Spectres are born.

oblivion.description: The Void. The ultimate destruction. Not a place so much as an ending.
oblivion.note: Connection to the Wyrm is debated/ambiguous in source material

the_dreaming.relationship: Connected but distinct from the Umbra
the_dreaming.description: The realm of dreams, Glamour, and the fae. Not technically part of the Umbral structure.

layers.near_dreaming: Close to mortal dreams, relatively safe
layers.deep_dreaming: The most ancient and alien regions

connections.arcadia_gateway: Near Realm that borders the Dreaming
connections.trods: Ancient pathways that cross both Umbra and Dreaming

stepping_sideways.description: Crossing the Gauntlet to enter the Middle Umbra

moon_bridges.description: Safe passages between caerns, opened by spirits

spirit_travel.description: Using Spirit Sphere to traverse Umbral regions

projection.description: Sending consciousness into spiritual realms while body remains

_meta.description: World of Darkness Spirit Charms - merged from all gamelines
_meta.dice_pools: Usually Gnosis or Willpower vs difficulty 6

freebie_cost_rules.standard: 1 freebie per Essence needed to activate
freebie_cost_rules.special: 5 freebies if: no Essence cost, variable cost, luck-based, or always-on

Airt Sense.effect: Innate awareness of spirit paths and directions in the Umbra.

Re-Form.effect: Reconstruct after destruction. Time varies by spirit power. Cannot be prevented unless Essence is depleted.

common._note: Widely available to many spirit types

Armor.effect: +1 soak per Essence spent. Lasts one scene.

Blast.effect: Ranged attack dealing Gnosis in damage dice. Element/form matches spirit nature.

Cleanse.roll: Gnosis vs difficulty based on corruption
Cleanse.effect: Purify corruption, taint, or spiritual pollution. More severe corruption requires more Essence.

Create Element.effect: Conjure appropriate elemental matter. Amount scales with Essence. Must match spirit nature.

Healing.effect: Heal 1 health level per Essence spent. Aggravated may require Gnosis roll.

Materialize.effect: Gain physical form in material world. High cost, limited duration.

Peek.effect: Observe the physical world from the Umbra. Cannot interact.

Possession.effect: Enter and control a mortal host. Duration and control vary by successes.

Shapeshift.effect: Change physical form. Must remain within spirit's conceptual nature.

Swift Flight.effect: Enhanced movement speed in Umbra or physical world.

Tracking.effect: Follow a target's spiritual trail in Umbra or physical world.

Corruption.effect: Spread Wyrm taint to targets or locations.

Open Moon Bridge.effect: Create passage between caerns for travel.

Solidify Reality.effect: Reinforce Pattern, strengthen Gauntlet. Weaver spirits only.

Bad Luck Curse.effect: Each success changes one of target's next roll results into a 1. Signature power of black cats and ill-omen spirits.

Bargain.effect: Adds +2 difficulty to mage's subsequent bargaining/binding rolls for the scene.

Create Water.effect: Conjure water. 1 Essence = ~10 gallons; 10 Essence = small flood.

Deflect Harm.effect: Block incoming damage (any type). Each Essence blocks one health level that turn.

Disorient.effect: Target becomes lost even in familiar places. Lasts one hour per success.

False Wealth.effect: Makes worthless materials appear precious. Lasts ~1 hour. Technology not fooled.

Good Luck Charm.effect: Grant one reroll on any task. Must keep second result.

Jack In.effect: Access any internet-connected device remotely. Technological spirits only.

Mirage.effect: Conjure vivid illusions of sight and sound. No physical substance.

Mislead.effect: Scrambles decision-making. More successes = worse choices.

Plant Command.effect: Control plant and fungal life. Cumulative costs for duration, area, effects.

Sand Storm.effect: Create blinding sandstorm. Damage = 1 bashing per Rage dot.

Sand Swallow.effect: Opens ground to swallow target. Each success = 3 feet deeper.

Smoke Screen.effect: Conjure thick smoke or fog obscuring all vision including magical sight.

Spirit Gossip.effect: Travel into Umbra seeking information. Time varies by complexity.

Teleport.effect: Instant travel to any visited location. 10 self, 20 with passenger.

Umbraquake.effect: Disrupt local Umbral landscape. Can damage spirits or alter terrain.

Bane Protean.effect: Assume horrific forms beyond normal shapeshift.

Incite Frenzy.effect: Force Garou or other rage-users to frenzy.

Spirit Static.effect: Disrupt Umbral perception and spiritual senses.

Consume Essence.effect: Eat defeated spirits to absorb their Essence.

Calcify.effect: Trap target in Pattern Web. Target cannot act until freed.

storyteller_only._note: Cannot be purchased by player characters

Rouse the Dead.effect: Temporarily revive dead person. Revived being loses 3 dice from all pools and all magical abilities.

Wish Fulfillment.effect: Grant a single wish within spirit's power. Cannot affect Avatar, Arete, or Spheres.

_meta.description: World of Darkness Spirit Hierarchy - unified across all gamelines
_meta.essence_formula: Rage + Gnosis + Willpower (W20 formula, used as standard)
_meta.source: Combined from W20 Umbra: The Velvet Shadow and M20 Gods & Monsters
_meta.note: All WoD games use this hierarchy. Middle Umbra uses W20 naming, High Umbra uses M20 naming for highest rank.

gaffling.description: Simple spirits with animal-like intelligence. The wildlife of the spirit world.
gaffling.awareness: Limited. Perceive world through lens of their nature. 'What I do' equals 'what I am.'
gaffling.feeding: Attach to objects/places embodying their nature. Enter Slumber to conserve energy.
gaffling.purpose: Serve something larger without questioning. Obsessively uphold duty.

jaggling.description: Sapient spirits with thoughts, personalities, and agendas. The 'people' of the spirit world.
jaggling.awareness: Full sapience. Goals may differ from their superiors.
jaggling.feeding: Service, worship, active involvement in spiritual affairs. Less Slumber.
jaggling.purpose: Broader purview than Gafflings. Forest vs single tree. Military unit vs single weapon.
jaggling.promotion: Gafflings become Jagglings when their purview increases or they earn promotion from superiors.

incarna.description: Avatars of concepts, existing on multiple levels of reality simultaneously. Leaders of broods.
incarna.awareness: Vast. Experience multiple realities at once.
incarna.feeding: Direct embodiment of their concept. Worship from lesser spirits and shapeshifters.
incarna.purpose: Embody major concepts. Lead spirit broods. Patron totems of tribes and packs.

celestine.description: Cosmic entities of almost unimaginable power. Luna, Helios, Gaia herself.
celestine.awareness: Cosmic scale. May not notice individual mortals or even supernatural beings.
celestine.feeding: Universal forces. Celestial bodies. Fundamental aspects of reality.
celestine.purpose: Cosmic balance. Creation. The largest possible scale.
celestine.avatars: Send avatars (Incarna-level) to interact with lesser beings.

emanation.description: Spirits outside the normal hierarchy. Not born from impressions or broods.
emanation.origin: Spontaneous creation, cosmic accident, or unique circumstances.
emanation.notes: Do not fit neatly into Gaffling/Jaggling/Incarna progression.

rage.description: Capacity for violence and aggressive action
rage.use: Combat rolls, intimidation, resisting certain effects

willpower.use: Resisting control, contested rolls, maintaining form

broods.description: Spirit families descended from Incarnae, related by philosophy/nature rather than literal descent.
broods.structure: All descend from one or more Incarnae and ultimately from cosmic forces.
broods.loyalty: Even if they don't get along, brood members show proper respect to their Incarna.
broods.offense_consequences: Offending one brood member affects relations with entire brood.

game_specific_notes.W20: Primary game for spirit interaction. Garou have Spirit Gifts and can bind spirits into Fetishes.
game_specific_notes.M20: Mages interact with spirits via Spirit Sphere. High Umbra spirits may use 'Lord' or 'Preceptor' for Incarna rank.
game_specific_notes.Wr20: Spectres are NOT spirits - they are Shadow-consumed wraiths. Ancestor spirits are distinct from wraiths.
game_specific_notes.C20: Chimera are dream-spirits from the Dreaming, using similar mechanics but with Glamour instead of Gnosis.

_meta.description: Rotes from the Lore of the Traditions sourcebook, organized by Tradition

Blood for the Ghosts.description: This effect's name comes from classical Greek myth, but the practice of offering sacrifices and gifts to those already dead recurs in Celtic and African traditions too.
Blood for the Ghosts.effect: The mage offers up a sacrifice of fresh, warm human blood — or any other vessel for Quintessence — and calls forth ghosts or orisha from the world of the dead. The sacrifice makes them biddable, and in some traditions obedient, and a mage can converse or interact with them.
Blood for the Ghosts.benefits: Ghosts summoned with this ritual give information more freely, and sometimes without asking for anything in return.

materialization.effect: Causes a ghost to take material form

lie_detection.effect: Determines whether a spectral informant is lying

The Last Sacrifice.description: Death is not the end, only the beginning of the next stage. When an agent of the Wheel kills someone, they like to make sure it sticks and that their target doesn't linger as a ghost.
The Last Sacrifice.effect: This effect is most often a gesture of respect: a final gift to bid farewell to the spirit and send them on their way. The sacrifice ensures the target passes on properly rather than lingering as a ghost.

forms.greek: Coins for the ferryman placed on eyes or tongue
forms.hindu: Elaborate funeral rites and cremation of the body
forms.african: Gift of grave goods for interment with the corpse

The Last Sacrifice.interpretation: Some Euthanatoi understand it as a deal, or even a way of paying off an otherwise unquiet spirit.

Palimpsest.description: A Celestial Chorus rote involving layered prayers and sacred texts.

Prayer as an Instrument.description: Technical note on using Prayer as a focus instrument for Celestial Chorus workings.

Dismiss the Discordant.description: A Celestial Chorus rote for banishing disharmonious influences.

Dwennimmen.description: A Dreamspeaker rote based on Adinkra symbolism, specifically the ram's horns symbol representing humility and strength.

Bullet-Rider's Blessing.description: A protective rote used by Dreamspeakers, particularly those in dangerous urban environments or conflict zones.

instruments_new._note: New instruments introduced or expanded in Lore of the Traditions

qi_tools.description: Tools for manipulating qi/chi energy flow

mantras.description: Sounds with magickal properties, commonly associated with meditation
mantras.note: Over a billion variations exist across Eastern spiritual traditions

memories.description: For reincarnated Akashi, remembering how a past life performed a similar task. Requires specific focus and intent to sift through hundreds of years of history to find the right moment.
requirements: Must practice deliberate memory access techniques
Avatar serves as bridge between lives
memories.risks: Attempting without right mindset can result in failure or experiencing distracting/traumatic events
memories.benefit: Simplifies challenges from 'doing the impossible' to 'doing the impossible again'

sigils.description: Personal symbols charged with intent, used extensively by Cult of Ecstasy practitioners

money_as_instrument.description: Wealth and financial resources used as transformative instrument - 'Money, and Lots of It'

passionate_dreamers.description: Creative and artistic collaborators who serve as living instruments through their passionate engagement

augmented_reality_objects.description: AR overlays, spatial data, and tagged objects used for magickal workings

projects.First Sector: AR library for indigenous knowledge preservation
projects.Project Timmy: Remote laboratory work through AR projection

_meta.description: Rotes specific to Disparate Crafts

Devouring Gullet of Flame.description: The mage creates a spinning ring of fire that expands into a vortex, drawing victims toward its center.
Devouring Gullet of Flame.system: Target must roll Dexterity + Athletics (difficulty 7) versus mage's successes to escape the pull. Those who fail are drawn into the flames and take aggravated damage.

Groundswell.description: Command the earth beneath a target's feet. The ground can open into chasms, rise into pillars, or shift to unbalance foes.
Groundswell.system: Successes determine the magnitude of earth movement. Can create difficult terrain, damage structures, or trap opponents.

Imbue Item.description: Grant a crafted item limited autonomous movement and the ability to follow simple commands.
Imbue Item.system: The object must be the mage's own creation. Successes determine complexity of commands it can follow. Duration based on Arete.
Imbue Item.note: Object must be made by the mage, not purchased or found

Sha'ir's Sentence.description: Compose a poem or proclamation that bestows a nickname altering the target's fate. The name reflects and shapes their destiny.
Sha'ir's Sentence.system: Successes grant +1 or -1 die to rolls related to the nickname's meaning. Positive or negative at mage's choice. Lasts Arete rolls or end of chapter.

Riding the Rails.description: Travel through the Railroad — a network of doorways connecting Darkling sanctums across the world.
Riding the Rails.system: Touch a door in a Hollow sanctum and sense all available destinations. Can arrive 'when expected' or 'when no one is there' using Time component. Riders (couriers) use this to carry messages between sanctums.
Riding the Rails.coincidental: Only when inside a Hollow sanctum

Pule Pale.description: Protection chant invoking Laka, goddess of hula and the forest. Wards against harm and misfortune.
Pule Pale.system: Successes can be allocated to: warn of approaching harm, avoid harm (add to dodge/soak), or add botches to attacker's rolls.

Accelerate the Current.description: Invoke Paka'a, the wind god, to speed travel. The mage ignores the normal dangers of exceeding safe vehicle speed.
Accelerate the Current.system: Ignore difficulty penalties for traveling faster than a vehicle's safe speed. Duration is one journey.

Searching for the Lost Path.description: Invoke Wākea, the Sky Father, to perceive the path previously traveled by a target.
Searching for the Lost Path.system: Successes needed based on time since departure: 1 hour = 1, 1 day = 2, 1 week = 3, 1 month = 4, 1 year = 5. Used to track lost Wayfinders and stolen artifacts.

Godly Possession: Hua Tuo.description: Channel the divine physician Hua Tuo to enhance medical skill.
Godly Possession: Hua Tuo.system: +2 dice to Medicine rolls for the duration of one treatment or diagnosis.

Godly Possession: Guan Yu.description: Channel the martial god Guan Yu to enhance combat prowess.
Godly Possession: Guan Yu.system: For the duration of combat, enhance damage: bashing becomes lethal, or lethal becomes aggravated.

Qimen Dunjia.description: Ancient geomantic battlefield manipulation using wuxing (five elements) and bagua (eight trigrams).
Qimen Dunjia.system: Offensive application: -1 difficulty to combat rolls for allies. Defensive application: +1 difficulty for opponents. Cannot stack; choose one mode per scene.

Communion.description: Telepathic collaboration allowing multiple Batini to share thoughts and work together across time.
Communion.system: Connect minds of willing Batini for collaborative problem-solving. Time 3 allows including past insights of members who used the rote before. Correspondence 2 extends to members not physically present.

Traversing the Web of Faith.description: Travel through the Web of Faith — the network of Nodes and aqueducts connecting Batini worldwide.
Traversing the Web of Faith.system: Requires Web of Faith background to access. Higher Correspondence allows reaching more distant or restricted Nodes.

Base Transmutation.description: Transform simple material into similar substance — the classic lead-to-gold transformation.
Base Transmutation.system: Successes determine amount transmuted and duration. Simple substances only (elements, basic compounds).

Complex Transmutation.description: Transform complex materials, including alloys and compounds.
Complex Transmutation.system: As Base Transmutation but allows more complex transformations.

Sublime Transmutation.description: Create permanent transmutations or transform materials into substances with magical properties.
Sublime Transmutation.system: Permanent duration. Can create Tass or materials with special properties.

The White Queen's Kiss.description: Sleep-inducing powder, potion, or touch. Various forms for different levels of effectiveness.
The White Queen's Kiss.system: Mind 2: Target feels irresistible urge to sleep (can be resisted with Willpower). Mind 4: Instant command to sleep, no resistance. Life 3: Body chemistry changes to induce unconsciousness. Life 4: Irresistible physical transformation into sleep state.

Elixir of Youth.description: Slow or reverse aging through cellular regeneration or temporal manipulation.
Elixir of Youth.system: Life 3: Slow aging temporarily. Life 4: Halt aging for extended period. Time 3: Actually reverse cellular age. 5+ successes can grant the Unaging Merit permanently.

Wake the Red Lion.description: Boost vitality by awakening the Red Lion — the alchemical symbol of strength and passion.
Wake the Red Lion.system: Each success adds +1 dot to a chosen Physical Attribute for the duration. Life 4 allows boosting Mental or Social Attributes.

Grapevine.description: Ask general questions about a city and its inhabitants, reaching beyond your normal Contacts network.
Grapevine.system: Gain information as if you had Contacts 3-4 for the duration of one question. Time 2 extends answers to include 'later today or tomorrow.'

I'm Good.description: Shake off the effects of intoxication, illness, or fatigue.
I'm Good.system: Life 2: Reduce penalties from drugs, alcohol, minor illness. Life 3: Eliminate effects entirely or handle more severe conditions.

Subway Map of the Supernatural.description: Using a map and dowsing technique, detect supernatural residents and hotspots in an area.
Subway Map of the Supernatural.system: Base effect detects general supernatural presence. Additional Spheres pinpoint types: Spirit for ghosts/spirits, Life for shapeshifters/vampires, Matter for awakened objects or constructs.

Revelation.description: Share your Awakened perception with a Sleeper, giving them a glimpse of the magical world.
Revelation.system: Target temporarily perceives magic, spirits, or other hidden aspects of reality. Life version affects their senses directly; Mind version shares your perceptions.

Not Me.description: Make observers overlook you, even if their detection abilities are actively pinging your presence.
Not Me.system: Observers fail to notice or recognize you unless they succeed on a Perception + Awareness roll (difficulty = your successes + 4). Correspondence 3 extends to cameras and remote observation.

Bum a Meal.description: Make targets believe you've paid for goods or services.
Bum a Meal.system: Mind 2: Target believes they received payment and won't check. Mind 3: Creates false memory of specific transaction.

Don't Touch My Shit.description: Ward a door, bag, or container against intruders. Mind makes people overlook your belongings; Life adds physical deterrent.
Don't Touch My Shit.system: Mind 3: Intruders fail to notice or feel compelled to ignore the warded object. Life 3: Touching the ward causes dizziness, nausea, or mild shock. Spirit 3 extends protection against ghosts. Matter 3 affects vampires and other unliving intruders.

Honor and Thanks.description: The fundamental Ngoma ritual of offering respect to Ancestors and spirits before any working.
Honor and Thanks.system: -1 difficulty on Spirit or Prime actions for the scene when performed as opening ritual. Also serves as focus for many other workings.
Honor and Thanks.note: Standard Ngoma practice; almost all Ngoma learn this as their first rote

Call the Golden Hind.description: Summon the Golden Hind — the enormous spectral deer with golden antlers sacred to Artemis.
Call the Golden Hind.system: The Hind appears and can be consulted for guidance. More powerful on Elaphebolia (February 26). The Hind speaks in riddles but its advice is always true.
Call the Golden Hind.coincidental: On Elaphebolia or in sacred groves
instruments: Offering of wild game or forest gifts

Orichalcum Blessing.description: Awaken the mystical properties of Orichalcum weapons and armor.
Orichalcum Blessing.system: Orichalcum items deal aggravated damage to supernatural creatures or provide enhanced protection. Duration based on successes.

_meta.description: Special Advantages for companion characters. Cost is in freebie points. Variable costs are shown as arrays or ranges.

effect.4: +2 Initiative, extra action when spending Willpower
effect.6: +3 Initiative, always act first in round

Armor.effect: 1 pt/die vs bashing, 2 pts/die vs lethal, 3 pts/die vs all damage

Aura.effect: Visible supernatural aura. Can also be taken as 3 pt Flaw if aura causes problems.

Aww!.effect: Cuteness inspires protection. Higher levels = stronger effect on observers.

effect.1: Halved need for food, water, sleep
effect.3: No need for food, water, or sleep

Blending.effect: Natural camouflage. +2 dice to Stealth when stationary in appropriate environment.

effect.4: Sense general emotional state, know if other is alive
effect.5: Share senses (switch perspective), telepathy at close range
effect.6: Full telepathic bond any distance, share Quintessence/Essence

Cause Insanity.effect: Induce madness. Roll vs target's Willpower; successes determine severity/duration.

effect.7: Str+3 lethal damage, may cause aggravated

Deadly Demise.effect: Explosion or harmful effect upon death. Higher cost = larger area/more damage.

Dominance.effect: Assert authority over natural animals of similar or lesser size. +2 dice to Animal Ken.

Earthbond.effect: Mystical connection to specific location. +1 die to all rolls while there; sense disturbances.

effect.5: Moderate control (ignite small fires, create gusts)

Empathic Bond.effect: Sense emotions of bonded individual. Range limited to line of sight or close proximity.

Extra Heads.effect: Additional heads. Each head can act independently for perception; +1 die to relevant rolls per head.

Extra Limbs.effect: Additional functional limbs. May grant extra attacks or actions at Storyteller discretion.

Ferocity.effect: Rage pool for combat. Functions like Garou Rage — extra actions, resist damage, frenzy risk.

Flexibility.effect: Enhanced joint mobility. Can squeeze through small spaces, escape bonds. +2 dice to escape/contortion.

Hazardous Breath.effect: Breath weapon. Cost = base damage dice + range modifier + special effects. Fire, acid, cold, etc.

effect.3: Saliva heals 1 bashing per lick (once per wound)
effect.6: Heals 1 lethal per lick, can cure disease/poison

effect.2: Always find way back to one specific location
effect.4: Find way to bonded person anywhere in the world

effect.2: Appear human but with tells (strange eyes, odd proportions)
effect.4: Perfect human appearance, passes all mundane inspection

Human Speech.effect: Can speak human languages despite non-human physiology.

Information Fount.effect: Repository of knowledge on specific subject. Functions as 5 dots in a Knowledge for that subject.

effect.8: Become insubstantial at will; cannot interact with physical objects while intangible
effect.10: Selective intangibility — choose what to phase through

effect.3: Hypnotic gaze — roll Manipulation + Subterfuge vs Willpower to entrance
effect.6: Implant suggestions, cause amnesia of encounter

Musical Influence.effect: Affect emotions via music. Performance roll; successes determine intensity and number affected.

Musk.effect: Pheromone influence. +2 dice to Social rolls against those who can smell you; may cause fear/attraction.

Mystic Shield.effect: Magic resistance. Each dot adds +1 difficulty to hostile magic targeting you.

Needleteeth.effect: Piercing bite. Str+1 lethal damage; ignores 1 point of armor.

Nightsight.effect: See in darkness. No penalties for dim light; halved penalties in total darkness.

Omega Status.effect: Social invisibility as advantage — people overlook you, useful for spying/infiltration.

effect.2: Absorb 1 point of Paradox per scene
Attackers take 1 lethal when grappling/biting you
effect.4: Can fire quills: Dex+Athletics, Str lethal damage, short range

Rapid Healing.effect: Accelerated recovery. Cost varies by speed: 1 pt = heal bashing in minutes; 3 pts = lethal in hours; 5 pts = aggravated in days.

Razorskin.effect: Damaging skin texture. Grapplers/biters take 1 lethal; unarmed strikes deal +1 lethal.

Read and Write.effect: Literacy for non-humans who wouldn't normally have it.

effect.2: Regenerate minor parts (fingers, toes) over weeks
effect.6: Regenerate any body part over days

Soak Lethal Damage.effect: Soak lethal damage with Stamina naturally (no armor required).

Soak Aggravated Damage.effect: Soak aggravated damage with Stamina naturally.

effect.2: Sense death and the recently dead within line of sight
effect.3: Perceive souls, ghosts, and the Shadowlands; sense impending death

Speed.effect: Enhanced movement. 1 pt = +5 yards/turn running; 2 pts = double movement; 4 pts = triple movement.

effect.10: Step sideways difficulty 6, move quickly in Umbra

Spirit Vision.effect: See spirits and the Umbra overlaid on physical world. Equivalent to Spirit 1 perception.

effect.2: Send/receive with willing targets in sight
effect.4: Probe surface thoughts, communicate at distance

Tides of Fortune.effect: Manipulate luck. Once per scene, reroll any one roll (yours or another's within sight).

Tunneling.effect: Burrow through earth at half walking speed. Cannot tunnel through stone or metal.

Unaging.effect: Do not age. Immune to effects that age or decay.

Universal Translator.effect: Understand all spoken languages. Does not grant ability to speak them without Human Speech.

Venom/Poison.effect: Toxic attack. Cost = damage dice + onset speed + duration. Delivered via bite, sting, or touch.

Wall-Crawling.effect: Climb any surface including ceilings. Normal movement speed while climbing.

effect.5: Breathe underwater AND in air equally

Webbing.effect: Produce webbing. Can create traps (Str 5 to escape), swing, or bind targets.

effect.5: Full flight, maneuverability (running speed or faster)

_meta.description: Companion-specific Merits for non-mage characters. These are in addition to standard Mage 20 and Book of Secrets Merits.

Alpha.effect: You were born to lead. The dominant beast in any situation, you provide for your pack regardless of species, take command when need be, and embody the will of the group. +2 dice to Leadership rolls and contested Social rolls to assert dominance.

My Master is My Slave.effect: The power dynamic in your relationship is inverted. Though you nominally serve, you actually control your 'master.' You manipulate your associated mage effectively: +2 dice on Manipulation rolls against them; they have +1 difficulty resisting your suggestions.

_meta.description: Companion-specific Flaws for non-mage characters. These are in addition to standard Mage 20 and Book of Secrets Flaws.

effect.1: Slightly off (uncanny valley) — people feel uneasy but can't say why
effect.2: Clearly unusual (strange eyes, odd proportions) — obvious to close inspection
effect.3: Obviously inhuman (visible differences) — cannot pass as human without disguise
effect.5: Utterly alien (incomprehensible form) — drives terror or madness in observers

Animal.effect: You are an animal. Cannot speak (without Human Speech advantage), cannot use tools easily, cannot interact socially with humans in normal ways. Required for natural animal companions.

Aura.effect: Visible supernatural aura that you cannot suppress. May cause problems with Sleepers, reveal your nature, or attract unwanted attention. Can also be taken as 3 pt Advantage if aura is beneficial.

Beta.effect: Naturally submissive, deferring to authority figures. +1 difficulty to resist intimidation or commands; -1 die to Leadership in group settings.

Broken.effect: Prolonged abuse has shattered your will. You obey reflexively and cannot spend Willpower to resist commands from authority figures. May require significant story events to overcome.

Limbless.effect: No limbs at all. Cannot manipulate objects, move without special ability, or perform most physical actions without assistance. Appropriate for objects, certain spirits.

No Dexterous Limbs.effect: Lack hands or equivalent. Cannot manipulate tools, type, open doors, etc. without assistance. Common for most animal companions (paws instead of hands).

Omega.effect: Lowest position in every social hierarchy, regardless of actual competence. -2 dice on all Social rolls in group settings; others naturally disregard you.

effect.1: Common source, long intervals (weekly charging) — electricity from any outlet
effect.3: Specific source, moderate intervals (daily) — particular fuel type or ritual
effect.5: Rare source, frequent need (hourly) — obscure component or constant connection

Power Source.note: Required for robots and some constructs. Without power, you become dormant or lose abilities.

Thaumivore.effect: Feeds on magical energy. Without regular exposure to Quintessence, magic use, or highly magical environments, you weaken and eventually fade. Must be near active magic or Quintessence regularly. Extended separation from mage or magical environments causes deterioration.

effect.3: Mild Unbelief — discomfort in mundane areas, -1 die to all actions in highly Consensual areas
effect.5: Moderate Unbelief — take 1 bashing per scene in static areas, cannot remain long
effect.8: Severe Unbelief — rapid deterioration (1 lethal per turn) outside protected zones

Unbelief.note: Reality rejects your existence. Only safe in Chantries, Horizon Realms, or Primal Reality Zones (Gauntlet 4 or lower). Required for most Bygones.

Ungainly Fingers.effect: Clumsy manipulation. +2 difficulty on all fine manipulation tasks (typing, lockpicking, surgery, detailed crafts).

Weak Spot.effect: Specific vulnerability. Examples: headshots do aggravated damage, silver causes unsoakable damage, sunlight causes damage, running water causes weakness. Specify vulnerability at character creation.

_meta.description: Spirit Charms for familiars and spirit characters. Freebie cost = 1 per Essence needed to activate, or 5 if always-on/variable/luck-based.

cost_rules.special: 5 freebies if: no Essence cost, variable cost, luck-based, always-on

Airt Sense.effect: Innate awareness of spirit paths and directions in the Umbra. All spirits and familiars have this automatically.

Armor.effect: +1 soak per Essence spent. Lasts one scene.

Bad Luck Curse.effect: Each success changes one of target's next roll results into a 1. Can turn successes into failures or failures into botches. May be used repeatedly. Signature power of black cats and ill-omen spirits.

Bargain.effect: On success, adds +2 difficulty to mage's subsequent bargaining/binding rolls for the scene. Each subsequent use against same mage adds +1 die to mage's resistance. Taftani immune when used by djinn.

Blast.effect: Ranged attack dealing Gnosis in damage dice. Element/form matches spirit nature.

Cleanse.roll: Gnosis vs difficulty based on corruption
Cleanse.effect: Purify corruption, taint, or spiritual pollution. More severe corruption requires more Essence and successes.

Create Element.effect: Conjure appropriate elemental matter (fire, earth, wind, etc.). Amount scales with Essence spent. Must match spirit nature.

Create Water.effect: Conjure water from nothing. 1 Essence = ~10 gallons; 10 Essence = backyard pool or small flood. Water drains away unless contained.

Deflect Harm.effect: Block incoming damage — bashing, lethal, or aggravated, physical or magical. Each Essence spent blocks one health level that turn. Spirits can use as long as Essence holds. Mortals blessed via Totem can block up to 5 health levels/turn.

Disorient.effect: Target becomes lost even in familiar places. Clouds memories of landmarks, directions. Lasts one hour per success. Common among djinn, tricksters, and fear-feeders.

False Wealth.effect: Makes worthless materials appear precious — leaves become bills, lead looks like gold. Lasts ~1 hour. Technology not fooled. Prime/Matter reveals truth instantly. Perception + Awareness (diff 9) sees through it. Mind 4+ mages and certain traditions get Willpower roll (diff 7).

Good Luck Charm.effect: Grant one reroll on any task. Target must keep second result. Only once per task, but may be used on different tasks repeatedly.

Healing.effect: Heal 1 health level per Essence spent. Bashing/lethal healed automatically; aggravated may require roll.

Jack In.effect: Access any internet-connected device remotely. Normal security doesn't block ephemeral spirits. Magical protections (hypertech, wards) require roll: 6 basic to 9 sophisticated. Pre-authorized familiars skip roll. Technological spirits only.

Materialize.effect: Gain physical form in material world. High cost, limited duration. Allows physical interaction.

Mirage.roll: None (observers may roll to see through)
Mirage.effect: Conjure vivid illusions of sight and sound. No physical substance. Seen through immediately by: animals, paranormal perceptions, sensor-tech, Sphere 1 perception, vampiric Disciplines. Characters with Acute Senses or Awareness may roll Perception + Alertness/Awareness (diff 8).

Mislead.effect: Scrambles decision-making. 1 success: obvious choice becomes unclear. 2 successes: target reaches false conclusion. 3+ successes: target chooses worst possible option.

Peek.effect: Observe the physical world from the Umbra. Cannot interact, only watch.

Plant Command.effect: Control plant and fungal life. Cumulative costs: 1 = 1 turn duration (min), 1 = 10' area (min), 1 = restore damaged plants, 1 = make plants flower, 2 = double yield/mass, 2 = wither plants, 2 = +1 bashing (min 2 total), 2 = +1 attack dice, 2 = +10 Str for grabbing, 3 = plants attack (base: Dex 1 + Brawl 1, 1 die bashing, Str 10), 3 = +1 lethal (all damage lethal), 4 = +1 aggravated, 5 = lend Charm to ally (5 Essence to spend), 5 = +5 more Essence for ally.

Possession.effect: Enter and control a mortal host. Contested by host's Willpower. Duration and control vary by successes.

Re-Form.effect: Reconstruct after destruction. Time varies by spirit power — minor spirits take longer. Cannot be prevented unless spirit's Essence is depleted or specific binding used.

Rouse the Dead.note: Cannot be purchased by player characters
Rouse the Dead.effect: Temporarily revive dead person. Revived being: clearly not alive (pale, stiff, slurred), retains personality/memories/skills, loses 3 dice from all pools, loses ALL magical abilities. Duration: sunrise to sunset or vice versa. Can be recast; each revival subtracts 1 more die. Corpse returns in death-state. Cannot work on utterly destroyed corpses. Cannot share via Totem.

Sand Storm.effect: 1 Essence: blind one opponent (Blinding maneuver). 8 Essence: storm covering ~500 feet. Duration depends on available loose soil. Damage = 1 bashing per Rage dot. Blinds anyone without eye protection.

Sand Swallow / Sinkhole.effect: Opens sand, mud, or loose soil to swallow target. Each success = 3 feet deeper. Target may suffocate. Djinn control sand only; other spirits control appropriate soil types.

Shapeshift.effect: Change physical form. Must generally remain within spirit's conceptual nature.

Smoke Screen / Blinding Fog.effect: Conjure thick smoke (djinn/elementals) or fog (water/swamp/coast spirits). Obscures ALL vision including magical and hypertech sight. Area: 10 feet square per Rage dot. Duration: while spirit concentrates + 1 turn after.

Spirit Gossip.roll: Gnosis + appropriate Abilities (Cosmology, Etiquette, Intimidation, Esoterica)
Spirit Gossip.effect: Spirit travels into Umbra seeking information. Time varies from turns to days based on complexity/complications. Must be able to enter appropriate Realms without getting attacked.

Swift Flight.effect: Enhanced movement speed in Umbra or physical world (if materialized).

Teleport.effect: Instant travel to any personally visited location. 10 Essence for self, 20 with passenger. Can cross Gauntlet if spirit already has that ability.

Tracking.effect: Follow a target's spiritual trail. Works in Umbra or physical world.

Umbraquake.effect: Disrupt local Umbral landscape. Can damage spirits, collapse pathways, or alter local terrain temporarily.

Wish Fulfillment.note: Cannot be purchased by player characters
Wish Fulfillment.effect: Grant a single wish within spirit's power. Cannot affect Avatar, Arete, or Spheres. Cannot be transferred via Totem. Djinn often pervert selfish wishes. Difficulty 6 = small (childhood toy, cured disease), 7-8 = moderate, 9-10 = great (government position, wealth, resurrection).

_meta.description: Quick reference for companion character types, their stats, and required traits.

Acolyte.description: Basic human companion — cult member, assistant, servant

Consor.description: Skilled ally — professional, lover, trusted confidant

Familiar.description: Spirit incarnated into physical body, bonded to mage

Animal.notes: May have legendary abilities matching folklore

Bygone.description: Mythical creature — griffin, unicorn, dragon, imp
Bygone.survival: Only survives in Chantries, Horizon Realms, or Primal Reality Zones

Robot.notes: No Unbelief in tech-friendly areas; may suffer in primal/magical regions

Spirit.description: Pure spirit entity — Storyteller NPCs only

ranks.Celestine: Willpower 10, Rage 8-10, Gnosis 10, Essence 100+, many unique powers

Spirit.notes: For player-controlled spirits, use Familiar rules instead

Object.description: Sentient item — talking sword, enchanted skull
Object.notes: Storyteller NPCs only due to lack of mobility and limited interaction

_meta.description: Sorcerer Affiliations (Fellowships) from M20 Sorcerer

Ancient Order of the Aeon Rites.philosophy: Benevolent teachers guiding humanity through precise hermetic ritual

The Arcanum.philosophy: Pure seekers of knowledge without moral judgment

Balamo'ob.philosophy: Warrior-priests protecting communities from dark spirits of Xibalba

Children of Osiris.philosophy: Balance between life and death, healing and acceptance of mortality

Cult of Isis.philosophy: Magic as nurturing force, protection of family and community

Cult of Mercury.philosophy: Movement is life, stagnation is death

Dozen Priests of the Pythian Order.philosophy: The future is written but can be influenced

The Fenian.philosophy: Magic serves battle, honor demands action

Forn Jafna\u00f0r.philosophy: The Web of Wyrd connects all things

Maison Liban.philosophy: Society is a game, magic gives better cards

Mogen HaLev.philosophy: Magic is study of divine structure, protect the community

Nebuu-Afef.philosophy: Death is not the end; properly prepared souls live forever

Nephite Priesthood.philosophy: Magic is divine gift, used in service of faith and community

Seven Thunders.philosophy: Magic of destruction and revelation; the storm cleanses

Silver Portal.philosophy: Be anywhere, be anyone, know everything

Star Council.philosophy: The stars reveal truth; weather reflects cosmic will

Thal'hun.philosophy: The dead guide the living; honor ancestors, gain wisdom

Uzoma.philosophy: The spirits are family; serve them, and they serve you

Lone Practitioner.philosophy: Self-taught or inherited traditions outside formal organizations

_meta.description: Psychic Phenomena from M20 Sorcerer
_meta.dice_pool: Varies by phenomenon (typically Perception/Intelligence + Phenomenon rating)
_meta.notes: No Practice or Ability cap — psychic phenomena are innate

effects.1: Sense animal emotions, basic empathic link
effects.4: See through animal's senses, control behavior
effects.5: Perfect animal control, summon animals from afar

Anti-Psychic.description: Suppress other psychic and supernatural powers

effects.2: Disrupt single psychic power in use
effects.5: Permanently burn out psychic abilities in others

effects.1: See beyond immediate surroundings while in trance
effects.3: Extended astral travel, interact minimally with physical
effects.4: Astral combat, affect physical world subtly
effects.5: Extended journeys, affect physical world significantly

effects.1: Ignore minor pain, control heart rate
effects.5: Feign death perfectly, extreme physical control

Channeling.description: Allow spirits to possess you temporarily

effects.5: Maintain control during possession, channel powerful entities
Complete electronic control, crash major systems
Exist simultaneously in physical and digital

effects.1: Basic mental resistance (+1 diff to read)
Induce light trance in willing subjects
Sense life energy, feed on ambient energy
effects.3: Drain from range, heal self with energy
effects.5: Drain supernaturals, use energy for other powers

effects.4: Deep history, see events around object
effects.5: Complete history, project scenes to others

effects.4: Teleport to unfamiliar locations, bring others

effects.1: Basic mental link with willing partner
effects.3: Share skills and knowledge within link
effects.5: Perfect gestalt, function as one being

effects.2: Read surface thoughts, send simple messages

_meta.description: Sorcerer Paths from M20 Sorcerer - hedge magic and psychic phenomena
_meta.dice_pool: Casting Attribute + Path Ability at difficulty Path Level + 4

Alchemy.description: Transformation and purification through one-use magical items
Alchemy.time: 1 day per level (reduced by Ability above level)

effects.2: Exceed physical limits (+1 Attribute, max 5), cryptic visions
effects.3: Grant low-level psychic abilities (1 dot, +1 per 2 extra successes)
effects.5: Reproduce up to 3 dots of supernatural powers (requires exotic components)

Alchemy.price_of_failure: Explosion, toxic byproduct, false success, or contamination

Conjuration.description: Move or summon objects and beings (not self)
Conjuration.modifiers: +1 diff if held by resisting person, +2 diff if actively resists, -1 diff for well-known objects
Conjuration.price_of_failure: Wrong destination, wrong object, partial conjuration

Conveyance.price_of_failure: Wrong location, arrive without belongings, painful travel

Divination.description: Perceive hidden information and glimpse the future

effects.2: Read surface impressions, postcognition of recent events
effects.5: Perfect clarity, see through any deception

Divination.price_of_failure: False information, seeing what you fear rather than truth

effects.3: Call spirits to you, request minor favors
effects.4: See into Penumbra, fight spirits if needed

effects.1: Minor items (+1-2 dice or -1 difficulty, not obviously magical)
effects.2: Moderate items (+2 dice or -2 difficulty, subtle reality alteration)
effects.3: Obviously magical (+2 dice to multiple rolls, replicate 1 dot supernatural)
effects.4: Superhuman (raise Attributes above 5, replicate 2 dots supernatural)

Fascination.price_of_failure: Effect rebounds on caster, or target becomes hostile

effects.5: Legendary fortune (auto-successes, critical failures on enemies)

Healing.price_of_failure: Worsen condition, transfer injury to self

Hellfire.description: Elemental attacks (each element is separate Path)

effects.4: Major attacks (6 dice damage, area effects)

Hellfire.price_of_failure: Backfire, hit wrong target, lose control

effects.5: Illusions that can cause psychosomatic damage

Illusion.price_of_failure: Illusion obviously fake, or caster sees illusions

Maelstroms.price_of_failure: Wind goes wrong direction, affects caster

Necromancy.description: Interact with ghosts and the dead
Necromancy.price_of_failure: Attract hostile ghost, become visible to all wraiths

Necronics.description: Techno-necromancy, interface with death through technology

effects.1: Detect digital ghosts, interface with dead networks
effects.3: Recover data from 'dead' systems, digital séance
effects.4: Create digital undead, store ghosts in machines

effects.5: Create lasting dream effects, trap in dreams

Oneiromancy.price_of_failure: Trapped in dream, nightmares bleed into waking

Quintessence Manipulation.description: Handle raw magical energy (required to use raw Quintessence)

effects.4: Draw from Nodes, channel large amounts

Shadows.price_of_failure: Shadows turn hostile, trapped in darkness

Starlight.notes: Provides life support in Shadowlands for mortals
Starlight.price_of_failure: Lost in Shadowlands, threshold opens wrong place

Summoning/Binding/Warding.description: Compel and protect against beings (each type requires separate rituals)

binding_intensity.3: Must answer all questions, perform one service (may interpret literally)

Summoning/Binding/Warding.price_of_failure: Being is unbound, magician believes success when actually failed

Weather Control.notes: Large-scale effects take time to manifest
Weather Control.price_of_failure: Weather goes wrong, attracts nature spirits

_meta.description: Spell Aspects for sorcerer Paths from M20 Sorcerer

Number of Targets.description: How many individuals the effect can affect

Metaphysical Weight.description: The supernatural significance/power of affected beings

levels.1: Simple creatures (small animals, minor Gafflings, smallest spirits)
levels.2: Larger creatures (bears, wolves, more powerful Gafflings, inexperienced ghosts)
levels.3: Humans and intelligent beings (most Jagglings, experienced ghosts, minor angels, servitor demons)
levels.4: Enhanced humans (ghouls, kinfolk, sorcerers, powerful Jagglings, Umbrood Preceptors, infernal tempters)
levels.5: Powerful supernatural beings (vampires, werewolves, mages, fae, Incarnae, demon barons, angelic generals)

Damage/Healing.description: Amount of damage dealt or health restored
Damage/Healing.base: 2 dice of lethal damage per level

Distance.note: May be doubled or tripled in less populated regions

levels.1: Touch only (requires successful Brawl attack if unwilling)

Sympathetic Connection.description: Connection required for targeting at distance

levels.1: About three times faster than on foot
levels.3: Driving without speed limits or red lights

levels.2: Yourself, clothing, and small amount of stuff
levels.3: Yourself and one extra person (or equivalent weight)

Detached.effect: No wound penalties on psychic powers until Incapacitated

Twin Link (4pt).effect: +2 Empathy to read partner's feelings (replicates Synergy 2)

Black and White.effect: +1 difficulty on social rolls where closed-mindedness causes friction

Psychic Feedback (2pt).effect: Roll Intelligence (diff 6) to 'soak' activation successes as bashing damage

Isolated Upbringing.effect: -1 die penalty to all social skills outside childhood Affiliation

Artifact.description: Begin play with an inherently supernatural item with its own power

levels.1: Minor artifact (e.g., -1 difficulty on aimed shots)
levels.2: Useful artifact (+2 dice to specific actions)

_meta.description: Wonders from the Lore of the Traditions sourcebook, organized by Tradition

Dragon Pearls.description: Named after the dragon pearls of East Asian myth and the Dragon guide of the Sān Zhàn. Because Akashics reincarnate, many transfer Quintessence into an object representative of their eternal name across lifetimes. These items know how to perform specific tasks due to centuries of rituals enacted by the same Avatar.
Dragon Pearls.form: Highly personal - rarely actual pearls. Form represents the mage's eternal name and provides protection from scrutiny.
Dragon Pearls.creation_note: When an Akashi dies, belongings are interred with them. Upon reincarnation and rejoining the Akashayana, they receive their former self's belongings.

system.quintessence_transfer: Like all Tass, using Dragon Pearls requires Prime 3 to store or withdraw energy.
system.rote_assistance: With an action, an Akashi can use a Dragon Pearl to remind them how to cast a rote they know, granting +1 die to Arete rolls for rotes.
system.cap: Cannot increase an Arete roll over 5 dice - masters don't need training wheels.

Angel Tear Daggers.description: A pair of elegantly jagged blades made of unusually sharp bronze marked with the Hebrew names of seven angels in silver filigree.

adaptive_damage.effect: Blades transform into whatever material or force would cause aggravated damage to the target.

vulnerability_detection.effect: Locates target's vulnerability if one exists.

aura_modification.effect: Modifies the wielder's aura to that of their liking.

thought_concealment.effect: Conceals the thoughts of the wielder.

energy_investment.effect: Can invest weapons with Prime energy.

Game of Senet.description: An ancient Egyptian board game with magickal properties when properly prepared. When two Awakened mages play Senet with these specific game sets, they find themselves blessed with good fortune.

system.activation: Two Awakened players must play a full game of Senet (takes 30 minutes, requires safe relaxed place).
system.roll: Both players roll Arete at Difficulty 6.
system.ability_bonus: If either player has dots in a gaming or strategy Ability, ST may allow reducing Difficulty by 1 per dot (minimum Difficulty 3).
system.effect: Mage with highest successes receives −2 Difficulty modifier to all Talent and Skill rolls until the next dawn.
limitations: Can only benefit from this bonus once per dawn
Cannot 'forfeit' to let another mage win - must complete full game

Imphepho Wierook.description: A ritually prepared incense used by Muti of South Africa. When lit, emits thick fragrant smoke smelling of camphor and fenugreek. Introduced to the Order by Sangomas of House Ngoma.
uses: Protection against evil entities and negative energy

system.duration: Each hour burned consumes one point of the Imphepho's Quintessence.
system.depletion: Once all points exhausted, no incense remains.

Waidan Ding.description: A three-legged alchemical cauldron used in Taoist ritual magic (Waidan or 'outer alchemy'). Typically created by mages of House Hong Lei or Wu Lung mages. Used for achieving both exoteric purpose (harmony) and esoteric purpose (control).

system.activation: Place quicksilver inside and heat with coal-based fire for one hour. Mage must meditate in front of cauldron for entire hour.
system.quintessence_cost: Each use consumes 1 point of Quintessence.
system.effect: At end of hour, roll Arete Difficulty 5. Regain spent Willpower equal to successes (up to normal maximum). If already full, gain 1 point temporary Willpower above normal maximum.
system.failure: Fail = no Willpower gained, no Quintessence spent. Botch = no Willpower, 1 Quintessence spent.

Antaratma.description: A personal object imbued with the mage's Avatar essence, used to maintain balance between depression and sadism. Helps manage the psychological burden of the Euthanatoi path.

effects.quiet_mitigation: When a Paradox discharge or other effect would push a mage into Quiet, reduce the severity by one level for every two successes on the antaratma's Arete roll (Difficulty 7).

Dumerang Blade.description: A variable-rating Etherite weapon device. The assembled 'ignition key' machete from The Last Caern is a fancy Dümerang blade attuned to that vehicle.

Kitab al-Alacir.description: A legendary tome containing Etherite wisdom and theories. Referenced in discussions of Marauders and unified cosmological theory.

The Last Caern.description: In 1919, Etherite Doctor Leland was hired by two fiery-haired brothers from a Detroit automotive company to engineer a unique 24-cylinder alternative fuel vehicle. With nearly unlimited funding, in a hidden laboratory under their Grosse Pointe mansion, Leland worked mechanistic miracles.
The Last Caern.legend: Contains a bound god (Mechi) imprisoned within. The truck is designed to unlock the atomic bonds of the tanker itself to release this entity - saving the world from one apocalypse or ensuring another.

ignition_key.description: Leland disassembled and hid pieces in parts unknown
ignition_key.assembled_form: Functions as fancy Dümerang blade attuned to vehicle

system.without_key: Can drive through Umbral realms back to material, otherwise operates as normal armored heavy truck
system.ignition: Once sword inserted, rotated 90-degrees, and pulled out, tanker begins expanding in slow motion as Prime and Entropy break atomic bonds under slowed Time effect, releasing small nuclear explosion in final moment.
system.timer: Nobody bothered to write down how long the timer was set for.

mechi.nature: God slain to protect world from all-consuming end
mechi.implication: Probably a good match for big end-of-days threats

The Last Caern.storyteller_note: Discretion advised for how any of this plays out.

Candle of Communion.description: A ritually prepared candle used in Verbena communion rites and coven workings.

Mama Cybele's Tea Collection.description: A collection of herbal teas with various magickal properties, prepared according to traditional Verbena methods.

Grand Book of Shadows.description: A major grimoire containing accumulated Verbena wisdom, rituals, and rotes passed down through generations.

Rod Logic Computer.description: Virtual Adepts are skittish about losing access to their kit. As technology advances, more places pack electronic countermeasures from metal detectors to EMP grenades. When you need to make vital calculations in harsh electromagnetic, technological, or informational environments, the coolest Adepts bust out their Rod Logic Computers.

Trinary Deck.description: All Trinary computers (still called decks) are quite powerful but only show their true power in Awakened hands. The 'tri' in Trinary: while binary computers have processor and operator, Trinary decks also use the Avatar. Burn-in process modifies deck to benefit from mage's Sphere knowledge.

sphere_benefits.Forces/Matter/Correspondence: Improves electricity flow and heat management
sphere_benefits.Data/Entropy/Life/Time/Mind: Predicts and avoids dead ends in code execution, handles computations mage does better than computer
sphere_benefits.Prime/Spirit: Brings out best in computer so it operates flawlessly

Explorer.description: You must see what's over the next horizon

Gallant.description: You live for the attention of others

Guardian.description: You protect those who cannot protect themselves

Innovator.description: You create new things and ideas

Jester.description: Life is absurd, so laugh at it

Rogue.willpower: Regain when your self-serving behavior pays off

Sadist.willpower: Regain when you inflict suffering on someone

Sage.willpower: Regain when your knowledge or wisdom solves a problem

Scientist.willpower: Regain when logic and the scientific method solve a problem

Seeker.description: You search for meaning and truth

Show-Off.description: You must be the center of attention

Soldier.willpower: Regain when you achieve a meaningful objective through discipline and duty

Survivor.willpower: Regain when you survive a dangerous situation through your own resilience

Thrill-Seeker.willpower: Regain when you survive a dangerous situation you put yourself in willingly

Traditionalist.willpower: Regain when you preserve tradition or convince others to follow established ways

Trickster.description: You expose folly through humor and misdirection
Trickster.willpower: Regain when your tricks expose someone's foolishness or teach a lesson

tenets: We along with many other beings are tasked with maintaining the One's work

Devika Kumari Shravana.background: Descended from Siddhis (Yoruba captives brought to India by Portuguese slavers), rumored raised among trash-collectors of Ankola
Devika Kumari Shravana.awakening: Claims to have Awakened in lap of Lakshmi while dying of starvation
Devika Kumari Shravana.name_meaning: 'Little Goddess' - accepted patron Lakshmi's role as bringer of transformation, beauty, and joy
Devika Kumari Shravana.personality: Not a Manic Pixie Dream Girl - combines compassion for human suffering with annoyance at human trivialities
Devika Kumari Shravana.quote: If you're going to play with my people's sacred culture, then at least learn what my people endure.
Devika Kumari Shravana.creed: Divinity shines in all of us. The less you see Her among our delusions, the more present, in truth, She becomes.
Devika Kumari Shravana.causes: Champions people on margins: servants, strangers, those who do dirty jobs or live off scraps

Lee Ann Millner.role: Tradition's most prominent representative since millennium turn, NHC leader
Lee Ann Millner.background: Abused horrendously during childhood, traded one cycle of abusers for another. Awakened while blasting one abuser all over apartment walls.

focus.practices: Dance and movement, music, meditation, eye contact, language (Sanskrit), prayers, offerings, energy, purity
focus.instruments: Occasionally adds intoxicants (drugs/poisons, food/drink), can invest weapons with Prime energy

powers: See and communicate through ravens
Sense lies
Beginner's luck

Lewis Hook.background: Parents, teachers, partners in crime, and therapists expected him to end up dead in gutter after third rehab stint in India. They were right - heart stopped while partying. Folk healer brought him back.
Lewis Hook.awakening: Came back screaming with white streaks in hair. Promised to reform, implored woman to teach him. Wasted the gift like every other precious thing.
Lewis Hook.behavior: Sold skills for drugs, money, respect, admiration. Everything mentor tried to instill passed through his head. Nobody's servant, not even the Great Wheel. Selfish asshole who can always justify one more abuse of power.

Kallisti.title: 'High Priestess' of House Xaos
Kallisti.age: Appears mid-late 20s but at least in 40s (possibly older)
Kallisti.combat: Sends entropy into environment and messes with heads to create confusion, hallucinations, chaos. Uses tech and information as weapon to destroy plans and reputation.

tattoos: Large 23 inside pentacle minus circle (left shoulder)
Golden apple with 'Kallisti' in classical Greek (small of back)

Zagadka Vandamal bani Criamon.title: Master
