_meta.description: Genetic Flaws and Enhancement Rules for M20
_meta.purpose: Rules for biological modifications, cybernetics, and construct creation

enhancement_rules.description: Organisms are complex. When you alter one aspect of a living thing, other aspects change in response. Genetic Flaws are innate problems with altered or constructed organisms that crop up when mages make permanent changes to the Patterns of living things.
enhancement_rules.balance_requirement: For each dot in the Enhancement Background, a character must take EITHER one Genetic Flaw OR one point of permanent Paradox. Can mix both (e.g., 2 Genetic Flaws + 1 permanent Paradox for 3 Enhancement dots).
enhancement_rules.life_sphere_alterations: Same rules apply for permanent Life Sphere changes. If permanently raising an Attribute above 5, must select one Genetic Flaw or take permanent Paradox per dot above normal maximum.
enhancement_rules.flaw_types: Despite the name 'Genetic,' these flaws may be psychological, supernatural, or mechanical. Character could be cyborg, soul-bound servant, witch-enhanced, or non-human entity.
enhancement_rules.construct_note: The Construct social flaw cannot also be taken as a Genetic Flaw - that flaw already assumes the uncanny quality Genetic Flaws reflect.

physical_genetic_flaws.description: Each type (Characteristic OR Drawback) counts as one separate Genetic Flaw.

characteristics: Unusual weight (too much or too little) for build

drawbacks: Impatience with slow clumsiness of everyone else
Unusual weight and density for build
Gray, pale, leathery or otherwise discolored or oddly-textured skin

characteristics: Lack of blemishes, scars, or birthmarks
drawbacks: Micropores or no pores at all (increased heat sensitivity, inability to sweat)
Pheromone scent that's too attractive for your own good

characteristics: Propensity to notice things before anyone else does

mental_social_genetic_flaws.description: Constructs, biomodded people, and otherwise altered folks are notorious for personality quirks that leave others uncomfortable.
personality_flaws: Obsessive-compulsive behavior (taking notes about everything, constant adjustments/critiques)
Talking to yourself even when others are watching
Treating everything like a computer game or reality TV show starring you
Emotional extremes or apparent lack of emotions
Speaking in BBC accent even if not British

basic_flaws_as_genetic.description: These standard Flaws can also be taken as Genetic Flaws. Each counts as a single Genetic Flaw even if the normal Flaw costs more than 1 point.
applicable_flaws: Other appropriate mental or social Flaws

derangements.description: Magick tends to break your brain. Derangements are mental and behavioral challenges that impair the character and her relationship with the rest of the world. At low levels, simply quirks; at extreme levels, extraordinarily dangerous.

Amnesia.description: Locks out traumatic, unsafe, or unreal memories. May block identity, forget people/places, blank specific incidents, or function in a level of reality where forgotten things simply don't exist.

Antisocial Personality Disorder (ASPD).description: Sociopathy/psychopathy - pervasive disregard for societies or fellow organisms. A form of 'emotional autism' where the person cannot comprehend others' feelings or understand impact of their actions. Can lie, cheat, steal, manipulate, and feel no remorse. Key element of Dark Triad.

Bipolar Affective Disorder (BAD).description: Manic depression - swings from hyperactive manic states into depressive crashes. Both states can exist at once. Manic: impulsive behavior, unrealistic expectations, intense passions. Depression: saps energy, crushes self-esteem, grinds motivation into black paste.

Dementia.description: Catch-all for variety of related illnesses: hallucinations, delusions, perceptual alterations, disinhibition (lack of restraint/filters/boundaries), unpredictable memory loss, personality changes, loss of language skills and physical coordination. Ranges from minor quirks to full-blown irrationality.

Fugue.description: Periodically disassociates from identity and relationships, sometimes forgetting who they were until returning from fugue state - probably in very different situation. Makes drastic, unexpected separations: drop friends, leave home, adopt new personality, maybe forget who they had been. Common among mages who make abrupt life changes by nature of who they are.

Megalomania.description: Narcissistic personality disorder - grand delusions, power fantasies, intense superiority, inflated self-esteem. Really common among mages who truly are superior to most people. The megalomaniac wishes to be powerful rather than charming, seeks to be feared rather than loved.

Multiple Personality Disorder (MPD).description: Advanced fugue state - consciously/subconsciously constructs several distinct identities with own speech patterns, memories, behaviors, even physical appearance. Can manifest from two to dozen or more identities. Extremely common among Marauders, frighteningly common among other mages too, especially if mage and Avatar begin switching places or merging.

Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder (OCD).description: Drives person to anxious, repetitious, ritualistic behavior patterns. Fixates on intrusive doubts and fears, tries to banish them by ensuring certain things are in order even if they already are. Attempt to control circumstances. Especially common among ceremonial mages, technomancers, and mad scientists.

Paranoia.description: Reasonable fears reach obsessive severity. Sees plots and rivals everywhere, even among friends. Trust becomes foolishness. +1 to social roll difficulties (possibly more with suspicious people). Uses every method to safeguard from treachery. At extreme levels, isolates completely - alone with terrors in head that never go away.

Schizophrenia.description: Disconnection from reality becomes profoundly dangerous. Hallucinations, phantom voices/sensations, vicious mood quirks, leaps of (il)logic extreme even by Awakened standards. Difficult to tell where reality ends and insanity begins. The road to Marauderdom, or that Mad destination from which no mage can return.

construct_character.description: Characters grown in labs, woven from plants, shaped from elements, or crafted from dead bodies.
required_considerations: Origin story (Progenitor facility, alchemical creation, flesh-tinkerer's workshop, etc.)
Matching Genetic Flaws or permanent Paradox
Optional: Construct social flaw (2pt) if character doesn't fit with humans

cyborg_character.description: Characters with cybernetic enhancements blending organic and mechanical systems.
required_considerations: Matching Genetic Flaws or permanent Paradox

enhanced_human.description: Characters permanently altered by Life Sphere magick or other means.
required_considerations: One Genetic Flaw OR one permanent Paradox per enhancement

rotes.name: Sense the Weave
rotes.description: Perceives magical energies and their nature

_meta.description: M20 Abilities - Talents, Skills, and Knowledges
_meta.allocation: Prioritize categories as Primary (13), Secondary (9), Tertiary (5)

optional_rules.well_skilled_craftsman: At 4+ dots in Art, Athletics, Crafts, Firearms, Martial Arts, Melee, Academics, Esoterica, Lore, Politics, or Science, purchase additional specialties for 4 XP each
optional_rules.minimum_abilities: Optional: Character needs at least 1 dot in focus-based Ability per dot in Sphere Rank focused through that Ability
optional_rules.professional_skills: Catch-all for trained disciplines not covered elsewhere (Cooking, Gambling, Camouflage, etc.)
optional_rules.expert_knowledges: Catch-all for intellectual pursuits not covered elsewhere (Bribery, Power-Brokering, Journalism, etc.)
optional_rules.hobby_talents: Catch-all for innate abilities refined by practice not covered elsewhere

talents.description: Intuitive abilities that cannot be taught, only learned through practice. No penalty for lacking.

Alertness.description: Sensing things coming, sizing up situations, responding to danger. Combination of keen instincts and sharp thinking.

Art.description: Creating works of visual or performing art. Each specialty (painting, singing, acting, etc.) must be purchased separately. Well-Skilled Craftsman applies at 4+ dots.

Athletics.description: Physical fitness and athletic prowess. Each specialty reflects different athletic pursuits. Well-Skilled Craftsman applies.

Awareness.description: Perceiving the supernatural—sensing magick, spirits, Resonance, auras, and the Periphery. Higher ratings reveal more detail.

Brawl.description: Unarmed fighting—punches, kicks, grappling. More effective than random swings from unskilled brutes.

Empathy.description: Innate sense of emotional energies. Insight into how people feel, understanding and adjusting emotional states. Combined with Mind Effects, can be potent tool or weapon.

Expression.description: Making impressions through theatrical flair and audience psychology. Rousing emotions, shifting opinions, grabbing spotlight.

Intimidation.description: Scaring people through presence, unconscious social alpha cues, cutting words, or being big/mean enough to inspire submission.

Leadership.description: Inspiring others to follow your lead through commanding presence, assertive words, clear determination, or the Right Stuff.

Streetwise.description: Understanding the underworld—codes and cues outside the law. Includes minor tricks (jimmying locks, fencing goods, swiping stuff).

Subterfuge.description: Winning trust and turning it to advantage. Spotting those who try the same. Getting around social barriers, figuring out desires, lawyering the truth.

Animal Kinship.description: Natural affinity for animals—puzzling out hierarchies, reading moods/health, communicating through vocalizations and body language. Intelligent animals easier to commune with than primitive ones.

Blatancy.description: Getting away with blatant acts of magick through theatrical dodges ('We're shooting a movie', 'It's all an illusion'). Requires props and credible explanation. Successful roll may turn vulgar Effect coincidental.

Carousing.description: Sharing the good times—sparking parties and getting folks to go along, possibly over their usual edges into something wild. Breaking shackles of propriety and busting inhibitions.

Do.description: The Akashic Way—far more than martial art. Requires total devotion: diet, philosophy, meditation, internal/external reflection. Must be taught by Akashic mage. Beginning Akashics max 2 dots; others must earn all dots in-game. Requires 2+ dots in 'limb' Abilities per Do dot.

ranks.1_insect: Initiated into simplest secrets. Learning proper methods of diet, meditation, and exercise.
ranks.2_crawler: Discovering keys to higher state. Body, mind, spirit achieve unity. Capable of impressive feats.
ranks.3_four_footed: Unlocked power of natural attainment. Hands become like claws/hooves. Rank of accomplished Tao-shih.
ranks.4_bipedal: Opened gates holding lesser beings. Accomplishes miraculous things. Earned right to be Sihing.
ranks.5_true_humanity: Returned to original state of human grace. No longer concerned with what CAN be done, only what SHOULD be done. Sifu: Master of the Way.

restrictions: Cannot also buy Martial Arts Skill
Behaving with selfish excess loses access to Do

Flying.description: Knack for unassisted flight—requires wings or innate/magickal flight power. Also covers small/precarious methods (brooms, carpets, levitation discs). For climbs, plunges, take-offs, landings, fancy moves, chases, aerial combat.

High Ritual.description: Art and science of ritual—techniques, trappings, symbolic/psychological/metaphysical principles. Planning and executing rituals from weddings to mystic rites. Success may reduce magick difficulty; failure may increase it. May turn vulgar Effects coincidental in appropriate ritual settings.
High Ritual.note: Does not stack with Blatancy—must choose one or the other

Lucid Dreaming.description: Controlling dreams—shifting tone, changing locations, confronting nightmares, constructing dreams. Tapping into Maya. Can direct conscious meditations. Successes count as Enigmas successes for puzzles meditated upon.

Search.description: Tossing rooms or combing woods. Eye for clues, mastering classic hiding spaces, following instincts. Combined with Sphere 1 Effects, little can hide for long.

Seduction.description: Master of attraction—drawing people into engagements they might otherwise avoid. Combination of carnal allure and emotional manipulation. Not always sexual but plays off target's desires. Don't need to be gorgeous.

skills.description: Abilities learned through training and practice. +1 difficulty if lacking appropriate Skill.

Crafts.description: Creating and repairing things with hands. Must define specialty even without 4 dots. Each different Craft purchased separately. Well-Skilled Craftsman applies.

Drive.description: Automobile handling. Single dot = basic automatic transmission. Higher levels = wider range of vehicles. Typical driving needs no roll; races/chases/challenges do.

Etiquette.description: Social graces—cultured manners, people skills, making good impressions. Passkey to important engagements in elaborate gamesmanship of high society and foreign cultures.

Firearms.description: Guns—shooting, cleaning, maintaining. 2+ dots = familiarity with range, ammunition types, makes/models. Does NOT cover energy weapons. Heavy weapons available via Well-Skilled Craftsman.

Martial Arts.description: Refined hand-to-hand combat disciplines. Must be learned from teacher skilled in same form. Grants access to special combat maneuvers. Well-Skilled Craftsman applies for multiple styles. Focus-based Effects limited by dots.
Martial Arts.note: If pursuing Do, may not buy further dots in Martial Arts

Meditation.description: Sweeping aside clutter to find inner calm. Can involve quiet time, postures, breath control, religious devotion, ecstatic dance/prayer. Helps make up for lost sleep, hibernate, gain insights, refresh Quintessence.

Melee.description: Weapons as extensions of limbs—brutal efficiency with blades, blunt instruments, polearms. Working knowledge of weaponry and practical combat effects. Well-Skilled Craftsman may apply.

Research.description: Tracking down information—public libraries, private archives, Internet, occult collections, verbal lore. Finding sources and skimming for information. May not find exactly what you seek, but gets you on track.

Stealth.description: Getting around unnoticed—moving silently, using environment, spotting hazards before blowing cover. Others may notice you, but high rating beats most mundane observation.

Survival.description: Living off the land, enduring harsh conditions. Locating food, water, shelter, relative safety. Basic skills apply broadly; advanced tasks or extreme environments demand specific specialties.
Survival.variant: Urban Survival—living off streets, dumpster diving, finding safe nap spots in cities/suburbs

Technology.description: Working knowledge of typical developed-world gadgets. Most urbanized characters have at least 1 dot. Covers simple operations and repairs; advanced/hypertech requires Crafts or secondary Skills.

Acrobatics.description: Dazzling feats of athletic grace defying physics and biology. Intense practice and dedication required. Combined with Life/Time/Correspondence, can be literally inhuman.

Archery.description: Shooting humanity's most venerable long-distance weapon. Can be meditative art. Wooden shafts good against vampires; near-silent for assassins/spies.

Biotech.description: Understanding connections between organic and mechanical systems, working where they interface. Essential for cyborgs and cybernetic engineers. Practical applications backing up Science Knowledges.

Energy Weapons.description: Laser guns, particle-beam accelerators, plasma hand-cannons, ectoplasmic disrupters. Basic understanding of hypertech weaponry—turning on, pointing, not blowing your own hand off. Handling, maintaining, adjusting, loading, storing.

Hypertech.description: Advanced principles transcending Mass understanding—nanotech, Trinary computing, extradimensional travel. At ranks 1-2, only your own group's Devices. At 3+, can decipher other groups' weird tech. Cannot exceed Technology Skill rating.

Jetpack.description: Controlling body-mounted flying gadgets. Success depends on familiarity with specific tech. NWO agent would struggle with Etherite jetpack and vice versa. Need flight-time to gain proficiency.

Riding.description: Saddling, caring for, and riding animals. Combination of techniques and bonding. Dangerous/exotic mounts (tigers, griffins, giant owls) require Riding 3+. Dex+Riding for challenges; Charisma+Riding to bond; Intelligence+Riding for care/gear.

Torture.description: Hurting people—mental, physical, possibly spiritual distress. May be religious duty, military service, mystic practice. Exquisite agony or 'simple' emotional manipulation. Scenes count as mature content.

knowledges.description: Academic and intellectual pursuits requiring study. Cannot attempt certain Knowledge-based feats without the Knowledge.

Academics.description: Overall academic understanding—language skills, math, history. Choose specialty for greatest expertise. Well-Skilled Craftsman applies. Every mage ought to have at least 1 dot.

Computer.description: Information Technology understanding. Basic proficiency far more typical now than in early '90s. Single dot = basic use. Higher ratings = deeper understanding of hardware, software, interface, Internet, IT culture. Focus-based Effects limited by dots.
possessed_by: Almost Anyone in Current Tech Cultures

Cosmology.description: Working knowledge of puzzling Otherworlds beyond Earthly plane (Technocrats call it Subdimensions). Finding your way without getting killed. Specific views depend on expectations.

Enigmas.description: Wrapping head around concepts giving others headaches—puzzles, riddles, artistic themes, uncanny entities, arcane secrets, bizarre communication. Making jumps of logic, wading into metaphysical currents.

Esoterica.description: Practical application of esoteric disciplines—astrology, angelography, fortune-telling, yoga, herbalism, demonology, stone lore, secret code languages. Each specialty reflects different field. Well-Skilled Craftsman applies at 4+ dots.
Esoterica.note: Suggests practices and instruments for magickal focus

Investigation.description: Clues of mundane nature—locating them, analyzing them, piecing them together. Basic and possibly advanced criminology, logistical guesswork, potential sources, deductive methodology.
possessed_by: Refined Cannibal Geniuses With a Taste For Chianti

Law.description: Understanding justice systems—cop-shops, police procedures, ranks and files, end-arounds. Different regions have different systems. Modern departments have common elements even at higher difficulties.

Medicine.description: Fixing broken people. 1-2 dots = basic First Aid. Higher ratings = advanced training/experience (formal or not). Treating, harming, diagnosing injuries/illnesses. Healing magicks often depend on this.

Occult.description: Generalized comprehension of mystic world as Sleepers understand it—often misleading, incomplete, or wrong. 3+ dots helps sort truth from bullshit. Overview of practices, philosophies, lore, history, arcane cultures, 'secrets'.
possessed_by: Folks Who Spend Too Much Time on the Internet

Politics.description: Working reins of power—government agencies, law enforcement, celebrity culture. Combined with Knowledges from previous editions into unified understanding of civil influence. Well-Skilled Craftsman applies. Can be focus instrument for subtle Mind Effects.

Science.description: Understanding scientific principles, research, history, applications. Every Technocrat/technomancer must have dots. Most modern people have 1 dot. Choose specialty; Well-Skilled Craftsman applies for multiple Sciences.

Area Knowledge.description: Knowing a specific region (no larger than a city) like the back of your hand. Getting around, spotting shortcuts, grasping customs/clues/trivia no outsider could understand. Well-Skilled Craftsman does NOT apply—must spend time there to learn.

Belief Systems.description: Understanding what people believe, how, why, and where. Religious, political, economic, philosophical belief systems worldwide. Higher ratings = more extensive and specific knowledge. Helps craft coincidental magick and shift reality zones.

Cryptography.description: Understanding codes—principles for crafting and cracking them. Background in mathematics and historical encryption. Create codes broken only by someone exceeding your rating. Try to unravel codes with Int+Cryptography.

Demolitions.description: Making things go BOOM without blowing yourself up. Explosive chemistry and tech, common designs, blast patterns/effects. At higher levels, defusing explosive devices too. Once things explode, chaos takes over.
possessed_by: Kids With More Enthusiasm Than Sense

Finance.description: Understanding money magic—trade, trends, investments, markets, risks. Key component of Ars Cupiditae. Essential for Syndicate Technocrats.

Lore.description: Knowledge about Night-Folk more than they'd appreciate. Understanding filtered through your own group's perspective. Each Lore category (Spirits, Fae, Werecreatures, Vampires, Ghosts, Hunters, Demons, Mages) purchased separately. Well-Skilled Craftsman may apply.

Media.description: Mass media as mass reality—crafting public perception. Who to call, what to tell them, which strings to pull. Does not grant access to high-placed figures (that's Influence). Dominion, Art of Desire, and Reality-Hacking often depend on this.

Pharmacopoeia.description: Drug specialty—street drugs, herbal compounds, experimental medications, psychoactives, hypertech concoctions. Effects of chemicals on human animal. Measuring, recognizing, analyzing, countering, or dosing.
Pharmacopoeia.variant: Poisons—altering natural chemistry of living things in unfortunate ways

Enochian.description: Understanding the angelic language and Enochian glyphs used by Hermetic mages. Enochian is the primary language used in many Hermetic rituals and is believed to be the tongue used by angels and other celestial beings. Higher ratings allow more complex invocations and deeper understanding of angelic names and correspondences.
Enochian.source: Lore of the Traditions (Order of Hermes)
Enochian.note: Common focus for Spirit and Prime effects among Order of Hermes mages

Umbrood Protocols.description: Formal procedures for spirit interaction—proper address, offerings, negotiations, binding agreements, and safe conduct when dealing with Umbrood (spirits of all types). Different spirits expect different protocols; violating them can have severe consequences. This knowledge helps avoid offending powerful entities and negotiate favorable terms.
possessed_by: Those Who Regularly Deal With Spirits
Umbrood Protocols.source: Lore of the Traditions (Order of Hermes)
Umbrood Protocols.note: Essential for Spirit-focused mages who wish to avoid offending or being manipulated by Umbrood

body_control_optional_rule.description: Characters with Esoterica specialty in Yoga or Body Control plus minimum dots can perform body control feats without magick.

ignore_distraction.description: Screen out most distractions during study or meditation

moderated_sleep.description: Fall asleep under any circumstances with chance to enter trance

hold_breath.description: Hold breath 2 minutes per Stamina dot + 1 minute per success

tolerate_temperature.description: No penalties from hot/cold; reduce fire/frost damage by 1 die

transcend_pain.description: Reduce wound/illness dice-pool penalties by 1 for scene

slow_bleeding_breathing.description: Regulate heart/breath to avoid shock, stabilize injuries

digestive_control.description: Delay toxic effects 1 hour per success

death_trance.description: Voluntary coma 1 day per success. Appears dead without advanced scanning. Bleeding stops, poisons/illness don't circulate.

_meta.description: Merits and Flaws for M20 character creation
_meta.source: Mage 20th Anniversary: The Book of Secrets
_meta.note: Merits cost freebie points, Flaws grant freebie points. Variable costs shown as arrays.
sources: Mage 20th Anniversary: The Book of Secrets (BoS)

Acute Senses.description: One sense (1pt) or all senses (3pt) are exceptionally sharp. Reduces difficulty of Perception rolls using that sense by 2.

Alcohol/Drug Tolerance.description: Make Stamina roll (diff 7) to shake off intoxication. 1pt for natural drugs only, 2pt includes synthesized drugs.

Ambidextrous.description: No penalty for using off-hand. Normal multiple action rules still apply.

Cast-Iron Stomach.description: Can eat anything without gagging. Does not protect from toxins, only allows you to keep it down.

Catlike Balance.description: Reduce difficulty by 2 for balance-related physical acts (rolling with falls, walking tightropes, etc.).

Hyperflexible.description: Extremely flexible joints. -2 difficulty for rolls involving flexibility (escape attempts, contortions, etc.).

Light Sleeper.description: Four hours of sleep suffices. Wake up ready for action from apparently dead slumber.

Noble Blood.description: Physical features link you to a powerful family. -2 to social rolls with those who respect aristocracy, +2 with those who hate the family.

Sterile.description: Cannot sire or conceive children. Can be Merit or Flaw depending on preference.

Enchanting Feature.description: One standout physical feature (eyes, voice, grace, etc.). -2 difficulty when deploying it socially. Can be personalized instrument.

Physically Impressive.description: Imposing and apparently dangerous. +2 dice to intimidation rolls.

Poison Resistance.description: +2 dice to Stamina rolls against toxins. Reduces intensity of powerful toxins, eliminates effects of lesser ones.

Poker Face.description: Nothing rattles you visibly. -2 difficulty on intimidation, subterfuge, resistance-to-intimidation. +2 to others trying to read you.

Daredevil.description: +3 dice to non-combat, non-magickal rolls for physically reckless acts.

Hypersensitivity.description: Extraordinary sensitivity to sensations. -2 difficulty on Perception + Alertness to identify sensory details. Painful sensations require Willpower roll or be stunned.

Nightsight.description: See in near-total darkness. Only complete absence of light negates this. Does not improve visual acuity.

Huge Size.description: Over 7 feet and/or 400 pounds. One additional health level (extra Bruised). Lost if shapeshifted to smaller form.

Insensate to Pain.description: Wound penalties do not affect dice pools until death. Physical impairment (crushed legs, etc.) still applies.

Too Tough to Die.description: Can soak lethal damage (NOT aggravated). Injuries still hurt but don't stop you - gunshots, knife wounds, broken bones still tear you up but you push through. Soaking is not healing; lethal injuries heal at normal rate.

Artistically Gifted.description: -2 difficulty when using the Art Talent.

Common Sense.description: Storyteller may ask 'Are you sure?' before stupid actions. Free warning about potential dumbassery.

Computer Aptitude.description: -2 difficulty for computer-based rolls. Cannot reduce magick difficulty below minimum or by more than -3.

Concentration.description: Eliminates modifiers from distracting circumstances. Truly distracting situations may require Willpower roll.

Language.description: Fluency in one additional language per purchase.

Lightning Calculator.description: -2 difficulty for math/calculation-based rolls. Simple calculations instant, complex ones take a turn or more.

Time Sense.description: Internal clock gauges time of day and passage of time without external reference.

Code of Honor.description: +2 dice to Willpower rolls when acting according to code or resisting temptation to betray it.

Eidetic Memory.description: Photographic memory. Detailed or stressful memories may require Perception + Alertness roll. Memory is still subjective.

Inner Strength.description: -2 difficulty on Willpower rolls against overwhelming odds.

Natural Linguist.description: Each Language Merit grants two languages. +3 dice for clear communication rolls.

Hyperfocus.description: +1 die per hour spent focusing on mundane extended action (max +3). Does not assist magick casting.

Iron Will.description: +3 dice on Willpower rolls against challenges to convictions or Mind magick. Spend 1 Willpower to shake off mind control.

Jack-of-All-Trades.description: No penalty for Skills you don't possess. +2 difficulty (not unskilled penalty) for Knowledges you don't possess.

Scientific Mystic/Techgnosi.description: Technomancer can study mystic instruments with Weird Science, or mystic can use tech instruments. Up to half instruments can cross paradigm boundaries.

Berserker.description: Under intense stress (combat, injury, disgrace), failed Willpower roll (diff 8) triggers rampage. Gain 3 temporary Bruised health levels, ignore wound penalties, +2 Strength dice, +1 Stamina die until all enemies dead/incapacitated. Everyone becomes an enemy - allies, bystanders, all targets. Cannot use magick or strategy. Lasts until knocked out, incapacitated, or left alone for several minutes destroying everything in reach. Merit if in shock-troop/wetwork role; Flaw if group demands subtlety.
Berserker.note: Same as Stress Atavism Flaw - context determines Merit or Flaw

Judge's Wisdom.description: Immune to Mind/Life Effects influencing emotions. Shrug off vampiric Presence under 6 dots. Immune to emotion-based powers.

Self-Confident.description: When spending Willpower for auto-success, keep the point unless it's your only success or difficulty is 5 or less.

Loyalty.description: +2 dice resisting attempts to turn you against the object of loyalty, or +2 difficulty to attacks using Willpower as difficulty.

Family Support.description: Family knows about Awakened life and approves. 1pt=typical family emotional support; 2pt=status/wealth/influence; 3pt=wealth/power/privilege with strings pulled on your behalf.

Favor.description: Someone powerful owes you. 1pt=minor act; 2pt=significant boon; 3pt=life-debt. Spent once performed.

Pitiable.description: -2 difficulty to get people to help you. +2 difficulty to intimidate or be taken seriously.

Prestigious Mentor.description: -2 difficulty for social rolls invoking your influential teacher. +2 with mentor's rivals unless they fear the mentor.

Regal Bearing.description: Aristocratic charisma. -2 difficulty on social rolls to make impressions. People defer reflexively.

Unobtrusive.description: Unremarkable and forgettable. Others need Perception roll (diff 6) to recall you. +2 difficulty to your social rolls.

Animal Magnetism.description: -2 difficulty when charming, seducing, or appealing to carnal natures.

Confidence.description: -2 difficulty on social rolls impressing others with capabilities. +2 difficulty for others to shake your confidence.

Hideaway/Safehouse.description: 2pt=small secret hideaway; 4pt=secured safehouse with supplies/staff/defenses (belongs to superiors); 6pt=both hideaway and safehouse that you own.

Natural Leader.description: +2 dice to Leadership-based pools. Requires Charisma 3+.

Officially Dead.description: Authorities consider you deceased. New identity required.

Perfect Liar.description: -2 difficulty when lying about important things. No usual tells. Does not alter auras or thoughts.

Prestige.description: +3 dice to social rolls within your faction. Also called Reputation.

Property.description: 2pt=small property ~3000sqft (Resources 3+); 3pt=larger with staff/income (Resources 4+); 4pt=substantial with land (Resources 5+); 5pt=impressive holding (Resources 6+).

Research Grant.description: Stipend from institution. Frees from regular job. Includes archive/facility access. Must report findings and please sponsors.

Sanctity.description: Project impression of purity. People trust you. Authorities go easy, friends aid, strangers defend you.

Secret Code Language.description: Knowledge of exclusive communication mode (hand signals, ciphers, symbolism, etc.) known only to initiates.

Socially Networked.description: High online profile with global influence. Crowdfunding backers, instant info, places to crash worldwide.

Subculture Insider.description: Innately familiar with an exclusive social environment. -2 difficulty for social/physical access within that subculture's turf.

Dark Triad.description: Blend of narcissism, Machiavellianism, and sociopathy. Add 3 dice to Seduction, Manipulation, Leadership, Subterfuge, and Charisma-based rolls. People find your Fuck Authority attitude seductive. Downside: you are an amoral bastard acting only on perceived self-interest. Once tendencies become clear, even Nephandi won't trust you.

Local Hero.description: -2 difficulty with your community. Free food, discounts, places to crash. Must maintain heroic reputation.

Noted Messenger.description: Known emissary between groups. Treated with deference. Must behave appropriately and keep companions in line.

Rising Star.description: -1 difficulty for social rolls within your group. Plum assignments come your way.

Ties.description: Connections, goodwill, and small influence within a specific group (Local Police, Underworld, Media, etc.). Not friends or servants. -2 diff for subtle requests (pull license number, get invite); -1 diff for significant favors (plant story, tamper evidence). Must maintain relationships. Each type purchased separately for 3 points.

Master of Red Tape.description: -2 difficulty dealing with bureaucracy. Know who to talk to and where loopholes are.

True Love.description: One automatic success on all Willpower rolls (negated only by botch). Does not apply to magick casting. Soulmate will move heaven and earth to help you.

Vatican Connections.description: Favors from the Holy See, from administrative help and Vatican Library access to Society of Leopold strike teams.

Knight-Captain.description: Command a squad of unAwakened Retainers. Each dot provides additional squad members. 2 background dots grants members True Faith.

Solomon Codes.description: Access to Templar mission funds. Each dot = 2 dots of Resources that can be liquidated for mission expenses only. Cannot be used for personal enrichment.

Wenqu.description: Born under the star Megrez (Wenqu in Chinese astrology). +2 dice on artistic Expression and Crafts rolls.

Wuqu.description: Born under the star Mizar (Wuqu). Financial luck. Once per story, either treat Resources as 2 dots higher for one purchase, or spend Resources without losing dots.

Zuofu.description: Born under the star Alcor (Zuofu). Once per session, the ST introduces a helpful NPC you have opportunity to win over.

Web of Faith.description: Connection to the Batini Node network. Higher ratings grant access to more powerful Nodes and resources within the Web.

Burning Aura.description: Aura burns with brilliance and clarity. +2 difficulty to hide aura. -2 difficulty on impressions matching aura to those who sense it.

Green Thumb.description: Plants flourish from your touch. -2 difficulty on non-Arete plant rolls, -1 on Arete rolls involving plants.

Bardic Gift.description: -2 difficulty with Art Talent. Creations have unmistakable Truth even on failed rolls.

Circumspect Avatar.description: Silent Avatar that works through everyday events. Seekings happen in physical realm as puzzles. Avatar may appear only as mundane person/creature.

Faerie Affinity.description: -2 difficulty with changelings. They also get -2 to obtain Glamour from you or enchant you. Forbidden to technomancers.

Medium.description: Affinity with ghosts. Can talk to them without Spirit Sphere. Perception + Awareness to sense them. -2 difficulty social with ghosts. Aura shines like beacon in Shadowlands.

Unaging.description: Age very slowly or not at all. Not immortality - can still die from injuries/sickness.

Celestial Affinity.description: -2 difficulty summoning/negotiating with one category of spirits. Does not apply to binding/warding. +3pts per additional category.

Cloak of the Seasons.description: Immune to exposure from harsh climates. Still need food/water/air. Climate obstacles still hinder.

Cyclic Magick.description: Merit AND Flaw. Peak: -3 difficulty for 1 hour, -2 for adjacent hours, -1 for next. Nadir: same pattern with penalties. Must tie to focus.

Danger Sense.description: Storyteller makes secret Perception + Alertness roll when hidden threat approaches. Difficulty based on immediacy.

Hands of Daedalus.description: -2 difficulty for mechanical technology work. Tech instruments become Personalized once familiar.

Lucky.description: Reroll failed die roll (including botches) up to 3 times per story. Each reroll can only be attempted once.

Manifest Avatar.description: Avatar is a full character under ST control that interacts almost daily. With Allies Background, becomes visible to all.

Mark of Favor.description: Features mark you as claimed by a godlike entity. -2 difficulty with those who respect the deity, +2 with opponents. May grant minor miraculous talents.

Natural Shapeshifter.description: -2 difficulty for Life shapeshifting Effects. Don't risk losing yourself in new form. Works only for self.

Oracular Ability.description: Perception + Awareness (diff 7) to perceive hidden messages. Perception + Esoterica to interpret (difficulty varies by randomness).

Parlor Trick.description: One specific non-combat Sphere 1-3 Effect performed without casting roll. Quick, coincidental, tied to focus. Max 3 tricks (3pts each).

Spirit Magnet.description: Merit OR Flaw. Spirits flock to you. Merit=benevolent spirits; Flaw=malevolent. Points based on how helpful/troublesome and numerous.

Spirit Mentor.description: Ghost/Loa/spirit teaches you secrets. Can teach Abilities appropriate to the spirit. Has own agenda.

Supernatural Companion.description: Friend among Night-Folk (vampire, changeling, werebeast, ghost). Not as reliable as Ally. ST controls character.

Stormwarden/Quantum Voyager.description: Immune to Avatar Storm effects. 3pt: pass through Gauntlet without harm. 5pt: can protect everyone/everything you touch (including via Correspondence). Persons you do not want to protect still suffer Storm effects. Does not protect against Disembodiment or other Otherworld hazards.
Stormwarden/Quantum Voyager.note: Called Quantum Voyager for Technocrats. N/A if Avatar Storm not in chronicle.

Deathwalker.description: Step sideways into Low Umbra with Spirit 3. Aura appears ghostly. Pass Avatar Storm without effects.

Fae Blood.description: Kinain - related to changelings. Banality no higher than 4. Permanently enchanted. Forbidden to technomancers.

Shapechanger Kin.description: Related to werecreatures. Immune to Delirium. Travel Otherworlds longer without Disconnection/Acclimation. Their enemies are yours.

Twin Souls.description: Avatar has a twin in another body. Same Nature/Essence. If both mages, share Avatar rating and can cast together while touching. Both get full Paradox.

Umbral Affinity.description: Innate affinity for Otherworlds - perhaps distant shapeshifter blood or Pagan heritage. No ill effects from 1st/2nd degree Acclimation; other stages affect at one degree less. No Disembodiment worry until six moon-cycles (roughly six months). Feel at home in strange Umbral Realms; may be recognized as natural traveler with innate right to be there.

Unbondable.description: Immune to vampiric blood bond. Willpower considered +2 for resisting metaphysical domination.

Ghoul.description: Fed on vampire blood. Age slowly, +1 auto success on Strength, +1 damage hand-to-hand. Need more vitae regularly. Highly addictive.

Clear Sighted.description: Perception + Awareness to see through perception-deceiving powers (Obfuscate, illusions, cantrips). Difficulty 5 + highest Sphere/power level. -3 diff if normally allowed a roll.

Immortal.description: 5pt=age 1 year per decade, recover from non-instant-kill injuries; 7pt=plus immune to death unless special doom or body obliterated. Must have one special doom.

Inner Knight.description: When hope is lost: access Dream 5 traits without trance, +5 temp Willpower, recall past life knowledge. For Technocrats/skeptics.

Legendary Attributes.description: May purchase up to 6 dots in one Attribute. Heroic capability at 6 dots (e.g., always inflict 1 damage, auto success on related rolls).

Powerful Ally.description: 5pt=one powerful ally; 6pt=small group or especially powerful one; 7pt=dozen or handful of powerful; 8pt=many or near-godlike.

Shattered Avatar.description: Avatar broken into pieces. Can increase Avatar Background after creation by finding pieces. Max 5 dots still applies.

Spark of Life.description: Lethal heals as bashing. Aggravated heals one level faster. Bashing heals within an hour. -2 difficulty healing others while touching. Vampires find blood twice as potent.

Guardian Angel.description: Powerful entity watches over you. Provides occasional help (ST discretion). May be angel, spirit, or mysterious force. May have hidden agenda or price.

Nine Lives.description: If roll would cause death, reroll. Success: survive and mark off one life. Failure: mark life and reroll. Until survive or run out of lives.

Sphere Natural.description: One Sphere costs 70% normal XP (rounded up). Even less for Affinity. Must tie to concept/focus.

Avatar Companion.description: Companion shares bit of Avatar across incarnations. Knows much about your past lives. Loyal but has own personality. Not Night-Folk.

Dual Affiliation.description: Initiated and trained in two Awakened groups. Affinity Sphere rate for one Sphere per group. Can use focus of either.

Nephilim/Laham.description: Descended from High Umbral entity. Quintessence 7 (refreshes on sleep). Must take 3pts Physical Flaws. 3pts starting Resonance. -1 diff Mind/Spirit for High Umbra. +2 diff vs Hermetic/Abrahamic rituals.

True Faith.description: Devotion to higher power enables miraculous feats beyond mere magick. Must belong to sincere creed with established moral code and historical legacy. Adds dice to Willpower and countermagick rolls equal to Faith rating. Faith must be lived - acts in accord strengthen it, acts against weaken it. Must align with magickal focus.

levels.1: Drive away vampires with prayer (Faith vs Willpower). Enemies uneasy. +1 die countermagick/Willpower.
levels.2: Sense magick as Awareness equal to Faith. Prayers cause pain to vampire/enemies of faith. +2 dice countermagick/Willpower.
levels.3: Detect vampires/supernatural opposed to creed (intuitive, not perfect). Night-Folk uncomfortable around you. +3 dice countermagick/Willpower.
levels.4: Immune to ghouling, +2 diff vs Mind magicks. Touch burns enemies (Faith diff 7, 1 agg/success). +4 dice countermagick/Willpower.
levels.5: Incarnation of creed - opponents driven to knees. Sinners weep. Enemies must spend Willpower, flee, or Stamina roll each turn to remain (diff 5+Intelligence). +5 dice countermagick/Willpower.

Shadow Appeal.description: The character radiates an attractive darkness that draws certain people. Reduce difficulty of Social rolls to seduce, recruit, or corrupt by 1 per dot (only vs. susceptible targets).

levels.1: Mildly intriguing to those with dark tendencies
levels.3: Magnetic pull on those susceptible to corruption

Innocuous Aura.description: The character's Nephandic nature is completely hidden from aura perception. Aura reading does not reveal Nephandic corruption. Prime or Spirit perception at 3+ can pierce this with contested roll.

Abyssal Mastery.description: Deep connection to the Qlippoth grants power over Abyssal energies. -1 difficulty on magick involving Entropy, summoning Qlippothic entities, or Abyssalism practice effects.

Saint of the Pit.description: The character is recognized and favored by Qlippothic entities. Demons and Qlippothic beings react favorably. +2 dice to Social rolls with such entities. May call for minor favors.

Aid From the Ancestors.description: At least one Ancestor appears when summoning spirits. -2 difficulty on Spirit Bargaining rolls.

Aumakua.description: Ancestral spirit guide functions as both Avatar Companion and Spirit Mentor. Can teach Abilities and Rotes but not Spheres. May advise or protect. If killed or driven away, can be bought again at 5 freebie points with proper propitiations.

Djinn Expertise.description: +1 die on Manipulation or Perception rolls when dealing with djinn.

Weavers' Paradox Resistance.description: Paradox Flaws begin one severity level higher than normal. 1-5 successes cause no flaw instead of trivial, 6-10 cause trivial instead of minor, etc.

Divergent Protocols.description: Can use Technocratic Protocol-style magick with appropriate equipment. Allows coincidental vulgar effects when using tech-based instruments.

Technomancer.description: 2pt: Halve Paradox from botched vulgar effects without witnesses. 4pt: Halve Paradox from botched vulgar effects with witnesses. Represents intuitive understanding of reality's tolerances.

Marked by the Goddess.description: Artemis' blessing grants various benefits. Effects scale with point cost. Born on Elaphebolia (February 26) receive this blessing naturally.

Addiction.description: Dependent on activity/substance interfering with daily life. 1pt: trivial enjoyment (games, tobacco, social media). 3pt: illegal, dangerous, or both (cocaine, fight clubs, etc.). Severe addictions have moral wrongness and cause social/financial/legal/physical difficulties.

Child.description: 1pt=near adulthood; 2pt=pre-adolescent; 3pt=young child. Physical size, legal status, and being taken seriously are limited. 2-3pt should also take Short.

Impediment.description: Physical condition hampering function. 1pt=occasional inconvenience; 2pt=constant but not insurmountable (+1 diff); 3pt=significant impairment (+1 diff); 4pt=inescapable major obstacle (+2 diff); 5pt=unable to function in most normal ways (+2 diff); 6pt=need major work-arounds (+2-3 diff).

Aging.description: Lose 1 Physical Attribute dot per 2 points. For bodies too old or too young for full adult capacity.

Easily Intoxicated.description: +3 difficulty on Stamina rolls to resist drugs/poisons (not disease).

Repulsive Feature.description: One unpleasant physical distinction. +2 difficulty on social rolls when feature shows. Carries into shapeshift. Can become -2 for deliberate intimidation.

Profiled Appearance.description: Physical features mark you as suspicious. Authorities harass you. Cannot take with Cultural Other.

Degeneration.description: 3pt=cannot heal without magick/medicine; 6pt=lose 1 health every 2 weeks without healing; 9pt=health loss is aggravated.

Monstrous.description: Frightening appearance. Appearance 0. Penalties to social rolls, reductions to intimidation.

Permanent Wound.description: Chronic injury returns to Wounded level at sunrise/sunset daily. Does not deteriorate further unless injured again.

Short.description: Under 5 feet tall. Half normal running speed. Reach and leverage problems.

Horrific.description: +3 difficulty on social rolls not involving scaring people. -3 difficulty to scare. Appearance below zero. May trigger Things Man Was Not Meant to Know.

Mayfly Curse.description: 5pt=age 1 year per 2 months; 10pt=age 1 year per week. Time magick aging effects multiplied.

Compulsion.description: Reflexive behaviors under stress. Spend Willpower to postpone temporarily.

Hero Worship.description: Adore someone to the point they can do no wrong. Willpower roll to refuse their desires (diff varies).

Impatient.description: Willpower roll (diff 6) to restrain from acting when others seem slow.

Inappropriate.description: Say/do things others frown upon. 1pt=occasional embarrassment (+1 diff); 2pt=fairly regular (+1 diff even when not acting out); 3pt=frequent (+2 diff); 4pt=constant (+2 diff plus bad reputation).

Mental Lock.description: Thoughts/images get stuck in loops. Willpower roll (diff 7), spend Willpower, or wait 5 turns to break free.

Nightmares.description: 1pt=constant nightmares affect mood/sleep; 3pt=also Willpower roll (diff 7) on waking or -1 die to all pools that day.

Overconfident.description: Believe you're the best. Rarely back down. Blame others when things go wrong.

Shy.description: +2 difficulty on social rolls. +3 if center of attention.

Soft-Hearted.description: Hate witnessing suffering. Willpower roll (diff 8) when confronted with pain or withdraw/act recklessly.

Speech Impediment.description: Psychological speech impairment. +2 difficulty to speaking rolls. Carries into shapeshift.

Vanilla.description: Innocent. Jokes and references to anything raw go over your head.

Whimsy.description: Get silly under stress. Willpower roll (diff 6) to not clown around in stressful situations.

Amnesia.description: Cannot recall life before Awakening. May take up to 5pts mystery Flaws ST will reveal later.

Curiosity.description: Can't resist mysteries. Wits roll to resist temptation (diff 5-9 based on compelling nature).

Icy.description: Ice-cold, can commit atrocities without twitch. People avoid you. Soul in peril.

Intemperate.description: Everything to excess. Willpower roll to resist going whole-hog (diff 8-9 for small risks, 5-6 for life-threatening).

Obsession.description: All-consuming interest overshadows common sense. Willpower roll (diff 6+) to focus on something else.

Phobia.description: Irrational terror of something. Willpower roll or flee. 3 successes needed to approach. 3pt version for frenzying creatures only.

PTSD.description: Hair-trigger response to certain situations from awful experiences. Anxiety, aversions, phobias, sudden rage. Character remains lucid but fears kick in at difficult, unpredictable times.

levels.2: Occasional nightmares/anxieties under rare circumstances (ghosts, demons, wilderness).
levels.3: Phobias/strong reactions to more common situations (elders, financial difficulty).
levels.4: Near-panic, powerful aversion, rapid mood swings to common provocations (gunshots, raised voices).
levels.5: Major reactions (panic, flashbacks, terror, catatonia) to common situations (sex, arguments). Nightmares, social anxieties even without specific trigger.

Rose-Colored Glasses.description: View your faction in most favorable light. Confronted with truths could devastate you.

Short Fuse.description: Willpower roll (diff 6) when angered or deal with it gloves-off.

Vengeful.description: Pursuing vengeance is highest priority. Spend Willpower to put aside temporarily.

Absent-Minded.description: ST calls for Intelligence rolls to recall things. Forget tasks, names, leave projects unfinished.

Bigot.description: Strong prejudice. +2 difficulty on social rolls with those people. Spills out when temper lost.

Chronic Depression.description: Willpower roll when pushing through. Failure adds +2 difficulty to primary task. Botch drops into deep pit. Can spend Willpower to avoid roll.

Deranged.description: Lasting mental illness. Successful Willpower roll may allow coping temporarily. 3pt: troubling but manageable. 5pt: danger to self and everyone nearby.

Driving Goal.description: Cause so intense it drives every aspect of life. Near-impossible to achieve individually (collapse of Technocracy, etc.).

Extreme Kink.description: Exotic needs beyond safe/sane. 3pt=can damage health/reputation; 4pt=can seriously harm; 5pt=can get prison time.

Feral Mind.description: More animal than human. Prefer non-linguistic communication. +3 difficulty social usually (-3 for intimidation/seduction). Max 3 Language Merits.

Flashbacks.description: Sudden sensory trauma bursts. Willpower roll (diff 8) to shake off in high-stress situations.

Hatred.description: Utterly despise something. Take advantage of any opportunity to harm it. If also Berserker/Beast Within, Willpower (diff 8) when confronted.

Lifesaver.description: Moral imperative to salvage lives, not just avoid killing. Big-hearted burden in World of Darkness.

OCPD.description: Obsessive-compulsive personality disorder. Follow strict rituals, obsessive order. Willpower rolls to break patterns.

Stress Atavism.description: Under intense stress (combat, injury, disgrace), failed Willpower roll (diff 8) triggers rampage. Gain 3 temporary Bruised health levels, ignore wound penalties, +2 Strength dice, +1 Stamina die until all enemies dead/incapacitated. Everyone becomes an enemy - allies, bystanders, all targets. Cannot use magick or strategy. Lasts until knocked out, incapacitated, or left alone for several minutes. Flaw if group demands subtlety; Merit if in shock-troop/wetwork role.
Stress Atavism.note: Same as Berserker Merit - context determines Merit or Flaw

Ability Deficit.description: Subtract 5 points from one Ability category. Starting traits in that category limited to 3 dots even with freebies.

Blacklisted.description: 1pt=trivial (poor driving record); 2pt=minor (misdemeanor); 3pt=significant (disbarred, dishonorable discharge); 4pt=major (felon, watch-list); 5pt=pariah (most-wanted, terrorist).

Compulsive Speech.description: 1pt=talk too much; 2pt=say wrong things to wrong people regularly. Spend Willpower to keep quiet for a scene.

Conflicting Loyalties.description: 1pt=minor crisis shuttling between loyalties; 2pt=significant clash mediating constantly; 3pt=irreconcilable differences forcing eventual choice.

Conniver.description: Reputation as backstabber. -1 die on non-magickal pools for getting others to trust you.

Cultural Other.description: Socially divergent. 1pt=small harassment; 2pt=family thinks you deserve it; 3pt=strangers feel free to attack; 4pt=authorities discriminate; 5pt=physically/legally hazardous to exist. Cannot take with Profiled Appearance.

Dark Secret.description: Secret that would cause trouble if revealed.

Debts.description: 1pt=<$10k; 2pt=<$50k; 3pt=>$50k; 4pt=>$100k; 5pt=>$500k. Creditors pursue more aggressively at higher levels.

Discredited.description: +2 difficulty on social rolls to be taken seriously by professional peers.

Enemy.description: Someone hates your guts. 1pt: minor grudge from inconsequential party. 5pt: deadly plans from powerful entity or group.

Esoteric Discourse/Technobabbler.description: Fill every hour with obscure jargon. +1-2 difficulty on social rolls.

Family Issues.description: Dysfunctional family you can't escape. More points = more interference with Awakened life.

Infamy.description: 1pt=regional dislike; 2pt=wide but faded; 3pt=famous but disliked; 4pt=authorities don't like you; 5pt=household name, that name is shit.

Insane/Infamous Mentor.description: Mentor is dangerous or has awful reputation splattered on you.

Mistaken Identity.description: Confused for someone else, possibly dangerous.

Naive.description: +2 difficulty to detect bad intentions. May lack empathy for others' pain.

New Kid.description: +2 difficulty on social rolls with experienced mages until you prove yourself.

Offline.description: 1pt in cultures where Internet is occasional; 3pt where it's major element of social life.

Rival House.description: Your Chantry has enemy Chantry. 1pt=minor rivalry with equal; 2pt=significant with equal or minor with powerful; 3pt=deadly with equal; 4pt=significant with powerful; 5pt=deadly with powerful.

Sect Enmity.description: A sect within your faction dislikes you. +2 difficulty with them.

Special Responsibility.description: Duty to your group consuming time/energy/resources.

Sympathizer.description: Expressed sympathy for enemy faction. Not popular.

Twisted Apprenticeship.description: Mentor taught you all wrong things. Bad rep and worse teachings hang over you.

Catspaw.description: Dupe for someone superior. Must follow orders while hoping to extract yourself.

Diabolical Mentor.description: Mentor is actively malevolent (Nephandus, Marauder, Infernalist, etc.).

Dogmatic.description: +2 difficulty on social rolls with people of differing beliefs.

Double Agent.description: Working both sides of a spiky fence. Dangerous game will catch up.

Failure.description: Blown a high-profile job. Laughingstock until redemption.

Gullible.description: -3 dice to penetrate falsehoods or fool people with your own deceptions.

Old Flame.description: Former love works for enemy. Knows your weaknesses. Resisted Manipulation contest to not be won over.

Troublemaker.description: Project impression of guilt. Blamed for everything, authorities harder on you.

Expendable.description: Upper-level member wants you dead via dangerous missions.

Narc.description: Reputation as informer. +1 difficulty with those who fear you're spying. May be fed misinformation.

Notoriety.description: +2 difficulty on all social rolls within your faction. Linked to some disgrace.

Sleeping with the Enemy.description: Paramour belongs to enemy group. Discovery probably means death for both.

Ward.description: Dependent character(s) requiring constant attention. Gets in trouble, requires rescuing, digs into your life.

Rivalry.description: 3pt=rival of equal power; 4pt=rival of greater power; 5pt=far more powerful rival.

Rotten Liar.description: +2 difficulty on deception rolls, including magickal deceptions.

Echo Chamber.description: Surrounded by groupthink. Cut off from contrary information. Group punishes disagreement increasingly harshly.

Hit List.description: Rival group wants you dead. +2 difficulty on social rolls if you even get chance.

Mr. Red Tape.description: +2 difficulty with bureaucracy. Stupid mistakes and delays plague you.

Overextended.description: Too many commitments. Others undermine your juggling. Failure looming.

Probationary Member.description: Recent defector on probation. Peers expect betrayal. Survival depends on doing everything right.

Rogue.description: Loosest cannon. +3 difficulty on social rolls with former allies. Certain Backgrounds forbidden or hard to access.

Witch-Hunted.description: Masses want you dead. Exposed for what you are. Various parties offer significant threat.

Fifth Degree.description: Technocrat: outlived usefulness. Set up to fall. One more chance before Room 101 or suicide mission.

Construct.description: Came from lab, not womb - grown in Progenitor facility, woven from plants, shaped from elements, crafted from dead bodies. Don't truly fit with natural-born humans. Self-doubt/social alienation OR sense you're better than "peers." Penalties on social rolls in many situations depending on origins, attitude, company.
Construct.note: Not required for all constructs - only for those who stand out

Anarchist Braggart.description: Wits + Empathy roll (difficulty 6) to avoid antagonizing people with overbearing anti-establishment opinions. Failure makes social rolls +1 difficulty for rest of scene.

Exposed.description: Drew unwanted attention through blatant action. 1pt: One faction seeks you. 3pt: Multiple factions or a powerful single enemy (Technocracy, Nephandi, etc.) actively hunt you.

Dijie.description: Born under the star of calamity (Dijie). Financial misfortune follows you. Resources can never exceed 1 dot regardless of effort or inheritance.

Qingyang.description: Born under the star of the raised goat (Qingyang). -2 dice on first impression social rolls with new acquaintances. Once they know you, this penalty fades.

Anachronism.description: 1pt=quirks from recognizable different time (+1 diff understanding current tech/behavior); 2pt=distinctly earlier/advanced age (+2 diff); 3pt=so distant current era seems alien (+3 diff, may be unable to process some things).

Bard's Tongue.description: Cannot lie. Compelled to speak truth. Things you say turn out true. Spend Willpower (maybe take 1 bashing) to keep quiet.

Cast No Shadow or Reflection.description: 1pt=missing one; 2pt=missing both. +1 difficulty on social rolls, +2 if witness figures out why you're weird.

levels.1: Minor quirks (hard time keeping secrets, tech malfunctions, people think ill of you).
levels.2: Small annoying problems (stutter at bad times, car trouble, expensive clothes ruined).
levels.3: Chronic misfortune (tools break, children fear you, always late).
levels.4: Major problems (people dislike you on principle, plans collapse, bank account drained).
levels.5: Pervasive bad luck (endeavors fail, tech never works, chronic pain/poor health).

Devil's Mark.description: Noticeable deformation insensate to pain. Creatures can draw Quintessence through it. May nurture Familiar without discomfort.

Echoes.description: Display weird phenomena associated with sorcery - air quivers, phantom music, shadows gather. Can serve as simple Resonance system.

levels.1: Slight manifestations (flickering shadow, souring milk, vague scent).
levels.2: Noticeable effects (animals shy/follow, vibes sensitives notice, uncomfortable around opposed energies).
levels.3: Recognized on sight by those who know what to look for. Plants bloom/wither. Holy/unholy symbols repulse (possible Willpower roll).
levels.4: Even Sleepers notice (shadow moves independently, no reflections, cold winds). Knowledgeable people can attempt countermagick (Int+Occult, diff Arete+3).
levels.5: Reality shifts around you (animals react strongly, people sick/energized, environmental changes radiate). Traditional charms can attack/repel (contested Willpower, 1 lethal/success).

Locked Vidare.description: Penumbra perspective frozen into one Vidare (Astral, Spiritus, or Mortem). Influences personality and focus.

Strangeness.description: Magick warps reality even unintentionally. ST rolls your Arete (diff 6) once or twice per session. Success = random Sphere-related occurrence. Botch = Paradox backlash.

Throwback.description: Haunted by past life. ST rolls dice equal to Flaw points (diff 8) when potential arises. Successes determine how much past affects present.

Scarred Avatar.description: Avatar carries trauma from past incarnations - typically violence, death, or moral failings. During the Diksha or Awakening, the mage experiences these traumas firsthand, creating lasting psychological scars. Common among Euthanatos whose Avatars fought in the Himalayan War.

levels.2: Occasional nightmares or unease when Avatar stirs. Past memories intrude at inconvenient times. +1 difficulty on Seeking rolls.
levels.3: Avatar's memories create noticeable personality bleed. May experience PTSD-like symptoms related to past life events. +1 difficulty to Arete rolls when emotionally triggered.
levels.4: Strong identification with past incarnation's traumas. Difficulty distinguishing present from past under stress. Avatar may withhold assistance during Seekings.
levels.5: Avatar and mage are deeply scarred. Past life's guilt, rage, or sorrow color every interaction. Seekings become nightmarish ordeals. May require atonement for past incarnation's deeds before advancing.

Scarred Avatar.note: Particularly appropriate for reincarnated Euthanatos, Akashi with troubled past lives, or any mage whose Avatar has witnessed atrocities across multiple incarnations.

Uncanny.description: Remarkably memorable. 1pt=stand out; 2pt=hard to conceal; 3pt=remembered long after; 4pt=creep people out; 5pt=scare people. Dice equal to points added to others' pools noticing you.

Gremlin.description: Troublesome companion creature. 1pt=trivial annoyances; 2pt=frustrating but not hazardous; 3pt=actual damage to property/health/status; 4pt=lasting harm; 5pt=significant power and malignancy.

Paranormal Prohibition or Imperative.description: Must do or forbidden from doing something. Base cost by likelihood of violation. +1-5 for consequence severity.

Bizarre Hunger.description: Must eat weird substances. 2pt=easy to get; 3pt=unpleasant/hazardous/illegal; 4pt=specialized/foul/criminal/expensive; 5pt=really shouldn't eat. Lose 1 health/day per Stamina dot without food.

Blood-Hungry Soul.description: Past-life ghoul addiction to vampire blood. 2pt=Willpower diff 5 to resist (rises to 6 after first taste); 3pt=diff 6 first/8 after; 5pt=diff 8 first/10 after.

Crucial Component.description: One instrument must be specifically created/harvested. 2pt=easy; 3pt=challenging; 4pt=hard; 5pt=unique/obscure/forbidden. Functions as Personalized Instrument.

Faulty Enhancements.description: Malfunctioning cybernetics. 2pt=disorientation/pain; 3pt=need daily medication or -1 die; 4pt=fail at critical times (on botch); 5pt=roll diff 7 each important use or fail.

Jinx/Infernal Contraption.description: Troublesome paranormal item. Points deducted from Wonder Background cost. 2pt=annoying; 4pt=problematic; 6pt=major flaws; 8pt=backfires on failed Wits+Esoterica; 10pt=open license for ST to cause problems.

Apprentice.description: Responsible for troublesome student. 1pt=cooperative ideal; 2pt=typical needs hand-holding; 3pt=clueless; 4pt=seriously challenging; 5pt=obstinate waste of time.

Branded.description: Tradition Tribunal found guilty. 3pt=temporary Low Crime brand (1-3 months, +1-2 diff social); 4pt=lasting Low Crime (year+, +2-3 diff); 5pt=lasting High Crime (9+ years, +3 diff, targeted by some).

Demented Eidolon.description: Technocrat: mad heretic in your head insisting what you do is magick. Avatar drives toward Reality Deviance.

Haunted.description: Angry ghost(s) determined to make you suffer.

Primal Marks.description: Marked by god/spirit/myth. Disconcerting appearance carries over through shapeshift. People recognize you.

Oathbreaker.description: Broken a sworn oath of significance. Serious atonement needed. Anyone reading auras or hearing gossip knows. Resonance/Paradox/Seekings/Quiet all reflect it.

Prone to Quiet.description: 4pt=Quiet is default backlash (5+ points); 5pt=can fall into Quiet without Paradox (Int+Enigmas roll in stressful situations).

Beast Within.description: Subject to frenzy. Roll Avatar rating + 1 (Willpower as difficulty) under intense stress. Failure = berserk rage using most destructive powers.

Blood Magick.description: Arts demand your blood. 1 unsoakable bashing health level per Effect. Accumulates quickly. Looks gross and vulgar.

Bound.description: In debt to entity whose power dwarfs yours. Live on borrowed time. Creditor calls in occasional favors.

Dark Fate.description: Terrible end in not-too-distant future. Must spend Willpower sometimes or lose 1 die from all rolls that day from dread.

Faithless.description: Broken faith with your god. Spheres stuck at Rank 1 until atonement. Paradigm must be religiously oriented.

Immortal Enemy.description: Pissed off immortal entity. Scale mirrors Powerful Ally Merit.

Psychic Vampire.description: Drain life-force from surroundings. 1 bashing health/hour to those in physical contact. Lose 1 health/day without draining someone. +2 diff healing Effects, -2 diff corruption Effects.

Bedeviled.description: Mysterious power dedicated to making your life misery. ST license for Book of Job treatment.

Phylactery.description: Avatar/soul resides outside body. Cannot use Spheres without physical connection to phylactery. If destroyed, lose magick forever. Immune to Gilgul while phylactery safe.

Taint of Corruption.description: Evil has intimate hold. 'Of the Wyrm' metaphysically. -2 diff for malignant magick, +2 diff for good magick. Aura shows corruption. Shapes focus.

Qlippothic Radiance.description: The Shells have left a visible mark. The character cannot conceal their Qlippothic nature from those with supernatural perception.

levels.1: Faint traces visible only to aura perception
levels.2: Heavier darkness in aura, minor unease to those nearby
levels.3: Pulsating anti-light in aura, distinct queasiness to others
levels.4: Strobing anti-light, urge to flee, buzzing sounds. +1 die Intimidation. Requires having reached Ghagiel.
levels.5: Storms of anti-light, insect swarms, cowering. +2 dice Intimidation. Requires having reached Thaumiel.

Spectral Presence.description: Passage through the Caul has torn the character's physical form. They exist largely in the Penumbra. Character is semi-solid—visible but barely tangible. Willpower roll (diff 6-8) to interact physically. 1 Willpower/turn to maintain solidity. Physical attacks pass through unless using Spirit/Mind/Prime/Entropy 2+.

Abyssal Lunatic.description: The character has been utterly shattered by Abyssal contact. They are not Quiet, not Marauder, not mentally ill—just broken. Renders character unplayable. Reserved for Storyteller characters only. Cannot be treated or repaired.

Widderslainte.description: Born with a Nephandic soul from a previous incarnation. The Cauls beckon constantly. May be taken by non-Fallen characters. Constant pull toward Descent. Willpower rolls to resist temptation toward evil. Eventually, the character will likely Fall. Same as Taint of Corruption but specifically defined as Nephandic heritage.

Obvious Resonance.description: After vulgar magick, your resonance lingers visibly for days equal to your Arete. -1 difficulty for others attempting to track or identify you.

Kapu.description: Sacred prohibitions that limit your use of mana. Examples: cannot take lava rock from islands, cannot eat with different genders, cannot approach dead bodies. Violating kapu causes penalties until properly atoned through ritual purification.

merits-flaws.sterile_note: Sterile (1pt) can be Merit or Flaw depending on whether character wants children
merits-flaws.cyclic_magick_note: Cyclic Magick (3pt) is both Merit AND Flaw - grants bonuses at peak, penalties at nadir
merits-flaws.spirit_magnet_note: Spirit Magnet (3-7pt) can be Merit (benevolent spirits) or Flaw (malevolent spirits)

_meta.description: M20 Attributes - 9 traits across Physical, Social, and Mental categories
_meta.allocation: Prioritize categories as Primary (7), Secondary (5), Tertiary (3)

physical.description: Raw physical capabilities of the body

Strength.description: Raw physical power: lifting, carrying, striking force

Dexterity.description: Agility, coordination, reflexes, fine motor control

Stamina.description: Endurance, toughness, ability to withstand damage and fatigue

social.description: Ability to interact with and influence others

Charisma.description: Personal magnetism, charm, ability to inspire and attract

Manipulation.description: Ability to get others to do what you want through guile

Appearance.description: Physical attractiveness and ability to make a visual impression

Perception.description: Awareness of surroundings, noticing details, intuition

Intelligence.description: Reasoning, memory, analytical thinking, learning capacity

Wits.description: Quick thinking, reacting to unexpected situations, mental agility

_meta.description: Awakened Mage character type for M20

attributes.note: All attributes start at 1 before allocation

rotes.note: Total Sphere dots across all starting rotes

resonance.note: Each trait is an adjective with a rating

abilities.note: Can exceed 3 only by spending freebies

arete.note: Maximum at character creation with freebies

background.multiplied: multiplier value (2 for Sanctum, Enhancement, Totem)

rotes.note: 1 freebie buys 4 Sphere dots worth of rotes

quintessence.requires: Prime 1 to hold more than Avatar rating

background_existing.multiplied: current * 3 * multiplier (current * 6 for Sanctum, Enhancement, Totem)

rotes.note: 1 XP buys 3 Sphere dots worth of rotes

affinity_sphere.advancement: XP cost is current * 7 instead of current * 8

quintessence.storage: Cannot hold more than Avatar without Prime 1
quintessence.maximum: With Prime 1, can store up to 20 (or more with higher Prime)

specialties.required: At 4+ dots in any Attribute or Ability
specialties.note: Must be defined at the time of reaching 4 dots

focus.practices: Should favor faction list but any permitted

faction_terminology._note: Use appropriate faction terminology in character sheets

validation_rules: Total attribute dots = 7+5+3 (plus starting 1 each) = 22 base before freebies
Total ability dots = 13+9+5 = 27 base before freebies
Background dots = 7 base before freebies (accounting for multipliers)
Sphere dots = 5 base + 1 free affinity = 6 total before freebies
Starting rotes = 6 Sphere dots worth before freebies
No sphere above Arete (determine Arete BEFORE allocating spheres)
All 4+ dot traits must have specialties
Affinity must match faction or chosen subfaction
All rotes must use only Spheres the character possesses
All rotes must be consistent with character's Practices
Freebie expenditure must equal 15 + Flaw points - Merit costs

_meta.description: Rules for mages who reach Arete 6+ and must choose their path to transcendence.
_meta.requirement: Upon reaching Arete 6, the mage must choose ONE path during their Seeking. This choice cannot be changed.

Archmage.description: The most common path. Archmages choose power in the context of their Focus. Though they can change the world, they are forever bound to their methods.

requirements.tenets: 5+ (Arete no longer limited by Tenet count at 6)

abilities.sphere_advancement: Can learn Spheres up to 6th dot

practice_mastery.description: Practices may continue to rise above 6, limited by Arete
practice_mastery.at_practice_6: One low-level effect (Spheres 2 or less) performed with that Practice becomes so embedded it is no longer vulgar for them

abilities.resonance: Gain one dot of Resonance tied to each Practice at 6+, which only Exemplar-level Prime can mask

Archmage.limitations: Forever unable to surpass their Focus
Archmage.role: Tend to remain active in mage society. Great leaders, massive undertakings, prolific mentors.

Exemplar.description: Rarer than Archmages. Exemplars align so strongly with a Sphere that it replaces their Focus and eventually consumes their individuality.

requirements.exemplary_sphere: Must designate one Sphere as their exemplary Sphere

sphere_advancement.description: Can raise exemplary Sphere up to 10th rank
sphere_advancement.other_spheres: No other Sphere can exceed (10 - exemplary Sphere rating). E.g., Forces 7 means no other Sphere above 3.

focus_transcendence.description: No longer need Practices for low-level effects using only exemplary Sphere
focus_transcendence.at_sphere_6: Ignore Focus for effects rank 2 or less
focus_transcendence.at_sphere_7: Ignore Focus for effects rank 4 or less
focus_transcendence.at_sphere_8: Ignore Focus for effects rank 6 or less
focus_transcendence.at_sphere_9: Ignore Focus for effects rank 8 or less
focus_transcendence.at_sphere_10: Ignore Focus for all effects; can use no other Spheres; has left human perspectives

abilities.faction_connection: Remain accessible to their faction, though increasingly distant

limitations.social_penalty: Subtract (exemplary Sphere rating - 5) dice from all social rolls with beings not tied to their exemplary Sphere
limitations.identity_loss: Eventually lose themselves to their exemplary Sphere
limitations.retreat: Almost all eventually retreat to the appropriate Shade Realm

Oracle.description: The rarest path. Oracles have the revelation that their Practice limits them. They seek to surpass their Focus entirely. This is the only path that leads to true Ascension rather than a dead end.

requirements.exceptional_seeking: Must have revelation during Seeking that Focus is limiting

focus_transcendence.description: Effects using Spheres rated below (Arete - 5) can be used without invoking Practices
focus_transcendence.practice_bonus: Using Practices still provides -1 difficulty bonus

abilities.universal_practice: For Reality Zones, Sanctums, Rituals, etc., act as if having rating of (Arete - 5) in ALL Practices. Can work with any mage easily.
abilities.tenet_transcendence: Realize their Tenets are true for them but not necessarily for others

limitations.sphere_cap: Cannot advance any single Sphere beyond 6
limitations.rarity: Most difficult path; few complete it

path_progression.description: Few call themselves Oracles. True Oracles have transcended Focus entirely.
path_progression.arete_7: Can use Sphere 1 effects without Practice
path_progression.arete_8: Can use Sphere 1-2 effects without Practice
path_progression.arete_9: Can use Sphere 1-3 effects without Practice
path_progression.arete_10: Full Oracle status - true transcendence and potential Ascension

Oracle.social_role: Rarely interact with former Traditions/Conventions/Crafts as members. Find the Ascension War petty. Often speak with mages on verge of Arete 6 Seeking to dissuade them from Archmage/Exemplar paths.

archspheres._description: Powers beyond normal Sphere ratings. Archmages can take 1 per Sphere at 6. Exemplars gain 1 per Sphere dot above 5. Oracles cannot gain Archmasteries.

acquisition.exemplar: One Archmastery per dot of exemplary Sphere above 5

Area of Effect.description: Target all people within an area simultaneously. Required successes determined by Correspondence chart for area size rather than number of targets.

Counter-Counterspell.description: The Archmage's magick with this Sphere requires twice as many successes to counter or unweave.

Doublecast.description: The Archmage can perform two effects involving this Sphere simultaneously.

Easier Conjunctions.description: Effects where the archsphere is the Primary Sphere have their conjunctional requirements halved (rounded down).

Efficient Quintessence.description: Quintessence and Tass costs are halved (rounded down) and may become zero. Particularly prized by Prime Archmages making Wonders.
Efficient Quintessence.note: Exemplars may take this multiple times

Extreme Specialization.description: No longer double 10s when using Specialty. Instead, roll two dice for each dot of Arete.
Extreme Specialization.note: Exemplars may take this multiple times

Larger Dicepools.description: Roll Attribute + Ability + Arete for rotes using this Sphere (instead of just Attribute + Ability).

Paradox Magnet.description: Upon casting a vulgar effect with this Sphere, may cause all Paradox accrued by others using this Sphere to apply to them rather than the caster. Lasts for a scene, cannot be canceled early.

Permanence.description: May permanently extend an effect's duration without the usually required successes by expending a Willpower dot.

Shade Access.description: May roll Arete at difficulty 6 to immediately transport to the Shade Realm of their archmastered Sphere.

Universal Specialization.description: Understands the Sphere so thoroughly that all effects using it are treated as though their specialty applies.

seeking_visions.description: At Arete 6, the Seeking presents three paths through appropriate symbolism. The mage can only walk one.
seeking_visions.archmage_symbolism: Often appears as gaining great tools, weapons, or a seat of power while being bound to a specific role or method
seeking_visions.exemplar_symbolism: Often appears as merging with a concept, element, or force - becoming one with pure [Sphere concept]
seeking_visions.oracle_symbolism: Often appears as shedding limitations, walking through walls, or ascending beyond all categories

tenet_path_affinities.description: Ascension Tenets strongly influence which path mages take at Arete 6

Achieve Full Knowledge.reason: Rare to give up learning more Sphere magick for abstract Arete understanding

Annihilation is Freedom.reason: Focus on abnegation of self aligns with transcendence paths

Build a Utopia.reason: Almost universal - seeking power to change the world without losing themselves
