Existence is Meaningless.reason: Seeing everything as meaningless makes distinctions between paths seem petty

Merge With The Divine.reason: Seeking Ascension itself rather than power or knowledge

Power is its Own Reward.reason: Archmages have broadest power; some evaluate Exemplars as more powerful

_meta.prime_2_rule: To conjure Pattern from nothing: Pattern Sphere 3 + Prime 2

Correspondence 2.name: Sense/Touch Space
Correspondence 2.vulgarity: Coincidental if unwitnessed; sensing is always coincidental
Correspondence 2.notes: The Rule of Correspondence: Effect limited to your Corr rank (can't project Mind 4 with Corr 2)

Correspondence 3.name: Pierce Space/Co-locality
capabilities: Be aware of all locations around a point
conjunctions: Corr 3 + Forces 3 + Entropy 2: Minor weather tweaks
Correspondence 3.vulgarity: Vulgar without witnesses (teleportation); coincidental if unseen departure AND arrival
Correspondence 3.notes: The Batman: disappearing into darkness can be coincidental

Correspondence 4.name: Rend Space/Co-location
capabilities: Be in multiple places at once
conjunctions: Corr 4 + Life 4 + Mind 2: Multiple simultaneous selves
Corr 4 + Time 4: Anchor point return from any distance
Correspondence 4.notes: Permanent gates require extended rolls, many successes

Correspondence 5.name: Mutate Localities
conjunctions: Corr 5 + Forces 5: Weather anywhere in world
Corr 5 + Prime 5 + Spirit 5: Spirit prison realm
Corr 5 + all Pattern Spheres 5 + others: Create Horizon Realm
Correspondence 5.notes: Horizon Realm creation requires: Corr 5 + Entropy 3 + Forces 5 + Life 5 + Matter 5 + Mind 3 + Prime 5 + Spirit 5

Entropy 1.name: Sense Fate & Fortune
Entropy 1.notes: Good for gambling, finding weak points in structures or arguments

Entropy 2.name: Control Probability
conjunctions: Entropy 2 + Corr 3 + Forces 3: Minor weather tweaks
Entropy 2.vulgarity: Usually coincidental if subtle; vulgar if blatant (rolling 20 sixes in a row)
Entropy 2.notes: Cannot affect living beings directly yet

Entropy 3.name: Affect Predictable Patterns
conjunctions: Entropy 3 + Life 3: Blessings/curses on living beings
Entropy 3.vulgarity: Decay: vulgar if rapid/witnessed. Luck: usually coincidental
Entropy 3.notes: Aggravated damage to objects; bashing to living beings

Entropy 4.name: Affect Life
capabilities: Heal or harm living beings directly (aggravated)
conjunctions: Entropy 4 + Life 4: Lasting curses that follow
Entropy 4.vulgarity: Direct harm is vulgar; subtle long-term effects can be coincidental
Entropy 4.notes: Entropy damage to living beings is aggravated

Entropy 5.name: Affect Thought
Entropy 5.notes: Binding oaths require willing agreement from target

Forces 1.name: Perceive Forces
capabilities: Perceive all energy types: light, heat, sound, electricity, radiation, kinetic, magnetism, gravity
Sense electrical fields and radio waves

Forces 2.name: Control Minor Forces
conjunctions: Forces 2 + Corr 2: Affect forces at distance
Forces 2.combat: +/- 1 die per success to impact damage; deflect projectiles
Forces 2.vulgarity: Invisibility/silence: coincidental if subtle. Flight: usually vulgar
Forces 2.notes: Blackout small electronics with few successes

Forces 3.name: Transmute Minor Forces
conjunctions: Forces 3 + Prime 2: Conjure fire/lightning from nothing
Forces 3 + Life 3: Transform body into elemental energy
Forces 3 + Matter 2: Transform forces into solid matter
Forces 3.vulgarity: Creating energy from nothing: vulgar. Transforming existing: can be coincidental
Forces 3.notes: Prime 2 required to conjure from nothing

Forces 4.name: Control Major Forces
conjunctions: Forces 4 + Entropy 3: Weather-witching (suggest to existing weather)
Forces 4 + Prime 3 + Matter 2: Dangerous storms with hazards
Forces 4.vulgarity: Weather from existing conditions: can be coincidental (takes hours). Instant storms: vulgar
Forces 4.notes: Weather-witching takes hours unless vulgar; weather follows natural climate tendencies

Forces 5.name: Transmute Major Forces
capabilities: Control any forces at massive scale
conjunctions: Forces 5 + Prime 4 + Entropy 3 + Matter 3: Impossible weather (1 Quint/Sphere dot)
Forces 5 + Corr 5: Weather anywhere in world
Forces 5.weight_limit: Most things this side of a mountain
Forces 5.vulgarity: Always vulgar for impossible weather; storms from nothing always vulgar
Forces 5.notes: Willpower rolls to maintain storm control (diff 5 rain, 7 thunderstorm, 9 tornado). Earthquakes harm structures not characters directly.

Life 1.name: Sense Life
Life 1.notes: Foundation for all Life work; can sense but not affect

Life 2.name: Alter Simple Patterns/Heal Self
Life 2.vulgarity: Healing unwitnessed: coincidental. Visible changes: vulgar if witnessed
Life 2.notes: Cannot heal others yet; cannot make major structural changes to self

Life 3.name: Alter Self/Transform Simple Life/Heal Others
capabilities: Add features to self (claws, gills, armor)
Life 3.successes: Transform self similar: 2. Self radical: 3. Other similar: 4. Other radical: 5+
Life 3.vulgarity: Healing unwitnessed: coincidental. Visible shapeshifting: vulgar

Life 4.name: Alter Complex Life/Perfect Metamorphosis
capabilities: Force werecreature to hold form (+ Spirit 4)
conjunctions: Life 4 + Spirit 4 + Prime 3: Revive recently dead (~5 min)
Life 4 + Corr 4 + Mind 2: Multiple simultaneous selves
Life 4.notes: Resurrection limited to ~5 minutes dead without decay

Life 5.name: Create Complex Life/Perfect Metamorphosis
capabilities: Any transformation on any living thing
Create life with soul (+ Prime 2 + Mind 5 + Spirit 5)
conjunctions: Life 5 + Prime 2 + Mind 5: Create complex life with mind
Life 5 + Mind 5 + Spirit 5 + Prime 3: Full resurrection
Life 5 + Prime 3: Periapt from living tissue
Life 5.vulgarity: Creating life: always vulgar. Perfect metamorphosis: vulgar
Life 5.notes: Full resurrection requires Life 5 + Mind 5 + Spirit 5 + Prime 3; add Matter 2-4 for decayed body

Matter 2.name: Basic Transmutation
capabilities: Transmute within same state/properties (solid to solid)
Matter 2.notes: Cannot change state (solid to liquid) or fundamental properties yet

Matter 3.name: Alter Form
capabilities: Alter form AND properties during transmutation
conjunctions: Matter 3 + Forces 3: Transform forces to matter
Matter 3.vulgarity: Creating from nothing: vulgar. Reshaping existing: can be coincidental if subtle
Matter 3.notes: Prime 2 required to conjure from nothing

Matter 4.name: Complex Transmutation
conjunctions: Matter 4 + Forces 4 + Prime 3: Complex technological wonders
Matter 4.notes: Can create working machines and electronics

Matter 5.name: Alter Properties
Matter 5.notes: Can create substances that don't naturally exist

Mind 1.name: Sense Thoughts & Emotions
Mind 1.notes: Mental shield provides defense against Mind attacks

Mind 2.name: Read Surface Thoughts/Mental Impulse
Mind 2.notes: Cannot control, only read and send impulses

Mind 3.name: Mental Link/Project Illusions
Mind 3.combat: Psychic blast: bashing damage. With Life 3: aggravated
Mind 3.notes: Illusions exist only in target's mind

Mind 4.name: Control Conscious Mind/Astral Projection
conjunctions: Mind 4+ + Spirit 3 + Prime 2: Astral with spirit travel
Mind 4.difficulty: Target's Willpower (min 4); +3 for unwanted action; +3 vs mages automatically; +5 vs Night-Folk often
Mind 4.notes: Astral body is vulnerable; possession requires beating target's Willpower

Mind 5.name: Control Subconscious/Untether Consciousness
conjunctions: Mind 5 + Life 5 + Spirit 5 + Prime 3: Full resurrection

Prime 1.name: Etheric Senses
Prime 1.notes: Required to perceive and work with raw magickal energy

Prime 2.name: Fuel Pattern/Body of Light
capabilities: Fuel patterns with Quintessence (required for conjuration)
Add aggravated damage to attacks (1 Quint per hit)
conjunctions: Prime 2 + Pattern 3: Conjure Pattern from nothing
Prime 2.vulgarity: Body of Light: vulgar. Fueling patterns: coincidental if effect is
Prime 2.notes: THE KEY CONJUNCTION: Prime 2 + Pattern Sphere 3 = conjure from nothing

Prime 3.name: Channel Quintessence
capabilities: Channel Quintessence from one thing to another
Prime 3.vulgarity: Energy weapons: vulgar. Enchantment: depends on effect
Prime 3.notes: Simple Wonders are temporary; permanent requires Prime 4

Prime 4.name: Expel/Infuse Energy
conjunctions: Prime 4: Create Fetish (willing spirit; unwilling = Spirit 4)
Prime 4.vulgarity: Draining to destruction: vulgar. Enchantment: depends
Prime 4.notes: Permanent Wonders require extended casting and Quintessence investment

Prime 5.name: Create Node/Nullify Paradox
conjunctions: Prime 5 alone: Create Node, Nullify Paradox, Blessings
Prime 5.vulgarity: Creating Nodes: vulgar. Nullifying Paradox: vulgar
Prime 5.notes: Node creation requires ~10 successes per Rating dot desired

Spirit 1.name: Spirit Sight
Spirit 1.notes: Can see but not interact with spirits

Spirit 2.name: Touch Spirit/Manipulate Gauntlet
Spirit 2.notes: Spirit-based Focus: Add Spirit 2 to effects for magic through spiritual connection

Spirit 3.name: Pierce Gauntlet/Step Sideways
Spirit 3.notes: Entering/leaving Umbra requires appropriate Gauntlet rating

Spirit 4.name: Rend/Seal Gauntlet/Bind Spirits
conjunctions: Spirit 4 + Life 4 + Prime 3: Revive recently dead
Spirit 4.notes: Binding unwilling spirits may have consequences

Spirit 5.name: Gilgul/Create Realms/Deep Umbra
conjunctions: Spirit 5 + Corr 5 + Prime 5: Spirit prison realm
Spirit 5 + Life 5 + Mind 5 + Prime 3: Full resurrection
Spirit 5.notes: Gilgul destroys the victim's Avatar permanently - considered one of the worst crimes

Time 1.name: Time Sense
capabilities: Perceive if time has been altered

Time 2.name: Past/Future Sight
capabilities: Conceal own Time magick from other Time mages
Total recall when combined with Mind 3/4
Time 2.notes: Futures seen are possibilities, not certainties

Time 3.name: Time Contraction/Dilation
capabilities: Speed up time for self (extra actions)
Time 3.extra_actions: 2 successes per additional action; 1-2 extra = may be coincidental; 3+ = vulgar
Time 3.vulgarity: Speed/slow: can be coincidental for 1-2 actions. REWINDING IS ALWAYS VULGAR even in Sanctums
Time 3.notes: Rewinding: +3 difficulty always; 1 Paradox layer per turn rewound; 2 layers per interval on timeline

Time 4.name: Time Determinism
conjunctions: Time 4 + Corr 4: Anchor point return from any distance
Time 4.vulgarity: Freezing time: vulgar. Triggers: can be coincidental until activation
Time 4.notes: Each successive Time effect in scene must beat previous successes

Time 5.name: Future Travel/Time Immunity
capabilities: Time immunity (unaffected by others' Time magick)
Time 5.notes: Time travel is extremely dangerous and paradox-prone; changing the past creates massive Paradox

_meta.description: Tenets are specific beliefs that form the building blocks of a mage's Paradigm. Every mage needs at least 3 Tenets: one Metaphysical, one Personal, and one Ascension. Arete cannot exceed number of Tenets until Arete 6.

rules.arete_limit: Arete cannot exceed number of Tenets until Arete reaches 6

metaphysical._description: Explains the fundamental nature of Reality and why magick exists

A Rational Universe.description: The Universe runs on logic. Things can be studied and experimented on; understanding can increase over time.

As Above, So Below.description: The cosmos is fundamentally interlinked across scales. A person is the same as the universe; changing one will change the other.

Fall From Grace.description: Things were once better than they are now. Memory of, knowledge from, or synergy with the lost better world can restore it.

Reality is a Lie.description: What our senses show us is wrong. The actual Reality is nothing like what we perceive.

The Divine is Real.description: Though debated, the existence of the Divine is clear. Knowing this allows it to be channeled.

Unfathomable Forces at Work.description: Humans are tiny compared to true powers in this world. A few can make themselves known to things that matter.

personal._description: Explains why the mage can use magick but others cannot

I Am Chosen.description: Something (God, demon, incomprehensible force) chose the mage to empower. They owe their power to whoever chose them.

I Am Not Limited.description: Limitations hold people back. The mage laughs at these - physics, morality, whatever - and refuses to be limited.

I Am Special.description: Something intrinsic sets the mage apart - genetics, force of will, or something else that makes them permanently different.

I Have Greater Understanding.description: Power comes from greater knowledge and understanding - religious epiphany, years of study, or a trick that breaks physics.

ascension._description: Defines the ultimate purpose of magick

Achieve Full Knowledge.description: The whole point of magick is to acquire greater knowledge and understand things others don't.

Annihilation is Freedom.description: No one confined to the perceived world is truly free. True freedom requires annihilating the self or everything else.

Build a Utopia.description: A better world is possible, but Sleepers don't have what it takes. Mages exist to imagine and bring a better world into being.

Existence is Meaningless.description: It's all pointless. Either make our own meaning or recognize the absurdity. If nothing matters, we can do whatever we want.

Merge With The Divine.description: Humans weren't meant to be separate. Magick lets us return to or join with the greater Divine whole.

Power is its Own Reward.description: Some mages want power. Power is the only thing that matters. Magick is power, and more magick is more power.

social_role._description: Optional tenets about the mage's role in society

I Illuminate.description: The mage's role is to uncover truths and shed light on what is hidden, publicizing knowledge for Sleepers.

I Rule.description: Magick naturally puts mages at the top. Weak defer to powerful mages, Sleepers defer to all mages.

I Serve.description: The role of the mage is to serve the masses or higher beings, not using magick for selfish ends.

epistemology._description: Optional tenets about how knowledge is gained

Mystical Insights.description: Gaining knowledge lies between rational and irrational. Intuition and logical leaps are crucial.

Scientific Experimentation.description: Science pries knowledge from the Universe through theory and experiment. Techniques can push beyond normal science.

Divine Revelations.description: New knowledge only comes from direct revelation from the Divine. Books are less valuable than personal revelation.

openness._description: Optional tenets about how the mage views other Focuses

Closed Paradigm.description: There is only one right way. Supremely confident in their vision, intolerant of other views.

Hierarchical Paradigm.description: Many Paradigms can work, but some are better than others. The mage believes theirs may be best.

Open Paradigm.description: All roads lead to Rome. Many methods work to change the world and lead to Enlightenment.

afterlife._description: Optional tenets about what happens after death

Reincarnation.description: Life cycles extend to the soul, which returns to do it again. Everyone lives many lives.

YOLO.description: This is it. No do-overs. Past Lives are only faint echoes through the Avatar, not proof of soul reuse.

_meta.description: Resonance traits by Sphere affinity and Practice. Nodes/Wonders should have Resonance totaling at least their Rank. Archmasters gain mandatory Practice Resonance at Practice 6+.

practices._note: Archmasters at Practice 6+ gain one dot of mandatory Resonance from their Practice. This can only be masked by Exemplar-level Prime.

corrupted_practices._note: Corrupted Practice Resonance accumulates as the mage falls. When Corrupted Resonance equals Practice rating, the Practice is fully corrupted.

Correspondence.1: Sense immediate spatial relationships, find hidden things nearby, orientation
Correspondence.2: Sense distant locations, touch/affect through space, teleport small objects
Correspondence.3: Teleport self, open/close gates, view multiple places simultaneously
Correspondence.4: Create permanent gates, wards against passage, be in multiple places
Correspondence.5: Stretch/compress space, overlap locations, spatial mutilation

Entropy.1: Sense flaws/fate/fortune, detect lies, predict randomness, spot weaknesses
Entropy.2: Control probability, force specific random outcomes
Entropy.3: Decay/reinforce objects, grant good/bad luck to others
Entropy.4: Long-term luck control, heal/harm living beings directly (aggravated)
Entropy.5: Affect thoughts/memes, destroy ideas, bind oaths, alter beliefs

Forces.1: Perceive all energy types (infrared, electricity, radiation, kinetic, sound)
Forces.2: Manipulate existing forces, enhance/weaken, invisibility, silence
Forces.3: Transmute forces, conjure from nothing (with Prime 2), telekinesis
Forces.4: Control major forces, weather manipulation, mile-scale effects
Forces.5: Transmute major forces, region-scale effects, conjure infernos

Life.1: Sense living things, detect health/age/physical state
Life.2: Alter simple life (invertebrates, plants), heal self, cosmetic self-changes
Life.3: Transform simple life, alter/heal/harm others, add features to self
Life.4: Alter complex life, transform self into other creatures
Life.5: Create complex life (with Prime 2), perfect metamorphosis, any transformation

Matter.1: Analyze composition, understand structure, detect hidden compartments
Matter.2: Basic transmutation (same state/properties), lead to gold
Matter.3: Alter form and properties during transmutation, mend/break objects
Matter.4: Complex transmutation, create composite materials and machinery
Matter.5: Alter any properties, create any substance

Mind.1: Sense emotions/auras, shield mind, enhance mental attributes
Mind.2: Read surface thoughts, send emotional impulses, read object memories
Mind.3: Telepathy, project illusions, dreamwalk, psychic blast (bashing)
Mind.4: Control conscious mind, alter memories, astral projection
Mind.5: Control subconscious, permanent mental changes, create intelligence

Prime.1: Sense Quintessence/Resonance, use Nodes, consecrate items
Prime.2: Fuel patterns with Quintessence, add aggravated damage, Body of Light
Prime.3: Channel Quintessence, create simple Wonders, energy weapons
Prime.4: Destroy by draining Quintessence, create permanent Wonders, refine Tass
Prime.5: Create Nodes, infuse/withdraw life force, nullify Paradox

Spirit.1: See spirits/auras, sense Gauntlet strength, detect Fetishes
Spirit.2: Touch/speak to spirits, manipulate Gauntlet rating
Spirit.3: Step sideways, heal/harm spirits, awaken/lull object spirits
Spirit.4: Rend/seal Gauntlet, bind spirits, create Fetishes, exorcism
Spirit.5: Gilgul (destroy Avatar), create Realms, enter Deep Umbra

Time.1: Always know current time, detect Time magick ripples
Time.2: See past and future, conceal own Time magick
Time.3: Speed/slow time, bullet time, rewind time (+3 diff, always vulgar)
Time.4: Freeze time completely, time bubbles, set triggers, anchor points
Time.5: Time travel, time immunity, step outside time's flow

_meta.description: Faction-specific title systems by Arete or role. Format varies: some by Arete level, some by role.
Faction to Subfaction to Affinity Sphere mapping for M20
_meta.usage: Each faction has a default affinity and optional subfactions with alternate affinities
_meta.note: Orphans may choose any affinity Sphere

Jnani.description: Hermits and wanderers, one of the original three Akashic pai. They believe bodies, minds, and spirits are identical to the Tapestry, thus Spirit magick changes the caster as much as the spiritual world. Many Jnani now operate online, seeking wisdom through internet technologies.

Kannagara.description: The oldest of the three original pai. Monks who train every Akashi during their sidai apprenticeship. Keepers and interpreters of the Akashic Record, producing written accounts of karmic consequences. Most are ascetic monks with meditative hobbies.

L\u00ec-H\u00e0i.description: Founded on Mòzǐ's philosophy of jiān ài (universal love). Consequentialist rebels who incorporate traditional elements only after proving benefit to humanity. Act as spiritual R&D, partnering with other pai. Heavy involvement in internet research examining ideas for potential.
L\u00ec-H\u00e0i.leader: Thay Cô Một Hơi Thở (also Shīfù Một Hơi Thở)

Sh\u00ec-R\u00e9n.description: Bureaucratic legalists born from Chinese legalism shift. International leaders shaping culture toward ethics and virtue. Recently grown due to influx of former Wūlóng members. Spreading martial arts, yoga, meditation, and mindfulness to Sleepers through internet videos.

Vajrapani.description: Warrior monks seeking enlightenment through sweat and blood. Enforcers of the Tradition who avoid killing to prevent karmic stain, but will eliminate those beyond redemption. Heavily involved in martial arts studios worldwide. Created new blended martial art combining 36 Vajrapani styles.

W\u016bl\u00f3ng.description: Former enemies of the Akashayana who destroyed the Shaolin Temple. Once Heaven's mouthpieces and sole source of religious wisdom in China. After the Avatar Storm severed their connection to the Shen, most joined the Akashayana (some went to Order of Hermes or remained Disparate). Now partnered with Kannagara to understand what happened and reopen Heaven's connection.
W\u016bl\u00f3ng.note: Smallest pai; Jǐnyú Xī left to join Shì-Rén

terminology.Akasha: The fifth element in classical Buddhism and Hinduism
terminology.Akashi: One or more members of the Akashayana
terminology.Bodhimandala: A Chantry (also: Akhara, Dōjō, Dojang, Wǔguǎn)
terminology.Draladharma: Guiding principle - understanding there are no enemies, only morally correct actions
terminology.Eternal name: The name attached to one's Avatar, used by reincarnated Akashi
terminology.Sh\u012bf\u00f9: Teacher and master (also: sifu, Sensei, seonsaeng, guru)
terminology.Sempai: Any Akashi senior to the speaker; informal teaching role
terminology.K\u014dhai: Any Akashi junior to the speaker; informal student role
terminology.Sidai: Apprentice in Kannagara before choosing sect
terminology.L\u00f9k\u014fu: Intersection - karmic bond connecting two or more Avatars

Monists.description: Seekers of the One true source

Cult of Ecstasy.note: The Tradition is transitioning from 'Cult of Ecstasy' to 'Sahajiya' as part of internal reform movement

code_of_ananda_updated.6: Judge Not, For All Things Must Pass
code_of_ananda_updated.7: Claim Not the Mind of Another
code_of_ananda_updated.9: Your Truth is Not All Truths
code_of_ananda_updated.10: This World is Terrible. Be Kind

Sahajiya.description: Hindu tantric practitioners - also name of the reform movement

Baruti.description: African shamans of the living world

Spirit Smiths.description: Crafters of fetishes and spirit tools

House Criamon.description: Enigma-seekers and paradox philosophers. House Criamon produces some of the Order's most enigmatic mages.
House Criamon.notable_member: Zagadka Vandamal (Master, Arete 6) - Gender-fluid riddlemaster with deep violet eyes

House Hong Lei.description: Chinese elemental sorcerers practicing Waidan (outer alchemy). Known for jade gates and the Waidan Ding cauldron.
House Hong Lei.practice: Waidan - Taoist outer alchemy for achieving harmony (exoteric) and control (esoteric)
House Hong Lei.wonder: Waidan Ding - Three-legged alchemical cauldron for Willpower restoration

House Ngoma.description: African spirit-workers who maintain ties to the Ngoma Craft. Introduced Imphepho Wierook (ritual incense) to the Order. Sangomas of this House blend Hermetic theory with African traditions.
House Ngoma.wonder: Imphepho Wierook - Ritually prepared incense for protection, divination, summoning
House Ngoma.relationship: Maintains strong connections to the Ngoma Craft; some mages hold dual membership

House Quaesitor.description: Judges and law-keepers of the Order

House Xaos.description: Chaos mages embracing disorder and Discordianism. Worship Eris, goddess of chaos and discord.
House Xaos.notable_info: Kallisti combines High Ritual Magick with Reality Hacking. Has large '23' tattoo and golden apple with 'Kallisti' in classical Greek. Claims to sometimes BE Eris.

Gardeners of the Tree.description: Caretakers of the World Tree traditions

current_factions.Digital Web: Traditional VA focus on cyberspace, virtual reality, and the Web itself
current_factions.Beyond the Web: Newer faction focusing on AR, real-world integration, and meatspace operations

ar_operations.First Sector: AR library for indigenous knowledge preservation
ar_operations.Project Timmy: Remote laboratory work through AR projection
ar_operations.Blackhat Wiki: Enemy tagging and annotation system for identifying threats

Knights of Ganesha.description: Elite Tradition communications specialists providing IT support across factions

wonders.Rod Logic Computer: Non-electronic mechanical calculation device for hostile EM environments
wonders.Trinary Deck: Avatar-enhanced computer using three components (processor, operator, Avatar)

Ahl-i-Batin.description: Unity through subtlety; the Subtle Ones seek divine oneness (Tawhid) through connection

key_concepts.Web_of_Faith: Network of Nodes and aqueducts connecting Batini worldwide
key_concepts.Qutb: Judge - guides pursuits and prevents corruption
key_concepts.Tariqa: The Way - training and magickal techniques

terminology.Muwahhid: One who believes in tawhid (divine oneness)
terminology.Qutb: Judge who guides and prevents corruption

Bata'a.description: Afro-Caribbean spirit workers; mages of the African Diaspora practicing Voudoun and related traditions

Kongo.description: Communicators and trackers; detectives of the Bata'a who can trace connections across any distance

Igbo.description: Tricksters and con artists; manipulate situations and game systems, often enter politics

Akan.description: Gamblers and hustlers; roll dice and read cowrie shells, found among criminals and society's underbelly

Mande.description: Healers and poison-masters; run botanicas, work with herbs, roots, and Nkisi effigies

Fon.description: Messengers; maintain Chain of Souls, know every Creyente and member worldwide, creators of memework

Ewe.description: Keepers of knowledge and Books of Moses; artistic but demanding craft, prone to psychotic breaks from information overload

Yoruba.description: Warriors and Chwal (horses); ridden by les Mystères (Loa/Orisha), revolutionaries and heroes of the Bata'a

terminology.les Myst\u00e8res: The Loa/Orisha/spirits served by the Bata'a
terminology.Chwal: Horse - one who is possessed/ridden by spirits
terminology.Tobe: Mojo Bag - sign of office and passport to the Other Side
terminology.v\u00e9v\u00e9: Ritual symbol/sigil drawn to invoke spirits
terminology.Yawa Cross: Fork in the Road, center of offerings at the Four Corners
terminology.Seven Clans Made One: The unified clans forming the Bata'a

Hollow Ones.description: Post-modern eclectics embracing the hollow spaces; Darklings who find truth in decay, romance, and questioning everything

Councilors.description: Seek recognition and cooperation with Traditions; willing to work within systems for mutual benefit

Revolutionaries.description: Reject all organized mage factions; build alliances with other supernatural outsiders (vampires, werewolves, faeries)

Hollow Ones.cliques_note: Hollow Ones also organize into informal cliques (study groups) like Incognitos, Soundwaves, and many others

terminology.Clique: Informal study group of like-minded Hollowers
terminology.Railroad: Network of sanctum doorways for Rider couriers
terminology.Rider: Courier who travels the Railroad between sanctums

Kahu.description: Polynesian/Hawaiian guardians of mana and sacred places; navigators of physical and spiritual seas

Oracles.title: kahuna kilokilo
Oracles.description: Diviners and prophets; guide communities toward auspicious futures, saw the storm brewing on the horizon

Wayfinders.title: ho'okele-moana
Wayfinders.description: Navigate physical and spirit seas; searching for lost islands and Wayfarers lost to Avatar Storm, seek Ravana's Navel

Flametenders.title: kahuna ho'omanamana
Flametenders.description: Protect mana sources (heiau); work as firefighters, park rangers; seek stolen artifacts like those from Iolani Palace

Kahu.note: 'Kopa Loei' is a nonsense phrase imposed by outsiders; the Craft prefers 'Kahu' (guardians)

terminology.kapu: Sacred prohibition; violating causes penalties until atoned
terminology.kahuna nui: High priest skilled in multiple domains
terminology.Kumulipo: Creation chant/genealogy sung on New Year's

Ngoma.description: Northeast African scholar-priests tracing lineage to ancient Kush and Meroe; keepers of ancestral wisdom and ceremonial magick

Lightbringers.description: Largest faction; push for Alliance leadership and expanded Council involvement, ready to assume the mantle of leadership

Curators.description: Isolationist; focused on repatriation of stolen artifacts, deeply distrust Templars and some Alliance members

Meroe Priesthood.description: Fast-growing among young mages; advocate cooperation with Traditions (especially Hermetics) against Nephandi threat

terminology.New Kush: Initiative to rebuild Ngoma power and influence

Orphans.description: Self-taught or independently Awakened mages without formal Craft membership; fiercely independent and often clueless about the Ascension War
Orphans.not_a_craft: Orphans insist they are not part of the Alliance or any organization

Taftani.description: Persian elemental sorcerers and craftspeople; Weavers of Asha (Truth) who imbue their creations with magick and command djinn

Zaotar.description: Warriors for magick; embrace vulgar effects, want to show the world magick is real, no fear of Paradox

Kahin.description: Diviners and programmers; more cautious, work within systems, design Digital Web sectors, create viral social media content

terminology.Asha: Truth - woven into all Taftani creations
terminology.bagha: Gardens where Taftani gather twice yearly to meet and duel
terminology.Simoom: Wind spirit, often the first spirit a Taftani learns to call
terminology.Weaver: Common name for Taftani, from their craftwork origins

Templar Knights.description: Christian warrior-mystics descended from the Knights Templar; wield Orichalcum blades and pursue the triumph of virtue
alternate_names: Knights of the Temple of Solomon

terminology.Knight-Captain: Field commander with squad of Retainers
terminology.Orichalcum: Mystical metal used in Templar weapons

Wu Lung.description: Chinese celestial mages tracing lineage to ancient Dragon Witches; serve as advisors and work with gods and spirits through ritual

Yellow Dragon.description: Young, progressive; serve the people, support Hong Kong democracy movement, assisted 2019 protesters with magick

Azure Dragon.description: Older, conservative; serve political elites and wealthy, advised government during protests

Taiwan Branch.description: Supports democracy and progressive causes including gender equality and LGBT rights

terminology.tianshi: Heavenly master - title for experienced mage (Mandarin: tiānshī / Cantonese: tinsi)
terminology.Fu: Talismans - yellow paper with spells in fancy script
terminology.Tan: Makeshift altar with yellow tablecloth, Fu, incense, offerings
terminology.Xi: Archaic word for male witches; derisive nickname for Azure Dragon

Sisters of Hippolyta.description: Amazon warrior-mystics tracing lineage to ancient Themiscyra; fight for women's freedom and choices through martial prowess and shamanic magick

France Conclave.description: Largest and most traditional; recently reformed after 2005 riots, mixed epitropi

Greece Conclave.description: Close to mythic roots; based near historical Themiscyra region

UK Conclave.description: Active in feminist causes across Britain

Vancouver Conclave.description: Most progressive; involved in abortion rights, indigenous women's rights, LGBTQ+ rights; sends elders on pilgrimages to Themiscyra

Elaphebolia.description: Feast day, gift-giving, family time; can summon Golden Hind spirit; daughters born this day carry Artemis' blessing

Amarysia.description: Games, competitions, pranks; younger Sisters can prank elders; what happens on Amarysia stays on Amarysia

terminology.Golden Hind: Spirit of enormous female deer with golden antlers, consulted in times of need

_meta.description: Updated Disparate Crafts data for m20.rules.subfactions.crafts

Children of Knowledge.description: Alchemists seeking consciousness transcendence through material transformation; symbolic thinkers who see lead-to-gold as metaphor for spiritual elevation
Children of Knowledge.note: Distinct from House Solificati in Order of Hermes, though historically connected

terminology.Great Work: The true pursuit of alchemy - elevating consciousness to nonphysical immortality
terminology.Crown'd Ones: Alternate name evoking Sol (the Sun) and illumination
terminology.Red Lion: Alchemical symbol for vitality and strength
terminology.White Queen: Alchemical symbol for purity and sleep/death

_meta.description: Faction-specific names for chantries/strongholds
Practices are the How of magick. Each mage has a rating (0-5+) in their Practices. Characters gain one Practice dot per Arete dot at creation.

rules.practice_dots: 1 dot per dot of Arete at creation
rules.ability_requirement: Must have 2+ dots in Associated Abilities per Practice dot
rules.associated_practice_bonus: -1 difficulty when using a Practice associated with one of your Tenets
rules.limited_practice_penalty: +1 difficulty when using a Practice limited by one of your Tenets
rules.practice_cap_effects: Practice rating caps the level of effects you can perform with that Practice

Alchemy.description: The art of transformation - taking things from one state to another. Most alchemists view transforming objects as metaphor for transforming the self.
Alchemy.benefit: Very efficient at creating Charms and Gadgets. Only require half the usual Quintessence/Tass (rounded up).
Alchemy.penalty: Particularly bad at fast-casting. All rolls to improvise magick in the moment are at +1 difficulty.

The Royal Art.additional_benefit: May create the Philosopher's Stone and other legendary alchemical wonders

Animalism.description: A Practice of primal instinct and connection to the animal kingdom. Each Animalist has a Heartbeast - an animal they connect with spiritually.
Animalism.benefit: When in an appropriate natural environment for their Heartbeast, all Animalism effects are at -1 difficulty.
Animalism.penalty: Effects that require higher thinking or complex technology are at +1 difficulty.

Feralism.description: Embraces abandonment of civilization and humanity. Techniques are vicious and violent.
Feralism.benefit: -1 difficulty on violent magick against products of civilization and technology.
Feralism.price: Increasing penalty (+1 to +3) on Drive, Etiquette, Technology, Science, and civilization interaction rolls.

Appropriation.description: The magick of taking. Not equitable trade - Appropriators take, leaving others worse off, rarely with permission.
Appropriation.benefit: When using an acquisition as an Instrument that significantly increases wealth or power, magick gets -1 difficulty.
Appropriation.penalty: If giving something away without expecting return, all Appropriation magick is at +1 difficulty until taking something of greater value.

Art of Desire.description: Manipulation through understanding and fulfilling desires. Works through economics, exchange, and the fundamental wants of beings.
Art of Desire.benefit: When fulfilling another's desire as part of magick, -1 difficulty if the desire is genuine and strong.
Art of Desire.penalty: +1 difficulty when working against someone's known desires.

Hypereconomics.additional_benefit: Can manipulate economic systems and markets at a fundamental level

Bardism.description: Music, stories, and performance that reshape reality through emotional resonance. The power of narrative and song made manifest.
Bardism.benefit: When performing for an audience, each 3 Sleepers present reduces difficulty by 1 (max -3).
Bardism.penalty: +1 difficulty when performing magick in complete silence or solitude.

Chaos Magick.description: Inversion, randomness, and belief-shifting to achieve results. Reality bends to those who embrace its fundamental chaos.
Chaos Magick.benefit: May use any object as an Instrument, though this requires declaring it before use. Gains -1 difficulty when deliberately contradicting expectations.
Chaos Magick.penalty: Cannot use the same specific Instrument for the same effect twice in a row.

Charity.description: Acts of selfless giving that generate magickal power through sacrifice. The power of genuine altruism.
Charity.benefit: After significant charitable act, next effect is at -1 difficulty. Stacks up to -3 for exceptional charity.
Charity.penalty: Any selfish use of Charity magick is at +2 difficulty. Self-serving 'charity' provides no benefit.

Craftwork.description: Creating with hands and tools. The act of making things imbues them with magickal potential.
Craftwork.benefit: When creating a physical object as part of the effect, -1 difficulty. Extended crafting rituals gain +1 die per hour invested (max +5).
Craftwork.penalty: +1 difficulty for purely mental or spiritual effects with no physical component.

Weaving.additional_benefit: Can weave fate and reality patterns into physical creations

Crazy Wisdom.description: Paradoxical enlightenment through absurdity and contradiction. Breaking logic to break reality.
Crazy Wisdom.benefit: When performing an action that defies logic or expectation, -1 difficulty. Paradox backlashes are reduced by 1 point.
Crazy Wisdom.penalty: +1 difficulty when attempting straightforward, logical effects.

Abyssalism.description: Embraces the absolute negation and annihilation of meaning itself.
Abyssalism.benefit: -2 difficulty when causing confusion, madness, or nihilistic despair.
Abyssalism.price: Gradually lose grip on identity and meaning. Eventually cannot distinguish self from void.

Occultation.additional_benefit: Can hide in plain sight by being simply overlooked

Cybernetics.description: Human-machine integration and technological enhancement. The merger of flesh and technology.
Cybernetics.benefit: Effects targeting or working through technological devices are at -1 difficulty.
Cybernetics.penalty: +1 difficulty in areas with no technology or purely natural environments.

Integrative Technology.additional_benefit: Seamless integration - implants never trigger rejection or Paradox from integration

Dominion.description: Command and control through authority and presence. The power of leadership made manifest.
Dominion.benefit: -1 difficulty when affecting those who recognize the mage's authority or are in their domain.
Dominion.penalty: +1 difficulty when affecting those who completely reject or are immune to authority.

Authority.additional_benefit: Commands carry the weight of official sanction, even without visible credentials

Elementalism.description: Working with primal elements - fire, water, earth, air, and beyond. Direct manipulation of fundamental forces.
Elementalism.benefit: -1 difficulty when in environment dominated by one's primary element. -2 when surrounded by that element.
Elementalism.penalty: +1 difficulty in environments hostile to one's primary element.

Wayfinding.additional_benefit: Never lost in natural environments; can find paths through any terrain

Faith.description: Belief-based magick drawing power from conviction and devotion. The power of true belief.
Faith.benefit: -1 difficulty when acting in accordance with one's faith. -2 at holy sites or during religious observance.
Faith.penalty: +1 difficulty when acting against one's professed beliefs or in profane locations.

The Black Mass.description: Deliberate inversion and blasphemy against sacred traditions.
The Black Mass.benefit: -2 difficulty when desecrating, corrupting, or inverting religious practices.
The Black Mass.price: Holy ground and true believers cause physical pain. Cannot enter consecrated spaces.

Harmony.additional_benefit: Can harmonize with other faithful practitioners, adding their Faith dots to rituals

Gladius Domini.additional_benefit: Combat-focused faith; -1 difficulty on all combat effects when defending the innocent

God-Bonding.description: Finding divinity within oneself or connecting to divine beings. The intimate relationship with the divine.
God-Bonding.benefit: -1 difficulty when calling upon or channeling divine entities with established relationships.
God-Bonding.penalty: +1 difficulty when acting contrary to the wishes of bonded divine entities.

Gutter Magick.description: Street magic born of desperation and urban survival. The magick of the marginalized and desperate.
Gutter Magick.benefit: -1 difficulty when working with improvised or scavenged materials. Additional -1 when truly desperate.
Gutter Magick.penalty: +1 difficulty in wealthy, pristine, or highly ordered environments.

The Scene.additional_benefit: Can tap into subcultural energy; -1 difficulty in locations associated with alternative subcultures

High Ritual Magick.description: Ceremonial magick with elaborate rituals and precise correspondences. The classical Western occult tradition.
High Ritual Magick.benefit: Extended rituals (1+ hours) gain -1 difficulty and +1 die per hour invested (max +5 dice, -3 difficulty).
High Ritual Magick.penalty: +2 difficulty for fast-casting or improvised effects without proper preparation.

Goetia.description: The summoning and binding of demons and malevolent spirits.
Goetia.benefit: -2 difficulty when summoning, binding, or commanding infernal entities.
Goetia.price: Each use risks the attention of powerful demons. Debt accumulates.

Ceremonial Magick.additional_benefit: Access to Hermetic formulae and traditions; can use Enochian and other sacred languages for additional -1 difficulty

Nyeredzi.additional_benefit: Star-based astrology and divination; -1 difficulty during astrologically significant times

Bureaucracy.additional_benefit: Can navigate and manipulate celestial and mortal bureaucracies

Hypertech.description: Advanced technology beyond conventional science. Technology that shouldn't work, but does.
Hypertech.benefit: Devices created with Hypertech appear to be (very advanced) technology, not magic. -1 difficulty when using technological explanations.
Hypertech.penalty: +1 difficulty in areas with no power or technology infrastructure.

Infernal Sciences.description: Technology powered by demonic energy or souls.
Infernal Sciences.benefit: -2 difficulty; devices never run out of power while fed.
Infernal Sciences.price: Requires souls, suffering, or demonic pacts to power. Inevitable corruption.

Tecknology.additional_benefit: Specialization in spatial and dimensional technology; -1 difficulty on Correspondence effects

Investment.description: Placing power into objects, people, or concepts for later use. The magick of patience and preparation.
Investment.benefit: Effects can be stored for later release. Stored effects gain +1 potency per week invested (max +5).
Investment.penalty: +1 difficulty for immediate, unplanned effects. Investment requires time.

Invigoration.description: Enhancing, empowering, and strengthening living things. The magick of growth and vitality.
Invigoration.benefit: -1 difficulty when enhancing living beings. Additional -1 when enhancing self.
Invigoration.penalty: +1 difficulty when affecting non-living matter or draining life force.

Lakashim.additional_benefit: Ecstatic practices provide additional power; trance states grant -1 difficulty

Maleficia.description: Dark magick, curses, and harmful workings. The path of the witch who chooses harm.
Maleficia.benefit: -1 difficulty when causing harm, suffering, or misfortune. -2 when target has wronged the caster.
Maleficia.penalty: +1 difficulty for healing, protecting, or benefiting others.

Martial Arts.description: Physical discipline as a path to magickal power. Mind, body, and spirit unified through combat and movement.
Martial Arts.benefit: -1 difficulty when performing effects through body movement. Combat effects require no Instruments.
Martial Arts.penalty: +1 difficulty when prevented from moving or when physically restrained.

Do.additional_benefit: Access to legendary Do techniques; can strike spirit and mind through flesh

Media Control.description: Influence through mass media, propaganda, and information. The magick of the modern age.
Media Control.benefit: -1 difficulty when affecting those exposed to media the caster controls. -2 for viral content.
Media Control.penalty: +1 difficulty when targeting those with no media exposure or who reject media.

Medicine-Work.description: Healing traditions combining physical and spiritual treatment. The healer's sacred calling.
Medicine-Work.benefit: -1 difficulty for all healing effects. -2 when treating illness or injury caused by magick.
Medicine-Work.penalty: +1 difficulty when causing harm or illness.

Biotech.additional_benefit: Can modify living systems at genetic/cellular level with technological precision

Artemis's Gift.additional_benefit: Specialized in women's medicine and midwifery; -1 difficulty for related effects

Mediumship.description: Communicating with spirits, ghosts, and the dead. The bridge between worlds.
Mediumship.benefit: -1 difficulty when communicating with or affecting spirits and ghosts. -2 in haunted locations.
Mediumship.penalty: +1 difficulty for effects on purely physical matter with no spiritual component.

Psionics.description: Mental powers expressed through psychic discipline. The power of mind over matter.
Psionics.benefit: -1 difficulty for Mind effects. Mental effects require no physical Instruments.
Psionics.penalty: +1 difficulty for effects on purely physical matter without a mental component.

Reality Hacking.description: Altering the underlying code or structure of reality. Treating existence as a system to be exploited.
Reality Hacking.benefit: -1 difficulty when finding and exploiting loopholes in reality. -2 in digital environments.
Reality Hacking.penalty: +1 difficulty in environments with no digital or systematic structure.

Reality Coding.additional_benefit: Can perceive and interact with the 'source code' of reality directly

Shamanism.description: Spirit work, journeying, and animistic practices. The ancient path of the spirit-walker.
Shamanism.benefit: -1 difficulty when working with spirits or in the Umbra. -2 when aided by allied spirits.
Shamanism.penalty: +1 difficulty in completely urbanized environments with no natural spaces.

Demonism.description: The binding and service of demons rather than natural spirits.
Demonism.benefit: -2 difficulty when summoning or commanding demons; demons are more willing to bargain.
Demonism.price: Natural spirits refuse to deal with the practitioner. Accumulating demonic debt.

Spirit Ties.additional_benefit: Deeper connection with spirits; can negotiate more favorable terms

Voudoun.description: Afro-Caribbean traditions working with the Loa. The path of the spirits of the crossroads.
Voudoun.benefit: -1 difficulty when working with the Loa. -2 when the Loa choose to possess and work through the mage.
Voudoun.penalty: +1 difficulty for effects that contradict the nature of the practitioner's Loa.

Asagwe.additional_benefit: Deeper relationship with Loa; can call upon multiple Loa simultaneously

Weird Science.description: Unconventional, impossible science that works anyway. Ether physics, ray guns, and mad science.
Weird Science.benefit: -1 difficulty when creating or using unique inventions. Devices can violate conventional physics.
Weird Science.penalty: +1 difficulty when trying to replicate others' work exactly. Weird Science is personal.

Ethertech.additional_benefit: Access to Ether physics; can create devices using Ether as power source

Witchcraft.description: Traditional folk magick and hedge-witch practices. The old ways of village and hearth.
Witchcraft.benefit: -1 difficulty when working with natural materials or during appropriate moon phases.
Witchcraft.penalty: +1 difficulty in environments completely divorced from nature.

The Old Ways.additional_benefit: Access to blood magic; can use own blood for additional power (-1 difficulty per health level spent, max -3)

Yoga.description: Spiritual discipline achieving power through meditation and enlightenment. The path of inner mastery.
Yoga.benefit: -1 difficulty when calm and centered. -2 after extended meditation (1+ hours).
Yoga.penalty: +1 difficulty when emotionally disturbed, rushed, or unable to focus.

Vamamarga.description: The left-hand path of tantric excess and taboo-breaking.
Vamamarga.benefit: -2 difficulty when breaking taboos as part of magick.
Vamamarga.price: Increasingly difficult to function within normal society. Addictive practices.

Wheel-Tending.additional_benefit: Mastery of death and entropy; can ease suffering and guide souls

Q\u00ec Manipulation.description: The art of sensing and directing the flow of vital energy (qì/chi/ki) through bodies, objects, and environments. Practitioners understand that qì flows through meridians in the body and through ley lines in the landscape.
Q\u00ec Manipulation.benefit: -1 difficulty when manipulating the flow of energy through living beings or aligned spaces.
Q\u00ec Manipulation.penalty: +1 difficulty in environments with stagnant or blocked qì flow (polluted areas, places of death).

Meridian Mastery.additional_benefit: Can block opponent's meridians to incapacitate or kill; can sacrifice own qì to bolster workings

Shadow Work.description: Psychological and spiritual practice of confronting one's 'shadow self' — the repressed, denied aspects of the psyche. Based on Jungian psychology and various mystical traditions. Ecstatics use Shadow Work for healing trauma and achieving wholeness.
Shadow Work.benefit: -1 difficulty when healing psychological trauma or confronting hidden aspects of self/others.
Shadow Work.penalty: +1 difficulty when trying to maintain illusions, denial, or surface appearances.
Shadow Work.source: Lore of the Traditions (Cult of Ecstasy)

Nightside Integration.additional_benefit: Can help others confront their shadows; -2 difficulty on Mind effects targeting repressed memories or hidden selves

Tantra.description: Sacred sexuality, breath work, and the union of opposites to achieve transcendence. Not merely about sex — Tantra uses the body's energies and desires as vehicles for spiritual awakening and magickal power.
Tantra.benefit: -1 difficulty when working with a willing, consenting partner. -2 difficulty when both partners are Awakened.
Tantra.penalty: +1 difficulty when working alone; Tantra fundamentally involves union.
Tantra.source: Lore of the Traditions (Cult of Ecstasy)

Sacred Union.additional_benefit: Can channel combined Avatar energy; Life and Prime effects benefit from partner's Quintessence pool

Postmodernism.description: Also called Hacker Analysis. A Practice of stripping away cultural and paradigmatic baggage to understand and emulate other magickal practices. Postmodernists deconstruct others' foci to understand the underlying mechanism, then replicate effects through their own methods.
Postmodernism.benefit: -1 difficulty when replicating another mage's effect after successfully analyzing their practice.
Postmodernism.penalty: +1 difficulty on first attempt at any truly novel working; Postmodernism builds on existing frameworks.

Hacker Analysis.additional_benefit: Can emulate effects from other Practices after observation; the Chorister's four-hour angel-summoning chant becomes a fractal tone row calling an entity from memetic space

Platonism.description: Also called Mathematicism. The belief that concepts, mathematical forms, and ideas literally exist independent from thinkers in an ideascape. Practitioners access this realm of pure thought to understand and manipulate the fundamental Forms underlying reality.
Platonism.benefit: -1 difficulty when working with mathematical or geometric patterns; -2 when accessing or modifying the ideascape directly.
Platonism.penalty: +1 difficulty when dealing with messy, imperfect, or irrational situations.

Correspondence Point Access.additional_benefit: Can modify thought objects in the Hypersphere to change how concepts manifest in reality

_meta.description: Reality Zones modify Practice difficulties. Positive ratings = easier (-diff), negative = harder (+diff).
_meta.balance_rule: Total of all Practice ratings must equal 0. Positive total must equal location Rank.
_meta.valid_practices: Only the 32 base Practices in practices.json may be used. Specialized and Corrupted Practices are excluded.

effects.positive: Each +1 rating gives -1 difficulty to that Practice
effects.negative: Each -1 rating gives +1 difficulty to that Practice
effects.stacking: Reality Zone modifiers stack with other difficulty modifiers

Hermetic Sanctum.notes: Favors ceremonial work, hinders street magic

_meta.description: Example Paradigms broken down into their component Tenets. Use these as templates or mix and match Tenets.

A Holographic Reality.description: Reality is a two-dimensional space holographically simulating three-dimensional physics. Understanding this allows manipulation.

A Mechanistic Cosmos.description: The Universe is fundamentally rational. Things work in specific ways that can be studied and understood.

A World of Gods and Monsters.description: Powerful forces that could be called gods or monsters exist. Mages can see these powers and potentially join them.

All Power Comes from God(s).description: There is only one true source of power - God or gods who grant some mortals power and deny it to others.

All Power Comes from Sin.description: God is real, but opposing Him grants power. Breaking rules and limits provides magickal strength.

Ancient Wisdom is the Key.description: The Ancients were wiser than most suspect. Their lost knowledge can be recovered and used to recreate utopias.

Bring Back the Golden Age!.description: Once upon a time, the world was better. Mages have a connection to this lost age and can tap into its power.

Creation is Innately Divine and Alive.description: The Universe literally lives, breathes, and thinks. Mages are aware of this and can tap into the universal processes.

Divine Order and Earthly Chaos.description: The divine realm has order; Earth is a poor reflection causing chaos. Those who know can bring divine order down.

Everything is an Illusion, Prison or Mis.description: Reality is a cage. Transcendence comes from understanding nothing is real, not even ourselves.

Everything is Chaos.description: There is no rational basis for Reality. Laws of nature are only suggestions. Understanding this grants freedom.

Everything is Data.description: The nature of reality is information. Changing that information changes reality.

It's All Good - Have Faith!.description: The Divine is real and has a plan. Everything will work out. The faithful can take an active part in that plan.

Might is Right.description: Rationalism is a lie of the weak. Only Will to Power reveals truth. Strength can change the world.

One-Way Trip to Oblivion.description: The world is on a slide to nothingness. Realizing this allows the mage to harness the entropy of a dying world.

Tech Holds All Answers.description: The world fundamentally makes sense. Technology is how we make changes; anyone can do it with enough knowledge.

Transcend Your Limits.description: We believe we are limited, but boundaries are tissue paper. Breaking through reveals new boundaries to break.

We're All God(s) in Disguise.description: We are all sleeping gods. Some can Awaken to their power. The best will fully realize their godhood.

Barbarism is the Truest State of Man.description: Civilization is a lie. Only in primal savagery do we find truth and power.

Cosmic Horror is the Only Truth.description: The universe is vast, uncaring, and full of things that would drive us mad. Accepting this grants power.

Everyone's Against Me, so Whatever I do.description: The world has wronged me. Everything I do is self-defense against a hostile universe.

Evil is Necessary, and so I am Evil.description: Someone has to do the dark work. The universe requires balance, and I am the necessary darkness.

Existence is Unknowable, Irrational, and.description: Logic fails. Reason fails. Only by embracing the irrational can we touch truth.

Forbidden Wisdom is the Truest Source of.description: Knowledge was hidden for a reason—because it grants power. I will take that power.

I am All.description: I am the center of existence. Everything else exists in relation to me, for me.

I'm a Predator, and the World is My Prey.description: Nature is predation. I am apex. Everything else is food.

Indulgence is Nature's Only Law.description: Deny nothing. Take everything. Pleasure and power are the only virtues.

Only the Strongest Deserve to Survive.description: Evolution's law. The weak perish so the strong can thrive. I will be strong.

People are Shit.description: Humanity is awful. Look at what we do to each other. We deserve what's coming.

Rebellion is the Road to Transcendence.description: Rules exist to be broken. Every limit I shatter brings me closer to godhood.

We are Stormtroopers of the Abyss.description: I serve powers greater than myself. When they point, I destroy. It's glorious.

All is Now and Now is All.description: Time is an illusion created by limited mortal perception. Past, present, and future exist simultaneously. Liberation comes from transcending the illusion of linear time and experiencing the eternal NOW where all moments coexist. The keys to time's prison lie within our consciousness.
All is Now and Now is All.source: Lore of the Traditions (Cult of Ecstasy)
All is Now and Now is All.notes: Ecstatics tend to age slower than mortals and perceive experience in a then/now/when cascade.

Break It Up.description: Human consciousness is so powerful that the rest of the world follows what we believe. Because most people don't understand this power, our collective beliefs lock the world in place, leading to stagnation. Periodically, what IS must be broken down and replaced with something new to prevent decline and enable renewal.
Break It Up.source: Lore of the Traditions (Cult of Ecstasy)
Break It Up.notes: Central truth of Mage - Awakened reshape Reality. Can be incredibly egotistical and dangerous if misused.

We are the Champions.description: Existence is often cruel. Those blessed with uncommon powers and insights have a responsibility to use those blessings to make the world a better place. An ethical ideal more than metaphysical framework - supplements other paradigms and guides compassionate decisions.
We are the Champions.source: Lore of the Traditions (Cult of Ecstasy)
We are the Champions.notes: The Spider-Man code / Superman ethic. Has darker implications - champions can become tyrants convinced they know best.

Platonism.description: Also called Mathematicism. Concepts literally exist independent from thinkers in an ideascape. Mathematical forms, ideas, and thought objects exist in a realm accessible to those who know how. The Correspondence Point contains all possibilities; the Hypersphere contains all possible expressions. Our reality is the outermost boundary or shell of the Hypersphere.
Platonism.notes: Ascension is to become a thought object or modify the cosmos thought object to contain the mage.

_meta.notation: Numbers in parens (X) mean 'on others'. Plus signs mean effect scales with higher levels.

Conjure Element.spheres: Forces 3 / Prime 2 (fire, wind); Matter 3 / Prime 2 (earth, metal, water); Life 3 / Prime 2 (living wood)

Flying / Levitation.spheres: Forces 2+; or Correspondence 3 / Life 2; or Matter 2

_meta.source: Technocracy Reloaded, M20 core, Book of Secrets
_meta.description: Technocratic focus elements: paradigms, practices, and instruments

A Mechanistic Cosmos.description: Reality is a machine following mathematical rules. Everything can be defined, calculated, and predicted. The universe operates on orderly principles.

Tech Holds All Answers.description: Technology is the key to understanding reality. Through technological advancement, all mysteries will be solved.

Everything is Data.description: Reality is information to be processed. Everything—matter, energy, thought—is ultimately data that can be read, analyzed, and modified.

A World of Gods and Monsters.description: Supernatural entities exist and pose threats to humanity. We fight them using superior technology and organization.

Embrace the Threshold.description: Humanity must evolve. Transformation and transcendence are inevitable and desirable. We guide this evolution.

A Holographic Reality.description: Physical reality is a simulation. Our flesh is an imperfect prison that we must transcend through understanding the true nature of existence.

Everything is Chaos.description: Order is an illusion. Beyond the Gauntlet lies maddening chaos. We impose order through will and technology, maintaining a necessary lie.

Might is Right.description: Power justifies itself. Those with the strength and will to take control deserve that control.

Everything Has Value.description: All things can be measured, traded, and valued. Economics is the fundamental force of reality.

More is More.description: Accumulation of resources is itself the goal. More wealth, more power, more everything.

Hypertech.description: Using advanced technology beyond current consensus to achieve effects. The primary Technocratic practice.
Hypertech.benefit: Effects framed as technology. Can create Devices.
Hypertech.penalty: Requires physical apparatus. Cannot work without tools.

Cybernetics.description: Integration of technology into biology. Human-machine interfaces, implants, and enhancement.
Cybernetics.benefit: Effects are 'internal.' Hard to take away.

Dominion.description: Control through authority, presence, and social manipulation. Command and obedience.
Dominion.benefit: Works through social interaction. Less obviously 'magical.'
Dominion.penalty: Requires social context. Less effective alone.

Reality Hacking.description: Treating reality as code to be modified. Finding exploits and backdoors in consensus.
Reality Hacking.benefit: Can modify reality 'remotely.' Good for information.

Weird Science.description: Unconventional approaches to Enlightened Science. Integrating alien tech, unusual theories.
Weird Science.benefit: Flexible approach. Can incorporate unusual elements.
Weird Science.penalty: May be viewed suspiciously by conventional Technocrats.

Art of Desire.description: Manipulating through desire, want, and economic forces. Making people want what you want them to want.
Art of Desire.benefit: Targets choose to comply. Long-lasting effects.

Martial Arts.description: Disciplined physical techniques that channel Enlightened understanding into combat and movement.
Martial Arts.benefit: No external tools required. Difficult to disarm.

Psionics.description: Mental disciplines allowing direct manipulation of mind and reality through willpower.
Psionics.benefit: Pure mental effects. Hard to detect.

critical_rule.apparatus_dependency: Technocrats can NEVER transcend their instruments. Unlike mystic mages who may eventually cast without tools, a Technocrat without appropriate apparatus is completely powerless. This is permanent and fundamental to Technocratic paradigm.

_meta.description: Catalog of Technocratic equipment by category

CLN-20 Fun House Gas.effect: Creates intense optical distortion affecting all vision including IR/night vision. Lasts 30-60 minutes in 20-foot radius.
CLN-20 Fun House Gas.system: Forces 2 refracts light, Entropy 2 increases accident chance. All optical sensors useless in area.

Spray Cams.effect: Spray-on nanite surveillance film. Millions of sensors create 3D video with positional sound.
Spray Cams.system: Data 2 for remote viewing. Covers wall surfaces.

UND.effect: EMP-like device that disrupts technology and Wonders.
UND.system: Line-of-sight range. Wonders get Arete/Enlightenment soak roll. Can permanently destroy mundane machines with 3+ successes.

AIS.effect: Drone swarm that searches for and collects samples. 1000 drones search 100-yard radius.
AIS.system: Detection Adjustment finds items. Forces 2 moves heavy objects. Entropy 1/Time 2 maximizes efficiency. Successes add to Investigation/Survival rolls.

ES-Phone.effect: Secure smartphone with encryption, Digital Web access, VR capability, and modular apps.
ES-Phone.system: Base security costs 1 Primal Energy/day. Digital Web access included. Apps cost 1 PE per use.

City Eye.effect: Access surveillance cameras, track targets across city

C-SAM.effect: Combat prediction. Add successes to Athletics, Brawl, Firearms, Energy Weapons rolls

Field Material Analyzer.effect: Analyzes any material sample using spectroscopy and spectrometry.

Quantum Analysis.effect: Detect Data connections, emotional resonance, temporal anomalies

G-186 Octopus Suit.effect: Adaptive camouflage suit mimicking surroundings. Creates optical illusions for movement concealment.
G-186 Octopus Suit.system: Forces 2 grants invisibility (add successes to Dex for Stealth/Dodge). Data 1/Life 1 locates invisible allies. Matter 2/Prime 2 self-repair and Armor 2.

Mimetic Mask.effect: 3D-printed synthetic flesh mask that perfectly copies a target's face.
Mimetic Mask.system: Place on target 1 minute to read DNA (Life 1/Matter 1). Then reshapes to match (Life 3/Matter 3). Facial injury reveals mask.

NOT.effect: Erases memories of Reality Deviance, replaces with consensus-acceptable memories.
NOT.system: Mind 3 alters memories. Higher levels add sophistication. Point, flash, done.

PAWS Taser.effect: Forces shapeshifters into human form by disrupting dimensional carrier waves.
PAWS Taser.system: Attack: Dex + Energy Weapons, diff 7. Forces target into Homid form plus electrocution damage. Against materialized spirits, deals Aggravated damage = successes.

SMC Vehicle.effect: Modular vehicle platform with Hardpoints for upgrades.
SMC Vehicle.hardpoint_rules: 1 HP per standard upgrade. Devices/Gadgets: 1 HP per 5 Background Cost (round up).

Species and Mineral Database.effect: Cross-references FMA results with global database to identify sample origin.
Species and Mineral Database.system: Data 3 traces sample through Data connections. Can pinpoint origin to within meters using microbial/insect analysis.

Universal Key.effect: Nanite-filled rod that defeats most locks.
Universal Key.system: Tumbler locks: Entropy 1/Matter 3 reshapes to correct key. Electronic locks: Entropy 2/Forces 2/Matter 3/Time 2 reads codes from residue. Last resort: Entropy 3 destroys mechanism.

VAPE.effect: Vape pen that emits chemical or biological toxins. User protected by tank coating.
VAPE.system: Life 2/Prime 2 for biological toxins OR Matter 2/Prime 2 for chemical. Toxin rating = successes. Emergency: Forces 2/Prime 2 overcharge causes Molotov-equivalent explosion (destroys device).

Dimensional Backdoor.effect: Primium-framed portal connecting to partner gateway anywhere in Tellurian.
Dimensional Backdoor.system: Requires partner gateway active. Setup: 10 minutes. Fits in backpack. EXTREMELY BLATANT. VE authorization required.

NIMBY-50.effect: Banishes extradimensional entities to random Umbral location. Ineffective against Earth natives.
NIMBY-50.system: Attack: Dex + Energy Weapons, diff 7. Targets with Gnosis/Pathos sent to random Umbra, prevented from stepping sideways for (net successes) turns. Earth-native targets just teleported away.

Sleepteacher.effect: Accelerates learning during sleep. Cram weeks of study into one night.
Sleepteacher.system: Mind 3/Time 2 ritual. Each 6+ hour session = one ritual roll. Can be interrupted and resumed within 24 hours. Used to rapidly train operatives.

Cybernetic Implants.notes: See Mage 20 pp. 657-661 for Biotech rules

VDAS Implant.effect: Heads-up display and audio system implanted directly

variants: A State of Mind - dormant implants triggered for instant docility
A Home Away from Home - physical room in every Construct

SPECM.description: Standard Primal Energy storage and power supply
SPECM.reference: Mage 20 p. 657, Book of Secrets p. 165

_meta.description: Sample Technocratic NPCs and notable figures

T1_Field_Operative.name: Agent designation varies
T1_Field_Operative.notes: Backbone of field operations. May or may not know the full truth about the Union.

T2_Enlightened_Agent.name: Agent designation varies
T2_Enlightened_Agent.notes: Full operative status. Handles Reality Deviants directly.

T3_Supervisor.name: Supervisor designation varies
T3_Supervisor.notes: Manages operations and personnel. Political skills essential.

John_Courage.name: John Courage
John_Courage.status: Legendary (possibly deceased, possibly ascended, possibly still active)
John_Courage.description: The most famous Man in Black. Stories of his exploits span decades and continents. Some say he's a title passed between agents; others claim he's immortal.
John_Courage.significance: Symbol of NWO ideals. The 'Friends of Courage' dissident faction is named for him.

Control.name: Control
Control.description: The voice on the other end of the line. No one knows Control's true identity—possibly multiple people, possibly an AI, possibly something else entirely.
Control.significance: Represents the faceless authority of the Technocracy.

hooks: May cross ethical lines for optimization

The_Augmented.personality: Questions what remains human, struggles with identity
The_Augmented.motivation: Prove enhancement makes one MORE human, not less

The_True_Believer.concept: Agent who genuinely believes in protecting humanity
The_True_Believer.personality: Idealistic but realistic, protective, sometimes paternalistic
The_True_Believer.motivation: Keep the Masses safe from things they can't handle

The_Watcher.concept: Intelligence analyst who sees patterns everywhere
The_Watcher.personality: Paranoid, perceptive, struggles with information overload
The_Watcher.motivation: Find the truth hidden in the data

The_Healer.concept: Medical professional driven to cure all disease
The_Healer.personality: Compassionate, driven, sometimes crosses boundaries 'for the patient'

The_Creator.concept: FACADE Engineer who sees creation as art
The_Creator.personality: Artistic, proud of 'children,' protective of creations

The_Dealmaker.concept: Agent who solves problems through negotiation and trade
The_Dealmaker.personality: Charming, calculating, sees everything as a transaction

The_Enforcer.concept: Hollow Man who works the criminal side
The_Enforcer.personality: Pragmatic, ruthless when needed, code of professionalism
The_Enforcer.motivation: Get the job done, maintain reputation

The_Explorer.concept: Pioneer driven to see what's beyond the next horizon
The_Explorer.personality: Curious, brave, sometimes reckless, haunted by what they've seen

The_Guardian.concept: Soldier who defends Earth from dimensional threats
The_Guardian.personality: Protective, vigilant, bears the weight of what they fight
The_Guardian.motivation: Keep the horrors from reaching Earth

Corrupt_Supervisor.concept: Authority figure who has lost their way
Corrupt_Supervisor.chronicle_use: Internal conflict, trust issues, institutional rot

Rogue_Operative.concept: Former agent now working against the Union
Rogue_Operative.chronicle_use: Former friend as enemy, mirror to PCs

_meta.description: Methodologies (subdivisions) of each Convention

BioMechanics.description: Specialists in melding flesh and machine. They create and maintain cybernetic enhancements, study the human-technology interface, and push the boundaries of transhumanism.

Macrotechnicians.description: Engineers of massive systems from power grids to climate patterns. Currently leading the Climate Change Reversal Initiative (CCRI).

Statisticians.description: The number-crunchers who once believed they could predict the future through mathematics. Humbled by repeated failures but still essential for analysis.
Statisticians.notes: The Time Table has been revised so often it's become a joke

TMM.description: Builders of the Union's machinery. From nanomachines to weapons systems, TMM creates the tools the Technocracy uses.

Ivory Tower.description: The intelligence arm of the NWO. They gather, analyze, and distribute information throughout the Union.

Q Division.description: The legendary 'Men in Black.' Field agents who handle direct intervention, from subtle manipulation to overt action.

The Feed.description: Controllers of information flow. They shape what the Masses see, hear, and believe through media manipulation.

Neutralization Specialists.description: When threats cannot be contained or converted, Neutralization Specialists ensure they cease to exist.

Applied Sciences.description: Taking theory from the labs and making it work in the field. They bridge research and operational reality.

Damage Control.description: A newer, cross-disciplinary faction that handles biological emergencies and cleaning up after operations.

FACADE Engineers.full_name: Forced Adaptation and Clone Alteration Development Engineers
FACADE Engineers.description: Creators of clones, surgical enhancement specialists, and designers of biological constructs.

Genegineers.description: Masters of the genetic code who reshape life at its most fundamental level.

Pharmacopoeists.description: Chemists who create drugs, poisons, and chemical enhancements for every conceivable purpose.

Disbursements.description: The purse-strings of the entire Technocracy. They control what gets funded and what doesn't.
Disbursements.notes: Perhaps the most internally despised Methodology

Enforcers.description: The dirty side of the dollar. They work through criminal enterprises and handle enforcement that can't go through official channels.

Financiers.description: The true power behind global finance. They understand that money is the most powerful shared belief system in human history.

Media Control.description: Shapers of what people want. They work through advertising, entertainment, and desire manipulation.
Media Control.notes: Constant tension with NWO's The Feed

Special Projects Division.description: No one talks about SPD. The Division disappeared around the time of the Dimensional Anomaly. SISD now covers for their absence.
Special Projects Division.notes: SISD is desperately pretending SPD still exists

BCD.description: Defenders of the border between Earth and the Umbra. They keep things from getting in.

EFD.description: When Void Engineers get lost or stranded, EFD brings them home. Also handles Earth-based frontier situations.

NSC.description: The heavy hitters of the Void Engineers. When something needs to die, NSC handles it.
NSC.special_facility: Descartes Institute of Mental Health - also provides mental health treatment

PDC.description: The true explorers who venture into the Deep Umbra, other dimensions, and the furthest reaches of space.

REC.description: Researchers who study what the explorers bring back, including alien technology and dimensional phenomena.

DSEATC.full_name: Dimensional Sciences Evaluation, Administration, and Training Committee
DSEATC.description: The governing body of the Void Engineers before the Avatar Storm. Oversaw all operations and training.

ETD.description: Current leadership focused on identifying and prioritizing threats to human existence.

_meta.description: The five Conventions of the Technocratic Union

Iteration X.current_state: Adapting to rapid technological change, leading Climate Change Reversal Initiative
Iteration X.typical_operative: Precision-focused engineer or mathematician who sees Reality as a machine to be understood and improved

paradigms: A World of Gods and Monsters
New World Order.current_state: Struggling with information chaos of modern era, competing with Syndicate Media Control
New World Order.typical_operative: Calm, professional agent who understands that controlling information controls reality

Progenitors.current_state: Reformed from past excesses, focused on helping humanity rather than experimenting on it
Progenitors.typical_operative: Brilliant biologist driven by curiosity and either profound compassion or unsettling detachment

Syndicate.current_state: Most openly powerful Convention, grappling with chaos despite wealth
Syndicate.typical_operative: Charismatic dealmaker who understands that desire is the ultimate currency

paradigms: A World of Gods and Monsters
Void Engineers.current_state: Recovering from Avatar Storm, defending borders while exploring
Void Engineers.typical_operative: Explorer or soldier who has seen things beyond human comprehension and fights to protect Earth from them

_meta.description: Cross-Convention initiatives and special programs

chronicle_hooks: PCs assigned to protect CCRI installation
System flags false positive on innocent

ETD.goal: Identify and prioritize threats to human existence

Operation_Ragnarok.goal: Humanity survival in case of total consensus collapse

_meta.description: Dissident factions within the Technocratic Union

Adamites.description: Bigots who fear and disdain enhanced operatives, including constructs, clones, LERMUs, cyborgs, and genegineered agents. They believe humanity must remain 'pure' and superior to its creations.
Adamites.status: Human supremacy is officially unmutual. Open Adamites face reprimand or Room 101. Most operate covertly.
chronicle_use: Supervisor with prejudice against enhanced PCs

Cassandra Complex.official_name: Strategic Prognostication and Data Dispersal Unit (SPDDU)
Cassandra Complex.focus: Gathering and distributing sensitive information to the 'right people'
Cassandra Complex.description: Internal eyes and ears that collect information—sometimes before it happens—and anonymously deliver it to operatives who need it. No one knows who they are.
activities: Anonymous data dumps to select operatives

package_mechanics.delivery: Home, desk, bus seat, lunch order—never awkward situations
package_mechanics.security: Self-destruct in 12 hours if unopened, immediate if opened by wrong person
package_mechanics.consequence: Refusing a package means never receiving another

Friends of Courage.description: Operatives who believe the Technocracy has lost its way and must be reformed from within. Named for the legendary agent John Courage.

Harbingers of Avalon.description: Technocrats who believe that mystic approaches have validity and seek to integrate them with Enlightened Science. Considered deeply heretical by most.
activities: Integration of mystic and scientific approaches

Project Invictus.description: Secret hunters who track and eliminate Nephandic infiltrators within the Union. They officially don't exist, operate without authorization, and may themselves be compromised.
complications: No one knows if they're real

SISD.description: Originally tasked to protect the Special Projects Division, SISD now desperately pretends SPD still exists after the Division vanished during the Dimensional Anomaly.
activities: Capturing Invictus operatives sent to kill 'SPD'
problems: SPD hypertech is breaking down and leaking reality toxins
Must impersonate Reality Deviants who were SPD members
