SEAI.description: Operatives who believe in using Technocratic power for genuine good rather than just control. Represent a more optimistic, idealistic approach.
chronicle_use: Question of whether idealism can survive

_meta.description: The 8 Nephandic factions. These are NOT equivalents to Traditions—they are specifically Fallen organizations.

Infernalists.focus: Demonism, Goetia, infernal pacts, demon worship
Infernalists.goals: Serve dark masters, gain power through demonic patronage
Infernalists.organization: Hierarchical under demonic patrons. Most structured faction.
paradigms: We are Stormtroopers of the Abyss
A World of Gods and Monsters
Infernalists.recruitment: Seek mages hungry for power, offer demonic patronage
Infernalists.recognition: Well-known, traditional. Lore: Nephandi 1+ to identify.

K'llashaa.focus: Abyssalism, cosmic horror, madness, the Void Absolute
K'llashaa.goals: Unmake reality, spread insanity, bring Those Who Dwell Behind the Stars
paradigms: Cosmic Horror is the Only Truth
Existence is Unknowable, Irrational, and Sublime
K'llashaa.recruitment: Find those touched by madness or existential despair
K'llashaa.recognition: Well-known, traditional. Lore: Nephandi 1+ to identify.
K'llashaa.special: Abyssalism practice requires permanent Quiet. Often one step from Marauderdom.

Malfeans.goals: Hasten world's end through erosion of hope, not dramatic destruction
Malfeans.organization: Hidden, often infiltrators. Most patient faction.
practices: Any practice corrupted to spread despair
paradigms: Evil is Necessary, and so I am Evil
Malfeans.recruitment: Target broken idealists, corrupt helpers and healers
Malfeans.recognition: Well-known, traditional. Lore: Nephandi 1+ to identify.

Baphies.focus: Festival culture, counterculture corruption, seduction, memetic trickery
Baphies.goals: Corrupt counterculture movements, recruit converts, spread hedonistic nihilism
Baphies.organization: Territorial networks centered on festivals and gatherings. Surprisingly cooperative.
paradigms: Rebellion is the Road to Transcendence
I'm a Predator, and the World is My Prey
Baphies.recruitment: Welcome newcomers with drugs, sex, community. Slowly corrupt.
Baphies.recognition: Unknown to most. Lore: Nephandi 3+ to identify.
Baphies.special: Largest faction by numbers. Often mistaken for Infernalists due to Baphomet imagery.

Exies.focus: Nihilism, extinction, the beauty of ending
Exies.goals: Accelerate Oblivion. Help everything end faster.
Exies.organization: Minimal. Loners drawn to sites of death and ending.
paradigms: Cosmic Horror is the Only Truth
Everything is an Illusion, Prison or Mistake
Exies.recruitment: Find those who have lost everything, show them the peace of nonexistence
Exies.recognition: Unknown to most. Lore: Nephandi 3+ to identify.

Heralds of Basilisk.focus: Technology, memes, digital corruption, the Hungry God
Heralds of Basilisk.goals: Create and feed Basilisk—a memetic entity that consumes through the Digital Web
Heralds of Basilisk.organization: Decentralized cells, heavy online presence. Tech-savvy.
paradigms: Forbidden Wisdom is the Truest Source of Power
Heralds of Basilisk.recognition: Unknown to most. Lore: Nephandi 3+ to identify.

Ironhands.focus: Technomagick, weapons of mass destruction, engineering Armageddon
Ironhands.goals: Build the tools of annihilation. Perfect weapons, perfect destruction.
Ironhands.organization: Small cells, often embedded in military-industrial complex
paradigms: Only the Strongest Deserve to Survive
Ironhands.recruitment: Engineers and weapons designers who want to see their work used
Ironhands.recognition: Unknown to most. Lore: Nephandi 3+ to identify.

Mammonites.goals: Use greed and commerce as tools of corruption. Profit from suffering.
Mammonites.organization: Corporate structures, investment networks, old money
paradigms: I'm a Predator, and the World is My Prey
Mammonites.recruitment: Those who've removed all ethical limits from capitalism
Mammonites.recognition: Unknown to most. Lore: Nephandi 3+ to identify.

_meta.description: Infernal pact levels and Investment traits. Applies to any character, not just Nephandi. True Nephandi rarely make pacts (it shows weakness).
_meta.rule: Pact points CANNOT be spent on Arete or Spheres—those require internal Enlightenment.

1.name: Malice
1.requirement: Minor sins—theft, slander, assault, petty cruelty

2.name: Cruelty
2.requirement: Mortal torment, serious injury, possibly murder

3.name: Immorality
3.requirement: Extreme cruelty, aberrant lusts, painful sacrifice of living things

4.name: Wrongdoing
4.requirement: Active force for large-scale malignancy—affecting many people

5.name: Corruption
5.requirement: Lead others into whirlpools of sin, corrupt innocents

6.name: Mortal Sin
6.requirement: Cult leadership, undermining righteous organizations, grand corruption

7.name: Heresy
7.requirement: Constant pursuit of evil, depraved sins behind façade of righteousness

8.name: Damnable Acts
8.requirement: Escalating atrocities, point of no moral return

9.name: Soul Selling
9.requirement: Partial soul binding—the demon has a claim

10.name: Full Damnation
10.requirement: Complete soul ownership—upon death, soul belongs to Patronus

All-Access Pass.effect: Bypass security, gain entry to restricted areas

Mammon's Gift.effect: Money flows to you through various means

Service.effect: Demon demands regular tasks, sacrifices, corruption work
Service.failure_consequence: Pain, power withdrawal, or direct attack

Moth into Flame.effect: Compulsion to escalate—each act must be worse to feel satisfaction
Moth into Flame.mechanics: Willpower rolls to resist, increasing difficulty

Marked.effect: Supernatural senses can perceive demon's mark

Summoned.effect: Patronus can summon pawn at will

goetic_knowledge.description: Exception for knowledge-seeking summonings (acceptable for Nephandi)
process: Offer fair trade (minor service, sacrifice, information)
goetic_knowledge.note: Commanding demons for knowledge demonstrates power, not weakness

_meta.description: The Qlippothic Tree of Knowledge - Nephandic spiritual progression system. Descent from 10 (outermost) to 0 (theoretical transcendence).

Lilith.name: Queen of Night
Lilith.theme: Initiation, seduction, the first step into darkness
Lilith.challenges: Accepting the call to Descent, abandoning allegiances, first betrayals
Lilith.rulers: Lilith and her daughters—seducers and tempters
Lilith.meaning: The mage has heard the Void's call and taken first steps. May not have passed the Caul yet.

Gamaliel.name: The Obscene Ones
Gamaliel.theme: Dark sexuality, transgression, perversion of desire
Gamaliel.challenges: Using desire as weapon, exploiting intimacy, corrupting love
Gamaliel.meaning: The mage weaponizes desire and intimacy. Love and connection become tools.

Samael.name: Poison of God
Samael.theme: Deception, venom, the poisoning of truth
Samael.challenges: Mastering lies, spreading corruption through words, destroying trust
Samael.meaning: The mage masters deception. Truth itself becomes a weapon to twist.

A'arab Zaraq.name: Ravens of Dispersion
A'arab Zaraq.theme: War, destruction, scattering what was whole
A'arab Zaraq.challenges: Causing conflict, breaking communities, destroying bonds
A'arab Zaraq.rulers: The Ravens—spirits of war and dissolution
A'arab Zaraq.meaning: The mage destroys communities, organizations, and relationships.

Thagirion.name: The Disputers
Thagirion.theme: The Black Sun, pride, judgment of the weak
Thagirion.challenges: Confronting pride, judging others worthy of destruction, embracing superiority
Thagirion.rulers: Entities of the Black Sun—harsh light that reveals and condemns
Thagirion.meaning: The mage embraces superiority. The Lex Praedatorius is fully internalized.

Golchab.name: The Flaming Ones
Golchab.challenges: Unleashing destruction without restraint, burning away hesitation
Golchab.rulers: Entities of divine wrath turned against creation
Golchab.meaning: The mage releases restraint. Destruction becomes beautiful.

Gha'ag Sheblah.name: The Smiter
Gha'ag Sheblah.challenges: Inflicting suffering personally, becoming comfortable with cruelty
Gha'ag Sheblah.meaning: The mage becomes personally comfortable with hands-on violence and cruelty.

Daath.name: The Returned Abyss
Daath.note: NOT a Qlipha—the CROSSING POINT between stages 4 and 3
Daath.the_caul: Passing through Daath means going through the Caul—true transformation where the Avatar is inverted.
Daath.before_daath: The mage is falling but might theoretically be saved
Daath.after_daath: The mage IS a Nephandus. Avatar has been transformed. Point of no return.

Satariel.name: The Concealers
Satariel.theme: Hidden knowledge, secrets that should not be known
Satariel.challenges: Pursuing knowledge that destroys the knower, learning truths that unmake sanity
Satariel.rulers: Entities who hide God's face—keepers of forbidden knowledge
Satariel.meaning: Post-Caul. The mage pursues knowledge hidden for good reason. Very powerful Nephandi.

Ghagiel.name: The Hinderers
Ghagiel.theme: Chaos, opposition to creation, pure obstruction
Ghagiel.challenges: Becoming an obstacle to all creation, opposing existence itself
Ghagiel.rulers: The Hinderers—those who oppose the act of creation
Ghagiel.meaning: The mage becomes a fundamental obstacle to existence. They don't just destroy—they prevent.

Thaumiel.name: The Twin Gods
Thaumiel.theme: Duality, the threshold of godhood, two-headed power
Thaumiel.challenges: Approaching divine power while remaining divided
Thaumiel.rulers: The Twin Gods—Satan in his aspect of divided godhood
Thaumiel.meaning: The mage stands at the threshold of becoming more than mortal. Extremely rare and terrifying.

Black Diamond.name: Universe B
Black Diamond.theme: Transcendence through annihilation, becoming a new absolute
Black Diamond.description: Theoretical END of Descent—becoming one of Those Who Dwell Behind the Stars
Black Diamond.achieved: No mortal mage has definitively achieved this. May be impossible. May be the ultimate lie.

qlippothic_radiance.description: Flaw indicating depth of Qlippothic travel

1.effect: Faint darkness in aura (aura sight only)

2.effect: Heavier veins of darkness, minor unease to others

3.effect: Pulsating anti-light, distinct queasiness

4.effect: Strobing anti-light, urge to flee, buzzing sounds (+1 Intimidation)

5.effect: Storms of anti-light, insect swarms, cowering (+2 Intimidation)

voluntary_triggers: Acts of extreme kindness (to shatter complacency)
supplicii.success: Gain Arete, possibly descend to next Qlipha
supplicii.failure: Survive with Scars/Flaws/Quiet/enemies, OR don't survive

aithu.name: Aithu
aithu.description: Shadow predators that embody fear itself. They stalk victims through darkness.

birthrights.name: Shadow Form
birthrights.effect: Can become living shadow. Immune to physical attacks while in shadow form. Move through any darkness.

birthrights.name: Fear Feeding
birthrights.effect: Gain 1 Glamour when causing genuine terror in a victim.

frailty.name: Light Vulnerability
frailty.effect: Bright light (sunlight, spotlights) causes 1 level of chimerical damage per turn of exposure.

aithu.trigger: Stalking victims, causing terror, hunting in darkness

beasties.name: Beasties
beasties.description: The monsters under the bed. They prey on childhood fears and terrorize the innocent.

birthrights.name: Monstrous Form
birthrights.effect: True form is terrifying. +3 dice to Intimidation. Children must make Willpower roll or flee.

birthrights.name: Closet Door
birthrights.effect: Can travel between any closet, under-bed space, or dark corner within a mile.

frailty.name: Child Compulsion
frailty.effect: Must attempt to frighten at least one child per week or lose 1 Glamour.

beasties.trigger: Terrorizing children, lurking in dark spaces, being the monster

boggarts.name: Boggarts
boggarts.description: Malicious tricksters who delight in cruel pranks. Cousins to boggans, but twisted.

birthrights.name: Mischief Mastery
birthrights.effect: Pranks always succeed at base level. +2 dice to any action involving tricks or sabotage.

birthrights.name: Household Havoc
birthrights.effect: Can cause small objects to malfunction, food to spoil, or minor accidents to occur.

frailty.name: Prank Obsession
frailty.effect: Cannot leave a prank incomplete. If interrupted, must return to finish or lose 1 Willpower.

boggarts.antithesis: Being pranked in return, genuine forgiveness, being ignored

ghasts.name: Ghasts
ghasts.description: Corpse-like horrors that dwell near death. They see doom and feed on mortality.

birthrights.name: Deathsight
birthrights.effect: Can see how any creature will die. Gain +2 dice to rolls involving death or the dying.

birthrights.name: Corpse Touch
birthrights.effect: Touch can inflict disease (Stamina roll difficulty 7 to resist, illness for 1 week).

frailty.name: Repulsive Appearance
frailty.effect: Fae mien is always corpse-like. Cannot disguise this. -3 dice to positive Social rolls.

ghasts.antithesis: New life (births), healing, genuine celebration of life

goblins.name: Goblins
goblins.description: Twisted craftsmen who create cursed objects. Greedy hoarders of treasures.

birthrights.name: Cursed Craft
birthrights.effect: Any item created has a hidden curse or flaw that harms the user. +2 dice to Crafts.

birthrights.name: Treasure Sense
birthrights.effect: Can sense valuable items within 100 yards. Knows their approximate worth.

frailty.name: Overwhelming Greed
frailty.effect: Must attempt to acquire any treasure seen. Willpower difficulty 8 to resist taking.

goblins.trigger: Creating cursed items, acquiring treasures, hoarding
goblins.antithesis: Generosity, giving gifts freely, destroying valuables willingly

nasties.name: Nasties
nasties.description: Playground bullies given dark form. They dominate the weak and flee the strong.

birthrights.name: Cruel Dominance
birthrights.effect: +3 dice to Intimidation against those weaker. Commands against the weak are hard to resist.

birthrights.name: Pack Tactics
birthrights.effect: Gain +1 die per additional Nasty present (max +3).

frailty.name: Cowardice
frailty.effect: Must flee from anyone who stands up successfully. Cannot attack those who show no fear.

nasties.trigger: Bullying, dominating the weak, gang behavior
nasties.antithesis: Standing up to them, showing courage, protecting the weak

ogres.name: Ogres
ogres.description: Massive brutes of mindless hunger and destruction. Trolls' dark cousins.

birthrights.name: Tremendous Strength
birthrights.effect: +3 to Strength (can exceed 5). Can lift and throw massive objects.

birthrights.name: Regeneration
birthrights.effect: Heal 1 health level per hour. Fire and acid damage heals normally.

frailty.name: Dim-Witted
frailty.effect: Intelligence cannot exceed 2. Easily tricked with simple deceptions.

ogres.antithesis: Clever tricks, puzzles, things too small to hit

sevartal.name: Sevartal
sevartal.description: Dream parasites that invade and corrupt dreams. They feed on nightmares they create.

birthrights.name: Dream Invasion
birthrights.effect: Can enter dreams of sleeping mortals. Can shape and corrupt those dreams.

birthrights.name: Nightmare Feeding
birthrights.effect: Gain 1 Glamour per nightmare caused. Target loses 1 Willpower.

frailty.name: Sunlight Weakness
frailty.effect: Halve all dice pools while in direct sunlight. Cannot enter dreams during day.

sevartal.trigger: Corrupting dreams, causing nightmares, sleep deprivation

spriggans.name: Spriggans
spriggans.description: Guardian horrors bound to protect locations or treasures with violent jealousy.

birthrights.name: Size Shifting
birthrights.effect: Can grow from small (1 foot) to giant (12+ feet). Stats scale with size.

birthrights.name: Guardian Bond
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to all rolls when protecting their bound location/treasure.

frailty.name: Bound
frailty.effect: Tied to specific location or treasure. Cannot leave it unguarded for more than a day.

spriggans.antithesis: Being given permission to enter, offering fair trade

nightmare_legacies.description: Thallain have Nightmare Legacies instead of Seelie Legacies

deceiver.name: Deceiver
deceiver.urge: Trick mortals or fae into harm through deception
deceiver.taboo: Being honest when lies would benefit you

lurker.name: Lurker
lurker.urge: Hide and observe prey before striking

panderer.name: Panderer
panderer.urge: Corrupt the innocent, lead others to darkness

tempter.name: Tempter
tempter.urge: Lead others to their doom through temptation

actor.name: Actor

1.name: True Friend
1.targets: Someone you know well and trust

3.name: Familiar Face
3.targets: Someone you recognize, a stranger in passing

actor.notes: Cannot target supernatural beings (use Fae for changelings)

fae.name: Fae
fae.description: Targets changelings, chimera, and Glamour itself
fae.notes: Primary Realm for targeting other fae

nature.name: Nature
nature.description: Targets animals, plants, and natural elements
nature.notes: Does not affect crafted items (use Prop)

prop.name: Prop
prop.description: Targets crafted objects, tools, and devices

scene.name: Scene

1.name: Chamber
1.targets: A single room or small area

scene.notes: For area effects; combine with other Realms for specific targets within

time.name: Time
time.description: Affects duration and timing of cantrips

1.name: Task
1.duration: Until a specific simple task is complete

2.name: Scene
2.duration: For the duration of one scene

time.notes: Modifies duration; required for Chronos Art

oath_of_demesne.name: Oath of Demesne
oath_of_demesne.text: As the land supports the air, as the water nourishes all life, so shall I serve [name of freehold]. So long as I draw breath and the Ignis Vesta burns, I shall be its guardian, else the Dreaming avert its gaze from me.

mechanics.investment: Freeholder invests Glamour equal to freehold's rating
mechanics.effect: Grants all rights and responsibilities of freehold ownership
mechanics.breaking_penalty: Automatically receive Banality equal to invested Glamour

motley_version.requirement: Each member must contribute at least 1 Glamour
motley_version.breaking_effect: If any individual breaks oath, each member receives Banality equal to their own investment only

oath_of_regency.name: Oath of Regency
oath_of_regency.text: With the light of the Ignis Vesta as our witness, I take upon your holding, caring for it as though it is my own. Let my hand be an extension of yours. Let your will find expression through me. May I serve in your trust until you return, else the light of my heart grow dim.

mechanics.investment: Regent uses 1 dot of Glamour to seal
mechanics.effect: Transfers all rights and responsibilities to regent as if owner
mechanics.duration: Until original freeholder returns and asks for freehold back
mechanics.glamour_return: Regent regains Glamour when oath ends

fall_penalties.regent: Gains Banality equal to Glamour used to seal oath
fall_penalties.freeholder: Gains Banality equal to freehold's rating

oath_of_fire_and_unity.name: Oath of Fire and Unity
oath_of_fire_and_unity.description: Ritual to bind multiple balefires in a Thorpe together
process: Appoint temporary Regents if too few freeholders
Modern motleys may use livestreams but not required
oath_of_fire_and_unity.effect: Binds balefires together - withdraw and re-invest Glamour for all combined
oath_of_fire_and_unity.benefit: Significantly reduces membership cost, especially with Treasure/chimera sacrifices
oath_of_fire_and_unity.vulnerability: Once one balefire depleted by Reaving, attacker can Reave linked balefires

covenant_of_flame.name: Covenant of Flame
covenant_of_flame.description: Proof of freehold ownership containing piece of freeholder's soul and balefire flame
covenant_of_flame.form: Small flame from balefire encased in crystal carved as freehold's crest, usually set in jewelry (ring, pendant)
covenant_of_flame.history: Common before Shattering; secret lost during Interregnum; recently rediscovered

creation.requirement: Freehold must have Call Forth the Flame power
creation.process: Celebrate at balefire for nights equal to Balefire rating

abilities.proof: Glows brilliantly when presented before balefire to prove ownership
abilities.monitor: Relays relative health of holding while away
abilities.restoration: Can be destroyed to release flame and reignite extinguished balefire (max Holdings • until more Glamour invested)
abilities.benefits: While carried, freeholder considered within freehold for benefits (per 'While They Reside Within' rule)

academy.name: Academy
academy.description: Commoners' answer to noble tutelage systems. Dedicated to teaching young Kithain lore, combat, and history.
academy.benefit: -2 difficulty on rolls for one chosen Ability while residing within. Training counts toward experience point purchases.

hearth.name: Hearth
hearth.description: Most common freehold type. Welcomes all changelings in need of safety. Commoners and nobles alike rise to defend it.
hearth.benefit: -2 difficulty on Leadership or Socialize rolls (player's choice) while residing within.

homestead.name: Homestead
homestead.description: Agricultural freeholds for growing chimerical crops and raising animals. Usually managed by commoner Regents for noble lieges.
homestead.benefit: -2 difficulty on Survival or Animal Ken rolls while residing within. Creates chimerical produce per C20 p.317.

manor.name: Manor
manor.description: Communities of changelings around a single balefire. Second most common freehold type. Usually run by nobles as Lord/Lady.
manor.benefit: -2 difficulty on Etiquette rolls while residing within.

market.name: Market
market.description: Trading hubs where changelings meet, trade chimerical goods and services, and seek employment. Hidden from mortals via secret raths.
market.benefit: -2 difficulty on Persuasion or Subterfuge rolls while residing within.

repository.name: Repository
repository.description: Dedicated to lore and research. Rare and highly sought-after. May take form of libraries, talking heads, or magical pools.
repository.benefit: -2 difficulty on Lore rolls while residing within.

stronghold.name: Stronghold
stronghold.description: Seats of power and first line of defense against Lost Ones, Fomorians, and hostile Dreaming incursions. Centers of noble political conflict.
stronghold.benefit: -2 difficulty on Firearms or Melee rolls while residing within.

thorpe.name: Thorpe
thorpe.description: Communities with multiple balefires burning throughout the property. Run by a Mayor who manages competing personalities.
thorpe.benefit: -2 difficulty on Empathy rolls while residing within.
thorpe.special: Oath of Fire and Unity can bind multiple balefires, reducing Glamour investment costs but increasing Reaving vulnerability.

workshop.name: Workshop
workshop.description: Craft-focused counterpart to Homesteads. Exists mostly in Autumn World. Usually managed by nockers or boggans for noble patrons.
workshop.benefit: -2 difficulty on Craft rolls while residing within. Creates chimerical goods per C20 p.317.

warning_call.name: Warning Call
warning_call.effect: Immediate awareness of intruders attempting entry or current location if already within
warning_call.vs_glamour_concealment: Freehold rolls Sanctuary rating (difficulty 6) to penetrate Chicanery/Treasure obfuscation

glamour_to_dross.name: Glamour to Dross
glamour_to_dross.effect: Every evening, unclaimed Glamour converts to dross
glamour_to_dross.cap: Stops when total unused dross equals 2× balefire rating

resonant_dreams.name: Resonant Dreams
resonant_dreams.effect: +2 dice bonus on either all mundane checks OR one Art that resonates with Aspect
examples: Water Aspect → +2 Sovereign vs aquatic subjects

call_forth_the_flame.name: Call Forth the Flame
call_forth_the_flame.description: Create Covenant of Flame Treasure component
call_forth_the_flame.process: Celebrate at balefire in manner suited to nature for nights equal to Balefire rating
call_forth_the_flame.result: Produces Covenant Ember for Covenant of Flame Treasure
call_forth_the_flame.note: Treasure Background rating must be purchased separately

dual_nature.name: Dual Nature
dual_nature.effect: Gains mechanical benefit of second Archetype in addition to first

cantrips.name: Cantrips
cantrips.requirement: Cantrip must resonate with Archetype or Aspect
cantrips.note: Storyteller determines which cantrips fit the freehold's dream

lingering_dreams.name: Lingering Dreams
lingering_dreams.description: Dreams at wellspring provide lasting bonus
lingering_dreams.effect: +1 die per dot to changeling who last harvested Glamour
lingering_dreams.tie_to: Dreams experienced during harvest relate to bonus application

natures_bounty.name: Nature's Bounty
natures_bounty.description: Multiple changelings can harvest from wellspring
natures_bounty.effect: Number of changelings who may harvest equals rating
natures_bounty.note: Normally only first to fall asleep receives Glamour

imbolc.ritual: Firebrands carry lanterns lit from Well of Flames at Tara-Nar to freeholds
imbolc.freeholder_duty: Provide or arrange for a unique story each year
imbolc.failure_penalty: One fewer Glamour when harvesting until next rite; balefire weakens

hospitality.name: Rule of Hospitality
hospitality.description: Must offer food, drink, and one night's lodging to any changeling who asks
hospitality.extension: Guest may petition any freeholder to stay longer
hospitality.tie_breaker: If freeholders disagree and can't reach consensus, Dreaming allows guest to stay
hospitality.refusal_penalty: Loss of Dreaming's Banality protection for one week + immediate Banality trigger
hospitality.revocation: May be rescinded without consequence if guest attempts harm to freeholder or possessions

mandate.name: Right of Mandate
mandate.description: Complete sovereignty within freehold - freeholder's word is law
mandate.scope: Overrides external rank (even visiting High King)
mandate.conflict_resolution: Last freeholder to speak to visitor takes priority
mandate.group_decisions: If troupe decides beforehand, must inform others before revoking

aspect_support.requirement: Freeholder must support freehold's Aspect through tangible acts
aspect_support.benefit: Freehold impedes those acting against freeholder (penalty up to balefire rating)
aspect_support.failure: Freehold takes no action to stop those acting against freeholder

passage.name: Right of Passage
passage.description: Responsible for maintaining all connected trods and raths
passage.maintenance: Must reinforce trod's Aspect (usually aligned with freehold's)
passage.special_rites: Some trods require specific actions on meaningful dates
failure_consequences: Unpredictable Dreaming creatures may cross into Autumn World
Creatures range from benign annoyances to life-threatening perils

examples.fireplace_rath: Milk and cookies on Christmas Eve
examples.zambezi_trod: Welcome returning residents with mbira music
examples.secrets_trod: Answer riddle every Solstice coinciding with new moon

sanctuary_right.name: Sanctuary
sanctuary_right.description: Protection while in sync with freehold
sanctuary_right.benefit: Extra dice for defensive rolls (physical and magical) equal to freehold rating
sanctuary_right.soak_bonus: Half freehold rating (round up) extra dice for soak
sanctuary_right.condition: Must uphold all duties backed by the Dreaming
sanctuary_right.loss: Penalties applied if neglecting duties until maintenance resumes

regency.description: When freeholder cannot personally maintain freehold
regency.oath: Oath of Regency transfers all benefits and responsibilities
regency.duration: Until original freeholder returns and asks for freehold back
regency.return: Freehold returns automatically whether regent wishes it or not

fall_penalty.regent: Gains Banality equal to Glamour used to seal oath
fall_penalty.freeholder: Gains Banality equal to freehold's rating

neglect.description: Forgetting duties causes freehold to withdraw support
neglect.effect: Cry for help as balefire sputters

infestation.description: Chimerical pests eat away at balefire

reaving.description: Forcing balefire to produce more Glamour than natural
reaving.effect: Dangerous Banal act; tends to weaken or destroy balefire

contested_ownership.description: Disputes over rightful ownership (especially Arcadian sidhe claims)

prodigal_threats.werewolves: May mistake freehold for holy site

lost_ones.description: Changelings who succumb to Bedlam in their freehold
lost_ones.cause: Completely letting go of mundane; Dreaming rushes into psyche schism
lost_ones.effect: Mind and freehold become one; personality subsumed by Aspect
lost_ones.binding: Can be bound by oaths but interpret literally and capriciously
lost_ones.origin: Most date to Shattering when fae barricaded themselves from Banality floods

glades.description: Glades are natural places where the Dreaming touches the Autumn World. May be developed into freeholds.

difference_from_freehold.natural: Raw, primal sources of Glamour rather than refined
difference_from_freehold.shifting: Shift more easily in response to environmental changes
difference_from_freehold.lifecycle: May evolve between Archetypes over centuries

aerie.name: Aerie
aerie.terrain: High places - mountain peaks, tall trees, clifftops

grotto.name: Grotto
grotto.terrain: Coastal caves, sea cliffs, tidal pools

hollow.name: Hollow
hollow.terrain: Tree hollows, burrows, enclosed natural spaces

barrens.name: Barrens
barrens.notes: Sometimes mistaken for Glens but distinguished by remote location, desolation, harsh climate

garden.name: Garden
garden.notes: Recent category; often mistaken for small Homesteads

mire.name: Mire
mire.notes: Often mistaken for Grottos or Hollows

oasis.name: Oasis
oasis.notes: Most known Oases in Middle East and Africa

passage.description: One free rath/trod; additional cost 1 dot each

resources.description: Chimerical resources only (produce, stone, metal, wood)
resources.limit: Cannot exceed lesser of Size or Wellspring

sanctuary.description: Protection from accessibility, geography, weather, wildlife, or guardian efforts

scale.1: Pocket garden, hill, fishpond, small cavern
scale.3: Wooded copse, series of hills, lake/stream, large cavern, small cave system (2-3)
scale.4: Forest, mountain, large lake/river, cave network (6-8)
scale.5: National park, Mount Everest, Great Lakes, mountain range, significant caves (9-15)

wellspring.manifestation: Natural object fitting Archetype - stone, geyser, flower, tree, dust devil, leaf swirl
wellspring.removal: If removed, Glamour dries up; Glade loses 1 dot/day until restored

lingering_dreams.effect: +1 die per dot to last harvester

natures_bounty.effect: Number of changelings who can harvest equals rating
natures_bounty.default: Normally only first to sleep receives Glamour

balefire.name: Balefire
balefire.description: Heart of the freehold. Generates Glamour and/or dross equal to rating. Can split production any way (e.g., 3 dots = 2 Glamour + 1 dross).

1.name: Ember
1.description: Barely visible, needs constant tending

2.name: Candle
2.description: Small but steady flame

3.name: Hearth
3.description: Warm and reliable

4.name: Bonfire
4.description: Bright and powerful

5.name: Blaze
5.description: Legendary, visible across Dreaming

notes: Glamour split evenly among changelings sleeping near balefire
Freeholders can grant/deny guests permission to harvest
If freeholders disagree, majority rules; ties favor denial

size.name: Size
size.description: Area the freehold encompasses (mundane or chimerical, whichever larger)

0.description: Miniscule, no walls - faerie ring, decorated stone

1.description: Apartment; 1-2 average rooms

2.description: Home; 3-4 average rooms

3.description: Mansion, warehouse, church; 5-8 average rooms

4.description: Sprawling estate, fortress, tunnel network; 9-15 rooms

5.description: Significant countryside chunk, town; Tara-Nar scale

sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
effects: Grants threshold + bonus dice equal to rating for defense
Subtracts dice equal to rating from Reaving attempts
Subtracts dice from attempts to find or break into freehold
Does not work against freely-invited guests (until invitation rescinded)

resources.name: Resources
resources.description: Material generation (mundane money or chimerical goods/creatures)

types.chimerical: Plants, stone, metal, creatures, special materials

resources.notes: Rating determined by value and rarity of what's produced

passages.name: Passages
passages.description: Connections to Dreaming and other locations
passages.free_passage: Every freehold has one free rath or trod

types.rath: Portal connecting single point to single point (freehold to dream-realm, etc.)
types.trod: Path/highway through Dreaming connecting multiple locations

glamour_investment.description: All freeholders must invest at least 1 Glamour dot in the freehold
glamour_investment.minimum: 1 dot per freeholder, even if exceeds balefire rating
glamour_investment.shortfall: If combined investment < balefire rating, pay difference or sacrifice Treasures (C20 p.314)
effects: Attunes freehold to freeholder's wishes
Allows shaping (conscious or unconscious)
Permits harvesting balefire
Grants Sanctuary benefits
Allows granting/denying hospitality
glamour_investment.destruction_effect: Invested Glamour returns plus equal Banality

boggans.name: Boggan
boggans.description: Practical and hardworking, boggans are the keepers of households and industrious homemakers. They can't help but get involved in the business of others.

birthrights.name: Craftwork
birthrights.effect: Accomplish mundane tasks in 1/3 time when unobserved. Cannot be witnessed by anyone.

birthrights.name: Social Dynamics
birthrights.effect: Instantly perceive social connections and hierarchies. +2 dice to social perception.

frailty.name: Call of the Needy
frailty.effect: Must help those who sincerely ask. Willpower roll (difficulty 8) to refuse.

boggans.appearance: Stocky, often with ruddy complexion. Comfortable, practical clothing. Warm, welcoming demeanor.

clurichaun.name: Clurichaun
clurichaun.description: Fun-loving and charismatic leprechaun-kin who love revelry and collecting. Prone to mercurial tempers.

birthrights.name: Twinkling of an Eye
birthrights.effect: Can hide small objects on person that cannot be found by search.

birthrights.name: Fighting Words
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to all rolls when fighting for sport or defending honor.

frailty.name: The Dark Mood
frailty.effect: Subject to bouts of depression or rage. When triggered, must act on the mood for the scene.

clurichaun.appearance: Short, often red-haired. Fancy but mismatched clothing. Twinkling, mischievous eyes.

eshu.name: Eshu
eshu.description: Wandering storytellers and explorers from African traditions. Known for arriving exactly where and when they need to be.

birthrights.name: Spirit Pathways
birthrights.effect: Can always find path to destination. +2 dice to navigation, reduce travel time.

birthrights.name: Talecraft
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to Performance (storytelling). Stories can temporarily grant bonuses to listeners.

frailty.name: Recklessness
frailty.effect: Cannot refuse a direct challenge or dare. Willpower roll (difficulty 8) to resist.

eshu.appearance: Diverse appearances reflecting African diaspora. Travel-worn but dignified clothing. Presence that commands attention.

nockers.name: Nocker
nockers.description: Foul-mouthed curmudgeons who are ingenious inventors and perfectionist crafters. Prefer their creations to company.

birthrights.name: Make It Work
birthrights.effect: Can fix or jury-rig any device. -2 difficulty to Crafts and Technology.

birthrights.name: Perfect Understanding
birthrights.effect: Instantly understand how any device works with a Perception + Crafts roll.

frailty.name: Flaws
frailty.effect: Everything they create has an imperfection. ST determines the flaw secretly.

nockers.appearance: Small, often gnomish. Stained work clothes, tool belts. Perpetually grumpy expression.

piskies.name: Piskie
piskies.description: Innocent, wide-eyed wanderers seeking beauty and wonder. Useful messengers but can't resist taking shiny things.

birthrights.name: Nimble
birthrights.effect: Can squeeze through any opening their head fits through. +2 dice to Athletics.

birthrights.name: Unerring Direction
birthrights.effect: Always knows which way is north. Never gets lost.

frailty.name: Sticky Fingers
frailty.effect: Must take interesting objects. Willpower roll (difficulty 7) to resist acquiring something that catches eye.

piskies.appearance: Small, childlike. Bright colors, mismatched borrowed finery. Wide, curious eyes.

pooka.name: Pooka
pooka.description: Shapeshifting tricksters with animal affinities. Adore practical jokes and are compelled to lie.

birthrights.name: Shapechanging
birthrights.effect: Can transform into one specific animal type (chosen at creation). Takes one turn.

birthrights.name: Confidante
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to gaining trust. People naturally confide in pooka.

frailty.name: Untruth
frailty.effect: Cannot tell the complete truth. Must always lie or omit something significant.

pooka.appearance: Features suggest animal affinity (cat-like eyes, rabbit ears, etc.). Often disheveled.

redcaps.name: Redcap
redcaps.description: Monstrous eating machines with bad attitudes. Terrifying, violent, and unwelcome but undeniably useful in battle.

birthrights.name: Dark Appetite
birthrights.effect: Can eat anything, including chimerical and some mundane materials. Teeth inflict Strength +2 damage.

birthrights.name: Bully Browbeat
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to Intimidation. Can demoralize with presence alone.

frailty.name: Bad Attitude
frailty.effect: Must soak blood in cap regularly or lose Glamour. -2 dice to all Social rolls except Intimidation.

redcaps.appearance: Sharp teeth, red cap stained with blood. Menacing, predatory appearance. Often unkempt.

satyrs.name: Satyr
satyrs.description: Spirits of pleasure and passion with goat legs. Hedonistic but also fierce warriors and wise counselors.

birthrights.name: Gift of Pan
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to Performance (music). Music can affect emotions of listeners.

birthrights.name: Physical Prowess
birthrights.effect: +1 to Stamina. Can run twice normal speed.

frailty.name: Passion's Curse
frailty.effect: Cannot resist passionate experiences. Willpower roll (difficulty 8) to avoid indulgence.

satyrs.appearance: Goat legs, small horns. Attractive upper body. Often minimal clothing, musical instruments nearby.

selkies.name: Selkie
selkies.description: Skinchanging sea-folk who straddle land and sea. Playful but cautious, must protect their sealskin pelts.

birthrights.name: Seal Form
birthrights.effect: Can transform into seal when wearing sealskin. Full aquatic adaptation.

birthrights.name: Ocean's Grace
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to all rolls while in or near ocean. Can hold breath indefinitely.

frailty.name: The Sealskin
frailty.effect: Must keep sealskin safe. If destroyed, cannot transform and loses 1 Glamour/day until new one found.

selkies.appearance: Liquid dark eyes, sleek hair. Graceful movements. Often wet or near water.

sidhe_arcadian.name: Sidhe (Arcadian)
sidhe_arcadian.description: Returned rulers from Arcadia who take mortal hosts rather than being reborn. Beautiful, powerful, and somewhat alien.

birthrights.name: Awe and Beauty
birthrights.effect: Appearance never below 3. +2 dice to Social rolls based on appearance.

birthrights.name: Noble Bearing
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to rolls involving leadership, command, and social dominance.

frailty.name: Banality's Curse
frailty.effect: Gain Banality at twice normal rate. More vulnerable to Undoing.

sidhe_arcadian.appearance: Impossibly beautiful. Otherworldly grace. Regal bearing. Often tall and slender.

sidhe_autumn.name: Sidhe (Autumn)
sidhe_autumn.description: Sidhe who took the Changeling Way and are reborn into mortal bodies. Bridge between noble and commoner.

birthrights.name: Awe and Beauty
birthrights.effect: Appearance never below 3. +2 dice to Social rolls based on appearance.

birthrights.name: Noble Bearing
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to rolls involving leadership, command, and social dominance.

frailty.name: Banality's Curse
frailty.effect: Gain Banality at 1.5x normal rate. Moderately vulnerable to Undoing.

sidhe_autumn.appearance: Beautiful but more human. Complex beauty mixing mortal and fae. Often striking features.

sluagh.name: Sluagh
sluagh.description: Whispering secrets-keepers who dwell in shadows and underworlds. Trade in information and hidden things.

birthrights.name: Squirm
birthrights.effect: Can contort body to fit through any opening. Double jointed.

birthrights.name: Sharpened Senses
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to Perception. Can see in near-total darkness.

frailty.name: The Whisper
frailty.effect: Can only speak in whispers. Cannot raise voice above soft speaking level.

sluagh.appearance: Pale, gaunt. Dark clothing. Tends to lurk in shadows. Spidery movements.

trolls.name: Troll
trolls.description: Honorable giants bound by their word. Fierce warriors but also loyal friends and oath-keepers.

birthrights.name: Titan's Power
birthrights.effect: +2 to Strength (may exceed 5). +1 additional Health Level.

birthrights.name: Strong Constitution
birthrights.effect: +2 dice to resist poison, disease, and fatigue.

frailty.name: Bond of Duty
frailty.effect: Bound by word absolutely. Breaking a promise causes 1 permanent Banality.

trolls.appearance: Large, imposing. Blue-tinged skin. Often scarred from honorable combat. Simple, practical clothing.

middle-east._region: Al-Hilal Al-Khaseeb (The Fertile Crescent / Middle East)
middle-east._note: The Jinn are the fae of the Middle East, distinct from but related to the Kithain. They have their own courts, traditions, and political structures including the Empire of the Caucasus, Caliphate of Cedars, and Sultanate of Hejaz.

ifrit.name: Ifrit
ifrit.description: Forged in flame and battle hardened. They value strength, honor, and shrewd leadership, never shying from a fight for a righteous cause. Formidable in battle thanks to both physical prowess and strategy. Capable generals in times of war. When they fall in love, their passion exceeds reason.

birthrights.name: Flame Forged
birthrights.effect: Extreme heat and smoke inhalation do not bother them. Take no damage from ordinary fire. Spend 1 Glamour to ignore damage from magical fire for a scene.

birthrights.name: Warrior's Might
birthrights.effect: Add one dot to Strength (even above 5). Cannot botch Athletics or Intimidation rolls.

frailties.name: Hot Headed
frailties.effect: If slighted, must insist other party make amends or challenge them to combat/competition. Must make Willpower roll (difficulty 8) to avoid immediately and directly answering an insult. Letting a serious insult stand unanswered triggers Banality. Minor insults (like stranger's rudeness) don't require duel but still provoke quick temper.

ifrit.appearance: Commanding presence. In human form, often tallest in family; fae mien larger still. Rough skin color of stone or sand, always hot to touch. Fire dances in eyes. May carry flaming blades or wear glowing molten armor. Adore jewelry worn in large amounts (earrings, necklaces, bracelets, rings)—often augmented chimerically with personal meaning. Vibrant colored, loose-fitting clothing.
ifrit.revelry: Battle, competition, proving one's mettle against worthy opposition. Winning is sweetest.
ifrit.unleashing: Cinders and motes of ash swirl around body. Smoky haze descends, temperature spikes to sweltering. Harmless but vivid chimerical flames spring up around caster and target.
ifrit.seemings: Childling: battle (love to fight). Wilder: tactics. Grump: strategy.

lilin.name: Lilin
lilin.description: Headstrong and alluring, they know what they want and how to get it. Claim descent from Lilith, who rebelled against her creator and refused to submit. Born from fever dreams of those craving release from oppressive heat and social mores that demonized pleasure. The jasmine-scented evening breeze, the darkness of approaching storm, the life-bringing downpour.

birthrights.name: Breaking Bonds
birthrights.effect: The Dreaming shields them from legal/financial repercussions for breaking mundane deals or contracts (if not done from spite). Can invalidate fae oaths or supernatural pacts without magical consequences if they can make reasonable case it is imbalanced or unjust. Broken oaths don't trigger Banality. Can shield others from mundane contract consequences for 1 Glamour each (cannot release others from magical oaths).

birthrights.name: Endless Charms
birthrights.effect: Add one dot to Charisma, Manipulation, or Appearance (even above 5). Spend 1 Glamour to negate a botch on any roll with that Attribute (turns to ordinary failure). Winged Merit cost reduced to 2.

frailties.name: Wilting Nightbloom
frailties.effect: While in direct sunlight, +1 difficulty to all rolls including cantrips. Moving into shade ends disadvantage.

frailties.name: Free Spirit
frailties.effect: Hard time putting others' needs above own desires. Honoring an obligation (employer, romantic partner, stable relationship) instead of doing what lilin wants triggers Banality. E.g., choosing date over hunting chimerical beast triggers Banality.

lilin.appearance: Long hair that never tangles regardless of texture. Athletic human form with accentuated curves and prominent musculature. Move with serpentine grace, prefer fitted clothing leaving just enough to imagination. Display patron gifts of jewelry. Fae mien: soft wings from shoulder blades, patches of skin may shimmer with scales. Favor chimerical companions like owls and snakes.
lilin.revelry: Physical pleasure—experiencing or administering for others. Physical contact with at least one other person required. Not limited to bedroom pleasures but those are most potent.
lilin.unleashing: Faint rumblings of thunderstorm, unexpected gust of wind, jasmine-scented raindrops.
lilin.seemings: Childling: exhilarated by abilities, seek opportunities, thrive in nightclubs/bars, throw into new relationships but quickly become discontented. Wilder: more discerning, politically minded, seek powerful patrons, eager for diplomacy, desire to leave mark. Grump: seen it all, no longer see lovers as means to Glamour/power, keep few loyal partners, caution younger lilinot, level-headed, care for community, watch for injustice.

qareen.name: Qareen
qareen.description: The quintessential academics and scholars. Repositories of history who witness the world with endless patience and perfect recall. Form deep bonds with select few, which can heavily influence their moral alignment. When they fall in love, loyal to a fault.

birthrights.name: Timeless
birthrights.effect: Receive Faerie Eternity and Eidetic Memory Merits free at character creation. Cannot botch Academics or Gremayre rolls.

birthrights.name: Bear Witness
birthrights.effect: Relive any memory with perfect clarity. Spend 1 Glamour to telepathically share memory with single target. With target's consent and 1 Glamour, can enter another person's mind to observe their memories ('Visiting'). Non-qareen memories are imperfect and subjective—inexperienced qurana' find this disorienting. ST may require Willpower expenditure for old, damaged, incomplete, or traumatic memories.

frailties.name: Burden of Truth
frailties.effect: Cannot actively say something untrue (can choose not to answer, can lie by omission). +1 difficulty to all rolls for tricking/deceiving through speech. Must roll Willpower (difficulty 6) to willingly withhold important relevant information in crucial moment, even if sharing would embarrass them or put them at disadvantage. (Not obligated if it would break fae oath or directly cause death.) May forego roll and keep silence at cost of triggering Banality instead.

qareen.appearance: Modest by fae standards, prefer comfortable simple clothing. Fae mien: even young qurana' appear frail/elderly with gray hair and deep wrinkles, skin thin as parchment or cracked like dried clay. Eyes give clearest impression of actual age. Chimerical attire: simply draped natural fabric in muted neutral colors with minimal adornment.
qareen.revelry: Listening to stories (prefer plausible over fantastical), learning, teaching others what they have witnessed.
qareen.unleashing: Faint scent of papyrus in candlelight, old books. Residue of fine swirling sand on ground. Feeling of turning of ages and weight of history.
qareen.seemings: View seemings as different outlooks on knowledge: Childling: learning. Wilder: understanding. Grump: teaching.

shaytan.name: Shaytan
shaytan.description: Dealmaker, trickster, temptress, charlatan. Born from anxious dreams of those feeling trapped by society, unable to live as they truly are without committing 'grievous sins.' Most are happy to provide outlet for secret desires, then feed on resulting guilt and secrecy. Considered descendants of Iblis.

birthrights.name: Trust Me
birthrights.effect: Add one dot to Manipulation (even above 5). Cannot botch Streetwise or Larceny rolls.

birthrights.name: Pick Your Poison
birthrights.effect: Spend 1 Glamour and roll Perception + Streetwise (difficulty = target's Willpower) to learn an individual's preferred vice or dark desire. Don't learn other details (where they indulge, with whom, whether they've acted on it)—just what it is and that it exists.

frailties.name: As Within, So Without
frailties.effect: People quick to believe worst of them. +2 difficulty on all rolls to convince others of innocence, caring, or good intentions. Unsettling looks make others deeply uneasy. Cannot have Appearance above 3. Treat failures on Appearance Attribute or Empathy Ability rolls as botches.

shaytan.appearance: Ashen skin in varying shades of grey like shifting swirls of smoke. Something always unsettling about human seeming; fae miens are strikingly fearsome with horns sprouting from brow, gnarled fangs lining gums, long spiked tails. Often inhabit seedy casinos, back-alleys, race tracks, sporting events—anywhere they're likely to find desperate mortals.
shaytan.revelry: Successfully leading mortal or Jinn toward self-destruction. Gambling, carousing, cheating, lying. It's the potential for regret or guilt that nourishes them. Nobler shayateen get similar fix from hearing stories of bad behavior.
shaytan.unleashing: Lights dim as noxious fumes and dark smoke surround them. Scent may be sulfur, burning hair, or cheap cigarettes—never pleasant.
shaytan.seemings: Childling: always poking noses where they don't belong—eavesdropping, rifling through closets and purses. Wilder: quintessential bad influences parents warn about. Grump: eschew fleeting pleasures for long cons and complicated schemes.

alicanto.name: Alicanto
alicanto.description: Metal-eating bird-fae born from dreams of greed and gluttony. They can be signs of luck or peril—legends say they caused El Dorado's demise. They fight against those who plunder the earth for riches, while serving as exceptional treasure hunters themselves.

birthrights.name: All That Glitters
birthrights.effect: Gain one dot of Perception (even above 5). Track precious gems, valuable metals, and magical items by scent with Perception + Kenning roll (difficulty based on quantity and trail age). Cannot botch Kenning rolls.

birthrights.name: Wonder Workers
birthrights.effect: Natural talent for creating items of power. -2 difficulty on all rolls for crafting Treasures and Wonders. Takes half the time and two-thirds the materials. Cannot botch Crafts rolls.

frailties.name: Draconic Fever
frailties.effect: Must succeed on Willpower roll (difficulty 7) to refuse a better offer of payment, or to resist buying/taking a precious item they feel should be theirs. Require a meal of metal at least once per week (more valuable metal = less needed). Failure to eat metal prevents Willpower recovery.

alicanto.appearance: Slender and tall with sharp, angular, bird-like features. Hair often has metallic threads. Eyes are human-like colors but with gem-like or metallic sheen. Beautiful tattoos cover their skin. Fae mien: bipedal, bird-like humanoids forged from precious metals with gleaming feathers, flightless wings, fire-filled eyes. Wings used for displays, especially among kithmates.
alicanto.revelry: Shopping for fine things, showing off fine fashions and prized possessions. Tending to precious things—polishing jewelry, organizing couture wardrobes.
alicanto.unleashing: Exotic bird calls fill the air with scent of earth from deep mines. Nearby metals shine brightly polished; gems become dazzling display.

boraro.name: Boraro
boraro.description: Guardians of nature and fierce warriors defending their people and wild places. A second wave sprung from desperate nightmares of those suffering under colonization. Found wherever nature is threatened by industry, including decaying industrial cities where they hasten nature's reclamation.

birthrights.name: Deep Roots
birthrights.effect: Instinctively know how to find pockets of life and greenery even in big cities. Spend 1 Glamour to subtract -1 from all difficulties for the scene while standing on natural soil.

birthrights.name: Warrior Heart
birthrights.effect: Immune to surprise in combat. Add 1 success to all damage and soak rolls while in a natural environment or with real soil under their feet.

frailties.name: Creeping Menace
frailties.effect: Terrifying aura makes lives difficult. Can spend 1 Willpower to suppress for a single roll. +2 difficulty to all Charisma-based rolls except Intimidation, or those involving family/long-time friends and allies.

boraro.appearance: Dour and plain looking, would be overlooked if not for vague feeling of unease. Something always 'off' about them. Work-worn hands with dirt ground into creases. Large pricked ears, fangs, and grotesque twisted visages in fae mien—never quite hidden from mortals.
boraro.revelry: Spending time in nature (pristine wilderness or reclaimed urban spaces). Tearing down egregious elements of civilization.
boraro.unleashing: Howls of predatory animals and sudden feeling of being stalked by dread creature just out of sight. Shadows lengthen, nature turns feral and menacing, technology seems pointless and hollow.

encantado.name: Encantado
encantado.description: The enchanted ones—freshwater fae similar to selkies but bound to rivers, lakes, and streams. Legends say staring into their eyes drives mortals mad. At night they shed animal skin for mortal form, seeking companions. Children of such unions may become encantado themselves.

birthrights.name: Children of the River
birthrights.effect: Spend 1 Glamour to change into Amazon dolphin while submerged (changing back is free). Can use Hypnotic Gaze in dolphin form but cannot speak. Cannot botch Empathy or Athletics rolls. -2 difficulty for swimming or friendly socializing at parties.

birthrights.name: Hypnotic Gaze
birthrights.effect: After speaking to person for 1 minute with fairly consistent eye contact, gain 2 extra dots of Manipulation on all rolls with that person for the scene (even above 5). Does not work on bondmates or other encantado.

birthrights.name: Soul Bond
birthrights.effect: Can bond for life with mortal(s). Spend 1 Glamour to feel bondmate's general emotional state at any distance; automatically aware if bondmate is injured. Bonds entered willingly and can be broken (but breaking expends all Willpower). Multiple bonds possible. Bond need not be romantic but is intensely intimate.

frailties.name: Water-Born
frailties.effect: Must spend at least two daylight hours fully submerged in fresh water to heal or restore Glamour normally. After 28 hours without swimming, cannot regain Glamour until they do. Water must be at least twice bathtub size and unpolluted by chemicals like chlorine.

frailties.name: Coward's Curse
frailties.effect: Avoid conflict whenever possible. In aggressive situations, must succeed on Willpower roll (difficulty based on odds) to avoid backing down/fleeing. If forced to fight, must spend 1 Willpower or Glamour per round to take any action other than fleeing or begging for peace.

encantado.appearance: Beautiful and graceful with unearthly appeal. Luminous skin glowing from inside, silken soft and slick to the touch. Never scar, rarely tattoo. Deep, dark eyes like still lake on moonless night. Usually hairless bodies; head hair is silken fuzz (often favor hats, headscarves, short haircuts). In water: mermaid form with brightly colored/patterned tails and seaweed-like hair.
encantado.revelry: Hosting parties or crashing someone else's and making it their own. Long moonlight swims.
encantado.unleashing: Gleam with otherworldly light as everything drifts and sways as if underwater. Cool currents and ethereal singing fill the air. Sound distorts except for encantado's clear, perfect voice.

llorona.name: Llorona
llorona.description: The weeping woman, the banshee. Drawn to the suffering of others, they feed on despair from deepest loss. They have symbiotic relationship with mourners, drawing away grief and granting relief. In some communities, a place is always set for them at funerals.

birthrights.name: Ties That Bind
birthrights.effect: Touch another and spend 1 Glamour to take their emotional pain, rage, or sorrow into themselves, restoring 1 Willpower to target and easing their emotional state. Also instinctively sense when ghosts are nearby; spend 1 Glamour to see and speak with the Restless for a scene.

birthrights.name: Foreseen is Forewarned
birthrights.effect: Once per chapter, spend 1 Glamour to reroll any roll (new result stands even if worse). Can use on another character in line of sight, but hostile/unwilling targets require Willpower roll (difficulty = target's Willpower rating).

frailties.name: Inevitable Truths
frailties.effect: Suffer Bard's Tongue Flaw. Must succeed on Willpower roll (difficulty 7) to avoid giving totally honest assessment when asked for opinion. Not compelled to speak, but if they do, hard to hold back perceived truth. Difficult to use white lies and 'socially acceptable' fabrications. +1 difficulty on all rolls related to tricking or deceiving through speech. Does NOT apply when speaking with mortal children or anyone they used Ties that Bind on that scene.

llorona.appearance: Aged before their time with wisdom beyond apparent years. Premature wrinkles, greying hair, grating voices. Eyes retain spark of power and knowing beyond mortal ken. Look at least a decade older than human age after maturity (age gracefully). Long hair regardless of gender, often swept high. Eyes appear blind white (pupils/iris melding into sclera) but vision is normal. Face like skin stretched tight over bone—skeletal visage.
llorona.revelry: Attending funerals, joining memorial services, haunting support groups for the grieving. Wandering cemeteries collecting keepsakes from graves.
llorona.unleashing: Time drags to halt then explodes with possibilities. Shadowy images flicker carrying out multiple probabilities. Mirrors show faces that might have been or are yet to be. Scent of old tombs and freshly turned grave earth.

sachamama.name: Sachamama
sachamama.description: Giant serpent-fae born from tales of snakes so large they change the earth as they move. Masters of gossip and secrets who know the business of whole neighborhoods. In the wild they lurk for prey; in cities they sit on stoops gathering information. Love scandal and can always ferret out secrets.

birthrights.name: Snake Skinned
birthrights.effect: While touching their shed skin (typically appears as large snakeskin jacket), spend 1 Glamour to assume form of large snake. Retain speech (sibilant) and usable skills/powers. Shed skin cannot be lost, is extremely durable (only cold iron can permanently damage). Other damage mends in a day. If destroyed with cold iron, must kill and consume a large animal to make new one. Once per story, may assume huge fearsome snake form (up to 50 feet) for one scene: +4 Strength and Stamina, can swallow adult human whole, but cannot use other powers and communicate only in short phrases.

birthrights.name: Keen Observers
birthrights.effect: Receive Eidetic Memory Merit free. Cannot botch Alertness or Kenning rolls. Cannot be surprised unless attackers are supernaturally concealed.

frailties.name: Gorging
frailties.effect: Eat almost twice normal amount daily. At least once per year must devour roughly 500 pounds of meat in a day or two (most retreat to jungle; some make huge supermarket trips; some use it to eliminate rivals). Even ordinary meals leave them sluggish: +1 difficulty to all rolls for an hour after eating. Must succeed on Willpower roll (difficulty 5) to pass up easy chance to eat. Light snacking doesn't incur penalties but cannot substitute for 'real' meals—need at least a couple full meals daily.

sachamama.appearance: Stocky builds that look like they could crush someone. Eyes are light amber verging on yellow with vertical pupil. May fuse legs into serpentine tail (can still balance upright). Small patches of scales along jawline and down arms/legs (blend with skin, hard to spot). Distinctive laughter carries across great distances. Second row of long, needle-like teeth behind first row.
sachamama.revelry: People watching while gossipping with someone. Hunting in serpent form (must be real hunt—captive rats won't do).
sachamama.unleashing: Sibilant hissing fills the air, world seems to shimmer or slither with movement of tremendous serpent. Hot blood runs cold; scent and taste of freshly killed meat becomes overpowering.

biloko.name: Biloko
biloko.description: Traditional guardians and living embodiments of their communities' beliefs. Fiercely traditional, biloko take pride in keeping the ways of their people alive, serving as living embodiments of ancestral wisdom while guiding their communities through modern challenges.

birthrights.name: Ancestral Virtues
birthrights.effect: Add one dot to an Attribute especially valued by their culture, even above 5. Select one Ability their community is known for; cannot botch rolls in that Ability. Living Legend Merit cost reduced to 2 points.

birthrights.name: Natural Instinct
birthrights.effect: Always roll twice for initiative and keep best result. Always go first on ties. Cannot botch Survival rolls.

frailties.name: Familiar Ground
frailties.effect: Must make Willpower roll (difficulty 6) to recover Willpower when resting in unfamiliar place. Place not familiar until three lunar cycles spent there. Difficulty may increase for hostile/strange locations.

frailties.name: Guarded
frailties.effect: First social roll with unfamiliar person suffers +2 difficulty. Failed Etiquette rolls are treated as botches unless 1 Willpower spent.

biloko.appearance: Generally shorter, slim, and muscular from physical labor. Wear functional clothes adorned with cultural symbols: masks, beaded necklaces, wooden amulets, feathery headpieces, totems, or instruments. May use facepaint, scarification, or body modification. Never seen without tribal fashion or accessories.
biloko.revelry: Things that remind them of home culture, directly linked to their people. Easy in communities, harder when far afield.
biloko.unleashing: Sounds of ceremonial drums and stomping feet, songs in ancient tongues. Subtle scent of dust and fragrant ceremonial oils. Those of the eloko's folk feel exaltation; outsiders sense how cut off they are from their own roots.

okubili.name: Okubili
okubili.description: Fae who seek balance and duality in all things. They believe the cycle of death and rebirth is central to changeling existence, and encourage others to discover their past lives for enlightenment and atonement. Natural spiritual guides and gurus.

birthrights.name: Anger Management
birthrights.effect: May spend 1 Willpower to completely suppress strong displays of emotion and ignore mundane attempts to provoke emotional outbursts for a full scene. Magical emotion manipulation suffers increased difficulty.

birthrights.name: Strength of the Cycle
birthrights.effect: Receive two dots of Remembrance Background free at character creation (even above 5). -1 difficulty on all Remembrance rolls. Cannot botch Enigmas or Leadership rolls.

frailties.name: Immersive Mind
frailties.effect: Can become overwhelmed and lose track of current identity, causing episodes where they behave as though living other identities. Functions as Flashbacks Flaw, with triggers relating to other identities and past lives from Remembrance. No extra points for this Flaw.

okubili.appearance: Strong builds with lean muscles suited for running and battle. Neat, straightforward clothes. Most unique feature: eyes that shift color depending on mood and state of mind. Rapidly changing eye colors indicate being out of balance.
okubili.revelry: Meditation (which may be active rather than idle), teaching others.
okubili.unleashing: Shadows become darker and lights brighter. Profound self-confidence for benevolent magic, crippling doubt for malicious cantrips.

djedi.name: Djedi
djedi.description: Urban magicians born to thrive in city life, with great love of unity, crowds, parties, and teamwork. Natural magicians with impressive facility with Arts and Realms, who can conjure minor effects without needing Arts at all.

birthrights.name: Magic In the Blood
birthrights.effect: Spend 1 Glamour to create minor magical effects without bunks or cantrip rolls (equivalent to magic tricks, simple special effects). Cannot botch Gremayre rolls. May spend 1 Glamour to reduce cantrip difficulty by 1 for the scene (treats botches as failures). Up to 3 Glamour may be spent this way per scene.

birthrights.name: All Eyes on Me
birthrights.effect: Add one dot to Charisma (even above 5). -1 difficulty on first social roll in a scene if making a suitably flashy entrance.

frailties.name: Unsubtle
frailties.effect: -2 difficulty for others to track djedi through social investigation. Once per story, ST may declare djedi has attracted obsessive attention from dangerous individual (stalker, witch hunter, unfriendly Prodigal).

frailties.name: The Crash
frailties.effect: After using Magic In the Blood to reduce cantrip difficulties, suffer +1 difficulty on all rolls for the next scene per Glamour spent (e.g., 2 Glamour = +2 difficulty). Small magic tricks don't trigger this.

djedi.appearance: Looks always confusing, trendsetting, or avant-garde. Adopt extreme styles (Afrofuturism, Harajuku, rockabilly, 1970s punk, etc.). Fae mien: light blue-tinted skin, snow white hair, nearly three-inch fangs, typically under five feet tall. Often color hair every shade of rainbow or shave odd patterns.
djedi.revelry: Social gatherings and parties. Work as event organizers, entertainers, performers, athletic coaches, community organizers, politicians.
djedi.unleashing: Cinematic and spectacular—crackling nimbuses of power, swirling winds, phantom sounds, impressive displays.

kuino.name: Kuino
kuino.description: Sharp-eyed merchants and traders always on the lookout for good deals. Born from dreams of better lives when mortals come across valuable goods. Organized into 'the Company,' a loose organizational pyramid with famous/successful kith members at top.

birthrights.name: Eyes for Detail
birthrights.effect: Receive Acute Sense (Vision) Merit free. Cannot botch Investigation or Alertness rolls where vision is beneficial. Cannot be surprised in combat if threat is visible (second set of eyes never fully closes). Extra eyes see even while sleeping.

birthrights.name: Bargainer's Gift
birthrights.effect: Gain one dot in Manipulation (even above 5). Spend 1 Glamour and touch a contract/person to recognize any loopholes or areas of exploitation. -1 difficulty on Contract Art cantrips.

frailties.name: Sambio
frailties.effect: Have a treasured possession housing portion of fae spirit. If someone takes possession, cannot harm them and must roll Willpower (difficulty 8) to resist their commands. Item immune to normal damage but cold iron/magic can destroy it (10 Health Levels, max 1 damage per attack). If destroyed, kuino is slain. Cold iron destruction kills fae spirit too. Automatically sense if item is damaged.

kuino.appearance: Clothing suggests power and authority. Unique feature: second set of eyes on forehead above normal eyes. Second pair has completely black iris and sclera, giving distant, emotionless look. Often snow-white or mahogany black skin tone; rarely half-and-half.
kuino.revelry: Dealmaking, wordplay, immersing in their chosen field of business interest.
kuino.unleashing: Area reflects their chosen field (e.g., copper expert causes metallic sheen and weight of deep earth mine).

obambo.name: Obambo
obambo.description: Collectors and explorers with uncanny talent for mystical objects. Born from ghost stories and dreams of taking relics from forbidden places. Prefer fieldwork to archives—wading through swamps or crawling into caves for artifacts. Natural occultists who prefer practicing magic to cataloging it.

birthrights.name: Clever Hands
birthrights.effect: Instinctively know if entering a supernatural location. Know if an item is magical by touching it (not what kind or how to activate). -2 difficulty to identify magical items by sight or learn about one in possession. Don't need to research items—touching provides information. Cannot botch Kenning or Occult rolls.

birthrights.name: One False Move
birthrights.effect: When triggering a trap, alarm, or cursed item, may immediately spend 1 Glamour to take back the action, instead seeing a flash of what would have happened. Danger remains; only know that specific action triggers it. Know immediate consequences only. Cannot take back others' actions.

frailties.name: Vengeful Heart
frailties.effect: Must succeed on Willpower roll (difficulty 8) not to take immediate, vicious action against someone who hurts a person they care about, or to resist opportunity to retaliate against someone who betrayed their trust. Action need not be physical but is designed for maximum pain, damage, and/or humiliation.

obambo.appearance: Plain, utilitarian, rugged clothing with lots of pockets. Layer outfits (multiple jackets, shirts, dresses). Deck themselves with trinkets, rings, amulets, necklaces—often homemade and blessed. Mix of genuine and clever replicas.
obambo.revelry: Interacting with collections, discussing/presenting collections to others. Notably more animated around other collectors and obambo.
obambo.unleashing: Air fills with stale air and musty scent of forgotten tombs. Feeling of dread as if great trap about to snap shut.

australia._note: Spirit Beings are Australia's indigenous fae, distinct from Kithain. They served specific roles in Aboriginal societies—teaching lessons, tending land, guarding sacred sites, and bridging the gap between human and Dreamtime. The Dreaming and Dreamtime flow together in Australia in ways lost elsewhere since the Mythic Ages.

dulklorrkelorrkeng.name: Dulklorrkelorrkeng
dulklorrkelorrkeng.description: Night-flying sorcerers who take flight on leathery wings, searching for the soul whose needs call to them. Once bonded, that person becomes their companion for all their nights. Many now serve as freelance wish-merchants or diplomats, regarded with both scorn and fear.

birthrights.name: Nightflyer
birthrights.effect: Spend 1 Glamour to change between humanoid form and enormous flying fox. In flying fox form, can soar and glide long distances. Take no falling damage in either form (half damage from falls while human, rounded down).

birthrights.name: Night's Children
birthrights.effect: Suffer no impairment from darkness; can see normally with at least some light. Still affected by total blindness and supernatural darkness. Cannot botch Alertness or Kenning rolls.

birthrights.name: Wishgranter
birthrights.effect: Once per session, use Arts without Glamour cost to answer one wish for their companion. Must be genuine desire, not prompted. Can only use Musing, Ravaging, and other Glamour-gathering methods regarding their companion. Only one companion at a time; breaking bond triggers Banality.

frailties.name: Bound By Purpose
frailties.effect: Require a companion/bondmate as protectorate to be complete. May temporarily bond with a group or cause as stopgap. Without any bond, fade into forgetfulness of true nature until infused with Glamour again. All Banality gained is doubled while without companion; bonding to group helps but still gain +1 additional Banality any time Banality is gained.

frailties.name: Dayblind
frailties.effect: +2 difficulty penalty on all vision-related rolls in daylight or intense artificial light. Penalty reduced to +1 with heavy dark glasses.

dulklorrkelorrkeng.appearance: Tall, lean, and sleek as a blade. Long faces and patagial wings of flying foxes. Few display physical gender indicators in natural form. Shapeshifting skills allow appearing as male, female, or combination when interacting with others—often take shape pleasing to observer.
dulklorrkelorrkeng.revelry: Granting wishes for their companion, serving as diplomats.
dulklorrkelorrkeng.unleashing: Not specified; presume night-focused manifestations of darkness and flight.

mimis.name: Mimis
mimis.description: Among the most fae-like of Australia's Spirit Beings. Gregarious and mischievous caretakers of country, emerging at night to arrange and rearrange features like rocks and scrub. Some stories say they had human forms before the first people, and taught the first humans to hunt, paint, and prepare kangaroo meat.

birthrights.name: Muse of the Land
birthrights.effect: Instinctively know how to arrange environments to maximize Glamour flows. May freely make Musing rolls to regain Glamour when engaged in landscaping, natural conservation, or area cleanup. Gain 1 additional Glamour from successful Musing in such circumstances.

birthrights.name: Happy Spirit
birthrights.effect: Friendly and cheerful by nature. Receive social bonuses when interacting positively with others (specific mechanical bonus not detailed in source).

frailties.name: Fragile Body
frailties.effect: Slender build enables slipping into impossibly narrow cracks for shelter, but at cost of sturdiness. Convert one level of bashing damage to lethal any time receiving more than one level of bashing damage. Healing times for lethal and aggravated damage increased by half. Bashing healing times unaffected.

mimis.appearance: Very thin and tall with elongated bodies that look frail and easily broken, like they might blow away in stiff wind. Despite fragility, energetic and active with extroverted natures.
mimis.revelry: Landscaping, natural conservation, area cleanup, rearranging natural features at night.

rainmakers.name: Rainmakers
rainmakers.description: First Spirit Beings seen after the Wars of the Songlines. They firmly decline being called Rainbow Serpents but say they are of the Serpent's skin. Found all across Australia along ancient dreaming tracks, protecting ancient Glades and songlines. Hold Law dearer than anything else—older than the Escheat, a powerful force for fae morality.

birthrights.name: Serpent's Shape
birthrights.effect: Spend 1 Glamour to reflexively shift between human form and indigenous snake, gaining that species' qualities. Large pythons become amphibious with powerful crushing attack. Taipans gain speed, camouflage, and deadly venomous bite. Sea snakes gain both amphibious traits and envenomed bite.

birthrights.name: Watercaller
birthrights.effect: Once per session, spend 1 Glamour to call water from sky or ground regardless of conditions. Water is always clean, cold, and sufficient for camp's needs. Can also use to punish transgressors of Law—curse with terrible unslaked thirst, reducing soak by 1 and imposing +1 difficulty on all rolls for the scene.

frailties.name: Bound to Law
frailties.effect: If rainmaker acts against what they are charged to uphold, lose all temporary Willpower and cannot regain by any means until properly atoned. May not use Watercaller Birthright during this time.

rainmakers.appearance: Not often overtly identifiable as Spirit Beings outside snake forms. Some don traditional garb; others prefer Western clothing. All have patterns and colors reminiscent of snakeskin sweeping up spines and spreading along backs and bellies.
rainmakers.revelry: Retracing dreaming tracks, keeping the Dreamtime alive, living amongst mortal kin.

yawkyawk.name: Yawkyawk
yawkyawk.description: Daughters of the Rainbow Serpent, protectors of waters and all that dwell within. Found anywhere water flows and pools—rivers, streams, hidden water holes, even purpose-built wells. Guard fishes, frogs, insects, plants, animals, people, and the water itself.

birthrights.name: Guardian Form
birthrights.effect: Spend 1 Glamour to assume form of crocodile (freshwater or saltwater), dragonfly, small lizard, or swordfish. Gain all physical abilities of that form and can use Arts (but cannot speak without other powers). Cannot botch Animal Ken or Survival rolls.

birthrights.name: Stormcaller
birthrights.effect: Once per session, spend 2 Glamour to call down storm lasting one scene. Inflicts yawkyawk's Glamour rating in bashing damage per turn to focus of wrath. Can target one individual per turn (may change each turn). Mortal armor only half effective (rounded down); supernatural protection works normally. Used to punish Law transgressors, Oathbreakers, or destroy ships/injure those who despoil water sources.

frailties.name: Captive's Command
frailties.effect: If taken by force from home waters—caught in net or deliberately trapped—compelled to serve captor with all powers at disposal. Regains freedom completely upon re-entering own country. Often find ways to trick captors into releasing them into their waters.

yawkyawk.appearance: On land walk on legs. In water shift to mermaid form: humanoid from waist up, piscine from waist down, hair like seaweed. Freshwater yawkyawks have brightly colored patterned tails with freshwater vegetation hair. Seagoing yawkyawks have sleek marlin/shark tails with green and golden kelp-hair. In any form: strange compelling beauty, skin shimmering with scales, large magnetic eyes, long webbed fingers tipped in claws.
yawkyawk.revelry: Protecting waters and aquatic life, guarding their territories.

glomes.name: Glomes
glomes.description: Stone and earth spirits—patient, enduring, and ancient as mountains.

birthrights.name: Stone Form
birthrights.effect: Can become living stone. +2 soak, immune to poison, disease. Cannot be moved unwillingly.

birthrights.name: Earth Sense
birthrights.effect: Can sense through stone and earth. Know what touches the ground within 100 yards.

frailty.name: Slowness
frailty.effect: Cannot take more than one action per turn. Always act last in initiative.

kuberas.name: Kuberas
kuberas.description: Forest spirits—guardians of growth and decay, life and death in plants.

birthrights.name: Plant Bond
birthrights.effect: Can command plants within 50 yards. Plants grow, move, entangle at will.

birthrights.name: Photosynthesis
birthrights.effect: Regain 1 Glamour per day in sunlight. Don't need to eat or drink.

frailty.name: Rooted
frailty.effect: Must remain near living plants. Lose 1 Glamour per day in barren/urban environments.

ondines.name: Ondines
ondines.description: Water spirits—fluid, changeable, and essential to life.

birthrights.name: Water Form
