birthrights.effect: Can become liquid water. Flow through any space, immune to physical attacks in water form.

birthrights.name: Water Breathing
birthrights.effect: Can breathe underwater indefinitely. Swim at double normal speed.

frailty.name: Desiccation
frailty.effect: Lose 1 health level per day away from significant water source.

parosemes.name: Parosemes
parosemes.description: Air spirits—swift, ephemeral, and impossible to contain.

birthrights.name: Wind Form
birthrights.effect: Can become intangible air. Pass through any non-airtight space. Immune to physical attacks.

birthrights.name: Flight
birthrights.effect: Can fly at running speed. Perfect maneuverability.

frailty.name: Flighty
frailty.effect: Cannot concentrate on any task for more than a scene. -2 to extended actions.

birthrights.name: Flame Form
birthrights.effect: Can become living fire. Immune to fire/heat. Touch inflicts fire damage.

birthrights.name: Light
birthrights.effect: Can glow at will, from dim to blinding. Never lost in darkness.

frailty.name: Consumption
frailty.effect: Must burn something each day or lose 1 Glamour. Water causes aggravated damage.

mannikins.name: Mannikins
mannikins.description: Spirits of artificial things—urban elementals born from human creation.

birthrights.name: Object Bond
birthrights.effect: Can inhabit and animate any artificial object. Control machines.

birthrights.name: Urban Sense
birthrights.effect: Can sense through buildings and machines. Know everything happening in a building they inhabit.

frailty.name: Unnatural
frailty.effect: Natural elements reject them. Take 1 damage per hour in purely natural environments.

anchor_rules.description: Inanimae must maintain connection to their element

types.husk: Material body made of their element

consequences.anchor_destroyed: Begin losing health levels, may be destroyed

petros.name: Petros
petros.description: Earth manipulation—shape stone, sense through ground

levels.3: Breathe water to others, water attacks

levels.4: Create infernos, heat immunity for others
levels.5: Become living flame, massive fire control

acheri.name: Acheri
acheri.description: Plague spirits and disease bringers from South Asian traditions. They spread illness and feed on suffering.

birthrights.name: Disease Touch
birthrights.effect: Touch can inflict illness (Stamina difficulty 8 to resist). Severity varies.

birthrights.name: Plague Sense
birthrights.effect: Can sense illness, weakness, and vulnerability in living beings.

frailty.name: Compulsion to Spread
frailty.effect: Must spread sickness. Willpower difficulty 8 to refrain when opportunity presents.

acheri.origin: Dreams of plague, fears of disease, epidemic nightmares

aonides.name: Aonides
aonides.description: The Muses—spirits of pure inspiration who grant artistic genius but fade without purpose.

birthrights.name: Inspire
birthrights.effect: Can grant +3 dice to any artistic or creative endeavor. Target feels divine inspiration.

birthrights.name: Artistic Mastery
birthrights.effect: All Performance and Crafts rolls at -2 difficulty when creating art.

frailty.name: Fading
frailty.effect: Lose 1 Glamour per week not spent inspiring others. At 0, begin to fade from existence.

aonides.origin: Pure creative inspiration, the urge to create beauty

fir_bholg.name: Fir-bholg
fir_bholg.description: Ancient giant warriors from Irish mythology. Primal fighters who embody honorable combat.

birthrights.name: Titanic Strength
birthrights.effect: +3 to Strength (may exceed 5). Can wield weapons sized for giants.

birthrights.name: Battle Fury
birthrights.effect: In combat, +2 dice to all attacks. Cannot be intimidated or frightened.

frailty.name: Giant Form
frailty.effect: Cannot shrink below 8 feet tall. Always obviously inhuman. -3 to Stealth.

fir_bholg.origin: Dreams of ancient warriors, battle legends, heroic epics

fuath.name: Fuath
fuath.description: Water horrors from Scottish and Irish waters. They drown the unwary and guard water places.

birthrights.name: Water Form
birthrights.effect: Can become living water. Immune to physical attacks in this form. Can flow through any space.

birthrights.name: Drowning Touch
birthrights.effect: Touch can fill lungs with water (Stamina vs Glamour to resist).

frailty.name: Hydrophilia
frailty.effect: Must remain within 100 yards of significant water or lose 1 Glamour per hour.

fuath.origin: Fear of drowning, water spirits, lake monsters

keremet.name: Keremet
keremet.description: Forest spirits from Eastern European traditions. Guardians of sacred groves who punish trespassers.

birthrights.name: Nature Bond
birthrights.effect: Can command plants within 100 yards. Plants grow, move, or attack at command.

birthrights.name: Forest Sight
birthrights.effect: Can see through any plant in their territory. Cannot be surprised in forests.

frailty.name: Rooted
frailty.effect: Tied to specific forest or grove. Leaving for more than a day causes 1 Glamour loss per day.

keremet.origin: Sacred groves, forest worship, nature spirits

moirae.name: Moirae
moirae.description: The Fates—weavers of destiny who see and sometimes shape the threads of life.

birthrights.name: Fate Sight
birthrights.effect: Can see the destiny threads of any creature. Know their past, present, and likely future.

birthrights.name: Weave Fate
birthrights.effect: Can subtly influence destiny. +3 dice to Soothsay. Predictions usually come true.

frailty.name: Bound by Fate
frailty.effect: Cannot act against their own predictions. Must let prophecies unfold.

moirae.origin: Concepts of fate and destiny, the inevitable

naraka.name: Naraka
naraka.description: Demon spirits and tempters from various traditions. They offer deals and collect on debts.

birthrights.name: Temptation
birthrights.effect: Can offer deals that are nearly impossible to refuse. +3 to Manipulation for bargains.

birthrights.name: Contract Sight
birthrights.effect: Can see any oath, promise, or debt owed. Know the terms and penalties.

frailty.name: Contract Bound
frailty.effect: Must honor all deals made. Breaking a contract causes 3 Glamour loss and 2 Banality.

naraka.origin: Fears of damnation, Faustian bargains, moral temptation

aria_system.description: Adhene shift between three mood states called Ariá

dioniae.name: Dioniae
dioniae.behavior: Act on impulse, seek pleasure, embrace chaos

apolliae.name: Apolliae
apolliae.behavior: Plan carefully, seek harmony, create beauty

araminae.name: Araminae
araminae.triggers: Loss, failure, witnessing tragedy, deep thought

armor.name: Armor
armor.effect: Natural armor provides +1 soak per level of Rede (max +3)

claws_fangs.name: Claws/Fangs
claws_fangs.notes: Can purchase multiple times for +1 damage each

flight.name: Flight
flight.effect: Can fly at running speed. Requires wings or magical means.

glamour_sense.name: Glamour Sense
glamour_sense.effect: Can detect Glamour and magical effects within 50 yards
glamour_sense.notes: Perception + Alertness to identify specific sources

hide.name: Hide
hide.effect: Can become invisible or perfectly camouflaged
hide.notes: Requires stillness or costs 1 Glamour to maintain while moving

increased_attribute.name: Increased Attribute
increased_attribute.effect: +2 to one Attribute (may exceed normal limits)
increased_attribute.notes: Can purchase multiple times for different Attributes

poison.name: Poison
poison.effect: Attacks inflict poison (Stamina roll difficulty 7 or lose 1 health/hour for 24 hours)
poison.notes: Stronger poisons available at ST discretion

regeneration.name: Regeneration
regeneration.notes: Does not work against cold iron damage

shapeshift.name: Shapeshift
shapeshift.effect: Can change form to one alternate shape

size_large.name: Size (Large)
size_large.effect: +1 health level, +1 Strength, but easier to hit (+1 difficulty to dodge)

size_small.name: Size (Small)
size_small.effect: -1 health level, +1 to dodge difficulties, can fit through small spaces

speech.name: Speech
speech.effect: Can speak any language its creator knows

swim.name: Swim
swim.effect: Can swim at full speed, breathe underwater

wyrd.name: Wyrd
wyrd.effect: Can affect the mundane world physically. Visible and tangible to mortals.
wyrd.notes: Rare and powerful. Most chimera lack this.

telepathy.name: Telepathy
telepathy.effect: Mental communication with bonded changeling at any distance

special_attack.name: Special Attack
special_attack.effect: One special attack form (fire breath, sonic scream, etc.)
special_attack.notes: Damage and range determined by ST

immunity.name: Immunity
immunity.effect: Immune to one damage type (fire, cold, electricity, etc.)
immunity.notes: Cannot be immune to cold iron

tracking.name: Tracking
tracking.effect: +3 dice to track by scent or other means

chicanery.name: Chicanery
chicanery.description: The Art of illusion, misdirection, and deception

1.name: Fuddle
1.effect: Confuse a target, making them forget what they were doing or saying

2.name: Veiled Eyes
2.effect: Become unnoticeable, blend into background

3.name: Fugue
3.effect: Alter or erase memories

4.name: Haunted Heart
4.effect: Create a compelling, persistent hallucination

5.name: Captive Heart
5.effect: Complete control over target's perceptions

legerdemain.name: Legerdemain
legerdemain.description: The Art of sleight of hand, theft, and object manipulation

1.name: Gimmix
1.effect: Cause minor mechanical/electronic malfunctions

2.name: Ensnare
2.effect: Make an object stick to target or surface

3.name: Effigy
3.effect: Create a perfect duplicate of an object

4.name: Mooch
4.effect: Teleport small objects to yourself

5.name: Phantom Shadows
5.effect: Create animated shadow-constructs that can perform tasks

primal.name: Primal
primal.description: The Art of nature, elements, and the wyld

1.name: Willow Whisper
1.effect: Communicate with plants, sense through nature

2.name: Eldritch Prime
2.effect: Create minor elemental effects (wind, sparks, etc.)

3.name: Oakenshield
3.effect: Gain armor from natural materials, resist damage

4.name: Heather Balm/Poisoned Ground
4.effect: Heal or harm through natural energy

5.name: Elder Form
5.effect: Transform into a nature elemental or control large natural areas

soothsay.name: Soothsay
soothsay.description: The Art of fate, prophecy, and fortune

1.name: Omen
1.effect: Read portents, sense immediate future

2.name: Fair Fortune/Ill Fortune
2.effect: Grant luck or bad luck to target

3.name: Tattletale
3.effect: Perceive lies, see through deception

4.name: Prophecy
4.effect: Receive a vision of the future

5.name: Fate's Harvest
5.effect: Major curse or blessing that shapes destiny

sovereign.name: Sovereign
sovereign.description: The Art of authority, command, and rulership

1.name: Protocol
1.effect: Know proper etiquette, sense social standing

2.name: Dictum
2.effect: Issue a command that must be obeyed for one action

3.name: Grandeur
3.effect: Inspire awe, fear, or devotion

4.name: Weaver Ward
4.effect: Create a zone where rules must be obeyed

5.name: Geas
5.effect: Bind target with a compulsion or prohibition

wayfare.name: Wayfare
wayfare.description: The Art of travel, movement, and speed

1.name: Hopscotch
1.effect: Enhanced jumping, safe landing from falls

2.name: Quicksilver
2.effect: Move at supernatural speed

3.name: Portal Passage
3.effect: Step through a doorway to emerge from another

4.name: Wind Runner
4.effect: Fly through the air

5.name: Flicker Flash
5.effect: Teleport to any location you can visualize

autumn.name: Autumn
autumn.notes: Associated with Unseelie Court, use with caution

1.name: Chill of the Mundane
1.effect: Sense Banality levels, detect Autumn People

2.name: Invoke the Autumn
2.effect: Temporarily increase target's Banality

3.name: Withering
3.effect: Drain Glamour from chimera or fae

4.name: Coldsnap
4.effect: Create zone of high Banality

5.name: Endless Winter
5.effect: Permanently increase Banality or destroy chimera

1.name: Wyrd
1.effect: Sense the flow of time, detect temporal anomalies

2.name: Backwards Glance
2.effect: View past events in a location

3.name: Dream Time
3.effect: Accelerate or slow time in a small area

4.name: Permanence
4.effect: Freeze something in time, make effects permanent

5.name: Reversal of Fortune
5.effect: Undo recent events, reset time briefly

metamorphosis.name: Metamorphosis
metamorphosis.description: The Art of shapeshifting and transformation

1.name: Hidden Form
1.effect: Minor cosmetic changes to appearance

2.name: Impersonate
2.effect: Take on appearance of another person

3.name: Go Ask Alice
3.effect: Change size dramatically (shrink or grow)

4.name: Chimeric Form
4.effect: Transform into chimerical creature

5.name: Mythic Form
5.effect: Become a legendary creature (dragon, etc.)

naming.name: Naming
naming.description: The Art of true names and identity

1.name: Seek Name
1.effect: Learn mundane name, sense identity

2.name: Know Name
2.effect: Learn true name, gain insight into nature

3.name: Reweave Identity
3.effect: Alter how others perceive target's identity

4.name: Saining
4.effect: Grant or reveal True Name, perform naming rituals

5.name: Umbra
5.effect: Erase identity, make someone forgotten

pyretics.name: Pyretics
pyretics.description: The Art of fire, heat, and passion

1.name: Will-o-the-Wisp
1.effect: Create small flames, sense heat sources

2.name: Willow Light
2.effect: Control existing flames, create light

3.name: Prometheus' Fist
3.effect: Hurl fire, create heat waves

4.name: Burn
4.effect: Set things ablaze, create infernos

5.name: Star Body
5.effect: Become living flame, immune to fire

infusion.name: Infusion
infusion.description: The Art of fantastical creation and chimerical manipulation. Favored by crafters like boggans and nockers, as well as House Dougal nobles. Originally a nocker secret, shared during the Interregnum. Opens options and shortcuts other crafters don't have.
infusion.notes: Several cantrips reference 'rightful ownership' - the Dreaming defaults to protecting existing items. Ownership is usually clear; if you need loopholes or convoluted arguments, you probably aren't the rightful owner.
infusion.unleashing: Air becomes charged, smelling of ozone and tasting of lightning. Glamour arcs between surfaces. Chimera spring to life, appliances gain sentience, smart technology gets smarter with distinct personalities. Even the fumble-fingered become capable of unsuspected engineering prowess.

1.name: Maker's Eye
1.effect: Accurately assess chimerical items, creatures, and Treasures at a glance with specific detail (unlike Kenning's general scope). Each success reveals one aspect: Attributes, Abilities, Glamour, Willpower, Health Levels, Redes for chimera; or item level, powers, how made, owner, recharge method, uses remaining, and curse status for objects. No effect on changelings including Lycians.

2.name: Make It Work
2.effect: Touch to repair or reshape chimerical items/Treasures. Successes equal to item level needed for cosmetic changes; 1 damage repaired per success (spend extra Glamour 1:1 for more). Can change living chimera's appearance at +1 difficulty; sentient chimera must consent. Cannot harm chimera or use on hostile creatures/without owner consent.

3.name: Energize!
3.effect: Store Glamour in objects (up to caster's Glamour rating). Lasts weeks equal to successes, then decays 1/week (1/month in freeholds/Dreaming). Password protection optional. Anyone with Kenning can sense charged items. Cannot use magical items or living creatures as batteries. Can transfer Glamour between willing volunteers (both touch caster), losing 1 point. Max batteries = permanent Glamour rating.

4.name: Reforge
4.effect: Fundamentally alter chimera and Treasures: size, shape, capabilities. Swap powers for equal or lesser ones. Requires successes = item level + 5 Glamour. Can break down enchanted items to create Glamour battery with item's level in points; can use to instantly create new item up to (original level - 1). For living chimera: re-spend 5 creation points per success. Sentient chimera must consent.

5.name: Apotheosis
5.effect: Create chimerical life. Requires Fae ••••• (Dweomer of Glamour). Construct/grow suitable body through extended crafting rolls. AUTOMATONS: Install battery, cast cantrip, spend 5 Glamour. 10 chimera points per success (max 50) for traits; no Intelligence. SENTIENT BEINGS: 10 Glamour, cantrip for points, then crafting roll difficulty 4 + desired Intelligence. Success = true sentience; failure = flawed automaton (5 pts/success); botch = twisted, hostile being. Max successful creations per story = permanent Glamour.

tale_craft.name: Tale-Craft
tale_craft.description: The power of storytelling itself. Once exclusive to eshu, now spreading to other garrulous fae (clurichauns, piskies, pooka, satyrs, Fiona, Leanhaun sidhe). Uses stories to actively transform the world.
tale_craft.notes: Nominally Seelie but used by both Courts. Bunks involve displays of talent and wordplay: telling stories, singing songs, reading poetry, writing tales, setting proper ambiance.
tale_craft.unleashing: Makes character center of attention; causes others to get lost in fantasy; compels sharing stories and gossip; inspires acting out roles from tales. Inspires and thrills but may leave targets wondering what is real.

1.name: Twice-Told Tales
1.effect: Learn rumors, folktales, gossip, legends, and 'unofficial truths' about a subject. Name general area of interest or let most famous stories surface first. Subsequent uses reveal increasingly obscure info. Stories must have been told in public venue; actual secrets won't surface. Different from Backward Glance (which shows what actually happened) - these are stories, potentially distorted. One story learned per success.

2.name: Work the Room
2.effect: Send magical pulses to infuse targets with chosen emotion or simple idea (expressible in couple words). Can inspire 'rebellion' but not specific actions. Cannot compel action or control reactions. Each success lowers difficulty of Performance/Expression rolls by 1 for the scene when reinforcing the emotion/idea. Scene Realm required for multiple targets.

3.name: Bated Breath
3.effect: Hold audience in place while speaking, keeping focus solely on you. Targets not paralyzed but utterly absorbed, missing all but most obvious events. Must speak without significant interruption. Dreaming prevents targets from coming to harm while affected. Can be used to approach for strike or set up ambush (targets surprised first turn). 1 minute per success (1 action turn in combat); extend by 1 interval per extra Glamour. Target affected once per scene.

4.name: Legend Tripping
4.effect: Infuse targets with power of narrative by assigning them roles in a story, boosting capabilities while they act the part. Must tell story and work out specific roles (like giving Quests and Bans). Traits boosted must fit the role (Lancelot boosts Melee, not Computer). Costs 1 Glamour + 1 Willpower. Each success improves one Attribute/Ability by 1 (even above 5). Lasts until end of scene or target acts outside role.

5.name: Stranger Than Fiction
5.effect: Tell a story so powerful it alters reality - creating lucky breaks, freak chances, fortuitous coincidences. Cannot undo established actions or contradict long-known facts; works by exploiting gaps in what's commonly known. Cannot conjure things in plain sight but can describe finding them elsewhere. Minor coincidences = 1 Banality; seriously unlikely = 2 Banality; outlandish but plausible = 3 Banality. Theorists believe this works by diverting Banality that normally prevents such events.

chimera.name: Chimera
chimera.description: Chimerical companions, items, or guardians bound to the changeling

levels.1: Minor chimera—small pet, simple item, or piece of voile
levels.2: Useful chimera—loyal companion, functional weapon or tool
levels.4: Powerful chimera—exceptional companion or major artifact
levels.5: Legendary chimera—near-sentient companion or legendary item

contacts.name: Contacts
contacts.description: Network of mortal information sources and connections

levels.1: One reliable contact in a specific area
levels.4: Extensive network, can find almost anyone

contacts.notes: Described in main document, no separate files needed

dreamers.name: Dreamers
dreamers.description: Mortals who produce Glamour that the changeling can harvest
dreamers.notes: Brief profiles in main document. Dreamers are artists, children, creative people

holdings.name: Holdings
holdings.description: Access to and ownership of freeholds

levels.2: Resident of a freehold with some influence
levels.5: Control multiple freeholds or a major holding

mentor.name: Mentor
mentor.description: A teacher and guide in changeling society

levels.4: Master in their field, regular contact

mentor.notes: Document as NPC for significant mentors

remembrance.name: Remembrance
remembrance.description: Memories from past lives and incarnations

levels.2: Clear memories of one past life
levels.3: Detailed recall of several past lives
levels.5: Perfect recall of all past lives

remembrance.notes: Narrative background, no separate documentation needed

title.name: Title
title.notes: Requires Noble House affiliation. Document household for PC nobles
title.requirements: Must be sidhe or ennobled commoner

beaumayn.name: House Beaumayn
beaumayn.description: Seers and prophets cursed with visions they cannot control. Known for tragic foresight.

boon.name: The Sight
boon.effect: Receive prophetic visions. +2 dice to Soothsay. May have uncontrolled premonitions.

flaw.name: Cassandra's Curse
flaw.effect: Visions come unbidden and are often ignored. Others distrust their prophecies.

beaumayn.history: Ancient house of seers, often tragic figures who see doom but cannot prevent it.

dougal.name: House Dougal
dougal.description: Practical builders, engineers, and crafters. Bridge traditional fae and modern world.

boon.name: Master Craftsman
boon.effect: -2 difficulty to all Crafts rolls. Natural affinity for building and repair.

flaw.name: The Stigma
flaw.effect: Each Dougal has a physical deformity (limp, withered hand, etc.) they hide.

dougal.history: Rose to prominence by embracing technology while other sidhe scorned it.

eiluned.name: House Eiluned
eiluned.description: Mystics, sorcerers, and keepers of arcane secrets. Masters of shadow and magic.

boon.name: Mystic Affinity
boon.effect: -1 difficulty to all cantrip rolls. Natural talent for magic.

flaw.name: Mistrusted
flaw.effect: +2 difficulty to Social rolls with those who know their reputation for secrets.

eiluned.history: Ancient house of magicians, rumored to consort with darker powers.

fiona.name: House Fiona
fiona.description: Passionate romantics, fierce warriors, and rebellious spirits who follow their hearts.

boon.name: Passion's Fire
boon.effect: +2 dice when acting on genuine passion (love, anger, art).

flaw.name: Reckless Heart
flaw.effect: Cannot resist romantic pursuit. Willpower difficulty 8 to act against passion.

fiona.history: Legendary lovers and warriors. Queen Mab of Apples is Fiona.

gwydion.name: House Gwydion
gwydion.description: Noble warriors and rightful rulers. Epitome of sidhe nobility and honor.

boon.name: Battle Presence
boon.effect: +2 dice to Leadership and command in battle. Aura of authority.

flaw.name: Gwydion's Rage
flaw.effect: Prone to fury when honor challenged. Willpower roll or fly into rage.

gwydion.history: Traditional rulers of the sidhe. High King David was Gwydion.

liam.name: House Liam
liam.description: Protectors of mortals and scholars of humanity. Considered disgraced by other houses.

boon.name: Human Connection
boon.effect: +2 dice to all Social rolls with mortals. Understand human nature deeply.

flaw.name: Stigma of Disgrace
flaw.effect: +2 difficulty to Social rolls with other nobles due to 'mortal-loving' reputation.

liam.history: Stripped of rank long ago for championing mortals. Slowly rebuilding honor.

scathach.name: House Scathach
scathach.description: Shadow warriors who stayed behind during the Shattering. Masters of combat and stealth.

boon.name: Shadow Warrior
boon.effect: -2 difficulty to Stealth and combat rolls. Trained killers.

flaw.name: Outsider Status
flaw.effect: Not fully trusted by Arcadian sidhe. +1 difficulty to Social with other nobles.

scathach.history: Chose to stay with commoners during Shattering. Respect earned through action.

ailil.name: House Ailil
ailil.description: Master manipulators and political schemers. Every interaction is a chess move.

boon.name: Political Acumen
boon.effect: +2 dice to Manipulation and Subterfuge. Natural politicians.

flaw.name: Paranoid Rivalry
flaw.effect: Trust no one, especially family. Always assume others scheme against you.

ailil.history: Ancient rivals of Gwydion. Masters of the political game.

balor.name: House Balor
balor.description: Marked by the legendary evil eye. Brutal, straightforward, and feared.

boon.name: The Evil Eye
boon.effect: Can inflict pain with a glance (Glamour vs. Willpower). +2 to Intimidation.

flaw.name: Balor's Mark
flaw.effect: Visible deformity (scarred eye, twisted limb). Cannot be hidden.

balor.history: Descendants of the Fomorian king Balor. Carry his curse and power.

daireann.name: House Daireann
daireann.description: Keepers of lost secrets and forbidden lore. Bound by ancient traditions.

boon.name: Ancient Memory
boon.effect: +2 dice to any roll involving ancient lore or secrets.

flaw.name: Tradition Bound
flaw.effect: Must follow ancient protocols. Cannot break with established patterns.

daireann.history: Preserved knowledge others thought lost. Bound by oaths to ancient powers.

commoner_ennoblement.description: Commoners may be ennobled and join a house through exceptional service, marriage, or political necessity.
commoner_ennoblement.process: Requires formal ceremony, house sponsorship, and usually the Title background.
commoner_ennoblement.notes: Ennobled commoners may face prejudice from born sidhe but can rise to prominence.

bumpkin.name: Bumpkin
bumpkin.description: Simple pleasures, earthy wisdom, honest living
bumpkin.ban: Cannot refuse hospitality or simple requests

courtier.name: Courtier
courtier.ban: Cannot break protocol or social rules

dandy.name: Dandy
dandy.quest: Be recognized for elegance or taste

orchid.name: Orchid
orchid.description: Rare beauty, delicate sensibility, refined taste
orchid.quest: Preserve or create something of rare beauty

paladin.name: Paladin
paladin.quest: Defend the helpless or uphold justice
paladin.ban: Cannot ignore injustice or abandon duty

panderer.name: Panderer
panderer.description: Bringing joy, entertainment, making others happy
panderer.ban: Cannot refuse to help someone have fun

regent.name: Regent
regent.quest: Make a decision that benefits your people
regent.ban: Cannot shirk responsibility or betray trust

sage.name: Sage
sage.ban: Cannot withhold knowledge from the worthy

squire.name: Squire
squire.quest: Serve faithfully and learn from mentor
squire.ban: Cannot disobey or abandon your liege

troubadour.name: Troubadour
troubadour.quest: Create art that moves someone deeply
troubadour.ban: Cannot let a performance go unfinished

wayfarer.name: Wayfarer
wayfarer.ban: Cannot refuse a journey or stay too long

beast.name: Beast
beast.quest: Follow instincts to survive or dominate

fatalist.name: Fatalist
fatalist.description: Acceptance of doom, dark wisdom, inevitability
fatalist.quest: Accept an unavoidable truth others deny

fool.name: Fool
fool.ban: Cannot be serious when gravity is expected

grotesque.name: Grotesque
grotesque.description: Ugliness, shock value, confronting the horrible
grotesque.quest: Make others face what they fear to see

knave.name: Knave
knave.description: Self-interest, cunning, looking out for number one
knave.quest: Profit from a situation at others' expense
knave.ban: Cannot put others' interests before your own

outlaw.name: Outlaw
outlaw.description: Rebellion, freedom from rules, defying authority
outlaw.quest: Defy an unjust authority or rule
outlaw.ban: Cannot obey rules you disagree with

pandora.name: Pandora
pandora.quest: Uncover a secret regardless of consequences

peacock.name: Peacock
peacock.ban: Cannot accept insult to your pride

rake.name: Rake
rake.description: Seduction, manipulation, using charm as weapon

riddler.name: Riddler
riddler.description: Puzzles, misdirection, never giving straight answers
riddler.quest: Test someone with riddles or mysteries
riddler.ban: Cannot give a direct, simple answer

ringleader.name: Ringleader
ringleader.quest: Bend others to your will through strength

schismatic.name: Schismatic
schismatic.quest: Sow doubt or division in a group
schismatic.ban: Cannot accept anything at face value

oath_of_clasped_hands.name: Oath of Clasped Hands
oath_of_clasped_hands.words: Blood for blood, bone for bone, life for life, until none walk the earth save we alone. I place my life into your hands, my blood in your veins, my bones as your bones. Hold me well, as I hold you, and I will lend you my strength. Break your bond, and may we both perish. I swear to you friendship by this oath of clasped hands and shared hearts.
oath_of_clasped_hands.benefit: Can sense partner's location and emotions. -2 difficulty to resist mental domination when protecting partner.
oath_of_clasped_hands.penalty: Both parties may perish if broken. Lose 3 permanent Willpower.
oath_of_clasped_hands.witnesses: Required: at least one other changeling

oath_of_fealty.name: Oath of Fealty
oath_of_fealty.words: I swear fealty to you, [Lord/Lady name]. Your command is my desire, and your request my fulfillment. May my service always please, and may my sight grow dark if it does not. As the tides to the moon, my will to yours, my lord/lady.
oath_of_fealty.benefit: -2 difficulty to resist mental domination. Protected by lord's resources and name.
oath_of_fealty.penalty: Lose 3 Willpower. May be struck blind for a year and a day.
oath_of_fealty.witnesses: Required: the court of the lord
oath_of_fealty.duration: Until released by lord or broken

oath_of_the_accepted_burden.name: Oath of the Accepted Burden
oath_of_the_accepted_burden.purpose: Promise to complete a specific task
oath_of_the_accepted_burden.words: I take upon myself this burden, [describe task]. I shall [specific action] or face the consequences of my failure. By Glamour and Willpower, I bind myself to this task.
oath_of_the_accepted_burden.benefit: +1 Willpower while actively pursuing the task
oath_of_the_accepted_burden.penalty: Lose invested Willpower. Gain 1 Banality point.

oath_of_the_long_road.name: Oath of the Long Road
oath_of_the_long_road.words: I take this quest upon my shoulders. I shall not rest until [goal] is achieved. On my honor, on my Glamour, on my very soul, I shall see this through to the end. Let all who hear bear witness.
oath_of_the_long_road.benefit: +1 Willpower, +1 Glamour while on the quest
oath_of_the_long_road.penalty: Lose all temporary Glamour. Lose 1 permanent Willpower. Gain 2 Banality.
oath_of_the_long_road.witnesses: Required: multiple witnesses strengthen the oath

oath_of_truehearts.name: Oath of Truehearts
oath_of_truehearts.words: I give my heart to you, [name], to hold and protect for all our days. Where you go, I shall follow. What you need, I shall provide. My love is yours, as yours is mine, until death and beyond.
oath_of_truehearts.benefit: Can sense partner at any distance. Can share Glamour. +1 die when aiding partner.
oath_of_truehearts.penalty: Heartbreak—cannot feel love for a year and a day. Gain 1 Banality.

oath_of_fosterage.name: Oath of Fosterage
oath_of_fosterage.words: I take you, [name], as my ward. I shall teach you the ways of our people, protect you from the cold of Banality, and guide you until you stand on your own. By my Glamour, I swear this bond.
oath_of_fosterage.benefit: Mentor: +1 die teaching fledgling. Fledgling: Can call on mentor's aid.
oath_of_fosterage.penalty: Mentor abandoning: Gain 1 Banality. Fledgling betraying: Lose all temporary Glamour.
oath_of_fosterage.duration: Until fledgling comes of age or is released

oath_of_guardianship.name: Oath of Guardianship
oath_of_guardianship.purpose: Protect a person, place, or thing
oath_of_guardianship.words: I take upon myself the duty of guardian to [subject]. No harm shall come to them while I draw breath. By my sword, my Glamour, and my honor, I swear this.
oath_of_guardianship.benefit: +2 dice to all rolls defending the protected subject
oath_of_guardianship.penalty: If protected subject harmed through negligence: Lose 2 Willpower, gain 1 Banality
oath_of_guardianship.duration: Until released or subject no longer needs protection

oath_of_silence.name: Oath of Silence
oath_of_silence.words: I swear to keep this secret: [subject]. No force shall pry it from my lips, no torture shall loose my tongue. Should I speak of it to any unauthorized soul, let my voice be taken from me.
oath_of_silence.benefit: +2 dice to resist revealing the secret
oath_of_silence.penalty: Lose voice for a month per violation. Permanent loss for complete betrayal.

escheat.name: The Escheat
escheat.description: The seven great laws of the Kithain

right_of_demesne.name: The Right of Demesne
right_of_demesne.rule: A lord is the ruler of their domain. All disputes must go through proper channels.
right_of_demesne.violation: Judged by the lord whose domain was violated

right_to_dream.name: The Right to Dream
right_to_dream.rule: Never destroy a source of Glamour. Dreamers must be protected.

right_of_ignorance.name: The Right of Ignorance
right_of_ignorance.rule: The Mists must be protected. Never reveal fae nature to mortals.
right_of_ignorance.violation: Must fix the breach or face punishment

right_of_rescue.name: The Right of Rescue
right_of_rescue.rule: All fae must be protected from Banality. Never abandon one of your own.

right_of_safe_haven.name: The Right of Safe Haven
right_of_safe_haven.rule: Freeholds are sanctuaries. Violence within is forbidden.
right_of_safe_haven.violation: Banishment from the freehold, possibly all freeholds

right_of_life.name: The Right of Life
right_of_life.rule: No fae shall kill another fae.

right_of_confrontation.name: The Right of Confrontation
right_of_confrontation.rule: The accused must be allowed to face their accuser and defend themselves.
right_of_confrontation.violation: Invalid judgment, accuser may be punished

Mirrorlands.overview: Tangled and tragic history; cultures and worldviews come together in complicated ways
key_features: Shadows treated as partners, not antagonists

factions.Rada: Cool; patient; diplomatic; Common Arts only
factions.Petro: Hot; fiery; warlike; pledged to Les Mysteres; Common + Initiate Arts

notable_locations.Island Below the Sea: Les Mysteres' domain; source of Relics/Artifacts

notable_spectres.Queen Anacaona: The Burning Queen; rules realm in Labyrinth; leads raids wreathed in barrowflame

Dark Kingdom of Ivory.overview: African Underworld through African wraiths' stories; difficult for European/American ghosts to perceive
key_features: Creation stories and their modern legacy

Dark Kingdoms of the Americas.overview: Pre-European empires of the Restless Dead; plague and genocide caused unparalleled horrors but didn't destroy everything

Dark Kingdom of Flint.status: Hidden Islands of Flint in Tempest; Byways known only to them
Dark Kingdom of Flint.notable_location: Seattle area—controlled by Islands of Flint under Chief Seattle
Dark Kingdom of Flint.special: Argos +1 difficulty in Puget Sound; Relics cannot be altered with Flux

Dark Kingdoms of the Americas.first_nations: People of First Nations live on; some enter afterlife with unfinished business

key_features: Layers of Shadowlands neither Swar nor Stygia suspect
Ways for European/American wraiths to interact

notable_locations.Night Markets: Southeast Asian settlement; commerce-focused; led by 'The Host-Chef' Persaud
notable_locations.Monsoon Markets: Traveling markets led by Ashura; gravitate toward Storm that Dreams

factions.Naga: Powerful entities; use Cult of Salt for their purposes

notable_storms.Storm that Dreams: Glass-bodied depths; appears over Sea of Shiva

Seattle.history: Formally established 1853; land controlled by Duwamish and Suquamish for 4000 years
Seattle.special_feature: Islands of Flint control—when Chief Seattle ceded lands (1855), native dead vanished to Islands of Flint in Tempest
Seattle.argos_restriction: +1 difficulty; failure sends to Seattle Underground or Portland

key_organizations.Speakers to the Islands (Doc's Own): Diplomatic corps led by Doc Henry Maynard; keep peace with Islands of Flint
key_organizations.Cormorant Order: Air travel; relic helicopter; outposts in Seattle and Spokane
key_organizations.Alchemists Guild: Aerospace engineer ghosts from Boeing; seek Flint relic secrets

notable_locations.Ji-Ji-La-Etch (Pioneer Square): Little Crossing Place to Islands of Flint
notable_locations.Seattle Underground: Connects to other city Undergrounds (Portland, New Orleans, Chicago)
notable_locations.Mount Rainier: Manifests only to erupt; rains Labyrinth material; regional Maelstroms

special_rules: Slavery illegal within Puget Sound (Islands demanded)
No smaller Necropoli allowed in Puget Sound area

Halifax Nova Scotia.special_feature: Mont-Blanc is frozen Nihil—crew trapped forever trying to extinguish pre-explosion fire
Halifax Nova Scotia.spectre_activity: Spectres use Nihil to hide from Iron Legion and Legion of Fate

Zone Rouge (France).key_event: WWI Western Front; prelude to Fourth Great Maelstrom
Zone Rouge (France).status: 1200+ km uninhabitable; many Nihils; easy Labyrinth access
Zone Rouge (France).special_feature: Ghost towns with no physical remains—entire communities in ruins mark graves
Zone Rouge (France).activity: Iron Harvest—forge Spectres into Stygian steel weapons
Zone Rouge (France).example_town: Beaumont-en-Verdunois—armed fort waging endless war against Spectres

Chosen.origin: Former Relics and Fetters that gained sentience after their wraith fell to Oblivion
Chosen.drive: Reflects departed wraith's final feelings; single-minded mission to spread specific misery
Chosen.personality: Simple, direct; easy allies on single topic; disinterested in politics unless clearly aligned

relationships.Doppelgangers: Preferred by Doppelgangers for simple drive and lack of ulterior motives
relationships.Other castes: Little use for them; may find surrogate similar to former master

Chosen.appearance: Anything that could have been Relic or Fetter; usually looks like original inanimate object; some have anthropomorphized forms with mobility

arcanoi.restrictions: Cannot learn any other standard Arcanoi; cannot learn Tempestos

Chosen.special: Attributes can grow as Chosen learns to live beyond grief for departed master

Indwelling.origin: In life, people of patience and introverted purpose; Oblivion shaped their form to use patience against wraiths
Indwelling.drive: Trap and attack unwary wraiths from within objects
Indwelling.behavior: Flip between passive resting state and active havoc; long absences from Labyrinth make them excellent Doppelganger collaborators

relationships.Striplings: Have learned not to play with Indwelling unless wishing to be devoured
relationships.Dark Spirits: Unusually productive relationship; recommend Indwelling to Doppelgangers

appearance.resting: Appear as normal objects—record players, daggers, toys, books, pens, guns
appearance.active: Transform: daggers open carved eyes, instruments play, etc.
appearance.poles: Either cherished mundane objects (pen, doll) or attractive items (antique record player, weapon, ritual implement)

arcanoi.dark_arcanoi: Full access to all Dark Arcanoi
arcanoi.standard_arcanoi: Limited—must be feasible for item type (e.g., record player can take Keening but not Fatalism)

leeching.from_relics_artifacts: 1 Corpus per scene with physical contact; continues each scene item remains present
leeching.from_wraiths: Physical contact required; wraith rolls Willpower difficulty 6 to avoid losing 1 Pathos or Willpower (Indwelling's choice)
leeching.overflow: Continues draining even at maximum rating (no benefit)

Dark Spirits.origin: Unknown—widely assumed to be former Doppelgangers transformed somewhere in Labyrinth
Dark Spirits.role: Oracular Spectres practicing Blighted Insight; flit in and out of Spectral cities trading rumors and connecting Spectres
Dark Spirits.personality: Never let denigrating comments go; terrible things happen to the unkind and impolite

relationships.general: Isolated in Spectral society due to appearance and unique Dark Arcanos
relationships.Lamachis: None found among Lamachis followers (reason unknown)

Dark Spirits.appearance: Visages of nightmares—flying skull-faced spirits from paintings, penny dreadfuls, horror movies, internet legends. If once angel, manifests only as most terrifying form. Without doubt still something to fear.
Dark Spirits.restriction: Cannot casually walk among Restless like Doppelgangers; cannot use Moliate to disguise true nature

Chosen.restriction: No standard Arcanoi except Inhabit; no Tempestos

Indwelling.attributes: Standard Spectre allocation by equivalent power level
Indwelling.arcanoi: All Dark Arcanoi + limited standard Arcanoi (item-appropriate)

Dark Spirits.attributes: Standard Spectre allocation by equivalent power level
Dark Spirits.arcanoi: Blighted Insight • + 7 free dots (all Arcanoi/Dark Arcanoi)

Stripling.description: Newly fallen Spectres, confused and weak
characteristics: May retain some memories of former existence

Doppelganger.description: Infiltrator Spectres who mimic other wraiths

factions.description: Some Doppelgangers organize into philosophical factions

Mortwight.special_abilities: May have one basic Shadecraft art

Nephwrack.political_role: Often serve as lieutenants to Malfeans

Malfean.creation: Not statted - use as plot devices

Neverborn.description: Primordial entities dwelling in the Labyrinth
Neverborn.creation: Never statted - they are forces of nature
Neverborn.note: Encountering a Neverborn should be campaign-defining

crucibles.description: Orpheus trains projectors in tight-knit groups called crucibles, more closely bonded than most wraith Circles.

requirements: Sufficient comfort to share spiritual energies

ritual.failure: Hesitation can cause formation to fail

formation.size: No upper limit, but typically 3-5. Larger groups increasingly difficult to find compatible individuals.

pathos_sharing.description: Members may share Pathos by touch
pathos_sharing.effect: Leaves donor emotionally drained, recipient enlivened

yoking.description: Link with another to magnify Arcanoi powers
yoking.training: Orpheus trains crucibles for weeks to master yoking

Banshee.description: Natural team players who make everything easier
Banshee.effect: Lower the difficulty of an Arcanos art by 2

Haunter.description: Efficient souls who maximize power efficacy
Haunter.effect: Double the duration of another Arcanos

Marrow.description: Master of adaptation, useful to entire crucible
Marrow.effect: Act as nexus for multiple Benefits—allow two other crucible members to yoke to them while passing both Benefits to a third beneficiary

Poltergeist.effect: +3 damage dice to the next Arcanos-powered attack
Poltergeist.duration: One scene or until successful hit

Phantasm.description: Subtle power renders yoked power difficult to resist
Phantasm.effect: +2 to difficulty of roll to resist the Arcanos, or +1 success if no resistance roll

Skinrider.description: Knows principles of flesh apply to Corpus
Skinrider.effect: Lend 2 dice to a Physical Attribute roll for an Arcanos' effect

Wisp.description: Calm yet mercurial, offers aid indirectly
Wisp.effect: Beneficiary may reroll any two failed dice on Arcanos roll (except 1s)

crucible_dynamics.compatibility: Based on psychological profiles and willingness to work together
crucible_dynamics.intimacy: Formation requires trust normally reserved for close friendships
crucible_dynamics.loyalty: Crucibles find reasons to stick together once in the field
crucible_dynamics.training: Weeks of intense time together to properly master yoking

orpheus_crucible_use.mission_teams: Standard deployment unit for Orpheus operations
orpheus_crucible_use.research: Project Echo uses crucibles for Underworld exploration
orpheus_crucible_use.redundancy: If one member is in danger, others can assist via yoking
orpheus_crucible_use.communication: Crucible bonds help coordinate in hostile territory

orpheus_group.description: A Silicon Valley-esque startup company with technology to pierce the Shroud and engage with the dead on their own terms.
orpheus_group.public_face: Cryogenics company that advertises via coded websites, word-of-mouth, and personalized catalogues for important officials.

services.investigation: Send projectors to investigate suspected hauntings
services.contact: Put clients in touch with departed loved ones
services.removal: Rid lives of relatives who can't let go
services.espionage: Private investigators who will never be seen, can't be stopped by doors/walls/locks
services.wetwork: Make enemies disappear, die of heart attacks, or perish in 'accidents'

orpheus_group.nda_restriction: NSA mandate prevents making findings public. Breach provokes government interference/shutdown.
orpheus_group.exposure: Limited—select tabloids, whispered by corporate/wealthy clients, discussed among paranormal researchers 'in the know'.

project_echo.description: Orpheus's primary mission—exploration of the Underworld and development of technology to bridge life and death.

recruitment.apps: Fund horoscope and ghost hunting apps that ask if users have been close to death
recruitment.qualifications: 3-4 near-death experiences, often police officers/ice road truckers/terminally ill
recruitment.salary: Just below six figures, more for hazardous ops

intelligence_gathering.primary_mission: Perform paying jobs while staying away from deepest Underworld
intelligence_gathering.restrictions: Strict mandate to not pursue deeper research. Necropoli are unknowable edifices—approaching causes swift disappearance.

services: Restore contact with deceased loved ones
salvation.limitations: True Transcendence too expensive/uncertain to demonstrate

removal_fumigation.description: When wraiths refuse to cooperate or clients specifically request
removal_fumigation.examples: Killed beloved pets, melted priceless jewelry, light arson

retrieval.description: Acquire objects, Artifacts, or relics on either side of Shroud
retrieval.storehouse: Empty warehouse in Skinlands, small but varied treasure trove of ghostly items

espionage.retainers: Growing stable income from companies paying to NOT be spied upon

wetwork.disposal: Disposing of resulting wraiths part of service
wetwork.side_effect: Some agents become vigilantes—punishing drug dealers, mobsters, crooked politicians

history.origins: JDG Cryogenics, mid-1990s Caltech startup. Bob Jackson and Anne Del Greco.
history.breakthrough: Dr. Eduardo Fernandez's protein-rich suspension fluid prevented ice damage. First client revived post-millennium.
history.discovery: Jane Kennedy—terminally ill client with Eastern esoterica background—wandered Shadowlands during suspension.
history.transformation: Kennedy's funding and insider knowledge led to Orpheus Group rebrand.

project_flatline.result: All escaped as wraiths, led by Uriah Bishop

history.drug_discovery: Dr. Amours Katlilian discovered Kakos stromithicarum in Bosawás Biosphere Reserve—addictive but facilitates projection.
history.nsa_projectors: First batch given to NSA for espionage. All killed by Spectres.
history.current_state: Two years since leaks reached message boards. Growing belief in ghosts among youth.

personnel.brass: Polished technocrat executives seeking profit from afterlife access
personnel.researchers: Mix of fringe scientists and college graduates seeking good pay
personnel.field_agents: All walks of life—only qualification is NDEs
personnel.wraith_employees: Some Enfants and wraiths with different agendas. Violates Dictum Mortuum.

Terrel_and_Squib.description: Biotech firm with superior pharmaceutical knowledge
Terrel_and_Squib.status: Years behind Orpheus. Can only duplicate skimming.
Terrel_and_Squib.secret: Dr. Lionel Squib possessed by Spectre, created pigment formula

NextWave.description: Private security company using old Soviet psychic programs

spectres.Zyras_cult: Opposed Orpheus, destroyed first NSA projectors
spectres.Doppelgangers: Easy prey for Spectre infiltrators—projectors have no Shadows

Destiny.description: Orpheus projectors often seem touched by fate, gravitating toward some heroic sacrifice or grand tragedy.
Destiny.effect: Reroll dice (one per dot, per session). Must take second result. Cannot reroll same dice twice.
Destiny.visibility: At 3+, markings of Fate shine on gauze. At 5, projections are portents that thunder through the Shadowlands.

ratings.3: 3 rerolls per session. Visible to Fatalism users. Draws interest from Isle of Eurydice.
ratings.5: 5 rerolls per session. Major portent. Labyrinth buzzes in anticipation. Lady of Fate's agents may aid or obstruct.

Destiny.notes: Wraiths may take this if destiny involved their death.

Gauze Relic.description: Harness volatile Corpus energy to manifest an item's ghost. The relic must be chosen at purchase and cannot change.
Gauze Relic.effect: Spend 1 Pathos to congeal a personal relic for the scene. Form varies (biker jacket → chainmail, etc.).
Gauze Relic.visibility: Highly disturbing to wraiths who cannot do this.

ratings.2: More powerful (handgun, no ammo). +1 to Ability roll related to item.
ratings.3: Electronic functions possible with Pathos investment (Wi-Fi across Shroud). Larger objects (bastard sword, assault rifle). -2 difficulty to one Ability roll.
ratings.4: Artifact-level complexity. Intricate mechanical/electrical operations (motorcycle without fuel).
ratings.5: Powerful talisman. +4 to Ability roll, or +1 to Attribute roll.

Gauze Relic.destruction: If gauze relic is destroyed: lose 1 Willpower and take 1 Aggravated damage.
Gauze Relic.death: If projector dies, dots are refunded as experience.

Reincarnate.description: Temporary death revealed deceased elements of past souls within your own. Dormant flashes of past lives rise when needed.
Reincarnate.effect: Free dice pool equal to rating per session. Supplement existing rolls or roll Abilities you don't possess.
Reincarnate.optional_rule: Storyteller may instead assign each dot to one predetermined Ability (1 die each).

ratings.1: Déjà vu allows drawing on past life skill
ratings.3: Remember names of past friends, occasionally pertinent
ratings.4: Extended flashbacks, often relevant to current situation
ratings.5: Remember past lives like an adult remembers kindergarten

standard_backgrounds_notes.Allies: Works normally. May include Orpheus colleagues or wraiths.
standard_backgrounds_notes.Artifact: Available but rare. Orpheus does have a relic storehouse.
standard_backgrounds_notes.Contacts: Works normally. Includes both living and dead contacts.
standard_backgrounds_notes.Mentor: Works normally. May be senior Orpheus projector or friendly wraith.
standard_backgrounds_notes.Notoriety: Limited utility. Reputation among the dead is risky.
standard_backgrounds_notes.Status: Within Orpheus organization or (rarely) wraith society.

tethers.description: Function identically to Fetters with key exceptions.

differences.silver_cord: Strongest Tether (5 dots) is visible to Lifeweb as shiny silver cord connecting to body.
differences.no_harrowing: Destruction does not drop projector into Harrowing (but body death makes them true wraith).
differences.ongoing: Tethers represent ongoing connections—cannot be neglected or resolved.
differences.repair: Tethers repair themselves if projector reintegrates with body.

tethers.sever_strand: Lifeweb can sever Tethers/silver cord, but damage repairs upon reintegration.

Adder's Scales.description: Snake scales cover the character's skin, making them supple and protected.
Adder's Scales.psychological_root: Fear of being pinned down or constrained
Adder's Scales.advantage: Difficulties to escape bonds or athletic maneuvers decrease by 1. Scales grant +1 soak die.
Adder's Scales.disadvantage: Must succeed Willpower roll (difficulty 6) when surprised or lash out physically/verbally.

Armor of Corpulence.description: The character grows grotesquely huge, barely able to move but highly resistant to harm.
Armor of Corpulence.psychological_root: Desire for protection through mass and presence
Armor of Corpulence.advantage: Immune to bashing damage. Takes only 1/4 damage from lethal weapon attacks. Environmental sources (fire, electricity) still inflict normal damage.
Armor of Corpulence.disadvantage: +2 difficulty to all movement-based actions. Maximum movement is 3 yards per turn.

Barbed Corpus.description: Barbs cover the character's hide, keeping others at painful distance.
Barbed Corpus.psychological_root: Feeling isolated, putting up barriers against others
Barbed Corpus.advantage: +1 soak die. Inflicts 1 lethal damage to unarmed attackers. Can grapple/punch to inflict lethal damage.
Barbed Corpus.disadvantage: Each scene, Willpower roll (difficulty 6) or accidentally brush against object/ally, inflicting 1 soakable lethal damage.

Brutish.description: The character grows into a hulking version of themselves—three feet taller and 100 pounds heavier.
Brutish.psychological_root: Desire for physical dominance and power
Brutish.advantage: +1 soak die. +3 dice to Strength rolls.
Brutish.disadvantage: Initiative reduced by 5. Movement halved. -1 die from all Intelligence and Appearance pools.

Chameleon Skin.description: The character's Corpus shifts color to blend into surroundings.
Chameleon Skin.advantage: +3 bonus dice on all Stealth rolls.
Chameleon Skin.disadvantage: No control over shifting. +1 Social difficulty when manifested (body language unclear).

Compound Eye.description: Eyes become huge, scintillating red domes like a fly's, with hundreds of hexagonal lenses.
Compound Eye.psychological_root: Paranoid need to see everything around them
Compound Eye.disadvantage: Loses distance vision. +2 difficulty to ranged combat or spotting distant objects.

Corpus Cilia.description: Small, gentle quills cover the wraith's arms, measuring air flow and displacement.
Corpus Cilia.psychological_root: Need for heightened awareness and sensitivity
Corpus Cilia.advantage: Perception difficulties reduced by 1. Vision impairments (injury, fog) completely nullified within 30 feet.
Corpus Cilia.disadvantage: +1 difficulty on all Wits-based rolls. -4 to all rolls in Maelstroms rated one bell or above.

Dark Speech.description: Tongue transforms into a dagger, flame, or acidic spittle that extends up to seven feet.
Dark Speech.psychological_root: Views themselves as caustic or bitingly witty
Dark Speech.advantage: Ranged Brawling attack inflicting Strength + 2 lethal damage.
Dark Speech.disadvantage: Must succeed Willpower roll (difficulty 7) to speak properly. Failure means insulting and threatening speech for the scene.

Gossamer Webs.description: Corpus grows layered and sticky, allowing the character to trap opponents.
Gossamer Webs.psychological_root: Difficulty letting things go; every challenge tears at the soul
Gossamer Webs.advantage: On successful Brawl attack, leave sticky Corpus to trap, blind, or pin. Each Corpus level creates 2 dots Strength binding. 4+ successes lets you choose target (eyes, legs, arms).
Gossamer Webs.disadvantage: Automatically lose Corpus when entrapping opponents or passing through Skinlands objects.

Hammer Fists.description: Hands grow massive with chitinous protrusions, delivering devastating punches.
Hammer Fists.psychological_root: Tendency to ruin all they touch
Hammer Fists.advantage: Unarmed attacks deal Strength + 3 bashing damage.
Hammer Fists.disadvantage: +3 difficulty on all tasks requiring manual dexterity.

Spider's Bristles.description: Hairy bristles erupt from every pore of the extremities.
Spider's Bristles.psychological_root: Capability for surprisingly vile things under pressure
Spider's Bristles.advantage: Climb walls and sheer surfaces like a spider (except soulsteel or slick Labyrinth surfaces).
Spider's Bristles.disadvantage: +1 difficulty on tasks involving light touch. Willpower roll (difficulty 7) to disentangle from objects accidentally glommed onto.

Spite-fueled Arcanoi.description: Corpus glows with a sickly orange-purple light, powered by negative emotion.
Spite-fueled Arcanoi.psychological_root: Using spite and darkness as fuel for accomplishment
Spite-fueled Arcanoi.disadvantage: Arcanoi gain dark side effects. Keening cannot incite positive emotions. Puppetry causes 1 health level damage per minute to the possessed. Effects ultimately up to Storyteller.

stain_rules.gaining_stains: 1 Stain per 2 dots of permanent Angst
stain_rules.manifesting_duration: Number of turns equal to permanent Angst
stain_rules.uncontrolled_manifestation: When temporary Angst exceeds permanent Willpower, all Stains manifest uncontrollably
stain_rules.permanent_stains: At permanent Angst 6+, one Stain becomes permanent. Each additional Angst dot above 6 adds another permanent Stain.
stain_rules.suppression: Spend 1 Willpower to suppress Stains for the scene (manifest immediately after)
stain_rules.willpower_9_exception: At Willpower 9+, Stains stay suppressed until Angst overwhelms completely

hues.description: Wraiths who tried pigment in life—faded, translucent ghosts appearing drained of color.
hues.appearance: Washed-out colors, ghostly even to ghosts. Monochromatic demeanor.
hues.origin: Every hue tried pigment in life, even just once. Many were addicts, most lost their lives to the drug.
hues.phantom_craving: Some say scratchy, syrupy craving still crawls over Corpus—only satisfied by Skinriding someone high on pigment.
hues.legion_assignment: Usually Reaped by Emerald, Grim, or Skeletal Legions (deathmarks tend toward ravages of drug abuse regardless of actual death).
differences_from_wraith: Can manifest Stains like projectors (all for 1 Pathos)
Dampened Pathos—little time before succumbing to Spectrehood or Oblivion
hues.purification: If hue purges pigment taint and becomes full wraith, Quiescent converts to another Archetype with appropriate Dark Passions. Background and Fetter differences immediately granted.

quiescent_shadow.description: Nearly ubiquitous in hues, unknown in other wraiths. The greatest trick this Shadow pulls is convincing you it doesn't exist.
behavior: Psyche may believe they're 'merely' dialoguing with themselves
Catharsis viewed as hue 'losing himself' for a bit
Shadow Dice offered during emotional duress or anger
quiescent_shadow.dark_passions: Mirror regular Passions—whenever hue draws Pathos from Passions, Shadow gains Angst.
detection: Hues reticent to undergo Pardoner examination ('No, I don't hear voices!')
Even seasoned Pardoners stymied by terse communications
Castigation functions normally despite communication difficulties
quiescent_shadow.conversion: If pigment taint is purged, immediately converts to another Shadow Archetype.

pigment.description: A hallucinogenic drug that allows users to see the dead. Chic, easily available, highly addictive.
pigment.orpheus_connection: Basis for Orpheus's projection drugs. Company substitutes pigment for training, weaning skimmers off before addiction becomes overwhelming.
pigment.hue_connection: Connected to hues, but exactly how is unknown.
pigment.dea_status: On verge of appointing task force. Defies chemical analysis—sometimes appears like crystal meth, sometimes LSD, always with impurity that alters brain effect.

smoked.penalty: -1 die to all rolls while high
smoked.perception: Intermittent Lifesight and Deathsight (usually chalked up to hallucinations)

pills.penalty: -2 dice to all actions, temporary halving of permanent Willpower
pills.perception: Can see wraiths and projected entities
pills.projection: Spend 2 Willpower to project as skimmer

injected.perception: Can see, hear, and speak to wraiths
injected.projection: Spend 1 Willpower to project (uses halved Willpower as max Pathos)

pigment_secrets.true_horror: Everyone who tries pigment becomes a wraith. Most cross as Drones. Only those who would likely become wraiths anyway realize they're different.
pigment_secrets.implications: Could mean more fodder for forges, or population explosion swamping Necropoli's ability to assimilate.
pigment_secrets.spectral_origin: Spectre cult under Lamachis engineered pigment's creation via possessed Dr. Lionel Squib.

Skimmer.description: Skimmers have mastered separating their spirits from their bodies naturally, through spiritually active drugs and Kundalini-inspired yoga biofeedback techniques.
advantages: Regenerate 1 Pathos per hour spent resting in physical body
Can 'ripcord' back reflexively by tugging silver cord (costs 1 bashing damage, usually nosebleed)
No wound penalties from damage until return to body
Make all soak rolls while projected at difficulty 5 (instead of 6)
disadvantages: Every scratch and wound suffered in Corpus reverberates to body
Bashing/lethal damage manifests as bashing damage to body (halved, rounded up)
Aggravated damage translates as lethal to body
Must spend 1 Pathos per hour projecting or suffer 1 automatic bashing to body
Must purchase Meditation to project in single turn
Limited to Shadowlands—deep Tempest/Labyrinth stretches silver cord too thin to ripcord
Skimmer.protocol: Orpheus protocol demands ripcord if fight seems unwinnable.

Sleeper.description: Sleepers have their blood replaced with chemicals to drop into cryonic suspension—a brute-force expulsion of the soul from the frozen, somnolent body.
Sleeper.projection_time: 5 hours to enter, 5 hours to exit
advantages: No Pathos cost to project or stay projected
Can voluntarily shunt Angst to body (1 Angst = 1 bashing damage, unsoakable)
Angst shunted cannot be recalled or washed away via Castigation
Rehabilitation process drains 1 Angst per day while healing
Almost all damage shreds Corpus like true wraith (no body transfer)
Can venture deeper into Underworld than Skimmers
disadvantages: Cannot project at will or in a hurry
5 hours to chemically flatline into cradle
5 hours for unit to warm corpse and replace fluids
Cannot recover Pathos while in suspension

angst_shunting.healing: Rehabilitation process heals and drains 1 Angst per day
angst_shunting.warning: If sleeper projects again while still wounded, remaining Angst converts back to temporary Angst pool

Sleeper.damage_handling: Damage shreds Corpus as if true wraith (no body transfer)

pathos_management.Sleeper: Free to maintain but cannot recover while frozen

angst_management.Sleeper: Can purge via shunting to body

dead_eyes.description: After first projection, can activate Lifesight/Deathsight in the meat
dead_eyes.permanent: Never subject to the Fog again

vitality.description: Projectors have a unique relationship between Willpower, Pathos, and Corpus.
vitality.rule: Maximum Pathos cannot exceed temporary Corpus rating
vitality.damage_effect: Suffering damage causes loss of Pathos as well as Corpus
vitality.willpower_boost: Spend 1 Willpower to immediately gain 3 Pathos (may exceed Corpus, but must be spent on Corpus restoration)

emblem_of_protection.description: When first encountering a Maelstrom, projector's Pathos transforms worn item into protective armor.
emblem_of_protection.forms: Varies—riot gear, chainmail, shields, robes, or anything subconsciously associated with protection
emblem_of_protection.maelstrom_protection: Downgrades Maelstrom effects by one Bell rating

electric_option.effect: Arcing electric current on skin causes 1 lethal damage to grapplers

Banshee.description: Introspective souls with natural insight into the psychological and metaphysical. Empathic and thoughtful, but can be slow to act.

Haunter.description: Adaptable souls driven toward new experiences. They make themselves at home wherever they may be, with a predilection toward possessing objects.

Poltergeist.description: Passionate, wrathful souls who draw strength from mastering their inner fury. Their frustration is difficult to control but gives them power.

Skinrider.description: Strong sense of self, reveling in physical and mental contact. The essence of control—organizers and manipulators with strong hands.

Wisp.description: Subtle and charming souls who prefer indirect action. Gifted at greasing social wheels, though some see them as manipulative.

Phantasm.description: Dreamers who seek to share their vision with others. Creatives eager for an audience, endlessly enthusiastic when inspired.

Marrow.description: Social chameleons who embrace novelty and alternate perspectives. They define themselves by their ability to adapt and transform.

misery_loves_company.effect: +1 die on Social rolls with wraiths of same Nature group

sense_the_strands.effect: -1 difficulty on Lifeweb rolls vs same Nature group, -2 vs same Nature

yoking_benefits.Marrow: Act as nexus—pass two Benefits to one recipient
yoking_benefits.Poltergeist: +3 damage dice to next Arcanos attack
yoking_benefits.Skinrider: +2 dice to Physical Attribute roll for Arcanos
yoking_benefits.Wisp: Reroll two failed dice on Arcanos roll

Argos.function: Travel through the Underworld and Tempest

1.effect: Wrap self in the Tempest's essence for concealment

2.name: Shadowseek
2.effect: Navigate the Tempest, find safe passages

3.name: Tempest Threshold
3.effect: Enter or exit the Tempest at will

4.name: Byway
4.effect: Find and use Byways (safe Tempest paths)

5.name: Phantom Wings / Jump
5.effect: Fly through the Tempest / Instant teleportation

2.name: Coax / Ensnare
2.effect: Calm a Shadow / Trap Shadow in temporary paralysis

3.name: Devil's Dare / Purify
3.effect: Force Shadow to make a deal / Remove temporary Angst

4.name: Dark Secrets
4.effect: Learn another wraith's Shadow's Dark Passions

5.name: Defiance / Exorcism
5.effect: Resist Catharsis automatically / Remove permanent Angst

5.effect: Full physical form, indistinguishable from living

5.name: Luck of the Damned
5.effect: Massive luck manipulation, curse targets

2.name: Decay / Residue
2.effect: Accelerate decay / Leave plasmic traces

4.effect: Major plasm reshaping / Extract plasm from objects

1.effect: Detect machines and their condition

3.effect: Cause malfunctions and sabotage

4.name: Empower / Diagnose
4.effect: Enhance machine function / Perfect understanding of machine

5.name: Claim
5.effect: Full possession of machine, create Artifacts

1.effect: Detect what someone wants

2.name: Blind / Enflame
2.effect: Suppress a desire / Intensify a desire

3.name: Fulfill Desire

4.name: Induce / Control
4.effect: Create new desire / Dominate through desire

5.name: Slave Master
5.effect: Complete control through desire manipulation

1.name: Dirge
1.effect: Induce sadness and melancholy

2.name: Ballad / Clarion
2.effect: Tell stories with emotional impact / Project voice over distance

3.name: Muse / Dead Man's Ears
3.effect: Inspire creativity / Eavesdrop through the Shroud

4.name: Requiem
4.effect: Powerful emotional manipulation through song

5.name: March of the Dead / Crescendo
5.effect: Summon wraiths / Devastating sonic attack

1.effect: Detect Fetters and their connections

2.name: Locate Strand / Web Sight
2.effect: Find specific Fetter / See all Fetter connections

3.name: Web Presence
3.effect: Sense through a Fetter

4.name: Sever Strand
4.effect: Cut Fetter connection (dangerous)

5.name: Tether

1.effect: Detect memories and their emotional weight

2.effect: View surface memories / Retrieve forgotten memories

3.effect: Copy memories / Alter memories

1.effect: Assess plasmic bodies and their condition

3.name: Sculpt Corpus
3.effect: Major body reshaping (self or others)

4.name: Bodywork / Grafting
4.effect: Enhance body with additions / Attach foreign plasm

5.name: Undo Soulforging / Reform
5.effect: Reverse soulforging / Complete body reconstruction

1.name: Ripples

2.name: Wraithgrasp
2.effect: Move small objects

3.name: Stonehand Punch
3.effect: Strike with force across the Shroud

4.name: Death Grip / Obliviate
4.effect: Powerful physical attack / Devastating force

5.name: Telekinesis
5.effect: Move large objects, multiple targets

1.effect: Detect fears and phobias

2.effect: Create unsettling atmosphere / Confuse targets

3.name: Foul Humours

4.name: Horror Show / Nightmare
4.effect: Major terror effects / Inflict waking nightmares

5.name: Hellsnight / Mortal Terror
5.effect: Devastating area terror / Kill through fear

False Life.description: Lures wraiths using scents, sounds, presence, and sensations of life as it appears to the Quick. Builds Angst and distracts from mission/safety.
tactical_uses: Eliminate entire Circle through fear and distrust
False Life.warning: Empowers Spectre's Psyche; makes Spectre vulnerable to Redemption attempts. Hive is loath to use it.
False Life.how_differs_from_harrowing: Single Spectre required; no location change; no puzzles; can go undetected; can slowly destroy entire Circle's trust; works over long term

1.name: Scent of Life
1.effect: Conjure scents of life (baking bread, mother's cookies, congealing blood, etc.)
1.duration: Target's Perception +1 difficulty for 1 turn + 1 turn per 2 additional successes

2.name: Sounds of Life
2.effect: Evoke sounds of life (children laughing, woman crying, happy humming, screams for help)
2.duration: Target's Perception +1 difficulty for 1 turn + 1 turn per 2 additional successes

3.name: Dangerous Distraction
3.effect: Lure with difficult-to-resist illusion using scent, sight, or touch; each success adds sense or complexity
3.example: Daughter's hair glimpsed outside Necropolis + dead wife's perfume
3.duration: Target's Perception +2 difficulty for 1 turn + 1 turn per 2 additional successes; Willpower +1 difficulty for scene
3.botch: Inundated with own fractured memories—Perception +1 difficulty, Willpower +2 difficulty for scene

4.name: Love's Caress
4.roll: Charisma + False Life vs target's Perception + Alertness or Willpower (whichever greater)
4.effect: Target believes they're within arm's reach of loved one or valued object
4.duration: Perception +2 difficulty for 1 turn + 1 turn per 2 additional successes; Willpower +1 difficulty for scene; target gains 1 Angst
4.botch: Target instantly aware of presence and failed attempt

5.name: Homecoming
5.effect: Tap into target's yearning to return to precious Skinlands location with rich detail and color
5.duration: Perception rolls difficulty 9 (except Passion-related); Willpower +2 difficulty for scene; target gains 2 Angst. Lasts until target endures new Harrowing.
5.botch: Can never use Homecoming on this target again

Blighted Insight.description: Enables Spectre visionaries to sense Fate connections, induce omens, and glean impossible information. Source unknown—theorized to be direct line to Malfean or gift from Oblivion itself.
Blighted Insight.secret: Some theorize source is minds/memories of Redeemed Spectres. If known, all practitioners would be destroyed.
Blighted Insight.warning: Spectral society doesn't favor thinkers below Nephwracks; flaunting these arts risks becoming sword-steel
Blighted Insight.how_differs_from_fatalism: Goes beyond Fatalism by summoning voices, visions, and memory of dreams. Nothing is safe from its practitioners' view.
Blighted Insight.note: None found among Lamachis followers (reason unknown)

1.name: Ill-Omen
1.effect: Meditate on Fate connections using divination implements; determine overall place in fate of person, place, or thing; read basic omens; manipulate chance-based decisions
1.uses: Particularly potent in games of chance
1.botch: Omens appear perfectly favorable or absolutely against; fate readings are all-or-nothing

2.name: Small Hours
2.effect: Induce visions or voice from depths; limited interaction about past events
2.duration: Interpretation difficulties -1 for session; -1 additional per 2 successes
2.botch: Forget how to use Ill-Omen or Small Hours for session; Perception +1 difficulty

3.name: Cimmerian Shade
3.effect: Invite guiding voice (not true mentor—accesses journals and teachings of long-gone people)
3.result: Accurate secrets from target's past; each success above first = additional secret (minor or major)
3.botch: Voice won't leave for session—Perception and Wits +1 difficulty; no Blighted Insight for session

4.name: Hypnos Reclining
4.effect: Tap into memories of dreams and prophecies (human, animal, or other)
4.result: One piece of information relevant to current predicament; +1 piece per 2 additional successes; lasts session
4.botch: Consumed with visions for session—all rolls +2 difficulty; no Blighted Insight; Willpower +1 difficulty

5.name: Gates of Horn
5.roll: Wits + Blighted Insight vs target's Willpower
5.effect: Make will manifest on future; entwine fates of targets with each other; curse or damn by giving expanded/new destiny mandate
5.result: Target's fate sealed and destiny changed; can explore potential fate in dreamlike vision
5.botch: Change own fate or Fetter's fate instead

emf_detector.name: EMF Detector
emf_detector.description: Detects electromagnetic frequencies. Best used to map locations and identify false positives rather than as a 'ghost detector'.
emf_detector.use: Baseline readings, identify high-EMF areas that cause headaches/nausea/oppressive feelings, rule out false positives
emf_detector.notes: High EMF can cause humans to feel uneasy without supernatural cause

evp_recorder.name: EVP Recorder
evp_recorder.description: Electronic Voice Phenomena recorder. More sensitive than standard voice recorders.
evp_recorder.use: Record wraith communications, ambient sounds, unexplained voices
evp_recorder.notes: Popular due to ghost hunting TV shows; sometimes subject to inventory shortages

ir_lights.name: IR/Full Spectrum Lights
ir_lights.description: Infrared and full-spectrum lighting. Some hunters believe it helps spot non-corporeal entities.
ir_lights.use: Illuminate investigation area in spectrum ghosts may be more visible in
ir_lights.notes: Scientific evidence for effectiveness is limited; requires power supply

ambient_temperature.name: Ambient Temperature Device
ambient_temperature.description: Sophisticated temperature detector for identifying hot/cold spots.
ambient_temperature.use: Identify temperature fluctuations, track entity movements, document patterns
ambient_temperature.notes: Small, easy to carry, inexpensive. Can identify individual spirits by their temperature signatures

dowsing_rods.name: Dowsing Rods
dowsing_rods.description: Y-shaped branch or L-shaped metal rods used to locate supernatural activity.
dowsing_rods.use: Find hotspots, buried objects, underground features, supernatural concentrations
dowsing_rods.system: Wits + Dowsing, or Perception + Occult at +2 difficulty if unskilled
dowsing_rods.notes: Hazel wood preferred for branches; copper or brass for metal rods

camcorder.name: Camcorder
camcorder.description: Portable video recording device. Can record visual and audio evidence.
camcorder.use: Document manifestations, record testimony, capture evidence
camcorder.features: Better models have infrared capability and flip-out screens
camcorder.notes: Battery life and low-light conditions are concerns

digital_camera.name: Digital Camera
digital_camera.use: Photograph manifestations, document locations, capture anomalies

flir_camera.name: FLIR Thermal Camera
flir_camera.description: Forward-Looking Infrared camera. Shows thermal signatures.
flir_camera.use: Detect temperature anomalies, track invisible entities by thermal signature

motion_detectors.name: Motion Detectors
motion_detectors.description: Devices that detect movement in doorways or hallways.
motion_detectors.use: Alert to activity in remote areas, document movement patterns

spirit_box.name: Spirit Box
spirit_box.description: Radio that rapidly scans frequencies, supposedly allowing spirits to communicate through white noise.

ghost_magnet.name: Ghost Magnet
ghost_magnet.description: Objects that have acquired psychic residue, attracting supernatural attention.
origin: Years in proximity to spirit activity
Cursed by supernatural means or force of will
ghost_magnet.effect: Add 1-4 dice to rolls to contact ghosts or investigate haunted locations
ghost_magnet.notes: More curse than blessing; ghost magnets attract all spirits, not just desired ones

rustys_radio.name: Rusty's Radio
rustys_radio.description: Small portable radio that picks up voices of the dead.
rustys_radio.origin: Unknown - possibly favorite possession of someone who failed to pass over, or cursed/instrumental in death
rustys_radio.effect: Once attuned to spirit world, cannot be turned off. Voices constantly come through: pleading, moaning, wailing, repeating phrases. Occasionally picks up old broadcasts.
rustys_radio.notes: Multiple may exist. Does not need power but must be switched on to attune.

ghost_trap.name: Ghost Trap
ghost_trap.description: Cage with electrical terminals that can trap non-corporeal entities.
ghost_trap.requirement: Car battery or other power source
ghost_trap.effect: Traps entity as long as power maintained. Trapped spirit will answer truthfully to best of ability.
ghost_trap.limitation: Powerful entities (demons, elementals, divine beings) not compelled to answer truthfully
ghost_trap.warning: Spirit will resent imprisonment and plague captors mercilessly if it escapes
ghost_trap.notes: Hard to find; easy to power but maintaining containment is challenging

orpheus_app.name: Orpheus App
orpheus_app.description: Cell phone application that genuinely allows communication with spirits of the dead.
orpheus_app.mystery: Unclear how it works or if it's supernatural AI
orpheus_app.features: Built-in AI assistant guides user through setup and finding subjects
orpheus_app.use: Contact spirits for conversation; spirits discuss what they're willing to discuss
orpheus_app.typical_contacts: Murder victims, those who died suddenly with unfinished business
orpheus_app.warning: May require leaving phone at haunted location. Spirits may use phone to make other calls. Phone may develop psychic resonance allowing spirit to follow user.

kirlian_camera.name: Kirlian Camera
kirlian_camera.description: WWII-era device that can photograph invisible supernatural entities.
kirlian_camera.construction: Gray steel box camera with complex internal circuitry
kirlian_camera.operation: Charged via hand crank; when photo taken, releases EM field (10ft x 10ft) that freezes entity for several seconds
kirlian_camera.effect: Crystal-clear image of supernatural entity captured on film
kirlian_camera.film: Originally required custom film; most retrofitted for 35mm. Some jerry-rigged for digital (up to 1 minute video before burning out)
kirlian_camera.maintenance: Circuits require complete overhaul after 1-2 uses
kirlian_camera.cost: Once acquired, requires sacrifice of 3 Resources dots for ongoing upkeep
kirlian_camera.availability: Most in hands of Terrel & Squib; few in veteran ghost hunter possession
kirlian_camera.notes: Expensive, difficult to maintain, but results are astounding

geistmann_lenses.name: Geistmann Lenses
geistmann_lenses.description: Legendary spectacles that reveal invisible supernatural entities.
geistmann_lenses.creator: Johann Geistmann, Dresden lens grinder (late 1700s)
