geistmann_lenses.origin: Created for Herman Sitzbach to see ghosts in his haunted former brothel. Sitzbach wore them once, came upstairs, left note warning never to use them in his building, and hanged himself.
geistmann_lenses.appearance: Wire-rimmed spectacles; lenses thick as soda bottle bottoms. Normal viewing shows only blur.
geistmann_lenses.effect: Clear, sharp image of ANY supernatural entity, even those using Obfuscate or similar powers
geistmann_lenses.cost: 1 Willpower per hour of use; more than 1 hour in 24-hour period drains 1 permanent Willpower
geistmann_lenses.availability: Nearly mythical. Rumors followed by many. Those claiming to sell genuine article spark bidding wars.
geistmann_lenses.danger: Certain unnamed individuals seek to acquire and destroy them
geistmann_lenses.notes: No one admits to owning them despite worldwide testimony of witnessing them in action

w_journal.name: W Journal
w_journal.description: Beat-up spiral notebook containing notes on supernatural encounters by 'W' and her daughter.
w_journal.content: Most encounters with corporeal undead (zombies, vampires)
w_journal.history: Passed parent to child for years; photocopies exist but handwritten notes don't copy well
w_journal.distribution: Veteran hunters pass it around; groups make hand copies before passing on
w_journal.effect: +2 dice bonus to tracking and combating any undead creature

ghost_hunters_guide.name: Ghost Hunter's Guide to the Occult
ghost_hunters_guide.description: Good basic guide for paranormal investigators with strong overview and definitions.
ghost_hunters_guide.content: Ghosts, other supernatural entities including demonic, world religions' views on paranormal topics
ghost_hunters_guide.effect: +1 die bonus to any Occult check when consulted on specific topic

tobins_spirit_guide.name: Tobin's Spirit Guide
tobins_spirit_guide.author: John Horace Tobin
tobins_spirit_guide.content: Careful catalog of all spirits, goblins, and demons Tobin and his partner encountered
tobins_spirit_guide.curse: Every publishing house suffered financial disaster after printing. Last run (Golden Goblin Press, 1967) ended when their building was swallowed by sinkhole 13 days after publication.
tobins_spirit_guide.availability: Copies still available (Golden Goblin run was large); usually sold online with anonymity
tobins_spirit_guide.effect: +2 dice bonus to capturing, questioning, or destroying supernatural entities, especially semi/non-corporeal

carnackis_journals.name: Carnacki's Journals
carnackis_journals.author: Carnacki (the famous ghost hunter)
carnackis_journals.content: Accounts of his investigations; some mundane, some much less so
carnackis_journals.note: Carnacki disappeared in 1917. Rumors of his spirit dictating further adventures in séances persist.
carnackis_journals.effect: +1 die bonus to Research checks involving hauntings or ongoing supernatural activity

motion_sensors.name: Motion Sensors
motion_sensors.description: Basic home security motion sensors repurposed for ghost hunting.
motion_sensors.effect: Placed strategically, some believe they can detect otherworldly movement. Connect to cameras to conserve battery and trigger recording on movement.

ghost_box.name: Ghost Box
ghost_box.description: Specialized FM radio that sweeps AM and FM frequencies at high speed.
ghost_box.effect: Creates channel for spirits to speak in broken fragments. Requires focus and attention to discern messages.
ghost_box.acquisition: Easy to purchase, common ghost hunting gear. Effectiveness debated.

warding_ash.name: Warding Ash
warding_ash.description: Spiritually charged ash from a particularly powerful conflagration, stored in single-use vials.
warding_ash.effect: Smear on doorframes (esoteric symbols or simple X). Creates trap: ghost may pass within but cannot leave without great effort. Weaker ghosts find themselves restrained for duration. Lasts one day and night. One vial wards entries to one room.
warding_ash.acquisition: Not easy to come by. Usually requires Cremationist membership. Buying/selling openly draws cult attention.

journal_of_another_life.name: Journal of Another Life
journal_of_another_life.description: Journals containing details of strange memories written by people claiming to remember past lives or glimpses into other worlds.
journal_of_another_life.effect: +1 die bonus to any Research check involving the deadlands or past lives.
journal_of_another_life.note: Some are wholly accurate, others are fakes or authored by those with dimmed/warped memories.

dead_amp.name: The Dead Amp
dead_amp.description: Half-melted, burned-out amplifier from Dyin' Youth's fatal last set. Absorbed pain and dissonance from the band members' deaths.
dead_amp.effect: -1 Difficulty on any Metallurgy Numina roll.
dead_amp.note: Shouldn't work, but does. Similar objects may exist from other tragic musical deaths.

hunters_trophy.name: The Hunter's Trophy
hunters_trophy.description: Long, lead-encrusted human femur taken from a Wild Hunt target with necromantic power. Inscribed with runes that hum near ghosts.
hunters_trophy.effect: When wielded as club, damages ephemeral entities, dealing bashing damage as a simple club would to physical creatures.

blessed_salts.name: Blessed Salts
blessed_salts.description: Salt blessed for creating warding circles against wraiths and spectres.
blessed_salts.effect: Single packet creates circle large enough for one person. Multiple packets for larger circles. Power lasts only as long as salt line remains unbroken.
blessed_salts.warning: Some ghosts can disturb the salt without crossing it.

exorcists_prayer_beads.name: Exorcist's Prayer Beads
exorcists_prayer_beads.description: Prayer beads that have seen many exorcisms, dispelling intruding souls from the possessed.
exorcists_prayer_beads.effect: When kept on person, provides resistance to possession. Not outright immunity—stronger ghosts may pierce this protection.
exorcists_prayer_beads.acquisition: Challenging to find. Pop up in illegal supernatural goods markets. Distinguishing real from fake is difficult.

mask_of_charon.name: Mask of Charon
mask_of_charon.description: Rare cracked mask with unnervingly blank visage and eye holes. Inside reeks of death and dry blood.
mask_of_charon.effect: When worn, wearer can see Shadowlands inhabitants even when not manifested.

deiter_bear.name: The Deiter Bear
deiter_bear.description: Old stuffed bear with patches and rough stitching, yellow and brown wool, simple pull string that apparently does nothing.
deiter_bear.effect: After pulling string, entity in bear wakes enough to answer simple questions about surroundings on the other side. Can relay questions to other ghosts (not precisely—can't force responses). Lasts until string fully rewinds. If pulled again same night, entity refuses to respond until following night.
deiter_bear.related_item: A stuffed clown exists with same abilities. Deiter's journal entries about it end with the word 'RUN.'
deiter_bear.note: One-of-a-kind. Has habit of vanishing from collections and appearing in random flea markets.

journals_of_alfonse_deiter.name: The Journals of Alfonse Deiter
journals_of_alfonse_deiter.author: Alfonse Deiter
journals_of_alfonse_deiter.description: Extensive journals tracking every supernatural occurrence encountered during Deiter's investigations.
journals_of_alfonse_deiter.effect: -1 Difficulty on Occult checks regarding a specific creature category (choose: Cryptids, Ephemeral, Mythological, or Unfortunate).
journals_of_alfonse_deiter.acquisition: Can fetch high price. Requires German language and understanding of strange turns of phrase.

scrying_mirror.name: Scrying Mirror
scrying_mirror.description: Common mystical instrument with long history. Antique metal frame with obsidian pane instead of silvered glass.
scrying_mirror.system: Offer blood (1 bashing damage), gaze into mirror while seated in dark place, focus on single question. Roll Perception + Occult (Difficulty 7). Storyteller gives cryptic vision answer.
scrying_mirror.limitation: One attempt per scene. Same question yields same cryptic vision.
scrying_mirror.acquisition: Well-crafted legitimate ones difficult to find. Most are antiques passed through many hands.

cleansing_incense.name: Cleansing Incense
cleansing_incense.description: Ethically sourced incense of aromatic herbs and purifying oils designed to cleanse a space.
cleansing_incense.effect: Lit and moved around a space to spread smoke. Can reduce anger and agitation of a ghost.
cleansing_incense.acquisition: Commonly found at new age shops and online 'Wellness' sites.

whistling.name: Whistling (Storm Calling)
whistling.restriction: Cannot be used if character cannot whistle (underwater, etc.)

1.name: Concentration
1.effect: 20ft radius; all ghosts become docile, will not attack unless attacked first

2.name: Consolidation
2.effect: Ghosts frozen and can be physically moved by mortal hands; cannot be used to harm spirits

3.name: Conspectus
3.effect: 40ft radius; suppresses Shadow of violent ghosts, stops combat, brings reason (ghost may still be angry)

4.name: Compression
4.effect: Gale with hail; purely malicious Spectres consumed by Shadow are erased; cannot return to location for year and a day

5.name: Compendium
5.effect: 100ft purge of all Shadowlands energy; all wraiths must leave or be ripped apart; lighter shades blown away, heavier ones annihilated; causes real-world collateral damage

black_hat.name: Black Hat
black_hat.description: Technology-based ghost interaction through hacking metaphors
black_hat.restriction: Requires phone, tablet, or computer. Physical touch during use causes 1 aggravated damage (nervous system overload)

1.name: DDoS
1.effect: Overloads haunting; all magical effects and ghostly apparitions cease by flooding space with life energy

2.name: Dox
2.effect: Learn how ghost died, why it stayed, and its true name

3.name: Firewall
3.effect: Blocks all haunting activity within a space; locks physical reality from ghostly interference

4.name: Phish
4.effect: Creates fake hauntable realm in Shadowlands; spirits are trapped thinking they're still haunting the Skinlands

5.name: Zero Day
5.effect: 150ft radius; inverts Shadowlands reflection into reality, nullifying its energy; ghosts within are 'deleted'; realities separate after one hour leaving no trace

starlight.name: Starlight
starlight.description: Shadowlands travel guided by invisible stars only the psychic can see
starlight.curse: Psychic has Phobia (2pt Flaw, player's choice) and cannot raise Courage above 2
starlight.protection: Creates protective shield for companions (up to Willpower in number); allows breathing and walking in Shadowlands
starlight.warning: Protected mortals can still be harmed in Shadowlands; power lasts only one hour

1.name: Key
1.effect: Enter Shadowlands through any doorway; doorway remains open only to creator; can close/reopen once without collapsing; can intentionally collapse and use different exit (costs 1 WP, exit location unknown)

2.name: Sky
2.effect: Effective Courage of 5 within Shadowlands for duration

3.name: Constellation
3.effect: Trace stars to receive one-sentence clue or riddle from Storyteller about how to reach goal; must be able to see

4.name: Fury
4.effect: Brief pep talk grants entire team effective Courage 5 for remainder of hour; must be able to speak

5.name: Compass
5.effect: Cannot become lost in Shadowlands; always know exactly how to return to doorway

shadow.name: Shadow
shadow.description: Concealment through shadow and sound manipulation
shadow.perception: Observer must roll Perception + Occult (difficulty = psychic's temporary Willpower) or have mystical sight to see through
shadow.effect_on_technology: Higher levels cause recording equipment to malfunction or disintegrate

1.name: Cultivate Shadow
1.effect: Shift nearby sounds/shadows to distract one person; -1 difficulty to Intimidation or Stealth when used on self

2.name: Bend Shadow
2.effect: Disguise self, baffle words, deepen darkness; lights fade, sounds become watery; -2 difficulty to Intimidation/Stealth

3.name: Build Shadow
3.effect: Darkness rises, colors fade, sounds become bleats/thumps; victim Willpower roll (diff 7) or minor panic; +3 difficulty for observers to perceive concealed target

4.name: Sculpt Shadow
4.effect: Affects 2-3 people or one large object; sounds completely indistinct; cameras/recorders malfunction; victim Willpower (diff 8) or panic attack, will try to flee violently; -4 difficulty to Intimidation/Stealth

5.name: Perfect Shadow
5.effect: Everything within 50ft goes black until effect ends; doesn't work in direct sunlight; all within cloud invisible unless mystical sight; mundane recording technology fails completely

divination.name: Path of Divination
divination.description: Prophecy through communion with the dead

system.cost: None (Willpower may be spent for additional dice)

divination.requirement: Must use external focus tool (tarot, tea leaves, bones, crystal ball, etc.)

results.1_success: Vague impression or muddle of possibilities
results.5_successes: High certainty about which option yields best result

divination.botch: Faulty information that may lead to danger

psychic_healing.name: Psychic Healing
psychic_healing.description: Tap into latent mental power to promote healing and wellness. Often developed out of desperation when a loved one is ill or injured.
psychic_healing.requirement: Must make physical contact with target
psychic_healing.restriction: Cannot possess both Psychic Healing and Psychic Vampirism

1.name: Diagnose
1.effect: Determine source of target's injury, illness, or discomfort through a series of senses or images conveying the problem's cause.

2.name: Healing Slumber
2.effect: Willing target falls asleep for up to 8 hours. Upon waking, minor illnesses are gone and bashing damage heals at double normal speed. Serious injuries/illnesses unaffected.

3.name: The Healer's Hand
3.effect: Lethal damage heals at double normal speed. Bashing damage equal to successes rolled heals instantly. Risks drawing attention if used openly.

4.name: Back from the Brink
4.effect: Mend broken bones, knit rent flesh, drag heavily injured patient back from death's door. Eliminates serious illness. Heals lethal damage equal to successes rolled.

5.name: Touch of Asclepius
5.effect: Miraculous healing. Banishes cancer and terminal illnesses, restores lost mobility or sight, heals Aggravated damage equal to successes rolled. Will attract significant attention if used publicly.

twilight_path.name: The Twilight Path
twilight_path.description: Manipulate the veil between life and death, twisting the Shroud's shadowstuff. Walking this middle road risks life and soul; practitioners often become detached from their lives.
twilight_path.requirement: Must possess the Shroud Sense Merit
twilight_path.warning: Practitioners commonly disappear without anyone noticing

1.name: Shroud Sight
1.effect: See the barrier between worlds as a translucent barrier of roiling shadows. Provides detailed view of Shroud's current level in your area.

2.name: Weaken the Weft
2.effect: Weaken the Shroud by two levels (cannot break it entirely - if already weak enough that this would drop it to 0, power fails). Subsequent uses extend duration by another hour.

3.name: Dark Anchor
3.effect: Trap a ghost in a small location (a room or small area). Ghost must already be within the chosen area. Cannot escape for one hour. Often agitates or angers the ghost.

4.name: Strengthen the Threads
4.effect: Strengthen the Shroud by factor of 2, making it harder for ghosts and psychics to penetrate. Increases Difficulty of other Shroud-manipulating powers by 1, including Rend the Way.

5.name: Rend the Way
5.effect: Tear a hole in the Shroud, allowing entry to/from the Shadowlands. Door remains for duration; anyone stumbling upon it can use it. When duration ends, rift heals, trapping anything that passed through and didn't return.

psychic_vampirism.name: Psychic Vampirism
psychic_vampirism.description: Where the psychic healer gives, the psychic vampire takes. First steps often taken unwittingly, but following to its end requires determination and selfishness.
psychic_vampirism.restriction: Cannot possess both Psychic Vampirism and Psychic Healing
psychic_vampirism.warning: Aura appears black after using lethal-draining powers

1.name: Echoes of Experience
1.effect: Draw on and drain target's emotions, experiencing them yourself while leaving target feeling empty and drained. Target suffers Fugue Derangement for remainder of scene.

2.name: Replenish the Will
2.effect: Siphon Willpower from target. Target loses Willpower equal to your successes; you gain equal temporary Willpower. Temporary Willpower lost at end of duration but does not return to target.

3.name: Siphon Stamina
3.effect: Draw life force from target. Heal bashing damage equal to successes rolled; deal same amount of bashing damage to target. Stops functioning when damage would become lethal.

4.name: Vital Leech
4.effect: Draw significant life force. Heal lethal damage equal to successes rolled; deal same amount of lethal damage to target. CAN kill target. Psychic's aura appears black afterward.

5.name: Tendrils of Suffering
5.effect: Target multiple individuals equal to your Occult dots. Spread damage (equal to successes) between chosen targets while healing that total in lethal damage. Stains aura same as Vital Leech.

passed_life.name: Passed Life
passed_life.description: Manifests when a fragment of the Abyss splinters off and becomes embedded in the wielder's soul. Powers are brutal, tempting, and liable to lead to madness.

1.name: Obliviate
1.effect: By touching target's forehead, purge the previous few minutes from a mortal's memories.

2.name: Innocence Lost
2.effect: Convince a single target of your innocence regardless of the situation. Lasts one scene, affects only one target per activation.

3.name: Shadow Pact
3.effect: Unleash the Abyss fragment. For rest of scene: no wound penalties, +2 dice to all Physical pools (including damage and Soak). The Shadow demands death and will not relinquish control until a life is taken. Cannot combine with Regression.

4.name: Regression
4.effect: Enter trance, cast mind back to other life. Successes on activation added to all rolls for either Physical, Social, OR Mental dice pools (choose one). Does not apply to damage or Soak. Lasts one scene.

5.name: Portal
5.effect: Unleash residual traces of Oblivion, briefly merging with the storms plaguing the Shadowlands. Cannot remain there; instantaneously emerge at any location in unbroken line of sight.

metallurgy.name: Metallurgy
metallurgy.description: Music-based necromancy unlocked by delving into the mysteries of Dyin' Youth's legacy, or by tormenting spirits and listening to their wails.
metallurgy.note: Benefits are as addictive as any drug rush

1.name: Backmasking
1.effect: Torment a captive spirit with white noise and record results to cassette. Wraith's Shadow whispers one secret per success. Can also record your own secret messages (only another necromancer or named target can understand) and use noise to progress psychic skills.

2.name: Party Animal
2.effect: Purge yourself of any drug, toxin, or disease. If toxin caused direct damage, success also heals a single Health level.

3.name: Backstage Pass
3.effect: Spend an hour relaxing to music in a place of death. Each success counts as an Automatic Success that can be divided between any Social rolls for the duration of the night.

4.name: Band Aid
4.effect: Heal by consuming flesh and bone of the dead. What's eaten must correspond to injuries (lost eye = eat an eye, severed arm = consume an arm). Heal Health levels equal to successes. Stains aura with blackened veins for one month.

5.name: Powertrip
5.effect: Tap into the band themselves. Blackened bolts of electricity arc around your body, striking everything within 2 meters (except other fans). Living and dead take lethal damage equal to successes each turn. Each turn active, you take 1 Aggravated damage. Can harmlessly release charge at any time.

dowsing.name: Dowsing
dowsing.description: Finding hidden things using rods or forked branches

system.alternative: Perception + Occult at +2 difficulty if unskilled
system.duration: Can take hours of patient searching

tools: Y-shaped branch (hazel preferred, local wood acceptable)
Two L-shaped metal wires or thin pipes
dowsing.use: Find water, lost items, underground features, supernatural hotspots, buried remains

signals.proximity: Rods cross or branch dips when directly over target
signals.depth: Strong reaction = shallow; subtle reaction = deep

innocent.name: Innocent
innocent.description: You are always thought of in the most positive light, unless evidence exists to prove otherwise.
innocent.effect: Wrongdoing not easily attributed to you will most likely be blamed on someone else.
innocent.note: Does not mean you ARE innocent, just that everyone thinks you are.

temperature_sensitive.name: Temperature-Sensitive
temperature_sensitive.description: You can easily sense atmospheric temperature changes when they rapidly rise or fall.
temperature_sensitive.effect: Special recognition of where spirits are trying to manifest. Also helps identify drafts and rule out false positives.

alley_cat.name: Alley Cat
alley_cat.description: Your curiosity has led you to explore extensively and remember what you've found.
alley_cat.effect: Once per session, you know where something unusual can be found (candles, cursed necklace, etc.). -1 difficulty to Investigation or Awareness rolls.

ashen.name: Ashen
ashen.description: You can feel when there is a ghost nearby.
ashen.effect: Gritty, slick feeling on skin when wraith is present. Hair stands on end, shivers travel through body.
ashen.note: Unsettling sensation you've probably kept to yourself.

human_lie_detector.name: Human Lie Detector
human_lie_detector.description: You can tell when individuals are not being completely truthful.
human_lie_detector.effect: -2 difficulty on all Empathy rolls. Does not reveal WHAT the truth is, only that you're being manipulated.

lucid_dreamer.name: Lucid Dreamer
lucid_dreamer.description: You are an incredibly vivid dreamer, either through training or in-born skill.
lucid_dreamer.effect: Build connections you'd otherwise miss; make leaps of logic that appear psychic. Spirits may attempt communication through dreams (images may be confusing/jumbled). -2 difficulty on Investigation rolls the day after 8 hours' rest.

bribes.name: Bribes
bribes.description: Everyone wants something. You can tell what it is and how badly they want it.
bribes.effect: -2 difficulty when trying to coerce someone, as your knowledge of their needs gives you leverage.

cultural_aficionado.name: Cultural Aficionado
cultural_aficionado.description: You have a passion for understanding history, folklore, and cultural practices.
cultural_aficionado.effect: Socially nimble in situations where cultural norms differ from your own. -1 difficulty on Social-based rolls in such situations.

frequency.name: Frequency
frequency.description: You can hear and see a wider spectrum of vibrational frequencies than normal humans.
frequency.effect: Like a human EVP/EMF device but more accurate with better range. Can hear and sometimes see ghosts or their spiritual wakes. Spend 1 Willpower to talk to those across the Shroud for one scene or hour.
frequency.note: Ghosts can hear you but cannot necessarily interact with you.

magicians_understanding.name: Magician's Understanding
magicians_understanding.description: Someone in your past family line had the gift of Second Sight, and you've inherited a faint touch.
magicians_understanding.effect: Often able to sense if a spirit is present or if phenomenon is fake. No conscious control—cannot turn on/off at will. Does not reveal HOW someone is faking, only that it IS fake.

mechanical_aptitude.name: Mechanical Aptitude
mechanical_aptitude.description: You have a natural predisposition to tinkering and modifying mechanical objects.
mechanical_aptitude.effect: -1 difficulty on any Technology roll. Acts as free point in Paranormal Tools Background.

circles.name: Circles
circles.description: You walked into the wrong place at the wrong time and they liked you.
circles.effect: Can tap into supernatural 'circles' for information. Acts as free point of Allies Background. Can raise Allies above 5-dot cap.
circles.warning: Knowledge may come at a price.

pop_culture_queen.name: Pop Culture Queen
pop_culture_queen.description: Your encyclopedic consumption of horror media provides a reference library for supernatural situations.
pop_culture_queen.effect: Once per scene, when dealing with something beyond understanding, ask Storyteller for cinematic reasoning/advice. They don't have to give the answer but can provide advantageous direction.

reichenbach.name: Reichenbach
reichenbach.description: Phenomenal abilities in visualization and recreation of events.
reichenbach.effect: When in an investigative location, easily picture situations as they happened or will happen. Once per scene, if you fail a roll involving such a location, use this ability to retrace steps and reroll.

houses_of_the_holy.name: Houses of the Holy
houses_of_the_holy.description: You have a sanctuary where the world makes sense and you are safe.
houses_of_the_holy.examples: Kindly old priest's church, pagan priestess's kitchen, university lab
houses_of_the_holy.effect: Regain 1 temporary Willpower per hour spent there (up to permanent rating). NO supernatural enemy may set foot inside.
houses_of_the_holy.note: Mortal agents of supernatural enemies can still enter.

medium.name: Medium
medium.description: Standard Merit allowing perception of and communication with wraiths.

well_stocked_trunk.name: A Well-Stocked Trunk
well_stocked_trunk.description: You always keep a stocked hunter's kit on hand, whether in a duffel or car trunk.
well_stocked_trunk.effect: Access to common, basic ghost hunting supplies that might have required foresight for others. Contains nothing costing more than 1 dot of Resources.
well_stocked_trunk.note: Storyteller discretion on what's reasonably included.

innocuous.name: Innocuous
innocuous.description: No one has ever taken you seriously as a threat, and this extends to the dead.
innocuous.effect: When multiple targets available, ghosts attack larger targets first unless you specifically draw attention to yourself.
innocuous.note: If multiple characters have this Merit, Storyteller determines target normally. Cannot have both Innocuous and Easy Target.

cradigans_blood.name: Cradigan's Blood
cradigans_blood.description: Descended from Lord Cradigan's bloodline of supernatural hunters.
cradigans_blood.effect: -2 difficulty on Survival checks to track a target.
cradigans_blood.note: Not required to be descended from Cradigan; represents talent that can spring up in hunter bloodlines.

steady_hand.name: Steady Hand
steady_hand.description: You've faced enough strange and supernatural that you've gained resilience in the face of the unknown.
steady_hand.effect: -1 difficulty on Courage rolls in the face of the supernatural.

born_for_this.name: Born for This
born_for_this.description: You've always known there was more to the world than science could explain, and you've learned to parse fake from real.
born_for_this.effect: -1 difficulty on investigation rolls to determine whether a supernatural lead is real or a hoax.

tried_by_fire.name: Tried by Fire
tried_by_fire.description: Everything you knew and loved was consumed by flame and tragedy. Only you remain.
tried_by_fire.effect: -1 difficulty on checks related to pursuit of your chosen purpose (selected when taking this Merit).

researcher.name: Researcher
researcher.description: You may not be much for hunts, but you excel at the stuff others write off as boring. The library feels like home.
researcher.effect: -2 difficulty on Investigation or Occult rolls to research a supernatural subject.

grizzled_veteran.name: Grizzled Veteran
grizzled_veteran.description: You've seen it all. Hunt after hunt, you've been put through the wringer and survived.

face_on_a_screen.name: Face on a Screen
face_on_a_screen.description: You've been on TV ghost hunting. Your show might not be on anymore, but people remember.
face_on_a_screen.effect: Provides effect of 1 dot Fame and 1 dot Allies (dedicated fans).

big_shot.name: Big Shot
big_shot.description: You solved a case that got your face on every ghost hunting blog that mattered.
big_shot.effect: -2 difficulty on Social rolls when dealing with other paranormal investigators you're meeting for the first time.

friends_with_the_dead.name: Friends with the Dead
friends_with_the_dead.description: The living have always been difficult to understand, but you have a knack for speaking with the deceased.
friends_with_the_dead.effect: -2 difficulty on Social rolls to interact with ghosts you've never encountered before.

keys_to_the_kingdom.name: Keys to the Kingdom
keys_to_the_kingdom.description: Someone trusts you implicitly and gives you access to equipment stores.
keys_to_the_kingdom.effect: Once per session, reach out to another hunter to borrow equipment up to 4-dots rarity. Must return before borrowing again. If lost or destroyed, lose this Merit.

lingering_possession.name: Lingering Possession
lingering_possession.description: You were possessed, and the ghost left something behind—flashes of memories of suffering and torment.
lingering_possession.effect: At Storyteller discretion, memory fragments may surface providing information about Shadowlands denizens, locales, or other pertinent Underworld information.

shroud_sense.name: Shroud Sense
shroud_sense.description: You've always been aware of the barrier between worlds of living and dead.
shroud_sense.effect: Sense the Shroud, particularly in places with strong supernatural activity. Can determine if Shroud is 'Strong,' 'Weak,' or 'Normal' in any location.
shroud_sense.note: Cannot affect the Shroud's strength, only sense it. Required for Twilight Path Numina.

fortress_soul.name: Fortress Soul
fortress_soul.description: For as long as you've been in the business, you've never been possessed—and you can't be.
fortress_soul.note: Could be exceptionally strong will, a warding tattoo, or unexplainable.

phobia.name: Phobia
phobia.note: Required Flaw for Starlight Numina practitioners

haunted.name: Haunted
haunted.description: A ghost has attached itself to you.

cursed.name: Cursed
cursed.description: You suffer from a supernatural curse.

bad_ticker.name: Bad Ticker
bad_ticker.description: You have a bad heart, whether from old injury or genetics.

easy_target.name: Easy Target
easy_target.description: You attract negative attention and draw hostile ghosts like a magnet.
easy_target.effect: Ghosts attack you first and prefer you as their target unless another character presents themselves as more pressing.
easy_target.note: Cannot have both Easy Target and Innocuous. If multiple characters have this Flaw, Storyteller determines target normally.

electricians_foe.name: Electrician's Foe
electricians_foe.effect: Chance that modern electronics simply won't work when you use them. Recordings may show odd visual or audio distortions from your presence alone.

weak_to_the_dead.name: Weak to the Dead
weak_to_the_dead.description: Weakness of soul that manifests in flesh.
weak_to_the_dead.effect: Damage from ghosts takes twice as long to heal naturally and resists being healed by other means. Must be left to heal on their own.

bloody_minded.name: Bloody Minded
bloody_minded.description: You're either an unrelenting skeptic or a diehard conspiracy theorist. You've made up your mind and won't be swayed.
bloody_minded.effect: When faced with supernatural evidence you can't explain (or can't attribute to supernatural causes), must make Willpower roll (Difficulty 7+) to keep your cool. Failure results in manic breakdown.

unwilling_empath.name: Unwilling Empath
unwilling_empath.description: Latent psychic ability manifests as sensing others' emotions whether you want to or not.
unwilling_empath.effect: In presence of person, spirit, or object with strong emotional resonance, must make Perception + Empathy (Difficulty 6). Failure increases Difficulty of Courage and Self-Control rolls by 1 for the scene.

mental_block.name: Mental Block
mental_block.description: You've had a bad experience so severe you made yourself forget it.
mental_block.effect: Gain Selective Amnesia Derangement. Work with Storyteller to determine what you've forgotten and what might trigger the break.

wannabe.name: Wannabe
wannabe.description: You watched too many ghost hunting shows. You're confident you know what you're doing, even if you don't.
wannabe.effect: +2 difficulty on Social rolls with other paranormal investigators you've never met before.

ex_cultist.name: Ex-Cultist
ex_cultist.description: You weren't just a member of a cult—you were well-known. Your membership is the first thing people remember.
ex_cultist.effect: +2 difficulty on all Social rolls with individuals who know of your cultist past.

known_quantity.name: Known Quantity
known_quantity.description: You've crossed a powerful supernatural entity. They know you, and they've made clear they'll stop at nothing to see you dead.
known_quantity.effect: Powerful supernatural enemy actively hunting you. May extend to family, friends, or team.

botched_conflagration.name: Botched Conflagration
botched_conflagration.description: You tried to cleanse the detritus from your life with fire and failed. There was a survivor or you left evidence.
botched_conflagration.effect: Under scrutiny from law enforcement. Another wrong move could bring them down on your head.

tormented_soul.name: Tormented Soul
tormented_soul.description: Flawed exorcism left you with a lingering taint of the Shadowlands.
tormented_soul.effect: Assaulted with images of horror in a hellish landscape while sleeping and sometimes while awake. First action requiring a roll each scene has +1 Difficulty.

hanger_on.name: Hanger-on
hanger_on.description: You picked up a straggler ghost that plays tricks on you and makes your life challenging.
hanger_on.effect: At Storyteller discretion, ghost inconveniences you (winds up shoelaces, moves phone, etc.), especially at worst possible times. Cannot be exorcised unless Flaw is bought off.

they_wont_shut_up.name: They Won't Shut Up
they_wont_shut_up.description: You see ghosts everywhere, and they see you. They follow you, ask for help, or just hurl insults.
they_wont_shut_up.effect: +2 difficulty when concentrating on something or making extended actions.

stygian_mark.name: Stygian Mark
stygian_mark.description: Something from the other side has marked you.
stygian_mark.effect: Constant sense of being watched, shadows behind you in reflections and photographs, feeling of ice running down spine. One day the Underworld will come calling.
stygian_mark.note: Work with Storyteller to determine where and how you got this mark.

starlight_curse.description: Those with the Starlight Numina suffer a cursed existence.
effects: Struggle with anxiety from their ability
Crushing weight of night sky weighs on spirit
Wracked with Phobia (2-pt Flaw, player's choice)
May never buy Courage past second dot

black_hat_vulnerability.description: Black Hat Numina users are vulnerable during use.
black_hat_vulnerability.effect: If touched by another living being while using this magic, take 1 aggravated damage as nervous system overloads. Can be life-threatening; requires immediate medical attention (AED) or magical healing.

arcanum.name: The Arcanum
arcanum.description: Global network of scholars dedicated to studying supernatural phenomena through academic methodology. Extensive archives and libraries.
arcanum.organization: University-style chapters with ranks and specializations
arcanum.attitude_to_wraiths: Study subjects; prefer observation to interference
arcanum.threat_notes: Extensive knowledge but rarely aggressive; may expose wraith activity through publication

chamber_of_corvi.name: Chamber of Corvi
chamber_of_corvi.description: Secretive society focused on obtaining supernatural artifacts. Competitive internal culture.
chamber_of_corvi.threat_notes: Will pursue Relics aggressively; may disrupt Fetters

fbi_special_affairs.name: FBI Special Affairs Department
fbi_special_affairs.description: Classified federal division investigating supernatural phenomena. Significant resources but limited supernatural expertise.
fbi_special_affairs.resources: Government funding, legal authority, technology, manpower
fbi_special_affairs.threat_notes: Resources to cause serious problems; may involve other agencies

piercers_of_the_veil.name: Piercers of the Veil
piercers_of_the_veil.description: Organization willing to cross ethical lines to achieve results. Believes end justifies means.
piercers_of_the_veil.attitude_to_wraiths: Resources to be controlled or eliminated
piercers_of_the_veil.threat_notes: Will attempt capture, binding, or destruction
hooks: Seeking wraith as weapon or tool

paranormal_investigation_collective.name: Paranormal Investigation Collective
paranormal_investigation_collective.description: Entertainment-focused ghost hunters seeking dramatic footage. More interested in content than truth.
paranormal_investigation_collective.resources: Camera equipment, modest funding, public platform
paranormal_investigation_collective.threat_notes: May expose wraith activity to public; provocation can anger Spectres

wisteria_prophets.name: The Wisteria Prophets
wisteria_prophets.description: Organization focused on direct spiritual contact through séances. Maintains museum of haunted objects.
wisteria_prophets.attitude_to_wraiths: Entities to be contacted and experienced
wisteria_prophets.threat_notes: Possession risks; may accidentally free dangerous entities
hooks: Hosting séance that contacts PC wraith
Possessing haunted object tied to wraith
Member becomes obsessed after genuine contact

ashukhi_corporation.name: Ashukhi Corporation
ashukhi_corporation.description: Archaeological company funding digs in Africa and Middle East. Secret archive in Alexandria. True purpose: discovering mummy lore.
ashukhi_corporation.resources: Significant funding, archaeological expertise, artifact collection
ashukhi_corporation.methods: Archaeology, artifact acquisition, ghost interaction training
ashukhi_corporation.attitude_to_wraiths: Reverent approach unless hostile; trained to differentiate ghost types
ashukhi_corporation.training: Employees taught to recognize ghosts, identify haunted objects, distinguish entity types
ashukhi_corporation.threat_notes: More respectful than most but will pursue valuable items; connected to powerful supernatural entities
hooks: Seeking specific artifact that is a Fetter
Employee becomes personally involved with wraith

calypso_network.name: Calypso Network
calypso_network.description: Organization specializing in nautical supernatural phenomena. Ships, ports, drowning victims.
calypso_network.organization: Network of contacts in port cities
calypso_network.threat_notes: Specialized knowledge of sea-death wraiths; may interfere with Fetters

centre_of_unusual_occurrences.name: Centre of Unusual Occurrences
centre_of_unusual_occurrences.description: International organization tracking and categorizing supernatural events worldwide.
centre_of_unusual_occurrences.threat_notes: Extensive information; may coordinate other groups; potential for Shroud-weakening exposure

sympathizer_spin_agents.name: Sympathizer Spin Agents
sympathizer_spin_agents.description: Organization that works to prevent supernatural exposure, discredit witnesses, cover up evidence.
sympathizer_spin_agents.threat_notes: Actually helpful to wraiths by preventing exposure; motives unclear

hounds_of_death.name: Hounds of Death
hounds_of_death.description: Organization dedicated to eliminating threatening supernatural entities.
hounds_of_death.threat_notes: Actively seek to destroy wraiths; may have effective methods

orphic_circle.name: The Orphic Circle
orphic_circle.description: Organization following Orphic mystery traditions. Greek/Roman approach to death and afterlife.
orphic_circle.attitude_to_wraiths: Entities to be communed with through proper ritual
orphic_circle.threat_notes: May have effective classical necromancy; seek to guide dead

sons_of_tertullian.name: The Sons of Tertullian
sons_of_tertullian.description: Religious organization performing exorcisms. Named for early Church Father.
sons_of_tertullian.attitude_to_wraiths: Lost souls to be saved or demons to be expelled
sons_of_tertullian.threat_notes: True Faith may be effective; may mistake wraiths for demons

spook_patrol.name: Spook Patrol
spook_patrol.description: Enthusiastic but inexperienced amateur ghost hunters.
spook_patrol.threat_notes: More danger to themselves; may stumble into serious situations

terrel_and_squib.name: Terrel & Squib
terrel_and_squib.description: Professional paranormal investigation firm. Owns most Kirlian cameras.
terrel_and_squib.resources: Kirlian cameras, professional equipment, trained personnel
terrel_and_squib.threat_notes: Kirlian cameras can freeze and photograph wraiths; professional competence

cremationists.name: The Cremationists
cremationists.focus: Fire-based necromancy using ash as magical component
cremationists.description: Would-be death lords who failed at traditional necromancy until making a fatal conclusion: unlock the world of the dead through immolation of themselves and everything they love.

initiation.name: The Funeral Pyre
initiation.description: Setting fire to oneself and loved ones. Critical and dangerous—most survive with minor burns (those chosen are protected), but for every success, dozens fail.
initiation.theory: By burning their old life away (their personal Fetter), they temporarily open their minds to the group's full power.

methods: Heavily utilize ashes of the dead in magics
Grind ash, use as paste, consume it, etch sigils
Summon entities with dormant energy in ash
Require ashes from bodies that produced wraiths
cremationists.goals: Accumulation of earthly power and understanding the realm of the dead
cremationists.organization: Prefer to work alone due to resource-intensive magics. Come together to share secrets, techniques, and rumors.
cremationists.typical_members: Not scarred pyromaniacs—successful members emerge fairly unscathed. Drawn to destruction, not flame itself. Forceful, high tolerance for setbacks.

jane_treble.name: Jane Treble
jane_treble.title: Investigative Journalist
jane_treble.background: Chicago journalist always a moment too late on stories. Met Ben and his ghost; after everything else failed, snapped and set fire to their shared home. Now follows a voice saying 'Follow me. Find me.'

hooks: Tracking down wraith-producing bodies for ashes
Joining other ghost hunters to find spirits (and later their bodies)

dispossessed_and_returned.name: The Dispossessed and the Returned
dispossessed_and_returned.focus: Survivors of possession who retain Abyssal fragments
dispossessed_and_returned.description: Those who have been possessed and emerged changed, with fragments of the Abyss embedded in their souls.
dispossessed_and_returned.notable_members: Various possession survivors who developed Passed Life abilities
dispossessed_and_returned.note: Powers are brutal, tempting, and liable to lead to madness. Botches grant Derangements.

dyin_youth.name: Dyin' Youth
dyin_youth.focus: Music-based necromancy through hidden messages in recordings

origin.event: Hair metal band Dyin' Youth's final performance. During encore, audience strapped band into electric chairs as part of the show. When switch was thrown, actual electrocution occurred. Thousands witnessed Crisszy Bishop, Pete Jonzz, and Jonny Mac die.
origin.aftermath: Dedicated fans discovered hidden messages in the music—backmasked recordings, liner notes, track ordering, live bootlegs. Messages go back to 1930s jazz and blues artists.

methods: Use Backmasking to torment spirits and record secrets
Consume flesh of dead to heal (Band Aid)
dyin_youth.organization: Wild and disparate. Forum boards and e-zines for communication. New Orleans is sacred ground (where band 'disintegrated' and Crisszy Bishop is interred).
dyin_youth.typical_members: Rockers, goths, punks, blues and jazz followers. Two camps: aging burned-out rockers who lived through it, or younger necromancers climbing ranks quickly.
conspiracy_theories: Deaths were start of grand necromantic ritual guaranteeing the band's return
Sacrifice by another, more influential member of entourage (roadie Parker hasn't been seen since)

wild_warren_thornton.name: 'Wild' Warren Thornton
wild_warren_thornton.title: #1 Fan
wild_warren_thornton.description: Was in audience, pulled the switch. Still dresses in leathers with big hair. Sharp mind with real talent for necromancy and a cruel, ruthless streak. Obsessed with his idols.

bobby_d.name: Bobby D
bobby_d.title: Record Collector Extraordinaire
bobby_d.description: Georgia bluesman tracked down when obscure blues singer was found to be key influence on band. Uncle had one of few remaining pressings. Instrumental in broadening group's musical and occult palette.

wild_hunt.name: Lord Cradigan's Wild Hunt
wild_hunt.focus: Hunting supernatural creatures to feed on their essence
wild_hunt.description: Aristocratic British family with heritage stretching to the Magna Carta. Publicly known for countryside hunts. Privately, their ghostly ancestors call the hunt when times are right to pursue supernatural prey.
methods: Consult books to ensure timing is right
Hunt commences—stalking, horseback, or night raids with modern equipment
The Great Feast—ghostly ancestors share prey's essence with participants

special_rite.name: The Great Feast
special_rite.description: Ceremony conducted by ghostly ancestors after hunt. Lion's share goes to those with most prestige. Even scraps provide bragging rights.
special_rite.system: Each participant rolls Willpower (Difficulty 6). Each success adds equal dice to relevant pools depending on prey type for duration until following new moon. Only one benefit at a time.

benefits.psychic: Add dice to any Numina dice pool
benefits.wraith: Add dice to any Ritual dice pool involving ghosts
benefits.shapeshifter: Add dice to any hand-to-hand damage dice pool; attacks now damage wraiths
benefits.vampire: Add dice to any Soak dice pool
benefits.changeling: Add dice to a single selected Social skill dice pool

wild_hunt.organization: Core family on vast country estates, throwing charity fundraisers. Extended family and allies recruited for their skills. Lower-tier members explore and catalog potential targets.
wild_hunt.typical_members: Born to wealth or mixing in those circles. Buy their way in with technology. Rarely recruit someone without something to add (shooting, brawling, tracking).

lady_matilda_cradigan.name: Lady Matilda Cradigan ('Granny Tilly')
lady_matilda_cradigan.title: Matriarch and Leader of the Hunt
lady_matilda_cradigan.description: Well into her nineties, considered part of the furniture. Eleven children married well, bloodline stretches into many dynasties. Sharp-witted, vacillates between sweet grandma and terrifying woman. Recently became ghoul to ancient vampire Aludian Thex.

tobias_crenshaw.name: Tobias Crenshaw
tobias_crenshaw.title: Loyal Butler
tobias_crenshaw.description: Former Royal Engineers sapper with exemplary record. Father served as butler until death. Military precision in everything. Has sharpened carving knives for next target: a lone Fídia. Estate fully loaded with defenses, escape plans, and claymore mines.

los_exorcistas_de_san_felipe.name: Los Exorcistas de San Felipe
los_exorcistas_de_san_felipe.description: Exorcists who crossed the line—instead of ignoring temptations, they indulged them. Each listened to the voices speaking through their charges and came to the teachings of San Felipe.

san_felipe.teachings: Every spirit is slave to infernal urges. By inflicting themselves upon the living, they've damned their souls. The faithful must ensure spirits suffer for their sins, their transgressions aren't forgotten, and their punishment fits the crime.

methods: Perform exorcisms, but imprison rather than banish
Bind spirits into Reliquaries (usually bone fragments)
Use Reliquaries for Willpower restoration (at cost of spirit's Torment)
Some command possession of the vain, profane, and unworthy

special_rite.name: Reliquary
special_rite.description: Binding rogue spirits into prepared tokens (commonly bone fragments). Torturous and tormenting for ghosts—each moment inside feels like a thousand.
special_rite.system: After successful exorcism: spend 1 Willpower, roll Manipulation + Occult (difficulty = ghost's Willpower + 2, max 9). Extended roll requiring successes equal to 2x ghost's Willpower (equal if token is Fetter or part of ghost's corpse). Mediums get 2 automatic successes. Botch = start over, spend another Willpower.
special_rite.use: After hour of contemplation, roll Charisma + Occult (Difficulty 7). Each success restores 1 Willpower; each use inflicts 1 Torment on imprisoned spirit. Botch releases specter, incandescent with anger.

los_exorcistas_de_san_felipe.organization: Small in number. Many denominations (longest-serving from Brazil, Colombia, Mexico, Adriatic countries). Operate itinerantly, going where the Lord wills. Older priests mentor newer ones.
los_exorcistas_de_san_felipe.morality: Incredibly black and white. Innocence and sin. Those aiding cursed dead are sinners. No mercy to dead who refuse God's will.

father_alejandro_siljanovski.name: Father Alejandro Siljanovski
father_alejandro_siljanovski.title: Architect of Aggression
father_alejandro_siljanovski.background: Macedonian priest with natural talent for communing with dead. During 'routine' possession, entity embedded itself within him. Never speaks of what transpired. Now works with haste and cruelty. Known for skill and collection of Reliquaries.

sister_francis.name: Sister Francis
sister_francis.title: Mother to the Innocents
sister_francis.background: Argentinian childhood was instructive period. Joined Discalced Carmelites in 1968. San Felipe taught her to protect spirits in Reliquaries so they cannot sin again. Possesses the largest collection of Reliquaries, each lovingly cared for.

andrew_sheppard.name: Andrew Sheppard
andrew_sheppard.title: Wraith Investigator (Grim Legion)
andrew_sheppard.background: Ex-NYPD detective, now a wraith. Dispatched by Grim Legion to investigate Los Exorcistas' frequent visits to violent death sites. Puppets bodies and influences the supple-minded. Just happy to be out of the Underworld.

hooks: Drawing attention from Grim Legion wraiths

benandanti.name: Benandanti
benandanti.history: Ancient Italian tradition of caul-born individuals who could enter the Underworld to combat evil spirits. Historically persecuted by the Inquisition but survived in secret.
benandanti.requirement: Must be born with a caul (amniotic membrane over face) and be 'Unhooded' (initiated) by an existing Benandante
benandanti.prevalence: Approximately 1 in 80,000 births occur with a caul; few are ever Unhooded

organization.traditions: Wisdom passed orally from Sapiente (wise one) to apprentice
organization.gatherings: Periodic meetings for debate and community

focus_object.use: Worn over eyes to enter or perceive Underworld

special_weapon.name: Fennel Sword
special_weapon.creation: Must be forged by the Benandante themselves, partly in Skinlands, partly in Underworld, final forging in a Nihil
special_weapon.properties: Functions as Stygian steel blade in Underworld
special_weapon.significance: Represents Benandante's power over and integration with death

ekstasis.name: Full Ekstasis
ekstasis.effect: Spirit form enters Underworld physically with fennel sword
ekstasis.timing: Only possible during hours of darkness
ekstasis.orientation: Must immediately roll Wits + Alertness (diff 6) to note entry point location
ekstasis.vulnerabilities: Has same vulnerabilities as a wraith while in Underworld
ekstasis.caul_requirement: Must keep caul; loss or destruction = permanent trapping

return.entry_point: Lasts until next dawn then disappears
return.finding_it: Wits + Alertness (diff 5) if orientation was successful
return.crossing_back: Perception + Meditation (diff 6) while stretching caul over eyes

ekstasis.failure: Loss of entry point or caul, or failed return roll = trapped in Underworld; rescue possible but may take nights to decades

schools_of_thought: Those who believe wraiths should be destroyed
Those who believe wraiths should achieve transcendence
Those who study the Underworld academically
benandanti.notes: Few shared resources due to isolation. Students may follow different school from teacher. Benandanti may change views as they age.

hidalgo.name: Hidalgo
hidalgo.history: Giovanni-connected bloodline established after Columbus. Mixed Spanish-Maya heritage. Created by Vespasiano Giovanni to exploit Maya necromantic knowledge while controlling access to it.
hidalgo.believed_status: Believed extinct by Giovanni since Sabbat massacre
hidalgo.actual_status: Surviving in hidden community in Chiapas/Guatemala rainforest

survival_secret.description: Three ghouls kidnapped a Sabbat vampire (Juanita Pinto) during the massacre
survival_secret.current_situation: Vampire remains staked in underground temple; ghouls drink her blood, she drinks theirs
survival_secret.importance: Without her, the ancient ghouls would crumble

organization.runaways: Some younger members have fled to modern life, taking their abilities with them

focus_object.significance: Maya world tree; roots in Xibalba (Underworld), branches in heavens
focus_object.bonus: +2 dice when in contact with sacred tree

traditions.rituals: Modern Maya rituals with colored candles at cardinal points
traditions.altars: Maya sites have modern altars showing recent use

underworld_sight.effect: Peer into Underworld (Shadowlands or Dark Kingdom of Obsidian)
underworld_sight.system: Perception + Meditation (difficulty 6, or 4 with Ya'aché contact)

wraith_command.effect: Make simple request of wraith in exchange for favor
wraith_command.typical_favors: Communication with loved one, protection of Fetter

special_knowledge.dark_kingdom_obsidian: Some attuned to Central/South American afterlife region
special_knowledge.xibalba: Maya Underworld; some attempt contact with its lords

threats.sabbat: Control Mexico; massacre still in living memory
threats.technology: GPS and LIDAR revealing hidden temples
threats.discovery: Archaeologists, tomb raiders, ghost hunters could find them

runaway_hidalgo.description: Those who left for love or modern life
runaway_hidalgo.abilities: Retain mediumistic talent, may have taught offspring
runaway_hidalgo.example: Some known as modern Maya priests, promote Maya traditions

hidalgo.notes: Mediums form connections with wraiths; ghoul leaders then bind them to service. Wraiths do much work: scouting, guarding, locating resources.

zukal.name: Zukal
zukal.history: Peasant family stretching back to Dark Ages. Pre-Christian ghost workers; adapted to Catholicism when it arrived. Pavel Zukal gained court position under Rudolf II in Prague (1600s). Family dispersed across Europe and Americas.

tradition.core_belief: Family produces children who can intercede with the dead
tradition.sacred_number: 13 active mediums at any time; when one dies, one of next three babies will have the gift

stryci.name: Strýci (Uncles)
stryci.role: Keep family records, distribute resources, test newborns, assign mentors
stryci.records: Antique family Bibles + multiple internet cloud backups
stryci.coding: Secret coding shows which family members carry medium talent

organization.support: Nadané children receive best medical care, education, and training
organization.tithing: Mediums tithe 10% of nadané-earned income to Strýci

focus_object.tradition: Uses trance state with focus object to summon specific ghosts

summoning.effect: Enter alpha-wave meditation state to summon specific ghost
summoning.limitation: Not every dead person becomes a ghost; some parts of Underworld inaccessible

family_network.effect: Can call upon dead family members for assistance
family_network.description: Each medium connected to at least one dead Strýc; many have immediate family connections
family_network.use: Wraith allies help if sought ghost fails to appear

exorcism.description: Difficult and exhausting; can take many hours
exorcism.warning: Non-ghostly entities (vampires, demons) no more visible to Zukal than anyone else

professional_work.pro_bono: Help community with hauntings without requesting payment
professional_work.paid: Take wealthy clients for high prices (Strýci set fair rates)
professional_work.protection: Mediums rarely appear without entourage of family muscle

historical_figures.pavel_zukal: Gained family positions through Rudolf II's court
historical_figures.magdalena_whittington: Infiltrated Madame Blavatsky's circle in London
historical_figures.pushkaryov_korney_petrovich: Involved with Mary Baker Eddy (Christian Science)

modern_status.distribution: Throughout Europe, USA, some in Russia and Australia
modern_status.communication: Use modern technology to stay connected
modern_status.search_protocol: When medium dies, if next three babies lack talent, entire family searches for lost branch

zukal.notes: Most family members lack nadané but may know hedge magic (enough to ward children from Spectres). Not every child trained actually has the talent, but better to train non-medium than miss a real one.

_meta.description: Creatures and entities encountered by paranormal investigators

chupacabra.name: Chupacabra
chupacabra.description: Blood-draining creatures. Hairless, leathery skin covered in spines, with sunken eye sockets and a mouth that unhinges like a snake's.

special_rules.exsanguinate: Drained victim provides enough sustenance that chupacabra can survive entire week without feeding again. Victim is drained so thoroughly flesh clings to bones.
special_rules.swarm: Larger livestock (horses, cattle) may require 2-3 chupacabras to bring down.

chupacabra.background: Reported throughout Americas, especially Puerto Rico and Mexico. Hunts at night. Multiple may work together for larger prey.
chupacabra.roleplaying_tips: Blood is everything. The hunger drives you.
chupacabra.storyteller_notes: Not vampires—distinct species. Livestock deaths often attributed to them. Some hunters theorize they're failed vampire experiments.

grootslangs.name: Grootslangs
grootslangs.description: Massive creatures—part elephant, part serpent. Gray wrinkled hide, serpentine body up to 40 feet long with elephant head and tusks.
grootslangs.background: South African legend. Said to guard diamond deposits. Extremely territorial.
grootslangs.roleplaying_tips: This is your domain. Intruders will be crushed.
grootslangs.storyteller_notes: Rare and reclusive. Attracted to gemstones, especially diamonds.

mapinguari.name: Mapinguari
mapinguari.description: Resembles giant sloth, towers over average person. Covered in alligator-scaled flesh instead of fur. One eye, second mouth in center of stomach.

special_rules.foulness: Permeates air with nearly tangible odor (rotting flesh, sunbaked garbage, sewage). Every turn exposed, victim makes Stamina roll or falls unconscious for minutes equal to their Stamina. Cloth filter: +2 to roll. Gas mask/rebreather: negates roll. Botch: 1 bashing damage to mucous membranes as you fall unconscious.

mapinguari.background: Legend says first was an Amazonian sorcerer cursed by the gods for discovering immortality. All mapinguari are believed to have reached for the same goal.
mapinguari.roleplaying_tips: Civilization holds no appeal. Most at home in woods where unfortunate campers realize too late what they smell.
mapinguari.storyteller_notes: Avoid cities, prefer familiar woodland territory. Recent camping interest has brought them close to humanity again.

mothfolk.name: Mothfolk
mothfolk.description: 9-10 feet tall. Grotesquely long thin limbs covered in fine fur. Thick leathery bat-like wings. Gleaming red eyes that refract light eerily. Some have small antennae or thick tufts like moth ears.

special_rules.devastate: Target nearest manufactured object and cause it to self-destruct in most explosive/damaging way possible. Object suffers 2 Aggravated damage; destroyed when Health reaches 0.

mothfolk.background: First recorded sighting: Point Pleasant, West Virginia, 1966. Shortly after, Silver Bridge collapsed killing 46 people. Sightings precede unfortunate events—harbingers of chaos.
mothfolk.roleplaying_tips: You and calamity go hand-in-hand. Do you follow chaos, or does chaos follow you?
mothfolk.storyteller_notes: Precede destruction and chaos. Sometimes just harbingers; worst cases, they directly cause disarray via Devastate. Responsible for bridge collapses and car accidents involving eye-witnesses.

grims.name: Grims
grims.description: Large black dog with glowing red eyes. Some skeletal like black greyhound with impossibly long stilt-like legs; others more like dire wolves with shorter legs but larger body.
grims.background: Legend says dogs were buried alive beneath church cornerstones so their ghost might protect the church and sacred grounds. Some hunters believe the dog form is an appearance a humanoid ghost takes to scare people from its Fetters.
grims.roleplaying_tips: The church is your home, its cemetery your backyard. Protect the ghosts that wander here.
grims.storyteller_notes: Appear and attack when someone profanes the church or yards—from graffiti to demolition attempts.

harlequins.name: Harlequins
harlequins.description: Well-dressed wraiths resembling speakers, preachers, leaders. Business or formal attire. Air of self-importance. Dastardly charisma helps convince living to be willing hosts.
harlequins.background: Volatile wraiths with deep resentment for Charon and Hierarchy (born from Charon infiltrating Guilds with deep-cover agents). Infiltrate extremist groups in Skinlands to attack Fetters and send Charon-following wraiths to Oblivion.
harlequins.roleplaying_tips: It doesn't matter what they want—you know best anyway.
harlequins.storyteller_notes: When not possessing to attack Fetters, prefer possessing those whose lives would suffer most. Rich people, those with buried secrets. Force adulterers to out themselves, embezzlers to get caught.

positive_actions: Seek Fetter (will likely lie, directing to another ghost's Fetter)

nightriders.name: Nightriders
nightriders.description: Carry night terrors around with them, playing them back through a screen that stretches over their eyes. Stronger ones play nightmares across their entire body as a screen.
nightriders.background: Sleep is a brief glimpse into being dead. When people dream, they travel close to Shadowlands—close enough for nightriders to manipulate. They influence nightmares, treating them as elevated art form.
nightriders.roleplaying_tips: Sweet dreams? Not if you can help it.
nightriders.storyteller_notes: The mind of a sleeping human is a theater. Nightriders fill the stage with horrific visages. Victims wake in cold sweat wondering how they imagined something so terrible.

poltergeists.name: Poltergeists
poltergeists.description: Indistinct masses of emotion—anger and frustration.
poltergeists.note: One of most well-known ghost types due to modern media.

banshees.name: Banshees
banshees.description: Thin gauzy veil covers face. Beneath: emaciated, gaunt, waxy skin clinging to sharp cheekbones (sometimes exposed). Solid milky white eyes. Lip-less mouth hangs open in eternal scream.

special_rules.funeral_dirge: Know when someone nearby is going to die (natural causes, accident, or malice) within the chapter. Glimpse brief vision of person's death. Pulled toward unfortunate person's next-of-kin to warn with terrifying shriek.

banshees.background: Appear in folklore as far back as 1380. Originally associated with great Irish clans; challenged when English hunter reported visitation. Drawn to the dying; sometimes scare them into early death with terrible keening.
banshees.roleplaying_tips: You never stop to wonder if the people you warn would survive if they hadn't been distracted by your wailing.
banshees.storyteller_notes: Wail so terrifying it could cause death in those less equipped to deal with the strange. Hunters speculate death banshee sees is often caused by the banshee itself.

griffons.name: Griffons
griffons.description: Strong feline lion body with head and wings of an eagle. Front paws replaced by dangerous talons often glittering with fresh blood. Glitters in direct sunlight as if gold dust coats fur. Sharp deadly beak.
griffons.background: Found near gold deposits (rumored to provide sustenance). Unclear if they consume gold to lay golden eggs, or if laying eggs requires seeking gold. Historically tracked by hunters desiring eggs, leading to small but intensely hostile population.
griffons.roleplaying_tips: King of forest and skies. No trespasser to your territory will live.
griffons.storyteller_notes: Solitary, jealously guarding hoard and nest. Found near substantial gold amounts including banks and treasuries. Hunters use jewelry to lure them from nests. Highly perceptive.

harpies.name: Harpies
harpies.description: Mostly (not always) women. No taller than average human. Bodies covered in soft down, feathers along forearms and shins. Thick skin flaps connecting arm to hip like flying squirrel wings. Hands and feet end in terribly sharp talons.
harpies.background: Ancient times, stole food from the gluttonous. Progressed to stealing people from situations they didn't deserve. Fiercely protective of each other, can't fathom family betrayal. Now scour world for adulterers and abusers.
harpies.roleplaying_tips: Family is the most important thing. Any slight against it wounds you to your soul.
harpies.storyteller_notes: Ever-vigilant, never rest. Hunt in suburban neighborhoods near parks and beaches. Craftier ones frequent bars/lounges, even attempt to persuade spouses to commit adultery. Scoop victims, take to secluded location, feed on flesh until nothing left. Nest identified by countless human bones.

fidia.name: Fídia
fidia.description: Mostly female. Human torso, long serpent body instead of legs. From afar: beautiful and exotic. Up close: gray waxy skin, red irises, blood and saliva dripping from three rows of needle-sharp teeth.

special_rules.open_wide: Unhinge jaw to consume small children effortlessly. Anything smaller than Medium size can be swallowed whole and causes no damage to fídi's insides.

fidia.background: First was a queen loved by a married god. When god's wife learned of affair, she stole the queen's children. Maddened, the queen tore out her own eyes. The god turned her into a terrible creature so she could steal others' children.
fidia.roleplaying_tips: These mothers are undeserving of the gift they take for granted. The one on her phone won't even see you sneak off with her 'precious' little boy.
fidia.storyteller_notes: Most often seen at night, using shadows to lure prey. Witty and conniving, manipulating shadows to conceal nature, then emotions of mothers and couples to get close to young children.

errors.name: The Errors
errors.description: Appearance depends on accident. Attempting liquid bones might appear gelatinous. Electrical accident might give off sparks. Most well-known are radioactive errors with eerie pulsating flesh. Can sometimes see through to bones and organs floating in weird jelly-body.

special_rules.merited_mind: Gain 5 free Merit dots to split between Mental Merits and Supernatural Merits.

errors.background: Usually cause of their own condition—scientist caught in experimental energy, volunteer subjects of disastrous experiment, or just wrong place wrong time.
errors.roleplaying_tips: Your world has changed. Will you rise above and do good, or succumb to pain and invest ways to inflict it on others?
errors.storyteller_notes: Often scientists/doctors trying to progress technology. Experimental technology sometimes succeeds in changing what minds and bodies can do.

flesh_constructs.name: Flesh Constructs
flesh_constructs.description: Vozhd-like constructs. Multiple limbs in wrong places. Legs protruding from where head should be, faces underneath collections of kneecaps. Reminiscent of Picasso.
flesh_constructs.background: Created by vampires with Vicissitude, combining multiple bodies into monstrous war machines.
flesh_constructs.storyteller_notes: Not natural creatures—vampiric creations. Extremely dangerous combat encounters.

infected.name: The Infected
infected.description: Resembles decomposing corpse. Entire flesh sections missing to gangrene-like infections or sustained injuries. Thick blood gives slightly bloated appearance. Damaged nervous systems allow only walking, grabbing, biting, or crawling.

infect.description: Every scene after being scratched or bitten, victim makes Stamina roll.
infect.exceptional: 5+ successes: disease regresses by two stages
infect.stage_5: Human transforms into infected, passes along infection
infect.suppression: Infected can spend Willpower to suppress contagion for one attack

infected.background: Buried in military R&D labs. Documents describe creation and testing of a virus. Observational notes show subjects with 'zombie'-like adverse reactions: extreme dementia combined with excessive violence.
infected.roleplaying_tips: What was that movement? That sound? Human?! Food!
infected.storyteller_notes: Virus is 95% fatal, transmitted through mucous membranes and bodily fluids. Original victims were military test subjects; subsequent victims infected through bites/scratches.

invisible.name: The Invisible
invisible.description: Could resemble anyone. The point of being invisible is no one can see them—not even to confirm what they look like.
invisible.background: All share need for control and sadistic streak. Most common origin: encounter with a jinn. Wished for power to control objects of obsession without being caught.
invisible.roleplaying_tips: What is your secret desire? What wakes you in cold sweat? What would you do knowing you wouldn't be caught?
invisible.storyteller_notes: Sadistic, unhinged, extremely dangerous. Like online arguments becoming explosive behind anonymity. Capable of most heinous crimes. Latch onto thoughts that make their heart race and meticulously plan terrible acts.

silent.name: The Silent
silent.description: All share one thing: they've lost use of their mouth. Some have no mouth at all (smooth flesh chin to nose). Others have mouths eternally sealed by magic threads through sinister ritual.

special_rules.free_merit: Oracular Ability Merit for free. Auto-succeed Intelligence + Occult to interpret omens.
special_rules.persuasion_penalty: -1 penalty to Persuasion for every person around they're trying to convince (cumulative, max -5)

silent.background: First tales: oracles cursed by gods to never be believed. Hunters suspect most were humans who stumbled upon something (like witches summoning great power) and were cursed with silence.
silent.roleplaying_tips: The things you see are horrifying. You might mitigate damage by warning someone. Will you be believed or terrify them?
silent.storyteller_notes: Tend to find most vulnerable and gullible humans. Some hunters theorize deliberate predatory act. Characters with Caregiver, Child, Idealist, or Visionary Nature may attract a silent's attention.

the_passive.name: The Passive
the_passive.description: Easiest to deal with. Not truly angry or sorrowful—simply exist. Cause disturbances by accident.

the_mourner.name: The Mourner
the_mourner.description: Spirit gripped by deep sorrow from which they can't escape. Lingers near site of death, unable to move on.

_meta.description: Optional rules for structured ghost hunts with Malice tracking

overview.description: Alternative to playing out investigation through normal rolls. Team selects lead investigator who makes final decisions on actions.
overview.goal: Determine nature of ghost before accruing 5 Malice points

spirit_box.name: Spirit Box
spirit_box.description: Set up spirit box and ask questions. Tone and nature of questions impact response.

emf.name: EMF
emf.description: Use EMF reader to detect lingering electromagnetic energy.

motion_sensors.name: Motion Sensors
motion_sensors.description: Detect presence of something unseen, typically with cameras to catch images.

thermal_cameras.name: Thermal Cameras
thermal_cameras.description: Detect cold spots or heat blooms hinting at ghost presence.

cleansing.name: Cleansing
cleansing.description: Use incense or other materials to cleanse area and calm spirit.

force_manifestation.name: Force Manifestation
force_manifestation.description: Cajole or use less typical means to force ghost to manifest.

confront.name: Confront
confront.description: Confront ghost with information about their life or death.

research.name: Research
research.description: Uncover details about ghost's life or death. Provides info for Confront action but not specific clues about ghost type or Fetter.

seek_fetter.name: Seek Fetter
seek_fetter.description: Determine what holds ghost to place, often through verbal communication. Can help find peace or identify object to destroy.

passive_action.name: Passive Action
passive_action.description: Restore damaged equipment or recover from mishap.

setbacks.equipment_malfunction: Equipment breaks, shorts out, battery dies, data card full, film over-exposed. Requires passive action to restore.
setbacks.false_clue: Ghost gives false clue about their nature, potentially leading to wrong action.
setbacks.ectoplasm: Disgusting sticky residue on objects and gear. Requires passive action to clean.
setbacks.changing_nature: Action caused mood shift. Storyteller switches one action from positive to negative or vice versa.
setbacks.pitfall: Ghost uses terrain against investigators. Requires passive action to clear.

malice_levels.1: Spirit slightly disturbed. General unease, slight temperature dip.
malice_levels.2: Ghost more agitated. Temperature drops enough for visible breath, mild electronic static, small objects move slightly.
malice_levels.3: First signs of anger. Lights flicker, frost on surfaces, larger objects move or rattle.
malice_levels.4: Lights go out. Glass shatters. Large furniture rocks and moves. Wind picks up even in enclosed spaces.
malice_levels.5: The end. Ghost is in rage. Walls weep blood, angry wails audible to everyone, equipment goes haywire, ghost manifests and lashes out.

find_peace.name: Find Peace
find_peace.description: Help ghost pass on quietly. They had unfinished business or needed to let go.
find_peace.restriction: Cannot be used on malevolent spirits.

exorcism.name: Exorcism
exorcism.description: Forcefully separate ghost from what tethers it to mortal realm.

seal.name: Seal
seal.description: Trap spirit too powerful/angry to find peace or relent to exorcism. Trap in place or object where least likely to hurt someone.
seal.warning: Seal can always be broken from within or without.

destroy_fetter.name: Destroy Fetter
destroy_fetter.description: Destroy object holding ghost, untethering them. Causes ghost trauma and pain.

cursed.name: Cursed
cursed.description: One investigator cursed by ghost. Behaves like Hanger-on Flaw. Can be bought off for same XP cost.

injury.name: Injury
injury.description: Ghost lashes out. One character receives 3 bashing damage, leaving them Injured and unable to hunt until medical attention.

broken_gear.name: Broken Gear
broken_gear.description: Ghost picks up and throws investigator's gear, breaking it (usually most important or expensive item). Broken beyond repair.

brink_of_death.name: Brink of Death
brink_of_death.description: Only at Malice 6+. Ghost injures team member badly enough to hover on brink of death. Not instant death—give chances to save.

possession.name: Possession
possession.description: Most spiritually susceptible character becomes possessed. Ghost assumes control. Each new scene, player attempts Willpower roll (Difficulty 6) to free themselves. Storyteller provides goal for ghost.

Spectre Prestige.effect: Respected by Spectres at this level
Spectre Prestige.details: Many Spectres can communicate with wraiths' Shadows. This Thorn represents the Shadow having garnered respect among the Shadow-Eaten.
Spectre Prestige.catharsis_use: Spectres treat the Shadow-controlled wraith favorably

Dark Allies.effect: Can call on Spectres for aid
Dark Allies.details: The Shadow regularly communicates and plots with Spectres, and can call on them for assistance. Cannot replicate Pact of Doom.

Tainted Relic.effect: A relic that only manifests during Catharsis
Tainted Relic.details: This relic always manifests when the Shadow takes control, even if previously 'lost' or 'destroyed.' Often has dark significance to the wraith.
Tainted Relic.catharsis_use: Shadow gains access to the Tainted Relic

Infamy.details: When the wraith Slumbers, roll one die per point of Infamy (difficulty 6). Each success gives temporary Angst. Botches remove temporary Angst.

Death's Sigil.details: A visible mark that manifests regardless of location. Examples: wings of smoke, seawater footprints, burned flesh odor. Spending Willpower suppresses for a scene.

Shadow Traits.effect: +1 Attribute or Ability during Catharsis only
Shadow Traits.details: These extra points are only available when the Shadow is in control. Can be purchased multiple times.

Nightmares.details: Costs 1 Angst. Wraith rolls Willpower (difficulty 6) or immediately wakes, losing all Slumber benefits. Wraith can spend Willpower before Slumbering for immunity.

Aura of Corruption.details: The Shadow defiles the wraith's presentation, making others uncomfortable. Effects are subtle but unsettling.

Mirror, Mirror.details: When wraith looks in a mirror or reflective surface, Shadow can make the reflection appear horribly distorted. No Angst cost, but wise Shadows save it for key moments.

Trick of the Light.details: More powerful than Mirror, Mirror—can alter the wraith's actual appearance briefly, not just reflections.

Devil's Dare.effect: Offer tempting bargains to the Psyche
Devil's Dare.details: The Shadow can offer deals that seem beneficial but always have hidden costs or terrible consequences.

Shadow Call.details: Can communicate with Shadows of other wraiths, coordinating mischief and betrayal.
Shadow Call.catharsis_use: Can reach out to ally Shadows

Pact of Doom.details: Can call Spectres to attack the wraith or her Circle. Extremely dangerous—Spectres may not leave after being summoned.

Tainted Touch.details: Others feel uneasy, cold, or nauseous when touching the wraith.
Tainted Touch.catharsis_use: Touch may cause pain or minor damage

Freudian Slip.details: The Shadow can cause the Psyche to say something embarrassing, inappropriate, or revealing at the worst possible moment.

Bad Luck.details: The Shadow can make small things go wrong—doors stick, objects break, weather turns. Cumulative effect can be devastating.

Shadowed Face.details: A permanent shadow or darkness hovers over the wraith's face, marking them visibly as touched by Oblivion.

Shadow Life.effect: Partial control even when Psyche dominant
