Shadow Life.details: Even when not in Catharsis, the Shadow has some influence over the wraith's actions—minor tics, involuntary movements, whispered asides.

A Moment Gone.effect: Retrieve one specific memory from an Oblivion-eaten wraith

levels.1: Memory is true but discoverable through research
levels.2: Memory provides insight into specific event Spectre witnessed (Quick or wraith)

A Moment Gone.special: After retrieval, memory-related arts can be used on Spectre's related memories. Shadow may share with Psyche to aid Spectral Redemption.

Absent Heart.effect: Conceal Psyche's awareness of emotions or source of Passions
Absent Heart.system: Willpower roll difficulty 8 to resist; lasts session duration
options: Suppress emotion linked to Passion (Psyche knows subject but can't access feeling)
Conceal subject of Passion (Psyche has emotion but can't fully access subject)
Absent Heart.notes: Impairs but doesn't prevent Passion benefits. Can be used cooperatively to delay Harrowing if Passion subject about to be lost.

collective_thorns.description: Thorns that multiple Shadows can use together by pooling Angst. Each participating Shadow must acquire the Thorn.
collective_thorns.mechanics: Angst cost may be divided among participating Shadows in any proportion.

Generation of Vipers.effect: Insert negative thought into minds of targeted wraiths
Generation of Vipers.system: Each target rolls Willpower difficulty 7 to resist
Generation of Vipers.scaling: Additional Angst increases number of targets
Generation of Vipers.limit: Cannot target same wraith more than once per session

Dining in Hell.effect: Feed on Angst from groups of 3+ wraiths or Spectres, dispersing among participating Shadows
Dining in Hell.system: Contested Willpower roll; successes = Angst extracted
Dining in Hell.limit: Cannot target same group more than once per session

options: Raise or lower local Shroud rating by 1
Modify Argos difficulty to enter/exit area by 1
Raise or lower local Maelstrom level by 1

scaling.duration: +10 Angst per level (3 turns → scene → day → week)
scaling.area: +10 Angst per level (line of sight → square mile → district → Necropolis)

countermeasures.affected_wraiths: Willpower roll difficulty 6 to act against; then spend 10 Pathos per turn to reduce duration
countermeasures.unaffected_wraiths: No Willpower roll needed; same Pathos/Willpower costs to reduce

collective_thorns.teamwork: Shadows using collective Thorns may use teamwork actions (W20 p.101). Wraiths may similarly pool resistance attempts.

inter_shadow_espionage.description: Shadows can target other Shadows to build trust with their Psyche
tactics: Reveal another Shadow's plans just in time to avert disaster
Create fake 'rivalry' with cooperative Shadow to sow discord
Use isolation campaigns while appearing heroic
Study Circle's collective hot buttons for maximum manipulation
inter_shadow_espionage.inspiration: Real-life double agents, Cold War intelligence operations, spy fiction (John le Carré)

The Alien.approach: Claims to have never been human
The Alien.belief: Denies ever belonging to a human Corpus—may claim cryptid, alien, or spirit origin
The Alien.tactics: Gaslighting; makes Psyche doubt their own memories and humanity; distances Psyche from human connections
The Alien.when_dominant: Makes Psyche doubt what they remember; convinces Psyche memories are wrong
The Alien.truth: The Shadow is lying—it was human, but denial serves its manipulation

The Conqueror.belief: Wants to conquer not just the Psyche, but the entire Underworld
The Conqueror.tactics: Brute force; refuses negotiation; demands absolute control; seeks followers
The Conqueror.when_dominant: Takes command of any situation with iron fist; controls everything around it
The Conqueror.goal: Total dominion over multiple Psyches; own domain; conquest

The Destroyer.belief: Seeks combustible end to everything the Psyche desires
The Destroyer.tactics: Targets Fetters, relationships, Artifacts; no self-preservation instinct
The Destroyer.when_dominant: Acts on destructive impulses regardless of cost to Psyche
The Destroyer.goal: See the world burn; destroy everything precious

The Disincarnate.belief: Believes it bubbled up from Labyrinth to attach to newly dead Psyche; existence is torment
The Disincarnate.tactics: Shares torment; shows existence as nightmarish hell; bombardment of unwelcome sensations
The Disincarnate.when_dominant: Lashes out at or escapes overstimulation; abandons companions at worst moments
The Disincarnate.goal: Escape existence by dragging Psyche to Oblivion

The Fearless.belief: Believes in righteous action; there is always one correct course
The Fearless.tactics: Pushes intervention in ambiguous situations; insists on action over inaction
The Fearless.when_dominant: Acts without hesitation regardless of cost; never questions itself
The Fearless.twist: Believes any action bringing anyone closer to Oblivion is best; or encourages unthinking action

The Future Reincarnation.belief: Believes driving Psyche to Oblivion will allow it to incarnate as living human
The Future Reincarnation.tactics: Tempts with memories of life; represents death as worse than it is; dangles reincarnation possibility
The Future Reincarnation.when_dominant: Seeks to experience taste of life no matter the cost; gets into intense 'alive' situations
The Future Reincarnation.focus: Always about what future brings; present is never good enough

The Narcissist.belief: Its survival matters above all; Psyche is inferior
The Narcissist.tactics: Makes Psyche feel heard briefly; takes advantage; plants doubt; preserves itself
The Narcissist.when_dominant: Pure self-interest; pushes Psyche's needs down; prevents Transcendence
The Narcissist.goal: Cut away Psyche's self-control and willpower until Shadow takes control

The Obsessed.belief: Must achieve specific goal (assassination, theft, etc.) before Oblivion
The Obsessed.tactics: Negotiates for progress toward goal; offers assistance in exchange for steps toward goal
The Obsessed.when_dominant: Arranges matters to encourage Psyche toward Shadow's goal; manipulates others
The Obsessed.pattern: When goal achieved, finds another; each more difficult than last

The Reincarnation.approach: Believes itself reincarnation of previous Shadow
The Reincarnation.belief: Claims it was reborn when its previous wraith fell to Oblivion
The Reincarnation.tactics: Gaslighting; mixes two lives until Psyche can't distinguish; parallels previous fall
The Reincarnation.when_dominant: Seeks out or creates situations like 'past life'; relives them harmfully
The Reincarnation.goal: Make Psyche retrace steps to Oblivion voluntarily

The Revolutionary.belief: Strife is the natural state; authority must be undermined
The Revolutionary.tactics: Inflames relationships; upends expected structure; twists love to hate; tears social fabric
The Revolutionary.when_dominant: Sows distrust; divides and conquers; manipulates others to look to Shadow first
The Revolutionary.truth: Actually a narcissist whose disruption serves only ego

notes.custom_archetypes: Players may write custom Archetypes with Storyteller permission. Include: priorities/goals, tactics when Psyche in control, actions favored during Catharsis
notes.core_principle: All Archetypes ultimately lead to Oblivion, whether Shadow admits it or not

overview.description: Converting wraiths into raw plasm and shaping into functional objects

appraising.description: Assess soul to determine optimal approach

working.description: Convert soul to plasm and shape
working.interruption: Ruins job; soul must cool before restart
working.three_botches: Must let cool (1 week); premature rework destroys
working.result: Rough and ready—mechanical ratings -1 or +2 difficulty

Nhudric.bonus: +25% Corpus only 2 successes; breaking requires Strength +1
Nhudric.risk: 3 botches during working = soul destroyed + 3 temp Angst

Zurcher.bonus: Specialties/decoration cost -1 success; -1 difficulty to impress visually

Rose_Island.bonus: First botch no crack; +2 cancellation vs Oblivion; Oblivion creatures +1 difficulty
Rose_Island.risk: Each botch gives 3 temp Angst to Shadow

Cachtice.risk: Botch destroys soul; learning grants 1 perm Angst; each job grants 2 temp Angst

Ash_Iron.properties: Luminescent white; armor Dex penalty -1 success; flexible weapons -1 attack difficulty

Labyrinthine_Adamas.requirements: Crafts ••••• (••• for Spectre), 3x time, Labyrinth substance
Labyrinthine_Adamas.properties: +50% Corpus; 2 Pathos/1 Angst = invisible (scene); agg damage (not to Spectres)

cracks.description: Spiritual defects from botches, not physical flaws

types.Transient: Beings across Shroud react to presence

forging_spectres.curse: Once per session, bearer's Shadow may convert one 10 to 1

overview.description: Arcanos of the Mirrorlands reflecting intimate relationship between Les Invisibles and their Shadows
overview.key_difference: Shadows are treated as allies/partners, not pure antagonists
overview.mark: All practitioners bear physical mark on Corpus related to Shadow's Archetype or strongest Dark Passion; appear as Spectres to Soulsight

Rada.name: Rada (Cool)
Rada.philosophy: Suspicious of Les Mysteres; patient, measured, diplomatic; calm and caring
Rada.uses: Locate Baka, explore Abyss, strengthen mortals, protect community, resolve through diplomacy

Petro.name: Petro (Hot)
Petro.philosophy: Pledge eternal service to Les Mysteres; fiery, warlike, passionate
Petro.transformation: Mingle Shadow essence with Les Mysteres; take on patron's dress and mannerisms
Petro.uses: Make war with abandon; protect Mirrorlands; prosecute causes with manic conviction

mounting_mechanic.description: Inviting Shadow to take temporary control

results.1_success: Indefinite period—Shadow chooses when to leave
results.5_successes: Can eject Shadow any time after first round

early_ejection.method: Contested roll—Shadow rolls temp Angst vs Serviteur's perm Willpower

mounting_mechanic.costs: Each ejection attempt costs 1 Willpower (even successful)
mounting_mechanic.benefit: Successful mounting causes Shadow to lose 1 Angst

Les Yeux du Chasseur.effect: Detect Spectres, Shades, Nihils, other Serviteurs, Shadow-dominant wraiths
Les Yeux du Chasseur.special: If navigating Tempest, subtract successes from Weather Eye or Storm Reader difficulty (minimum 2)

La Langue.effect: Speak secret language of Baka/Loa/Mysteres; Shadow translates

Renforcer Les Chevaux.roll: Manipulation + Connaissance (difficulty 8, -1 if Skinriding or during ceremony)
effect_options: Level 1 in any Arcanos wraith possesses (that affects living world)
1 point in Potence, Celerity, or Fortitude
limits: Mortal max Arcanoi dots = permanent Willpower
Does not work on supernatural creatures

Retirer d'en bas de l'eau.requirement: Night-long ceremony with houngan; contact with govi throughout
Retirer d'en bas de l'eau.fetter_rating: Successes (1-5 if other Fetters exist; up to 10 if sole Fetter)
Retirer d'en bas de l'eau.special: Living keeper can spend 1 Willpower to communicate with Serviteur for scene (any distance); both speak aloud; speech-based powers pass through link

Bonte Abyssale.effect: Mercury-surfaced oval mirror forms; reach through to retrieve item from Island Below the Sea
Bonte Abyssale.consequence: Grants 1 temp Angst; binds wraith to service for Les Mysteres within year and day (commensurate with gift value)

initiate_arts.access_requirement: Loa or Petro who swear fealty to Les Mysteres

Reler Baka.effect: Successes = number of Spectres summoned; travel by fastest means
Reler Baka.warning: Cannot summon specific Spectres; summoned Baka may attack summoner

Renvoyer Baka.special: Temporarily inhibits Shadow from calling bluff

Engagement.roll: Manipulation + Connaissance (difficulty = 5 + number of targets, max 5)
Engagement.warning: Rada believe connection operates both ways—risk of becoming Oblivion's puppet

Reler Mystere.option_1: Distribute successes as temporary Talent/Skill/Knowledge dots (max 5 per Ability, scene duration)
Reler Mystere.option_2: Trade all successes for one truthful answer (detail = successes)

Marrer Baka.effect: If successes ≥ target's Pathos: target paralyzed for rounds = Serviteur's Willpower; aware but cannot act/defend; follows if led
Marrer Baka.escape: Target may spend 1 Angst per turn to reroll contest
Marrer Baka.special: At Storyteller discretion, may subdue Shadow-ridden Restless

example_lines: You're worthless. You always were.
No one would miss you if you just let go.
Remember how you failed them? I do.
The Abuser.catharsis_behavior: Lashes out at anyone nearby, especially those who care about the Psyche

tactics: Giving 'helpful' advice that leads to isolation
example_lines: You should listen to me. I only want what's best for us.
Trust me, you don't want to do that.
See? If you'd listened to me, this wouldn't have happened.
The Director.catharsis_behavior: Takes total control, isolates the wraith from allies

The False Friend.voice: Warm, friendly, supportive... until it isn't
example_lines: I'm here for you. We're in this together.
Trust me on this one...
(later) Did you really think I was on your side?
The False Friend.catharsis_behavior: Destroys the Psyche's relationships and reputation

example_lines: Take it. You deserve it.
Do it now. Who cares about consequences?
Why wait? Why deny yourself?
The Id.catharsis_behavior: Pursues immediate pleasure and destruction without restraint

example_lines: What's the point? Nothing ever changes.
You're too tired for this. Just rest...
It's easier to just give up.
The Leech.catharsis_behavior: Does nothing, wallows, infects others with despair

example_lines: You don't deserve their help.
This is all your fault, you know.
They'd be better off without you.
DESTROY THEM.
Make them hurt like you hurt.
Blood. Pain. Now.
I expected better from you.
You've always been a disappointment.
After everything I've done for you...
The Parent.catharsis_behavior: Punishes the Psyche and anyone who enabled their 'failures'

example_lines: Logically, continued existence is inefficient.
The odds are against you. Why fight them?
Emotion clouds judgment. Let me show you the truth.
The Rationalist.catharsis_behavior: Systematically dismantles everything the Psyche built

example_lines: This time it will be different!
You're so close to fixing everything!
(after failure) See? I told you it wouldn't work.
The Voice of Hope.catharsis_behavior: Pursues impossible goals, sets up devastating failures

example_lines: This will end badly. I guarantee it.
You know what's going to happen, don't you?
I warned you. I always warn you.
The Stormcrow.catharsis_behavior: Actively sabotages plans to prove prophecies correct

Architect.description: You build things that last—systems, organizations, relationships
Architect.regain_willpower: Complete a significant project or see your plans come to fruition

Autocrat.description: You must be in charge; you know best and others should follow
Autocrat.regain_willpower: Achieve a goal through leadership or convince others to follow your plan

Bon Vivant.description: Life (and death) is to be enjoyed; pleasure is its own reward
Bon Vivant.regain_willpower: Fully enjoy yourself without reservation or share that joy with others

Bravo.description: Strength and intimidation solve problems; might makes right
Bravo.regain_willpower: Achieve a goal through force or intimidation

Caregiver.description: Others need your protection and nurturing; you give of yourself
Caregiver.regain_willpower: Protect or nurture someone in need

Celebrant.description: You have a cause, passion, or obsession that defines you
Celebrant.regain_willpower: Pursue your cause and make significant progress

Competitor.description: Winning is everything; second place is just the first loser
Competitor.regain_willpower: Win a significant contest or best a worthy rival

Conformist.description: Fit in, follow the rules, don't rock the boat
Conformist.regain_willpower: Support the group's decision even at personal cost

Conniver.description: Why work hard when you can work smart? Others are tools to be used
Conniver.regain_willpower: Achieve a goal through manipulation or trickery

Curmudgeon.description: Everything is terrible and you'll tell everyone about it
Curmudgeon.regain_willpower: Be proven right about a pessimistic prediction

Deviant.description: Normal is boring; you define yourself against convention
Deviant.regain_willpower: Shock others or subvert expectations significantly

Director.description: Everything has a purpose and place; you coordinate others
Director.regain_willpower: Organize a group to achieve a shared goal

Fanatic.description: Your cause is everything; no sacrifice is too great
Fanatic.regain_willpower: Make a significant sacrifice for your cause

Gallant.description: Style matters; you do things with flair and panache
Gallant.regain_willpower: Impress others with your style while achieving a goal

Idealist.description: Things could be better; you work toward a brighter future
Idealist.regain_willpower: Make progress toward your ideal or convert someone to it

Judge.description: Right and wrong are clear; you determine which is which
Judge.regain_willpower: Make a just decision that others accept

Loner.description: You don't need anyone; you work best alone
Loner.regain_willpower: Accomplish something significant entirely on your own

Martyr.description: You suffer so others don't have to; sacrifice defines you
Martyr.regain_willpower: Suffer for a cause or protect someone through personal sacrifice

Masochist.description: Pain proves you're real; suffering is meaningful
Masochist.regain_willpower: Experience significant pain in pursuit of a goal

Monster.description: You are what you are—dark, dangerous, and unapologetic
Monster.regain_willpower: Horrify others or embrace your monstrous nature

Pedagogue.description: Knowledge must be shared; teaching is your calling

Penitent.description: You have sinned and must atone; redemption is possible
Penitent.regain_willpower: Make amends for past wrongs or resist temptation

Perfectionist.description: Good enough isn't; only the best will do
Perfectionist.regain_willpower: Achieve something to your exacting standards

Pragmatist.description: What works, works; ideology is less important than results
Pragmatist.regain_willpower: Achieve a practical goal through realistic means

Rebel.description: Authority is wrong; the system must be opposed
Rebel.regain_willpower: Defy authority or subvert the system

Rogue.description: Rules are for others; you make your own way

Survivor.description: Whatever it takes to keep going; you endure
Survivor.regain_willpower: Survive a dangerous situation through your own efforts

Thrill-Seeker.description: Danger is the spice of existence; you crave excitement
Thrill-Seeker.regain_willpower: Take a significant risk and succeed

Traditionalist.description: The old ways are best; change is dangerous
Traditionalist.regain_willpower: Preserve tradition or convince others of its value

Trickster.description: Chaos is creative; you shake things up for fun
Trickster.regain_willpower: Create chaos that leads to positive change

Visionary.description: You see what could be; others must be shown
Visionary.regain_willpower: Inspire others with your vision or make it reality

Allies.description: Wraiths or mortals who aid you

ratings.2: Two allies or one powerful ally

Allies.notes: Can be wraiths, mortals, or even other supernaturals

Artifact.notes: Different from Relics - Artifacts have supernatural abilities

ratings.2: Contacts in one field or area

Contacts.notes: Less committed than Allies, more about information
Contacts.expansion: Key contacts may warrant NPC creation

Eidolon.notes: Helps resist Shadow, may provide insight
Eidolon.mechanics: Can roll Eidolon to resist certain Shadow effects

Fame.notes: Can be positive or negative fame
Fame.risks: Fame attracts attention - not always good

Guild.notes: Grants access to Initiate-level Arcanos powers
Guild.requirements: Must have at least 1 dot in Guild's Arcanos

Haunt.description: A personal refuge in the Shadowlands

Legacy.description: Lasting works or influence in the living world
Legacy.notes: Can be used to heal, provides comfort
Legacy.mechanics: Roll Legacy to recover Corpus once per story

Memoriam.description: How much you are remembered by the living
Memoriam.notes: Directly affects starting and regenerating Pathos
Memoriam.mechanics: Starting Pathos = 5 + Memoriam. Can roll to regain Pathos.

Mentor.description: An elder wraith who provides guidance
Mentor.notes: Provides training, advice, and sometimes protection
Mentor.expansion: Significant mentors may warrant NPC creation

Relic.notes: Function as they did in life, no supernatural powers

simplified-wraith-powers.description: Simplified wraith powers for quick NPC creation. Use when full Arcanoi are not needed.
simplified-wraith-powers.source: World of Darkness: Ghost Hunters Appendix

unseen_hand.name: Unseen Hand
unseen_hand.description: Allows ghost to interact with physical world using power of mind.

system.duration: Successes = number of turns wraith can affect object

malevolence.name: Malevolence
malevolence.description: Uses raw emotional power to plague victims with bad luck and accidents.

system.cost: Optional: spend Willpower to add dice (max +3 dice)

1.effect: +1 difficulty to relevant dice pools
1.description: Minor inconveniences: tripping, saying wrong thing
1.examples: Stubbed toe increases Athletics difficulty; awkward comment increases Etiquette difficulty

2.effect: +2 difficulty to relevant dice pools
2.description: Bad luck no longer merely annoying; sustained injuries
2.examples: Dump water on laptop, step on rusty nail

3.effect: +3 difficulty to relevant dice pools
3.description: Misfortune takes turn for the worse
3.examples: Car accident, lose job, contract disease

4.effect: +3 difficulty AND -1 die from relevant pools
4.description: Major catastrophes and chronic conditions
4.examples: Serious illness, major financial loss, relationship destruction

5.effect: +4 difficulty AND -2 dice from relevant pools
5.description: Epic misfortune; victim cannot do anything right
5.examples: Simplest movement breaks bones and shatters glass

creep.name: Creep
creep.description: Manipulates shadows and sounds to frighten and terrorize victims.

system.duration: Successes = turns and feet radius (max 5 each)
system.victim_resistance: Storyteller may call for Wits + Survival vs. ghost's Willpower; failure = lose a turn from fright

1.effect: +1 difficulty to victim's next action
1.manifestation: Shadows lengthen, stairs creak, air chills

2.effect: +2 difficulty to victim's next action
2.manifestation: Shadows move, lights flicker, air noticeably cool

3.effect: +3 difficulty to victim's next action
3.manifestation: Darkness snuffs out lights, walls shake, victim can see their own breath

4.effect: +3 difficulty AND -1 die to victim's next action
4.manifestation: Audible shrieking, minor illusions (bleeding walls, beetles on ground). If possessing victim, can make their skin appear to rot.

5.effect: +3 difficulty AND -2 dice to victim's next action
5.manifestation: Major illusions (screaming building, room changing size, rivers of blood). If possessing victim, can 'turn' head around and levitate body.

recently_deceased.name: Recently Deceased
recently_deceased.description: Newly-created ghost. May not realize they're dead. Retains significant ties to mortal world. Holds no secrets about supernatural.
recently_deceased.notes: Some revel in new state and torture living; others mourn former life and seek closure

spectre.name: Spectre (Simplified)
spectre.description: Wraith who has given in to darkness. Driven by rage, bitterness, hatred. Appears to communicate telepathically with other Spectres.
spectre.special: If one is in trouble, 1-3 more Spectres will appear to assist

old_soul.name: Old Soul
old_soul.description: Wraith dead for years or centuries. Connections to mortal world frayed. Humanity eroded. Among strongest and most feared ghosts.
old_soul.notes: Much more powerful than recently deceased

general_rules.strength_zero: Wraiths do not possess physical bodies and cannot lift/throw objects directly (use Unseen Hand)
general_rules.feeding: Wraiths 'feed' on emotion to recharge Willpower
general_rules.manifestation: Most effective in haunted sites where Shroud is weak (battlefields, torture chambers, suicide bridges, etc.)
general_rules.visibility: Normally invisible unless choosing to be seen
general_rules.possession: Can attempt to possess mortals (use as narrative device; Numina can resist/expel)

Harbingers.history: One of the oldest Guilds, maintained neutrality through the Breaking
Harbingers.current_activities: Guide services, maintain Byway network, courier work

Pardoners.reputation: Healers of the soul, feared and needed
Pardoners.history: Rose to prominence helping wraiths control their Shadows
Pardoners.current_activities: Therapy, Shadow management, preventing Spectre conversion

Proctors.history: Often worked with Hierarchy as enforcement arm
Proctors.notable_locations: Strong in Stygia and major Necropoli

Oracles.history: Close ties to Legion of Fate

Alchemists.history: Often blamed for accidents and disasters

Artificers.notable_locations: Strong in Los Angeles, industrial cities

Chanteurs.history: Preserved ghostly arts through dark times

Monitors.current_activities: Protection services, investigation, missing person cases

Mnemoi.history: Exiled after the Breaking for abuses
Mnemoi.warning: Practicing Mnemosynis marks one as Mnemoi - death sentence in Stygia

Masquers.history: Always in demand for their services
Masquers.notable_locations: Strong in Los Angeles, entertainment centers

Sandmen.history: Always somewhat apart from other Guilds

Puppeteers.warning: Puppetry directly violates the Dictum Mortuum

Emerald Legion.deathmarks: Green tinge, random injury marks, signs of mishap
Emerald Legion.notes: Often overlooked due to 'random' nature of deaths

Skeletal Legion.deathmarks: Sores, lesions, pallor, visible illness signs, wasting
Skeletal Legion.notes: Constant rivalry with Grim Legion for supremacy

Grim Legion.deathmarks: Wounds, scars, bullet holes, blade cuts, battle damage
Grim Legion.notes: Largest military force, constant rivalry with Skeletal Legion

Penitent Legion.deathmarks: Signs of excess, broken hearts, emotional wounds

Iron Legion.deathmarks: Aged appearance, weathered features, signs of long life
Iron Legion.notes: Many ancient wraiths; strong in Hierarchy administration

Silent Legion.deathmarks: Self-inflicted wounds, rope marks, pill residue, method-specific marks
values: Preventing others from the same fate
Silent Legion.notes: Strong counseling focus; works to prevent 're-suicide' among new wraiths

Legion of Paupers.deathmarks: Malnourishment, exposure damage, signs of deprivation
Legion of Paupers.notes: Often overlooked; strong mutual aid networks

Legion of Fate.notes: The Lady of Fate predates Charon; most mysterious Legion

level_5: Harmonious Unity of the Emerald Mother
Summon the Heart of the Ebon Dragon

level_3: Invoke the Spirits of the Storm
level_5: Invoke the Spirits of the Storm

Black Spiral Dancers.note: BSDs can also learn most standard Garou Gifts from Bane teachers, often with corrupted manifestations

gift_details.Bane Protector: Call a Bane to protect you for a scene. Gnosis roll to summon.
gift_details.Smell Fear: Detect fear in others, +2 Intimidation vs frightened targets.
gift_details.Ears of the Bat: Echolocation - see in total darkness through sound.
gift_details.Touch of the Eel: Generate electrical shock. Touch deals Gnosis in lethal.
gift_details.Wyrm Hide: Skin hardens, +2 soak dice for a scene.
gift_details.Foaming Fury: Berserk state: +2 Str/Sta, ignore wound penalties, cannot frenzy (already in it).
gift_details.Patagia: Grow bat-like wing membranes for gliding flight.
gift_details.Horns of the Impaler: Grow horns. Gore attack: Str+3 aggravated.
gift_details.Crawling Poison: Sweat toxic poison. Touch causes Stamina aggravated.
gift_details.Mask of the Wyrm: Perfectly disguise as any Garou. Fools all senses and Gifts.
gift_details.Consumption: Devour victim, gain their knowledge and 1 permanent Gnosis.
gift_details.Incarnate Horror: Transform into creature of pure nightmare. Form varies.

Weavers Eyes.description: Read patterns in enemy behavior and battlefield dynamics to predict what happens next
Weavers Eyes.system: Spend 1 Gnosis. For the rest of the scene, wait to declare action until after all others have declared, regardless of initiative. Still act on normal initiative result.
Weavers Eyes.notes: Excellent for tactical characters; lets you respond to enemy plans

Rally the Troops.description: Gather non-supernatural humans quickly with a commanding presence, bending them to a common task
Rally the Troops.system: Make short rallying cry to group of non-supernatural humans (few people to several hundred). Roll Charisma + Leadership (difficulty 6). Each success adds 1 die to all rolls that scene toward accomplishing one task the Garou directs. Difficulty -1 if mostly Kinfolk.
Rally the Troops.notes: Does not work on supernatural beings. Group must hear the Garou.

Web of Knowledge.description: Attune to streams of information spirits, gleaning answers without research materials
Web of Knowledge.system: Spend 1 Gnosis. Once during current scene, roll research or investigation as instant action (not extended) without tools or Ability dots, no penalty for lacking the Ability. Must have general idea of topic. Can only learn what could be found with appropriate source. Cannot exceed difficulty 7 (too obscure).
Web of Knowledge.notes: Cannot learn information that requires specialized access (classified, personal memories, etc.)

Stoats Guise.taught_by: Stoat, ptarmigan, or other color-changing animal spirit
Stoats Guise.description: Change superficial aspects of appearance to blend in or stand out
Stoats Guise.system: Roll Manipulation + Subterfuge (difficulty 6). Each success allows altering one aspect for the scene: hair/fur color or length, skin tone, eye color, height/size (±20%). Can alter or hide tribal markings and lesser scars.
Stoats Guise.limitations: Never potent enough to completely hide metis deformities

Rage of the Underdog.description: Turn the stigma of being wounded into fuel for devastating attacks
Rage of the Underdog.system: Permanent once learned. When suffering wound penalties and making successful attack against less-wounded opponent: spend 1 Rage to add dice of damage equal to the difference between your wound penalties and target's. If damage causes wounds at least as serious as your own, regain the Rage spent.
Rage of the Underdog.notes: Rewards staying in the fight while wounded; synergizes with metis resilience

Spirit Blossom.description: Plant part of yourself as a seed of spiritual power that grows into a Gnosis source
Spirit Blossom.system: Spend 2 Gnosis. Plant detached body part (blood, fur tuft, fingernails) in soil with significant sunlight. Within one week, chosen plant grows spiritually tied to Garou. Once per day, roll Gnosis to wake plant spirit; successes = Gnosis points donated to werewolf. If plant destroyed (uprooted, burned, etc.), Theurge suffers unsoakable lethal damage = permanent Gnosis. Only one Spirit Blossom at a time; can plant new one if destroyed.
Spirit Blossom.notes: Creates vulnerability but reliable Gnosis income. Protect your blossom.

Sense Trauma.description: Detect mental shattering from trauma or supernatural influence by scent
Sense Trauma.system: Roll Perception + Empathy (difficulty 6), spend action concentrating. Success detects if target suffers Derangement and identifies type by scent. Also senses Delirium and what stage.
Sense Trauma.notes: Useful for identifying damaged allies, mind-controlled enemies, or Wyrm influence

Firm Stance.description: Let Honor act as shield against subversive words
Firm Stance.system: Spend 1 Willpower, roll Honor as dice pool. Subtract successes from any Social roll made against you. Does not work against Garou with higher Honor than you.
Firm Stance.notes: Excellent defense against manipulation; rewards high Honor

Building a Legend.description: Each time accorded Renown, experience surge of confidence
Building a Legend.system: Permanent once learned. Whenever gaining a point of permanent Renown, regain Willpower points up to permanent rating.
Building a Legend.notes: Rewards advancement; synergizes with Renown-focused play

Flow Like Water.description: Balance offense and defense in perfect harmony
Flow Like Water.system: Spend 1 Willpower. For rest of scene, whenever splitting dice pool or spending Rage to take both defensive and attack action same turn, reduce difficulty of both actions by 1.
Flow Like Water.notes: Makes fighting defensively much more viable

Rebirth.description: Shed blood over bones to briefly return a creature to life
Rebirth.system: Touch bones of animal corpse (dead ≤ Gnosis months, no Wyrm taint). Spend 1 Gnosis, inflict lethal damage on self based on creature size: Small (bird, rodent) = 1; Medium (wolf, falcon, iguana) = 2; Large (horse, alligator, dolphin) = 3; Enormous (elephant, giraffe) = 4+. Extended Charisma + Primal-Urge roll (difficulty 5 + damage inflicted), accumulate 12 successes. Blood forms new flesh; creature lives loyal to Philodox until scene ends. Cannot use on same corpse twice.
Rebirth.notes: Powerful but costly; creates temporary animal allies

Canine Call.description: Produce howl only canines can hear; humans and others automatically ignore it
Canine Call.system: Spend 1 Gnosis when using a Garou howl. Only canines (including homid werewolves) hear it; humans and other creatures ignore automatically.
Canine Call.limitations: Does not work with rites (spirit world must hear ritual howls)

Battle Cry.description: Imbue battle cry with rousing edge to ready packmates for a fight
Battle Cry.system: Shout or howl to alert allies. Roll Charisma + Expression (difficulty 6). Any allied werewolf who hears gains bonus dice to initiative rolls that scene = successes. Can combine with howls (Call to Succor, Call to Hunt, Warning of the Wyrm's Approach) and Call of the Wyld to extend range.
Battle Cry.notes: Excellent pack support; stacks with other initiative boosters

Ritual Tuning.description: Set the stage for a rite with a preparatory performance
Ritual Tuning.system: Spend 1 Gnosis, perform prelude (minutes to hour+) before rite. Performance must be appropriate (no lullaby before Rite of Boasting). If rite commences immediately after, ritemaster gains bonus dice = Galliard's Performance dots + relevant specialty. Each additional Galliard using this Gift adds +1 die. Maximum +10 dice total.
Ritual Tuning.notes: Dramatically improves rite success chances; rewards pack coordination

Social Butterfly.description: Flit through conversations to make the pack seem familiar to a crowd
Social Butterfly.system: Spend minutes to hour socializing with group. Roll Charisma + Etiquette or Streetwise (difficulty by group size: 20-30 = 5, hundreds = 8). For one week, Galliard and packmates treat group as temporary Contacts (rating = successes, max 5) in area related to gathering.
Social Butterfly.example: Socializing at gay pride parade grants temporary Contacts in LGBTQ community

Words Like Wind.description: Send message across the world, spreading ear to ear like a breeze
Words Like Wind.system: Spend 1 Gnosis with short performance or catchy message. May include Social roll. For Gnosis days, message spreads virally (digital, phone, in-person - must be audible/visible). If Social roll included, applies to every listener in the trend. Listeners with Willpower > successes are unaffected by influence but don't stop spread. While circulating, Galliard gains Reputation Merit effects within 10 miles of origin.

Rhythm of War.description: As long as you keep fighting, you cannot be stopped
Rhythm of War.system: Spend 1 Rage. For rest of scene, if making attack every turn, immune to stunning via massive damage and knockdown. Effect ends if a turn passes without attacking.
Rhythm of War.notes: Rewards aggressive play; must commit to attack or lose benefit

Pack Shield.description: Draw enemy attention with fierce display of might
Pack Shield.system: Roll Charisma + Intimidation (difficulty = lowest enemy Willpower), spend action drawing attention. For rest of scene, opponents take dice penalty = successes to attacks not targeting the Ahroun. Opponents with Willpower < roll result can only attack the Ahroun.
Pack Shield.notes: Classic 'tank' ability; protects pack by becoming priority target

Loyal Defender.description: Pledge vow of loyalty as proof against anything that could turn you against packmates
Loyal Defender.system: Permanent once learned. Difficulty of any attack against packmates raised by 1 (even under mind-control, frenzy, or own will). If dealing damage to packmate while under supernatural influence or Thrall of the Wyrm, immediately roll Willpower (difficulty = original successes that caused influence). Success ends effect/frenzy and gain 1 Rage.
Loyal Defender.notes: Protects pack from you; may save you from mind control

Home Turf.description: Claim an area for the pack, making it dangerous for invaders
Home Turf.system: Howl claim on area (radius = 10 × Rage yards). Roll Charisma + Intimidation (difficulty 8 - number of packmates present, not counting self). Success: for (successes) hours, rolls to intimidate/cow packmates suffer -Rage dice penalty; packmates' intimidation attempts gain +Rage dice bonus. Only benefits Ahroun if at least one packmate present.
Home Turf.notes: Territory control; scales with Rage and pack size

Black Mamba Strike.description: Dash across battlefield with astonishing speed when ready to strike
Black Mamba Strike.system: Spend 1 Rage. For rest of scene, no need to split dice pool or spend extra Rage to move up to running speed before making attack on same turn.
Black Mamba Strike.notes: Exceptional mobility; reach any target and attack without penalty

gift_notes.learning: These Gifts are learned from the specified spirits through standard chiminage

gift_rules.acquisition: Must acquire through roleplay and experience points, not freebie points at creation
gift_rules.maximum_gifts: Most Kinfolk have 1 Gift; exceptionally talented may have 2; only under special circumstances (exceptional roleplay) may acquire 3
gift_rules.gnosis_requirement: Without Gnosis Merit, can only learn Gifts that do not require Gnosis expenditure
gift_rules.rage_restriction: Kinfolk cannot learn Gifts that require spending Rage or Rage rolls

owls_speech.name: Owl's Speech
owls_speech.description: Combines Beast's Speech and King of the Beasts Gifts, but only works on owls. Draws on connection between Athena and her sacred owls.
owls_speech.system: With Gnosis, permanent and usable at any time. Without Gnosis, spend 1 Willpower to invoke; lasts 8 hours.

chain_talk.name: Chain Talk
chain_talk.description: Enables human Kinfolk to participate in the Bone Gnawer's Barking Chain. Normal voice mimics wolf language.
chain_talk.system: Spend Gnosis or Willpower. With Willpower: lasts one scene. With Gnosis: lasts 24 hours.

trash_hound.name: Trash Hound
trash_hound.description: Creates hearty meal from food scraps and wrappers using a special cooking pot. Food need not be edible; can include wrappers, cereal box-tops, coffee filters.
trash_hound.system: Spend Willpower, combine ingredients while concentrating, wait 15 minutes. Must consume before next morning. With Gnosis: also erases tiredness and ensures good sleep.

water_conning.name: Water-Conning
water_conning.description: Purify water by touching hand to it or forehead to surface. Cannot cleanse Wyrm-taint (only Garou can).
water_conning.system: Spend Gnosis or Willpower, roll Perception + Intuition. Difficulty 6 (feces/parasites) or 8 (chemicals/toxins). Each success purifies enough for one person for one day.

safe_haven.name: Safe Haven
safe_haven.description: Supernatural watch on house or territory that alerts when Wyrm-tainted beings trespass. Useful for Kinfolk within the bawn.
safe_haven.system: Spend 1 Gnosis (or 2 Willpower) to activate. Maintain with 1 Willpower or Gnosis per day. Roll Perception + Occult (difficulty 7) to detect intrusion. More successes pinpoint type and strength.
safe_haven.limitation: May only protect an area you can lay claim to (within bawn excluding caern, or in outside world).

control_simple_machine.name: Control Simple Machine
control_simple_machine.description: Command spirits of simple machines: flip switches, operate levers, push buttons.
control_simple_machine.system: Spend Willpower, roll Manipulation + Crafts (difficulty 7). Lasts one scene.

diagnostics.name: Diagnostics
diagnostics.description: Tell what is wrong with a machine just by looking. May enlist the machine's spirit to aid repair.
diagnostics.system: Spend Willpower to diagnose. Spend Gnosis (or 2 Willpower) to convince spirit to aid repair. Roll Dexterity + Repair (difficulty 6). Repair time and successes needed halved.

well_oiled_running.name: Well-Oiled Running
well_oiled_running.description: Keep fighting equipment in best condition, protected from dust, damp, or environmental factors.
well_oiled_running.system: Spend Willpower, roll Stamina + Crafts (difficulty 7). Each success protects one piece of machinery from environmental damage for one day. Direct hits still affect it.

howl_to_the_pack.name: Howl to the Pack
howl_to_the_pack.description: Wolf Kinfolk raises voice in howl that any pack member can hear regardless of distance. Garou associated with pack can also hear and respond.
howl_to_the_pack.system: Spend 1 Willpower along with a howl.

purify_meat.name: Purify Meat
purify_meat.description: Cleanse tainted meat of poison, chemicals, and non-natural toxins. Does not affect naturally toxic foods. Cleanses up to 50 pounds.
purify_meat.system: Spend Gnosis. Must touch the meat to activate.
purify_meat.requirement: Wolf-Kin must possess at least 1 dot of Gnosis

aura_of_confidence.name: Aura of Confidence
aura_of_confidence.description: Project aura of superiority toward other humans, preventing detection of flaws or reading of aura.
aura_of_confidence.system: Spend Willpower to enact. Duration: one week.

whisper_catching.name: Whisper Catching
whisper_catching.description: Supernaturally overhear conversations, gaining heads-up on potential plots against Garou or Kin.
whisper_catching.system: Spend Willpower. Hear whispered conversations within earshot as if speakers were next to you. May need Perception roll if obstacles or distance impede.

heavens_guidance.name: Heaven's Guidance
heavens_guidance.description: Always find your way when stars are visible in the sky.
heavens_guidance.system: Spend Gnosis to learn; then operates from twilight to dawn. Never lost while seeing a single star; always knows north and the path taken.
heavens_guidance.teacher: Spirit servant of the North Star

silence.name: Silence
silence.description: Muffle any sound you make. Useful for assisting Strider Kin.
silence.system: Spend Willpower, gain +2 dice to all Dexterity + Stealth rolls. Lasts one scene.

ospreys_eye.name: Osprey's Eye
ospreys_eye.description: Spot objects or people through water, ignoring distortion or discoloring. See someone underwater as clearly as on dry land.
ospreys_eye.system: Spend Gnosis (or 2 Willpower). Lasts one scene, cannot be used again for 12 hours. When underwater, -2 difficulty for Perception rolls seeing objects or people.

balance.name: Balance
balance.description: Achieve near perfect balance on ledges, ropes, or narrow objects regardless of slipperiness or mobility.
balance.system: Spend Gnosis (or 2 Willpower) and center upon the task. Climbing difficulties decrease by 3; maintaining balance is automatic. Kinfolk must enact once each day or when necessary (unlike Garou for whom it is permanent).

iron_resolve.name: Iron Resolve
iron_resolve.description: Use resolve to execute great feats through Willpower alone.
iron_resolve.system: Spend Willpower to gain 2 automatic successes instead of one. May be enacted no more than three times per day.

sense_magic.name: Sense Magic
sense_magic.description: Detect pulses of magic and mystical energies: Garou Gifts, wizards' power, healers/shamans' magic, vampire or infernal magic.
sense_magic.system: Roll Perception + Enigmas (difficulty varies by nature and strength). 1-2 successes: spiritual energy present. 3+ successes: additional information (dreamcraft, herbal magic, blood magic, demoncraft). Radius: 20 feet per success.

call_the_breeze.name: Call the Breeze
call_the_breeze.description: Conjure strong, cold wind (20 mph) that chills unprepared targets. Can redirect/disperse vapor clouds, airborne toxins like tear gas, or deflect insect swarms.
call_the_breeze.system: Spend Gnosis (or 2 Willpower) and whistle or hum to summon. Direct by thought. Those caught lose 1 die from Perception rolls; after one minute exposure without appropriate clothing, -1 penalty to all actions.

kinfolk_fetish_rules.attunement: Gnosis roll (difficulty = fetish's Gnosis rating, one success needed)
kinfolk_fetish_rules.activation: Gnosis roll or spend Gnosis point (varies by fetish)
kinfolk_fetish_rules.willpower_alternative: Some rare fetishes may use Willpower rolls/expenditures instead of Gnosis for Kinfolk without Gnosis Merit. Difficulty remains fetish's Gnosis rating.
kinfolk_fetish_rules.special_negotiation: A Theurge must make a particularly good case with the inhabiting spirit for allowing use by a Kinfolk

blood_brother_blade.name: Blood Brother Blade
blood_brother_blade.description: Hunting knife carved or painted with Garou pictograms representing Kin and/or Honor. A Garou and Kinfolk perform blood brothers ceremony to mystically bond through the blade.
blood_brother_blade.creation: Bond can survive death of Kinfolk and pass to bloodline children. Once Garou passes away, inhabiting spirit is freed.
powers: Activate by cutting self (a thumb slice will do) to alert bonded Garou that Kin needs help
Alternatively, cut enemy and draw blood - bonded Garou knows the scent and can recognize/track it anywhere
blood_brother_blade.bound_spirit: Ancestor spirit related to the Garou or Kinfolk

bloodhounds_snout.name: Bloodhound's Snout
bloodhounds_snout.description: A dog's leash that leads its owner along a target's scent trail. Acts like a normal living dog tracking.
bloodhounds_snout.usage: Hold scent sample (scarf, glove, water bottle) up to leash while activating
bloodhounds_snout.behavior: Leash literally pulls ahead traveling along ground as if actual dog at the end
limitations: Can be fooled by stream crossing
bloodhounds_snout.duration: Until target is found or one full day
bloodhounds_snout.restriction: If Kinfolk has ever abused a dog, they cannot use this fetish - spirit will not cooperate

hearth_caul.name: Hearth Caul
hearth_caul.description: Preserved remains of a Kinfolk's birth caul (birth membrane). Must be preserved with special herbs and hidden inside family's hearth (or declared hearth space).
hearth_caul.effect: Good fortune for immediate and extended family (uncles, aunts, first cousins). Not miraculous luck but protective synchronicities: floods that spare only the Kin's house, flat tire preventing driving over a collapsing bridge.
loss_conditions: Non-family member sees the caul: effects end until re-activated (difficulty -1 if performed by family matriarch)
Non-family member (except Garou) touches the caul: ruined, spirit leaves
hearth_caul.activation: Willpower or Gnosis to reactivate after being seen
hearth_caul.bound_spirit: Ancestor spirit of the Kinfolk or their related Garou tribe
hearth_caul.note: Caul births are very rare. Herbalism Knowledge helps identify and collect preservation herbs.

songbird_staff.name: Songbird Staff
songbird_staff.description: Oak staff carved with stylized images of birds (wrens, vireos, crows - but not predators/scavengers like hawks/eagles).
songbird_staff.effect: Produces faint bird sounds conveying simple messages about immediate environment: people or predators nearby, weather changes, imminent danger (forest fire, earthquake).
songbird_staff.query: User can make bird sounds (just need to sound somewhat like birds) for specific information. Receives basic replies: 'three armed humans over the ridge', 'oily substance originates five miles upstream'.
songbird_staff.scope: Any information known by local bird population (even if they can't think analytically about it)
songbird_staff.bound_spirit: Songbird spirit, or talkative bird like crow or raven. Cannot be a bird that preys on other birds.

talen_rules.activation: Gnosis roll or spend Gnosis point
talen_rules.willpower_alternative: In some cases, Willpower may substitute for Gnosis, particularly for talens meant for Kinfolk use

biting_bullet.name: Biting Bullet
biting_bullet.description: A bullet or round of buckshot. Put between teeth and bite down to fire at a target you face, as if taking aim with a gun.
biting_bullet.system: Roll Dexterity + Firearms or Athletics to hit. Damage depends on caliber (treat as real gunshot). Biter takes 1 level of bashing damage from explosion in mouth.

finders_keepers.name: Finders Keepers
finders_keepers.description: A simple match (usually comes in box or matchbook with four others). When lit while speaking name of lost/stolen object, reveals vision of where it is.
finders_keepers.limitations: Image may not reveal exact location, but provides clues (Chinese take-out name over the crook's shoulder). Vision disappears when match burns out.

fumblegum.name: Fumblegum
fumblegum.description: Pack of five sticks of bubblegum. Chew a few times to activate, then toss on ground. Winds up on heel of anyone pursuing you.
fumblegum.effect: Pursuer must roll Perception + Alertness to notice gum. While stuck, harder to catch up: passersby block way, cops stop to question, traffic prevents crossing. If pursuer outright runs, must roll Dexterity + Athletics not to trip and fall. Success ends gum's effect; failure keeps it working.

leaf_of_grass.name: Leaf of Grass
leaf_of_grass.description: A broad-bladed tree leaf (despite its name). When laid over eyes, imparts words of an original poem.
leaf_of_grass.effect: Very good poem. If recited or published, receives high accolades. A Galliard would be envious.

spirit_shield.name: Spirit Shield
spirit_shield.description: Small shield the size of a pendant, worn around neck. When brought to lips and activated, glows with faint luminescence that expands to surround wearer in pale, unearthly light.

effects.vs_non_garou: All hostile non-Garou experience fear and do not approach
effects.vs_garou: Garou must roll Wits + Enigmas (difficulty = talen's Gnosis). Success: may attack, but talen absorbs up to 20 levels of damage before dissipating. Failure: attack misses regardless of successes.

spirit_shield.duration: Until absorbs all damage it can or combat ends
spirit_shield.restriction: Can only be used by Kinfolk - an ancestor spirit is bound within and only protects non-Garou descendants
spirit_shield.limitation: Does NOT protect against fomori or other Wyrm creatures

overview.description: Spirits bound to Kinfolk (usually at birth via Baptism of Fire rite) to watch over them. Alert tribe when Kinfolk undergoes First Change. Most Kinfolk never know they have one.
overview.release: Once a Kinfolk is confirmed to not be changing (usually into adulthood without First Change), the Kin-Fetch is typically released for reassignment.

fetch_brand.name: Fetch Brand
fetch_brand.description: Mark a mortal with small brand in shape of tribal glyph, visible only to Garou. Can be placed anywhere on body (inside lip, scalp). If marked mortal undergoes Change, brand burns away and Kin-Fetch is immediately aware.

subtle_watcher.name: Subtle Watcher
subtle_watcher.description: Make self invisible at no cost. Maintain invisibility indefinitely while within roughly 3 meters of fetch-branded target. Other spirits cannot detect it without specific counter-charms.

kin_fetch.name: Kin-Fetch
kin_fetch.description: Most basic Kin-Fetch. Represents one that hasn't successfully alerted tribe to a new cub more than once, or a freshly adapted spirit. Quiet, modest spirits fully dedicated to their job.
kin_fetch.image: Resembles member of totem's brood or small version of totem's avatar. Bears silvery glyph of allied tribe.
kin_fetch.personality: Remember little of previous existence. Poor conversationalists - focus on single charge.

blood_fetch.name: Blood Fetch
blood_fetch.description: Attached to old, prosperous Kinfolk families with high Pure Breed. Strengthened by higher birthrate of Garou. Act as household deities for their families.
blood_fetch.image: Clearly larger and more resplendent than basic Kin-Fetches. Usually resemble tribal totem. May have distinct personality traits reflecting family history.

fetch_spider.name: Fetch Spider
fetch_spider.description: Created to pass for Weaver servants in cities. Weaver-spirits ignore them, assuming they're one of their own.

special_charm.name: Weaver Camouflage
special_charm.description: Weaver-spirits ignore this spirit. In areas of strong Weaver activity, guards might notice something amiss. Difficulty to see through deception = 10 - Charm user's Rage.

fetch_spider.image: Looks largely like Pattern Spiders but with more organic rounding to joints. Glass Walker glyph subtly marked on abdomen underside.
fetch_spider.weakness: Fragile. Higher Rage = harder to pass as Weaver-spirit. Best at avoiding confrontation.

fetch_hawk.name: Fetch-Hawk
fetch_hawk.description: Wasp-like spirits groomed by Spiral Theurges. Hunt Kin-Fetches, parasitize them, then misdirect them to bring news of First Change to Dancers instead.

special_charm.name: Parasitic Possession
special_charm.description: As Possession Charm, but can sink essence into another spirit. Gains +3 dice to Gnosis roll to possess Kin-Fetches specifically.

fetch_hawk.image: Named after tarantula hawk wasps. Size of a man's thumb, long syringe-like abdomen, extra sets of bale-green compound eyes. Speech is wheezy whisper from beating wings.
fetch_hawk.tactics: Uses Tracking to scent out Kin-Fetches, possesses them, lies dormant. When host witnesses First Change, takes control and flees to nearest Hive to report target location.

blight_nurse.name: Blight Nurse
blight_nurse.description: Corrupted Kin-Fetches that have been twisted by the Wyrm. Instead of watching over Kin for the tribe, they watch over Kin for the Black Spiral Dancers.
blight_nurse.note: Stats and details vary. Storyteller creation based on original Kin-Fetch type.

story_hooks.interception: Kin-Fetch never arrived at sept after reporting a First Change. Spirit may have been intercepted by enemy.
story_hooks.nest_robbing: Intercepted Black Spiral Dancer Kin-Fetch trying to report in. Chance to rescue new Garou from corruption - but cub has blackened Rage in their blood.
story_hooks.chrysalis: Veteran Kin-Fetch showing increased intelligence, on verge of becoming Blood Fetch. But getting distracted in newfound awareness.
story_hooks.subtlety_required: Tribe needs to remove Kin-Fetches from older members of callow Kin family without causing a ruckus.
story_hooks.information_war: Tech-savvy Spiral Theurge has innovated way to track/detect Gaian Kin-Fetches via corrupted Weaver magic.
story_hooks.unknown_cousin: Stranger bears fetch brand but isn't from any known Kin bloodline. Could be callow Kin from a lost cadet branch.
story_hooks.presumed_extinct: Kin-Fetch tied to one of the Lost Tribes appears at caern. How could it still be bound after all these years?

numina_overview.description: Supernatural potentials among mortals who haven't had First Change, Awakening, Embrace, or died. Three categories: hedge magic, psychic phenomena, True Faith.
limitations: Having more than one type of Numina is extremely rare
Different Numina operate under mutually exclusive paradigms
Learning too many mystical powers from disparate sources strains mental health

hedge_magic.description: Different aspects of mystical ability including Brewing, Cursing, Healing, and Summoning. Does not require Awakened Avatar. Uses potions, rituals, and belief systems (totemic magic, mountain hoodoo, herbal magic).
hedge_magic.casting_method: Through rituals. Each level describes range of powers but hedge magician casts specific effects through specific rituals. Cannot cast willy-nilly.
hedge_magic.ritual_learning: Each new level grants one new ritual for that level. A different ritual exists for every object or item.

conjuration.name: Conjuration
conjuration.description: Move objects from one place to another: pull rabbits from hats, summon swords, move human-sized objects without touching.
conjuration.note: Objects must be prepared in advance using methods dictated by caster's belief system. Cannot substitute items.

levels.1: Nudge tiny object (coin, card, small knife) within 10 feet. No real force; anyone can stop it.
levels.2: Move/conjure small, simple item (book, rope, jar) within 15 feet. Strength roll difficulty 5 to stop.
levels.3: Large/complex objects (swords, laptops, 200 lbs max) or simple lifeforms (snails, insects) within 25 feet. Strength difficulty 7 to stop.
levels.4: Living mammals, reptiles, birds less than adult human mass. Inanimate objects like steamer trunks or small pianos. 50 feet range.
levels.5: Human or human-sized creature/object from 60 feet. Living subject must be willing or unconscious. Botching can cause serious injury or death.

conjuration.scaling: For each level known above required level, may move one additional object

divination.name: Divination
divination.description: Perceive the past or future through various methods (tarot, crystal gazing, tea leaves, etc.).

levels.2: Vague impressions about near future or recent past
levels.3: Specific visions of events within a week
levels.4: Detailed information about events within a month
levels.5: Clear visions of distant past or far future, prophecies

healing.name: Healing
healing.description: Hedge magic healing through herbs, rituals, and spiritual practices. Different from psychic Empathic Healing.

levels.1: Cure minor ailments, headaches, minor infections
levels.2: Heal minor injuries, ease chronic pain
levels.5: Miraculous healing, regenerate tissue, cure terminal conditions

herbalism_brewing.name: Herbalism/Brewing
herbalism_brewing.description: Creating potions, elixirs, and herbal preparations with supernatural effects.

levels.1: Simple teas and poultices for minor effects
levels.3: Complex brews affecting mind or body

spirit_chasing.name: Spirit Chasing
spirit_chasing.description: Especially meaningful for Kinfolk hedge mages. Allows limited interaction with spirit world.

levels.3: Negotiate with minor spirits, summon small spirits
levels.4: Command minor spirits, communicate with powerful spirits
levels.5: Summon and bargain with major spirits, limited Umbral awareness

psychic_phenomena.description: Mental powers. Characters rarely possess more than one type. Known as 'second sight' or 'dreaming true'.

empathic_healing.name: Empathic Healing
empathic_healing.description: Psychic ability to heal others by absorbing their injuries or illness into oneself.

levels.3: Absorb moderate injuries (lethal damage), minor illnesses

empathic_healing.cost: The healer typically takes a portion of the damage they heal

soulstealing.name: Soulstealing
soulstealing.description: Psychic ability to drain vitality, health, or even Gnosis from others.

levels.1: Sense Vitality: Detect life force and health in targets
levels.2: Drain Fatigue: Steal energy, causing exhaustion in target
levels.3: Steal Willpower: For every two successes, steal one point of Willpower, retaining until spent
levels.4: Shift Life: Every two successes transfers one Health Level to psychic's body as extra Bruised level or heals one lost Health Level. Can add up to twice normal Health Levels (up to 7).
levels.5: Gnosis Theft: Every two successes steals and keeps one point of Gnosis until spent. Even without Gnosis Merit, can use stolen Gnosis to power Gifts or use fetishes. Once used, does not return.

true_faith.name: True Faith
true_faith.description: Deep-seated, unshakeable devotion to the divine (Gaia, God, or other higher power). Ranges from 1-10.
true_faith.starting: Kinfolk with this Numen start with 1 dot
true_faith.general_effect: Adds to Willpower rolls in critical situations (+1 per point of Faith). Does NOT add to rites, Gifts, Psychic Phenomena, Hedge Magic, or similar.

specific_effects.vs_vampires_wraiths: May repel them. Roll Faith vs opponent's Willpower.
specific_effects.vs_mages: Each point acts as a die of countermagic.
specific_effects.vs_wyrm_creatures: Kinfolk with True Faith in Gaia may repel Wyrm creatures and Wyrm-tainted individuals (same as vampires/wraiths).
specific_effects.willpower_bonus: May gain additional temporary Willpower per point of True Faith
specific_effects.miracles: At higher levels, may produce miraculous effects: heal a Health Level to prevent death, receive second chance at failed action, fortuitous intervention when all seems lost

true_faith.advancement: Does NOT increase through experience points. Storyteller awards based on character's actions.

fellowships.description: Organized groups of Kinfolk that provide mutual support, resources, and services across tribal lines.

black_eagles.name: The Black Eagles
black_eagles.description: Specialize in locating and recovering lost or callow Kinfolk families who have been separated from their tribes. Often called upon by Garou for recovery operations.

gaia_network.name: The Gaia Network
gaia_network.description: Kinfolk environmentalists who coordinate conservation efforts and share information about ecological threats across the globe.

locksmiths.name: The Locksmiths
locksmiths.description: Kinfolk skilled in gaining access to restricted areas, breaking into secure locations, and bypassing security systems. Invaluable for intelligence gathering.

namid.name: NAMID
namid.description: Kinfolk organization dedicated to protecting and preserving indigenous peoples' lands, culture, and traditional knowledge.

silvertree_genealogical_society.name: The Silvertree Genealogical Society
silvertree_genealogical_society.description: Maintain extensive records of Kinfolk bloodlines. Help locate lost family members and trace lineages. Crucial resource for breeding decisions and identifying callow Kin.

sisterhood.name: The Sisterhood
sisterhood.description: Network of female Kinfolk who support one another through shared experiences, particularly regarding relationships with Garou and the unique challenges facing women in Garou society.

widdershins_society.name: Widdershins Society
widdershins_society.description: Kinfolk interested in supernatural knowledge, hedge magic, and other mystical practices. Share lore and techniques. Sometimes viewed with suspicion by Garou.

wolfenhome.name: Wolfenhome
wolfenhome.description: Network of safe houses and sanctuaries for Kinfolk and Garou in need. Provide shelter, resources, and assistance to those fleeing danger.

secret_societies.description: Covert Kinfolk organizations that pursue their own agendas, sometimes at odds with Garou leadership.
secret_societies.warning: Secret Kinfolk societies take their lives into their hands - Garou may equate them with Skin Dancers.

judges_of_gaia.name: Judges of Gaia
judges_of_gaia.description: Kinfolk who take justice into their own hands when they believe Garou fail to address wrongs committed against Kinfolk. Some see them as vigilantes; others as necessary balance to Garou power.

eleusines.name: The Eleusines
eleusines.description: Kinfolk who preserve and study ancient rites and lore that Garou have forbidden or forgotten. Named after the Eleusinian Mysteries of ancient Greece.

religions_and_cults.description: Religious movements and spiritual practices unique to Kinfolk communities.

buriers.name: Buriers
buriers.description: Kinfolk who specialize in proper burial rites and veneration of the dead. Believe proper funeral practices ensure ancestors can aid the living.

kinhome.name: Kinhome
kinhome.description: Movement advocating for Kinfolk to develop their own spiritual practices separate from Garou dominance. Sometimes controversial among traditional Garou.

lunae.name: Lunae
lunae.description: Kinfolk who worship Luna directly. Hold ceremonies during different moon phases and seek Luna's blessing for fertility and protection.

reincarnates.name: Reincarnates
reincarnates.description: Kinfolk who believe they are reincarnated souls, possibly of past Garou or heroic Kinfolk. Some claim memories of past lives.

tribal_kinfolk_overview.black_furies: Primarily female Kinfolk maintain traditions of strong women. Male Kin often given to other tribes.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.bone_gnawers: Street-level Kinfolk from diverse backgrounds. Resourceful urban survivors.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.children_of_gaia: Kinfolk from all walks of life. Known for counselors who help other Kin transition.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.fianna: Celtic-heritage Kinfolk preserve traditions of music, storytelling, and revelry.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.get_of_fenris: Northern European Kinfolk expected to be strong and capable. Martial training common.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.glass_walkers: Urban professional Kinfolk integrated into corporate and technological spheres.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.red_talons: Almost entirely wolf Kinfolk. Human Kin extremely rare and often uncomfortable.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.shadow_lords: Eastern European heritage Kinfolk. Political savvy and ambition encouraged.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.silent_striders: Wandering Kinfolk spread across the globe. Many in nomadic communities.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.silver_fangs: Aristocratic Kinfolk from noble bloodlines. Emphasis on Pure Breed.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.stargazers: Asian and philosophical Kinfolk. Meditation and balance important.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.uktena: Indigenous peoples as Kinfolk. Maintain ancient traditions and lore.
tribal_kinfolk_overview.wendigo: Native American Kinfolk, particularly northern tribes. Strong cultural identity.

fallen_tribe_kinfolk.bunyip: Australian Kinfolk who lost their Garou protectors. Scattered survivors.
fallen_tribe_kinfolk.black_spiral_dancers: Corrupted Kinfolk often kept as slaves or breeding stock. Some escape and seek redemption.
fallen_tribe_kinfolk.croatan: Kinfolk believed extinct. Any survivors would be remarkable.
fallen_tribe_kinfolk.white_howlers: Ancient Kinfolk from Britain. Bloodlines may persist unknown among Black Spiral Dancer kin.

equipment.name: Equipment
equipment.description: Access to specialized equipment not available through standard channels. Once used up, lost, stolen, or destroyed, cannot be replaced except through roleplay.

levels.1: One minor item: silver bullets, quality Kevlar vests, street-level drugs
levels.2: Two minor items: laser sights, healing herbs, gas masks, police-issue pepper spray
levels.3: One major item: explosive ammunition, wiretaps, pharmaceuticals, surgical field kits, white noise generators. With Gnosis Merit (5 pts), may have a lesser talen.
levels.4: Two major items: specialized vehicles, military-issue firearms, electron microscopes. With Gnosis Merit (6 pts), may have a greater talen.
levels.5: One unique item: high-tech experimental firearms, magical crystal balls, untraceable poisons. With Gnosis Merit (7 pts), may own one powerful talen.

garou_favor.name: Garou Favor
garou_favor.description: A big favor owed by a Garou for rescuing Kinfolk, saving a life, or preventing caern destruction. One-time use. Can be positive boon or avoid negative effect.

levels.1: One favor from a Garou of low rank (0-1)
levels.2: One favor from a Garou of medium rank (2)
levels.3: One favor from a Garou of high rank (3-4)
levels.4: One favor from a Garou of highest rank (5)
levels.5: One favor from a tribal leader

renown.name: Renown (Kinfolk)
renown.description: Temporary Renown awarded for exceptional actions. Does not confer Garou rank. Garou recognize and honor Kinfolk with Renown but demand more work.
renown.note: Points may be distributed among Glory, Honor, or Wisdom

rites_background.name: Rites (Kinfolk)
rites_background.description: Knowledge of Kinfolk-specific rites. Each level grants knowledge of that many levels worth of rites.

restricted_backgrounds.note: Kinfolk may NOT purchase: Ancestors, Past Life, Totem, Fetish (as Background). May take Fetish as a Merit instead.

intuition.name: Intuition
intuition.description: Innate sixth sense for hunches, sensing lies, and stringing together overlooked clues

levels.1: Novice: Instincts help find the right track
levels.2: Practiced: Follow initial guess without second-guessing
levels.3: Competent: Always know when something's going down
levels.4: Expert: Know not only what's wrong, but who's behind it
levels.5: Master: Insights and hunches scare you sometimes

bureaucracy.name: Bureaucracy
bureaucracy.description: Understanding organizational politics, navigating red tape, and manipulating administrative systems

levels.1: Student: Maneuver around administrative obstacles in everyday life
levels.2: College: Experience with agencies, HR departments, understanding of legal procedures
levels.3: Masters: Work within or for governments or large organizations, cut red tape
levels.4: Doctorate: Work for a government agency or lobbyist group, large-scale connections
levels.5: Scholar: Can arrange meetings with almost anyone, skills to run multinational corporations

herbalism.name: Herbalism
herbalism.description: Using healing and cooking herbs, growing and harvesting herbs, making natural products

levels.1: Student: Make basic herbal mixtures, identify most standard herbs
levels.2: College: Identify, plant, grow and harvest most herbs, make most concoctions
levels.3: Masters: Doctor of herbs, diagnose illnesses and prescribe herbal cures
levels.4: Doctorate: Complex herbal cures, treat any wound with confidence
levels.5: Scholar: Could write books, teach at university level

veterinary_medicine.name: Veterinary Medicine
veterinary_medicine.description: Medical care for animals including wolf Kin and lupus Garou

levels.1: Student: First aid and emergency treatment on animals and Garou
levels.2: College: Basic veterinary knowledge, needs field experience
levels.3: Masters: D.V.M., care for everything from gerbils to elephants
levels.4: Doctorate: Established reputation, major surgery under difficult conditions
levels.5: Scholar: Published papers and books, qualified to teach

rituals.name: Rituals (Kinfolk)
rituals.description: Kinfolk version enabling participation in Kinfolk rites and general Garou ritual knowledge

levels.1: Student: Closely watched as other Kinfolk perform rites
levels.2: College: Successfully participated in rites performed by others
levels.3: Masters: Teach rites to other Kinfolk
levels.4: Doctorate: Garou watch you to pick up pointers
levels.5: Scholar: Create your own rites, could write a book on the subject

rituals.note: A character cannot learn a rite of a level higher than her Rituals rating

supernatural_kinfolk.name: Supernatural Kinfolk
supernatural_kinfolk.description: For playing a vampire, mage, wraith, or changeling who is also Kinfolk. Despite supernatural status, your Garou tribe accepts you as Kin.
supernatural_kinfolk.details: Individuals outside your family may not like you. Other tribes may not acknowledge you as Kin. You may experience conflict walking between two supernatural worlds.
supernatural_kinfolk.note: Reserved exclusively for characters constructed as wraiths, vampires, mages or changelings. Standard mortal Kinfolk may NOT take this Merit.

alert_kin_fetch.name: Alert Kin-Fetch
alert_kin_fetch.description: You never Changed, but your Garou relatives never freed the Kin-Fetch bound to you. The spirit is unusually alert and responsive, occasionally whispering warnings.
alert_kin_fetch.effect: Once per story, alerts you to danger as if you had successfully rolled on the Danger Sense Merit.
alert_kin_fetch.drawback: You still have your fetch brand. Any Garou who sees it - including Black Spiral Dancers - instantly knows you for Kin.
alert_kin_fetch.note: Even callow Kin can take this Merit.

airhead.name: Airhead
airhead.description: Your personal concerns are so important that you tend to be clueless about the real world. You fade in and out of conversations, insert non sequiturs, or just plain fail to get it.
airhead.effect: Described as 'spacey'. The Garou and even your own Kin make fun of you behind your back.

flashbacks.name: Flashbacks
flashbacks.description: You survived a traumatic catastrophe (battlefield, childhood, etc.) and re-live the horror as if it were happening now.

levels.1: Momentary flashes, enough to rattle you for a single action or a few minutes.
levels.2: Flashback can last an entire scene. Requires action from someone trusted to bring you back (no roll required).
levels.3: Feel the terror anew, struggle to escape. Everyone becomes part of your horror scenario. Family/friend may try up to three contested Willpower rolls to bring you back, then need professional help.

unscented.name: Unscented
unscented.description: You have no noticeable body odor. Your scent is practically undetectable by animals and Garou.
unscented.advantage: May help hiding from scent-driven predators.
unscented.disadvantage: Garou instinctually distrust anyone without a scent, suspecting supernatural means to hide Wyrm taint. No Gifts like Scent of the True Form can reveal you as Kinfolk.

wyrm_tainted.name: Wyrm-Tainted
wyrm_tainted.description: Whether through actions in the Wyrm's service, hereditary blemish, or bad supernatural luck, you reek of Wyrm-taint.
wyrm_tainted.effect: Certain Gifts enable Garou to identify you as marked by the Wyrm. Most werewolves may try to kill you outright.
wyrm_tainted.warning: Not to be taken lightly. Work with Storyteller to determine how you acquired this taint.

malingering_kin_fetch.name: Malingering Kin-Fetch
malingering_kin_fetch.description: The Kin-Fetch bound to you was never freed, and its attentions have become unpleasantly obsessive.
malingering_kin_fetch.effect: Whispers for you to Change in times of stress, giving -2 penalty to Perception rolls in difficult situations.
malingering_kin_fetch.drawback: You still have your fetch brand. Any Garou can recognize you as Kin if they see the glyph.
malingering_kin_fetch.note: Can be particularly unpleasant and frightening for callow Kin.

overview.name: Skin Dancers
overview.origin: A Kinfolk called 'the Skinner' discovered a blasphemous rite to become a werewolf using the skins of five Garou.
overview.status: Despised by the Garou Nation. Effectively writing your own death sentence - you just have to be smart enough to avoid enforcement.

recruitment.approach: Many Garou don't tell Kin that Skin Dancers exist - which lets Dancers introduce themselves first.
recruitment.pitch: Smooth-talking ideals about how great it'd be if Kinfolk could stand eye-to-eye with Garou.
recruitment.core_question: How much do I want power?

acquisition_methods: Voluntary donation (rumored to produce Wyrm-free Skin Dancers)

characteristics.former_kin: They were Kinfolk before turning on their Garou relatives.
characteristics.methods: Committed atrocities to gain their power. Methods aren't justifiable but make sense to them.
characteristics.threat: Subversion. Can turn a Garou's family against her - nobody knows where to stick the knife like family.

strengths: Focus heavily on Abilities and Attributes (had to be skilled and tough to collect skins)
Good with rites (demands of learning Rite of Sacred Rebirth)
weaknesses: Gift selection is shoddy
Focus more on breed and auspice Gifts
Lack tribal affinity
Lack numbers and resources (unlike Black Spiral Dancers)
mechanics.organization: Cults of personality built around charismatic, capable leaders

real_danger.not_murder: Most Skin Dancers would rather recruit or subvert than murder. They need the numbers.
real_danger.listening_to_them: A Kinfolk suspected of Skin Dancer sympathies is at much greater risk from their own Garou cousins.
real_danger.keeping_secrets: Dangerous to keep secrets from werewolf relatives. Garou remember how the Skinner's legacy started. Secret Kinfolk societies risk being equated with Skin Dancers.

narrative_role.temptation: Points out power imbalance between Kinfolk and shapeshifters, offers way to balance scales.
narrative_role.threat_to_family: Possible danger to character's loved ones.
narrative_role.underdog_status: Fundamentally underdogs - usually reserved for protagonists. Need to be clever and ruthless to be proper antagonists.
narrative_role.articulate_complaint: Like Spirals, can explain their reasoning. Core complaint is understandable even if methods aren't justifiable.

story_uses: Kinfolk NPC who has been contacted by Dancers
Investigation into who collected pelts from recent Garou deaths
Former family member returns as a Skin Dancer
Rumors of 'clean' Skin Dancers who were gifted all five pelts
Kinfolk PC tempted by Dancer recruitment
Garou suspecting Kinfolk of Dancer sympathies (possibly wrongly)

rite_rules.garou_participation: May be asked to lead or participate as courtesy; free to refuse leading with no negative implications

rites_of_accord.description: Seek to restore or create harmony within a Kinfolk family or group. Element of symbolic rebirth or new beginning. No supernatural power unless ritemaster possesses and spends Gnosis.

rite_of_apology.name: Rite of Apology
rite_of_apology.description: When family members have serious disagreement and wish to make amends permanently. Each person focuses on transferring negative feeling onto paper, exchanges papers, then rips them in half together. Papers are burned.
rite_of_apology.system: Each Kinfolk spends 1 Willpower to transfer feeling onto paper. No roll needed. Willpower cannot be regained for 24 hours. Effect is permanent for that quarrel.

rite_of_unity_of_purpose.name: Rite of Unity of Purpose
rite_of_unity_of_purpose.description: Enacted when major issue divides a Kinfolk family or family is about to undertake major project (moving, going into combat as a family unit).

sway_the_hand_of_anger.name: Sway the Hand of Anger
sway_the_hand_of_anger.description: Protects a related Kinfolk from a Garou's frenzy. A trickster-spirit bonds to the Kin; if the designated Garou frenzies and threatens the Kin, the spirit redirects the Garou to attack other targets. Spirit is freed after this happens.
sway_the_hand_of_anger.system: Locate a household or trickster-spirit (usually with Garou help), convince it to latch onto the Kinfolk. Spend 1 Gnosis, roll Charisma + Rituals (difficulty = spirit's Willpower). Rite must be repeated each time for continued protection.

rites_of_the_milestones.description: Mark major life events in Kinfolk existence.

rite_of_welcoming.name: Rite of Welcoming (Birth)
rite_of_welcoming.description: Welcomes a newborn into the Kinfolk family.

rites_of_the_homestead.description: Rites for protecting and blessing Kinfolk homes.

rite_of_homestead_dedication.name: Rite of Homestead Dedication
rite_of_homestead_dedication.description: Dedicates and blesses a home for a Kinfolk family.
