rite_of_protection.name: Rite of Protection
rite_of_protection.description: Provides mystical protection for a home or location.

rite_of_true_seeing.name: Rite of True Seeing
rite_of_true_seeing.description: Grants ability to see through illusions or deceptions within the homestead.

rites_of_punishment.description: Rites for dealing with disruptive or wayward family members.

rite_of_exile.name: Rite of Exile
rite_of_exile.description: When a Kinfolk has proven so disruptive as to destroy family unity. Requires agreement from every household member at least 12 years old (or 2 years for lupus). Exile is usually at least a year and a day, sometimes five years or more.
rite_of_exile.process: Ritemaster reads bad behavior (serious drug/alcohol abuse, physical abuse, criminal behavior, consorting with Wyrm). Subject may speak for themselves. Words ring true or sound flat indicating sincerity or lies.
rite_of_exile.system: Ritemaster prepares candle inscribed with subject's name. Spends 1 Gnosis to light candle. Roll Charisma + Rituals (difficulty 7). If completed, ritemaster forcefully blows out and snaps candle. Creates barrier preventing exile from returning within one mile of household.
rite_of_exile.conditions_for_return: Stated at end of rite (e.g., proving sobriety)

rite_of_intervention.name: Rite of Intervention
rite_of_intervention.description: When a family member needs to face truth about themselves or take action they would otherwise refuse. Similar to mundane interventions but with Gnosis behind it.
rite_of_intervention.system: Family arranges subject to be present. Ritemaster announces rite beginning. Each family member contributes and expresses caring. Spend 1 Gnosis or 2 Willpower, roll Charisma + Rituals. More successes = more persuasive.

rites_of_renown.description: Mark acts of heroism or brave deeds in defense of family, tribe, or Gaia's children. Do not confer Garou Renown unless Garou agree to award temporary Renown.

rite_of_challenge.name: Rite of Challenge
rite_of_challenge.description: During a gathering, one Kinfolk may issue a challenge to another. Both work out details, who judges, and how to determine success.
examples: I challenge you to a race
I challenge you to stay overnight in the cave and bring proof
rite_of_challenge.system: Both Kinfolk spend 1 Willpower to seal the challenge. On completion, successful challenger gets Willpower back; on failure, the challenger gets theirs back.

minor_rites.description: Individual rites throughout the day to reinforce dedication to Gaia, tribe, and family. Take half time to learn and cost half as much. Usually require no Gnosis/Willpower and need not be secret.

rite_of_the_morning_song.name: Rite of the Morning Song
rite_of_the_morning_song.description: Rise before dawn and greet first sun rays with praise to Helios through singing, poetry, chanting, or other vocalization.
rite_of_the_morning_song.effect: If performed for nine straight sunrises, gain ability to Sense Wyrm for the rest of each day as if possessing the Garou Gift. Missing even one morning requires starting over.

rite_of_evening_chant.name: Rite of Evening Chant
rite_of_evening_chant.description: Sing Luna's praises through one entire phase of the moon for at least 15 minutes each night (songs, poetry, stories).
rite_of_evening_chant.effect: Receive +1 die on all Social interactions with Garou of the same auspice as the moon phase during which the rite was performed. Effect lasts until that moon phase comes around again.

note_baptism_of_fire.description: Common to kenning Kinfolk. Uses Rite of Baptism of Fire (p.210 W20 Corebook) to assign a Kin Fetch spirit to offspring. Kinfolk ritemaster cannot summon the spirit but can use one already present to the family. See Kin Fetches section for more information.

Berserker.effect: Frenzy-like rage (+2 Strength, +2 Stamina, ignore wound penalties, -2 dice all non-combat)

Regeneration.effect: Heal one health level per turn (as Garou)

Venomous.effect: Poison bite/claws, additional damage over time

Aura of Corruption.effect: Spread Wyrm taint to nearby area/people

Immunity.effect: Immune to one damage type (fire, cold, etc.)

Addiction.effect: Requires substance to function; withdrawal causes penalties

Deformity (Minor).effect: Visible but concealable; no mechanical effect

Deformity (Major).effect: Obvious; -1 to social rolls with unaware humans

Deterioration.effect: Slowly dying; loses 1 health level per month permanently

Vulnerability.effect: Takes extra damage from one source (silver, fire, etc.)

Wyrm Taint.effect: Detectable by Sense Wyrm and similar abilities

creation_rules.balance: Total Taint value must equal or exceed total Power cost

powers: Armored Skin (4)
Claws (3)
Darksight (2)
Mind Control (4)
Heightened Sense x2 (2)

Elder Alpha.description: The supreme leader of the sept, responsible for final decisions and representing the sept to outsiders
responsibilities: Make final decisions on sept matters
Elder Alpha.typical_auspice: Any, but Philodox and Ahroun most common
Elder Alpha.selection: Challenge, election, or inheritance depending on tribal majority

Warder.description: Sept security chief responsible for caern defense and organizing patrols
Warder.selection: Challenge or appointment by Elder Alpha

Master of the Rite.description: Primary ritemaster responsible for sept's spiritual health and leading ceremonies
Master of the Rite.selection: Appointment based on ritual knowledge and Gnosis

Master of the Howl.description: Opens moots, leads howls, and maintains sept's vocal traditions
responsibilities: Open and close moots with proper howls
Preserve tribal and sept howling traditions
Maintain the sept's oral history through howl
Master of the Howl.selection: Demonstration of skill; often informal recognition
Master of the Howl.notes: May also serve as Talesinger if positions combined

Talesinger.description: Keeper of sept history and performer of epic tales
Talesinger.notes: Sometimes combined with Master of the Howl

Keeper of the Land.description: Maintains bawn and surrounding territory, monitors borders
responsibilities: Report territory changes to Elder Alpha

Den Mother/Father.description: Cares for cubs and young Garou, oversees Rite of Passage preparation
responsibilities: Shelter and feed cubs before First Change
Teach basic Garou culture and Litany
Prepare cubs for Rite of Passage
Den Mother/Father.typical_auspice: Any; Philodox and Children of Gaia common
Den Mother/Father.selection: Appointment based on temperament and patience
Den Mother/Father.notes: One of few positions where metis face less discrimination

Truthcatcher.notes: May be same as Elder Alpha in small septs

Gatekeeper.description: Controls access to Moon Bridges and caern entry from Umbra
Gatekeeper.selection: Must know Rite of the Opened Bridge
Gatekeeper.notes: Critical position; bridge misuse can doom sept

Wyrmfoe.description: Specialist in tracking and destroying Wyrm corruption
Wyrmfoe.notes: High mortality rate; often temporary position

Master of the Challenge.description: Oversees formal challenges and ensures fair combat
Master of the Challenge.selection: Appointment; must be respected by all
Master of the Challenge.notes: Often combined with Warder or Truthcatcher

position_hierarchy.note: Hierarchy varies by sept; this is a common arrangement

Rite of Succession.description: Formal rite when taking sept position
Rite of Succession.system: Ritemaster recites credentials; successor brings sacrifice (human or animal); all eat; bone carved with position glyph; sept howls
Rite of Succession.benefits: If predecessor present and participates: +Rank bonus dice. Successor gains 1 temp Honor per 2 successes (round up).

common_combinations: Warder + Master of the Challenge + Wyrmfoe
Keeper of the Land + Den Mother/Father

black_spiral_litany.description: The twisted mirror of the Gaian Litany, guiding Black Spiral Dancer society

tenets.tenet: Reveal Your Secret Face to the Darkness of the World
tenets.meaning: Show your true corrupted nature to fellow Spirals; do not hide what you are among your own

tenets.tenet: Hunt Only for the Wyrm and Its Will
tenets.meaning: All kills serve corruption; hunting for personal pleasure alone is wasteful

tenets.tenet: Accept the Blight of the Wyrm
tenets.meaning: Embrace Wyrm taint, don't resist it; corruption is strength

tenets.tenet: Respect the Territory of the Powerful
tenets.meaning: Might makes right; stronger Spirals claim better territory

tenets.tenet: Accept All Challenges from Those Above You
tenets.meaning: Ritual combat determines rank; you must answer challenges from superiors

tenets.tenet: Submission to Those of Higher Station
tenets.meaning: Hierarchy of power is absolute; obey those who have proven stronger

tenets.tenet: Offer the First Share of the Kill to Those of Greater Glory
tenets.meaning: Feed the powerful first; earn your place through service

tenets.tenet: Do Not Consume the Flesh of Humans or Wolves
tenets.meaning: Often ignored by modern hives; some traditional Pits still observe this
Absolute obedience to those of higher rank

tenets.tenet: Do Not Suffer the People of the Goddess to Live
tenets.meaning: Gaians must die; this is the core commandment

tenets.tenet: Respect Those Beneath You, for All Serve
tenets.meaning: Even the weak have uses; don't waste resources
Protect hive locations, plans, identities; betrayal is death

renown_system.description: Black Spirals track Renown differently from Gaians

Infamy.earned_by: Atrocities, victories against Gaians, terrorizing enemies, spectacular destruction

Cunning.earned_by: Trickery, successful plots, infiltration, deception, stealing secrets

Power.earned_by: Dominance displays, gaining Wyrm favor, spiritual might, commanding Banes, political maneuvering

renown_system.note: Rank advancement uses these three Renown types as Gaians use Glory/Honor/Wisdom

modern_approach.description: Kinfolk as useful agents kept at distance

kinfolk_relationships.note: Many hives blend approaches - some Kinfolk are 'investments', others are expendable

pit_creation_methods.description: Digging beneath corrupted lands to create connections to Malfeas
pit_creation_methods.advantage: Hidden from surface, easy Umbral access

pit_creation_methods.description: Former Gaian caerns, corrupted after victory
pit_creation_methods.advantage: Most powerful Pits, strongest Umbral connections
pit_creation_methods.disadvantage: Gaians never stop trying to reclaim

pit_creation_methods.description: Places of power Gaians never found first
pit_creation_methods.advantage: No prior Gaian claim, easier to hide

pit_creation_methods.description: Sites of great tragedy, pollution, or corruption
pit_creation_methods.advantage: Easier to establish, plentiful in modern world

balefire.function: Powers rites, provides warmth that chills the soul
balefire.appearance: Sickly green, blue, or black flames

spiral_labyrinth.function: Where cubs undergo the Dance of the Black Spiral
spiral_labyrinth.design: Nine circles descending, often carved into stone or earth

breeding_pens.note: Modern hives may eschew this for distant Kinfolk networks

shrine.contents: Varies by patron - skulls, toxins, rotting offerings

defenses.spiritual: Bane sentries, Rite of Shrouded Glen effects

example_pits.name: La Bête Noire (The Black Beast)
example_pits.history: Site of mass slave deaths, became corrupted ground. BSDs claimed it in early 1800s.
example_pits.leadership: Ancient Metis Theurge known as Grandmother Gris-Gris
example_pits.notable: Allied with local vampire population, unusual tolerance

example_pits.name: The Swallowing Caves
example_pits.history: Wendigo caern captured in 1890s during deliberate campaign. Still not fully corrupted.
example_pits.notable: Wendigo still attempt reclamation every few decades

example_pits.name: The Nameless Tower
example_pits.location: New York City, exact location shifts
example_pits.history: Exists in the Umbra primarily, physical anchors change. Connected to city's despair.
example_pits.leadership: Council of three elders representing different Urge Wyrms
example_pits.notable: Primary East Coast coordination center for Pentex operations

example_pits.name: The Screaming Stones
example_pits.history: Original White Howler territory, where the tribe first fell
example_pits.leadership: Keeper of the Spiral, hereditary position
example_pits.specialty: Training cubs, Dance of the Black Spiral
example_pits.notable: Most sacred site for BSDs, pilgrimage destination

creation_notes.spirit_gnosis_reduction: Garou spends Gnosis to reduce spirit's Gnosis before binding roll
creation_notes.multiple_talens: Each success beyond first creates additional talen of same type
creation_notes.powerful_spirits: Jagglings and above add +2-3 to talen count

creation_rules.overview: Fetishes are permanent magical items containing bound spirits. Level reflects power; Gnosis rating reflects the spirit's strength and activation difficulty.
creation_rules.attunement: Roll Gnosis (difficulty = fetish's Gnosis rating). Silver fetishes reduce effective Gnosis by 1.
creation_rules.design_principle: Higher levels = more powerful effects, but higher Gnosis = harder to activate and attune

level_1.label: Minor Fetish
level_1.power_scope: Single, limited effect; passive or simple activation
effect_types: Minor resistance bonuses (+1-2 difficulty to enemy rolls)
level_1.combat_power: No direct damage; defensive or utility only

Harmony Flute.effect: +2 difficulty to frenzy rolls for listeners

Magpie's Swag.effect: Conceals up to 10 lbs, invisible to detection

design_checklist: Effect is useful but not powerful
No direct damage capability
Single target or small area
Cannot replicate Level 2+ Gift effects
Gnosis 4-5 unless trivial effect (then 3)

level_2.label: Lesser Fetish
level_2.power_scope: Specific, useful effect; active utility or enhanced detection
effect_types: Reliable detection (lies, specific spirit types, magic)
level_2.combat_power: Indirect combat support (tracking enemies, detecting lies)
design_checklist: Effect is reliable and useful in specific situations
May enhance other actions but doesn't replace them
Can affect small groups or single targets strongly
Detection effects are specific, not broad
Gnosis 5 standard; 4 if very limited, 6 if versatile

level_3.label: Fetish
level_3.power_scope: Significant effect; combat weapons, active supernatural powers, area effects
effect_types: Combat weapons with aggravated damage (Str+1 to Str+4)
level_3.combat_power: Direct damage weapons begin here. Typical: Str+2 aggravated, difficulty 6
design_checklist: Combat weapons: Str+1 to Str+4, usually aggravated
Utility effects are supernatural in scope
Area effects are room-sized or affect small groups
May have conditional enhanced effects (vs specific enemies)
Gnosis 5-7: lower for simple effects, higher for versatile ones

level_4.label: Greater Fetish
level_4.power_scope: Powerful effect; signature weapons, major transformation, spirit summoning
level_4.combat_power: Str+2 to Str+4 aggravated with additional effects (returning, bonus powers)
level_4.duration: Permanent transformation possible; active effects last scene+

Klaive.effect: Str+2 aggravated silver, difficulty 6; signature Garou weapon

Labrys of Isthmene.effect: Str+4 aggravated, grants Spirit of the Fray; Black Furies only

Monkey Puzzle.effect: Humans see wearer as human in any form

design_checklist: Combat weapons have secondary effects beyond damage
Non-combat effects are supernatural and powerful
May grant Gift-like abilities
Can have tribal or auspice restrictions
Gnosis 5-8: 5-6 for focused effects, 7-8 for versatile/powerful ones

level_5.label: Legendary Fetish
level_5.power_scope: Legendary effect; chronicle-defining items, unique powers
level_5.combat_power: Str+5 to Str+6 aggravated, often two-handed; may have supernatural side effects
level_5.duration: Permanent effects possible; or major scene-length powers

Grand Klaive.effect: Str+5 aggravated silver, difficulty 7; two-handed, extremely rare

Jarlhammer.effect: Str+6 aggravated silver; thunderclap on kill; only seven exist

Runestones.effect: Visions of future; successes determine clarity

design_checklist: Effects are chronicle-defining or legendary
Should be unique or extremely rare in-world
Combat weapons are devastating (Str+5-6)
Non-combat effects change character's fundamental capabilities
Usually have significant drawbacks or restrictions
Gnosis 6-8; up to 10 for artifacts of immense power

gnosis_rating_guidelines.3: Trivial effect; easy to activate but limited power
gnosis_rating_guidelines.5: Useful effect; standard for Level 1-2, low for Level 3
gnosis_rating_guidelines.6: Significant effect; standard for Level 3, typical for Level 4
gnosis_rating_guidelines.7: Powerful effect; standard for Level 4-5, combat weapons
gnosis_rating_guidelines.8: Major effect; high-end Level 4, transformative effects
gnosis_rating_guidelines.10: Artifact-level; bound Incarna or unique cosmic power

object_selection_guidelines.thematic_matching: Object should relate to the spirit's nature or the effect's function

examples.weapons: Daggers, swords, hammers, whips, axes for war spirits
examples.concealment: Cloaks, veils, bags, pouches for stealth/trickster spirits
examples.detection: Feathers, needles, crystals for truth/tracking spirits
examples.communication: Flutes, whistles, bells for sound/air spirits
examples.protection: Chimes, shields, rings for guardian spirits
examples.transformation: Masks, skins, talismans for trickster/ancestor spirits

material_considerations.silver: Required for weapons meant to harm Garou/Fera; reduces effective Gnosis by 1
material_considerations.gold: Associated with Helios, sun effects, anti-vampire
material_considerations.iron: Strong against Fae; can be combined with silver
material_considerations.bone: Death spirits, ancestor spirits, cold effects

talen_creation_summary.difference_from_fetishes: Single-use; no attunement; created via Rite of Binding
talen_creation_summary.creation_process: Garou spends Gnosis to reduce spirit's Gnosis before binding roll. Each success beyond first creates additional talen.
talen_creation_summary.power_scaling: Similar effects to fetishes but one-time use; can be more powerful per activation

custom_fetish_checklist: Assign Level (1-5) based on power guidelines
Set Gnosis rating based on level and effect strength
Choose appropriate spirit type to bind
Define activation method (roll vs spend Gnosis)
Verify power level matches examples at same Level

meta.description: Spirit ecology, hierarchy, and life cycle

gaffling.description: Simple spirits, animal-like intelligence. They are to the spirit world what wildlife is to the physical.
gaffling.awareness: Limited. Perceive world through lens of their nature. 'What I do' equals 'what I am.'
gaffling.feeding: Attach to objects/places embodying their nature. Enter Slumber to conserve energy.
gaffling.purpose: Serve something larger without questioning. Obsessively uphold duty.

jaggling.description: Sapient spirits with thoughts, personalities, and agendas. The 'people' of the spirit world.
jaggling.awareness: Full sapience. Goals may differ from their Incarna superiors.
jaggling.feeding: Service, worship, active involvement in spiritual affairs. Less Slumber.
jaggling.purpose: Broader purview than Gafflings. Forest vs single tree. Military unit vs single weapon.
jaggling.promotion: Gafflings become Jagglings when their purview increases (sapling becomes forest) or earn promotion from superiors.

incarna.description: Avatars of concepts, existing on multiple levels of reality simultaneously. Leaders of broods.
incarna.awareness: Vast. Experience multiple realities at once. Heritage/genealogy seems arbitrary to flesh-beings.
incarna.feeding: Direct embodiment of their concept. Worship from lesser spirits and shapeshifters.
incarna.purpose: Embody major concepts. Lead spirit broods. Patron totems of tribes and packs.
incarna.complexity: Lion serves as Silver Fang totem (adopted by Griffin's brood) while separate aspect serves Simba werelions (no Griffin connection).

celestine.description: Cosmic entities of almost unimaginable power. Luna, Helios, Gaia herself.
celestine.awareness: Cosmic scale. May not notice individual werewolves.
celestine.feeding: Universal forces. Celestial bodies. Fundamental aspects of reality.
celestine.purpose: Cosmic balance. Creation. The largest possible scale.
celestine.avatars: Send avatars (Incarna-level) to interact with lesser beings.

emanation.description: Spirits outside the normal hierarchy. Not born from impressions or broods.
emanation.origin: Spontaneous creation, cosmic accident, or unique circumstances.
emanation.notes: Do not fit neatly into Gaffling/Jaggling/Incarna progression.

birth.impression_method: Actions/objects in physical world leave impressions in spirit plane. If deep enough, Essence coalesces into spirit matching that 'shape.'
birth.location: May form at location of impression, within the object, or far away in Deep Umbra.

feeding.attachment: Spirits feed by attaching to objects/places that let them embody their nature.
feeding.slumber: Conserve energy through hibernation. Being available is enough for some spirits.
feeding.consumption: Predator spirits hunt and consume prey spirits. Banes do this destructively.
feeding.worship: Higher spirits feed from service and reverence of lesser spirits and shapeshifters.

growth.natural: If purview strengthens (sapling becomes oak), spirit grows.
growth.promotion: More powerful spirits can elevate lesser ones to greater roles.
growth.threshold: Gaffling to Jaggling requires crossing awareness threshold—sapience emerges.

death.destruction: Spirits can be destroyed by combat, starvation, or consuming their Essence.
death.Essence_harvest: Destroyed spirits yield Essence to their destroyer.
death.reformation: Some spirits reform over time if their concept persists.

broods.description: Spirit families descended from Incarnae, like Garou tribes. Related by philosophy/nature rather than literal descent.
broods.structure: All descend from one or more Incarnae and ultimately Gaia.
broods.adoption: Many brood members are adopted rather than literally born from the Incarna.
broods.loyalty: Even if they don't get along, brood members show proper respect and reverence to their Incarna.
broods.offense_consequences: Offending one brood member affects relations with entire brood. May affect pack totems from that brood.
broods.adoption_honor: Very rarely, a brood adopts a worthy werewolf into its ranks—closer than even tribal totem bond. May offer to serve as ancestor spirit after death.

communication.basic: All spirits can communicate with shapeshifters who know the Spirit Speech Gift.
communication.conceptual: Spirits often communicate through their nature—fire spirits through heat/light, etc.
communication.chiminage: Spirits expect proper offerings for assistance. Know what different spirit types prefer.
communication.respect: Shapeshifters command more respect than human visitors as creatures of both flesh and spirit.

by_aspect.wyld_spirits: Chaos, interesting experiences, spontaneity. May help just because it sounds fun.
by_aspect.gaian_spirits: Service to Gaia, protection of nature, destroying Wyrm-spawn.

common_requests.material: Specific objects, sacrifices, things associated with their nature.
common_requests.symbolic: Gestures showing understanding/respect for spirit's concept.
common_requests.strange_favors: Rat-spirit: destroy all mousetraps you see. Night-spirit: share secret you've never told anyone.

Bitter Rages.appearance: Invisible in Realm; swarm of gnats or wasps in Umbra
Bitter Rages.behavior: Drives hosts to greater and greater anger until they destroy themselves
Bitter Rages.tactics: Subtle possession, escalating rage over time

Psychomachiae.appearance: Reflects host's inner demons; personifications of fears

Scrags.appearance: Emaciated humanoid with too many joints, wrong angles
Scrags.behavior: Causes violence and pain wherever possible

Hoglings.tactics: Possess gluttons, drive them to fatal excess

Drattosi.behavior: Saps will to live, encourages giving up

Nexus Crawlers.appearance: Massive corruption incarnate, unique horrific forms
Nexus Crawlers.behavior: Anchors to corrupted locations, spreads taint

Kalus.appearance: Seductive, attractive, changes to match desires
Kalus.behavior: Seduces victims, drives them to destructive acts
Kalus.tactics: Possession of the lustful, corruption through desire

Mara.tactics: Attack through nightmares, drive to madness

creating_banes.step_1: Define what negative concept the Bane embodies
creating_banes.step_5: All Banes have Airt Sense and Corruption charms
creating_banes.step_6: Add Possession if Bane possesses hosts
creating_banes.step_7: Select other charms based on nature

overview.nature: Four Maeljin who embody corrupted versions of the classical elements
overview.origin: Unlike the Urge Wyrm Maeljin, these represent pollution of the physical world itself
overview.domain: Each rules pollution of their element and conflicts with pure elemental spirits

elemental_maeljin.name: Lord Choke
elemental_maeljin.domain: Air pollution, smog, toxic gases, suffocation
elemental_maeljin.appearance: Massive humanoid of swirling gray-brown smog, features only visible as darker patches in the cloud, voice sounds like wheezing
powers: Smog Body - immune to physical attacks, can only be harmed by wind or purified air
Choking Cloud - fills area with toxic smog, causes suffocation
Poison Breath - exhalation is concentrated industrial pollution
Air Corruption - can permanently taint air in an area

destruction.method: Four of the greatest air elementals working together
destruction.difficulty: Air elementals rarely cooperate; convincing four powerful ones requires epic questing
destruction.hint: Each elemental must represent a different wind - north, south, east, west

elemental_maeljin.servants: Smog spirits, industrial Banes, Pentex pollution subsidiaries
elemental_maeljin.duchy: The Choking Sky - endless gray nothing where breathing is agony

elemental_maeljin.name: Lord Kerne
elemental_maeljin.domain: Toxic fire, radiation, burning that corrupts rather than cleanses
elemental_maeljin.appearance: Pillar of sickly green-black flame that takes humanoid shape, face shifts between burning skull and beautiful fire dancer
powers: Balefire Body - immune to fire, touching him causes aggravated damage
Toxic Flames - fire that spreads corruption, wounds don't heal cleanly
Nuclear Heart - can cause radiation sickness in area around him
Corrupt Flames - can turn normal fire into balefire

destruction.method: Freeze solid, then encase in lead
destruction.difficulty: Freezing a being of fire requires incredible cold; lead must be pure
destruction.hint: Some believe the coldest reaches of the Aetherial Realm could provide the necessary cold

elemental_maeljin.servants: Balefire spirits, nuclear waste Banes, Pentex energy subsidiaries
elemental_maeljin.duchy: The Burning Lands - everything on fire but nothing destroyed, just forever burning

elemental_maeljin.name: Lord Collum
elemental_maeljin.domain: Water pollution, industrial runoff, toxic sludge, poisoned wells
elemental_maeljin.appearance: Humanoid shape of thick brown-black sludge, occasionally objects visible within (bones, industrial waste), speaks with gurgling voice
powers: Sludge Body - immune to physical attacks, reshapes around weapons
Polluted Touch - contaminates any water source on contact
Toxic Drowning - can engulf victims, drowning them in poison
Spread Contamination - pollution he creates flows to connected water sources

destruction.method: Plant five seeds of rare purifying plants in his body and allow them to grow
destruction.difficulty: The plants are nearly extinct; seeds must come from five different species
destruction.hint: Mokole and certain Garou Theurges keep seed banks of rare healing plants

elemental_maeljin.servants: Sludge spirits, river-poison Banes, industrial dumping operations
elemental_maeljin.duchy: The Stagnant Sea - endless ocean of toxic sludge where nothing can live

elemental_maeljin.name: Lady Yul
elemental_maeljin.domain: Soil contamination, toxic waste burial, poisoned ground, dead earth
elemental_maeljin.appearance: Woman made of gray, dead soil and toxic crystals, beautiful face but crumbling, everywhere she steps plants die
powers: Dead Earth Body - immune to earth-based attacks, can merge with any soil
Toxic Ground - contaminates soil permanently on contact
Crystal Corruption - grows toxic crystals that poison everything nearby
Earth Memory - can sense everything that has been buried in poisoned ground

destruction.method: Must ingest Moly herb from Pangaea
destruction.difficulty: Pangaea is the legendary lost realm; reaching it is nearly impossible
destruction.hint: Some say the Mokole remember the way; others say fragments of Pangaea survive in the Deep Umbra

elemental_maeljin.servants: Dead earth spirits, toxic waste Banes, illegal dumping operations
elemental_maeljin.duchy: The Barren - endless gray wasteland where nothing has ever grown

elemental_conflicts.pure_vs_corrupted: Each Elemental Maeljin is at eternal war with pure elemental spirits of their type
elemental_conflicts.gaian_elementals: Nature spirits and elemental Jagglings ally against the corrupted elements
elemental_conflicts.pentex_support: Pentex subsidiaries deliberately feed the Elemental Maeljin through industrial pollution

using_elemental_maeljin.environmental_horror: Perfect for chronicles focused on ecological themes
using_elemental_maeljin.local_threats: Their servants can be fought without facing the Maeljin directly
using_elemental_maeljin.quest_hooks: Destruction methods provide epic quest objectives
using_elemental_maeljin.combining_threats: Could work together or be manipulated against each other

overview.nature: The Maeljin Incarna are the Dark Lords of Malfeas - once-human beings who transcended mortality to become Incarna-level Wyrm spirits
overview.origin: Each was a human so devoted to an Urge Wyrm's concept that they literally became an embodiment of it
overview.power: Incarna-level - beyond most Garou to challenge directly
overview.destruction: Each can only be permanently destroyed through a specific, often obscure method

maeljin.name: Aliara
maeljin.title: Queen of Desire
maeljin.domain: Seduction, obsession, wanting what you cannot have
maeljin.appearance: Impossibly beautiful, shifts to match viewer's desires, always has something wrong that makes her more alluring
powers: Perfect seduction - none can resist her initial approach
Know Heart's Desire - instantly knows what anyone wants most
Obsession's Chains - creates unbreakable fixation on target
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.method: Must be killed by someone she genuinely desires
destruction.difficulty: Aliara desires nothing; her desires were burned away in ascension
destruction.hint: Some theorize she might come to desire someone who truly does not want her

maeljin.duchy: The Garden of Longing - everything beautiful but just out of reach

maeljin.name: Lord Steel
maeljin.title: The Faceless King
maeljin.appearance: Massive armored figure, face hidden behind featureless steel mask, blood constantly dripping from gauntlets
powers: Incite Hatred - causes groups to turn on minorities/outsiders
Armor of Rage - physical damage heals instantly unless attacker is at peace
Genocide's Call - can influence mortals to commit mass violence
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.method: Remove his mask, imprison in mirrored room for one lunar month
destruction.difficulty: Mask has never been removed; room of perfect mirrors required
destruction.hint: He cannot bear to see his own face - reminder of the human he was

maeljin.duchy: The Burning Fields - endless war between factions he creates

maeljin.name: Lady Aife
maeljin.title: Mistress of Torments
maeljin.domain: Torture, sadism, suffering for its own sake
maeljin.appearance: Beautiful woman in constantly shifting attire of blades, hooks, and restraints; smiles beatifically while causing agony
powers: Exquisite Agony - can cause any type of pain with a touch
Immortal Torment - victims cannot die from her torture unless she wishes
Empathy of Suffering - knows exactly how to hurt anyone
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.method: Only the Nameless Angel, Pattern Spiders, or entities completely indifferent to pain can slay her
destruction.difficulty: Pattern Spiders serve the Weaver, not Garou; Nameless Angel is another Maeljin
destruction.hint: Some spirits achieve true indifference to suffering through enlightenment

maeljin.duchy: The Scarlet Halls - endless torture chambers where the screaming never stops

maeljin.name: Hellbringer
maeljin.title: Marshal of the Legions
maeljin.domain: War, slaughter, battle for its own sake
maeljin.appearance: Giant warrior in baroque armor, face locked in permanent battle-grimace, carries crossbow that never misses
powers: Perfect Warfare - cannot be outmaneuvered or outsmarted in battle
Crossbow of Destruction - always hits, damage cannot be soaked
Legion's Fury - can animate endless soldiers from the fallen
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.method: Must stab himself with his own crossbow bolt, far from any battle
destruction.difficulty: Hellbringer is always in battle; cannot conceive of peace
destruction.hint: The bolt could theoretically be stolen and used, but he'd have to wield it

maeljin.duchy: The Forever War - endless battlefield where no one truly dies, just keeps fighting

maeljin.name: Knight Entropy
maeljin.title: The Hungry Dark
maeljin.domain: Addiction, gluttony, consuming until nothing remains
maeljin.appearance: Emaciated figure with distended stomach, mouth too wide, eyes that are bottomless pits; constantly eating but never satisfied
powers: Endless Hunger - can consume anything, including abstract concepts
Addiction's Kiss - one touch creates unbreakable addiction
Devour Memory - can eat experiences, leaving hollow shells
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.difficulty: Pure Wyld is almost impossible to find; most Wyld is already touched by other Triat
destruction.hint: Some deep Umbral realms or primordial spirits carry pure Wyld essence

maeljin.duchy: The Hollow - everything has been eaten, nothing but hungry void

maeljin.name: Maine duBois
maeljin.title: The Prince of Lies
maeljin.appearance: Handsome figure in fine clothing, face shifts constantly between trustworthy appearances; speaks with everyone's voice
powers: Perfect Lie - can make anyone believe anything temporarily
Contract's Weight - magical bargains are utterly binding
Know Truth - ironically, knows when he's being lied to
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.method: Must sign a contract requiring forfeit of his existence if broken, where no one profits from the outcome
destruction.difficulty: He would never sign such a contract, and tricking him is nearly impossible
destruction.hint: He honors the letter of contracts absolutely; the trick is in the wording

maeljin.duchy: The Masquerade - endless party where nothing is true and everyone wears masks

maeljin.name: Doge Klypse
maeljin.title: The Watcher
maeljin.appearance: Figure wrapped in shadows, thousands of eyes visible in the darkness, cannot be looked at directly
powers: Eyes Everywhere - can see through any eye, natural or artificial
Seeds of Doubt - one whisper destroys trust between allies
Isolation's Embrace - can cut someone off from all allies spiritually
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.method: Find a brass box containing the memory of the last person he trusted, and show it to him
destruction.difficulty: Box is hidden in Malfeas; he trusted someone once, before ascension
destruction.hint: The box is in his own duchy, hidden from even himself

maeljin.duchy: The Panopticon - endless watchtowers where everyone spies on everyone

maeljin.name: Nameless Angel
maeljin.title: The Void
maeljin.domain: Depression, suicide, hopelessness, the final ending
maeljin.appearance: Beautiful androgynous figure with empty eye sockets, voice that sounds like final breaths, wings of shadowy nothing
powers: Despair's Touch - victim loses all hope, may simply stop living
Final Comfort - appears to suicidal mortals, encourages them
The Empty - can create zones where hope literally cannot exist
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.method: The Concolation ritual, a rite of ultimate hope and renewal
destruction.difficulty: The ritual has been lost for millennia; no one knows it
destruction.hint: Some believe the Stargazers carried fragments of it; others say it's in the Deep Umbra

maeljin.duchy: The Abyss - nothing but emptiness and the slow erosion of self

maeljin.name: Thurifuge
maeljin.title: Lord of Disease
maeljin.domain: Plague, entropy, rot, 'why bother fighting it'
maeljin.appearance: Robed figure constantly decaying and regenerating; locusts and flies swarm around; presence causes exhaustion
powers: Plague's Breath - exhales any disease, natural or supernatural
Entropy's Embrace - accelerates decay in anything
Why Fight - victims lose will to resist, just accept fate
All standard Incarna charms

destruction.method: Drown in the purest healing spring
destruction.difficulty: Such springs are rare; Thurifuge corrupts water he touches
destruction.hint: Springs sacred to healing Incarna might work; getting him there is the challenge

maeljin.duchy: The Plaguelands - everything slowly dying, too tired to do anything about it

using_maeljin.as_antagonists: Maeljin are campaign-ending threats. Fighting one directly should be the climax of a major chronicle.
using_maeljin.servants: More commonly, Garou face Maeljin servants - powerful Banes, cults, fomori devoted to a specific Dark Lord
using_maeljin.boons: Maeljin can grant powers to followers, usually at terrible cost
using_maeljin.weaknesses: Their destruction methods are quest hooks for epic campaigns
using_maeljin.politics: Maeljin scheme against each other; clever Garou might exploit rivalries

animal_spirits.teach: Gifts related to their animal's traits

Englings.notes: Garou hunt them to replenish Gnosis

urban_spirits.description: Modern spirits born of technology and cities

examples.animal_spirits: Respect for their animal, offerings of food

overview.nature: The twelve Urge Wyrms are aspects of the Wyrm embodying specific corruptions
overview.origin: When the Wyrm went mad, its aspects fractured into these entities
overview.relationship: Each is served by a Maeljin Incarna and countless Banes

urge_wyrms.name: Foebok
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of terror, panic, and phobia
urge_wyrms.influence: Areas of great fear - war zones, haunted places, hospitals

urge_wyrms.name: Vorus
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of avarice, hoarding, and theft
urge_wyrms.influence: Financial districts, gold vaults, resource extraction sites

urge_wyrms.name: Mahsstrac
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of tyranny, domination, and control

servants.maeljin: None currently (too competitive to accept one)

urge_wyrms.name: Karnala
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of obsessive desire and corrupted passion
manifestations: Desire that can never be satisfied
urge_wyrms.influence: Red light districts, sites of obsessive devotion

urge_wyrms.name: Abhorra
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of bigotry, genocide, and us-vs-them
urge_wyrms.influence: Sites of hate crimes, concentration camps, battlefields of ethnic conflict

urge_wyrms.name: Angu
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of sadism, torture, and suffering for its own sake
urge_wyrms.influence: Torture chambers, sites of prolonged abuse

urge_wyrms.name: Ba'ashkai
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of war, murder, and destruction
urge_wyrms.influence: Active war zones, sites of mass violence

urge_wyrms.name: Khaaloobh
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of gluttony, addiction, and devouring
urge_wyrms.influence: Drug dens, overfished waters, deforested lands

urge_wyrms.name: Pseulak
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of falsehood, betrayal, and broken trust
urge_wyrms.influence: Media headquarters, political centers, sites of famous betrayals

urge_wyrms.name: Sykora
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of suspicion, isolation, and seeing enemies everywhere
urge_wyrms.influence: Surveillance centers, isolated compounds, conspiracy meeting places

urge_wyrms.name: Gree
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of hopelessness, depression, and suicide
urge_wyrms.influence: Sites of mass suicide, hospitals' psychiatric wards, locations of great tragedy

urge_wyrms.name: Lethargg
urge_wyrms.description: The embodiment of sloth, indifference, and slow decay
manifestations: Failing to act when action is needed
urge_wyrms.influence: Abandoned places, dying towns, neglected institutions

using_urge_wyrms.as_antagonists: Urge Wyrms are too powerful to fight directly; they are cosmic forces
using_urge_wyrms.through_servants: Combat their influence through fighting their Maeljin, cults, and Banes
using_urge_wyrms.thematic_focus: Choose an Urge Wyrm to theme a chronicle around its particular corruption
using_urge_wyrms.corruption_source: NPCs and locations can be influenced by specific Urge Wyrms

meta.description: Modern and contemporary spirits for 21st century chronicles

city_mascot.name: City Mascot
city_mascot.description: Spirits embodying a city's self-image and pride. Often tied to sports teams, landmarks, or cultural identity.
city_mascot.image: Appears as stylized versions of city symbols—a bear for Chicago, a phoenix for Atlanta, etc.

city_tree.name: City Tree
city_tree.description: Spirits of trees surviving in urban environments. Stubborn, resilient, often bitter about their surroundings.
city_tree.image: Gnarled, determined tree-forms pushing through concrete.

crowdfunding.name: Crowdfunding
crowdfunding.concept: Collective resource gathering for shared goals
crowdfunding.description: Spirits of pooled resources toward common purpose. Helpful but fickle—interest fades quickly.
crowdfunding.image: Swirling masses of small lights converging into larger forms.

gridlock_beetle.name: Gridlock Beetle
gridlock_beetle.description: Born from frustration of stopped traffic. Neither fully Gaian nor Weaver—exists in the tension between movement and stasis.
gridlock_beetle.image: Beetle-like creatures formed from brake lights and exhaust.

meme.name: Meme
meme.description: Spirits of ideas that spread rapidly. Short-lived but can be incredibly powerful while relevant.
meme.image: Flickering images that shift form rapidly—today's joke, tomorrow's forgotten.

murica.name: Murica
murica.description: Spirit of performative patriotism rather than true love of country. Neither fully corrupt nor pure—complicated.
murica.image: Over-the-top Americana: eagles with gun wings, flag-draped everything, absurd in presentation.

nuntius.name: Nuntius
nuntius.concept: Divine messenger adapted to modern times
nuntius.description: Ancient messenger spirits now appearing through modern media—breaking news alerts, viral videos, emergency broadcasts.
nuntius.image: Human-shaped but assembled from screens, broadcasts, and notification sounds.

srador_king_of_pets.name: Srador — King of Pets
srador_king_of_pets.concept: Domesticated animals and the human-animal bond
srador_king_of_pets.description: Powerful spirit representing all domesticated animals. Kind but concerned about the Weaver's influence on his 'subjects.'
srador_king_of_pets.image: Shifts between domestic animal forms—dog, cat, horse—but always with a regal bearing.
srador_king_of_pets.notes: Incarna-level spirit. Approach with appropriate respect.

road_warrior.name: The Road Warrior
road_warrior.description: Spirit of the open road and protection of travelers. Hunts those who prey on highway travelers.
road_warrior.image: Leather-clad figure on a ghostly motorcycle, or a semi-truck with burning eyes.

bot_net.name: Bot-Net
bot_net.description: Networks of enslaved computer spirits forced into coordinated action. Terrifying in swarms.
bot_net.image: Swarms of identical spider-like constructs moving in perfect unison.

brand_loyalty.name: Brand Loyalty
brand_loyalty.description: Spirits feeding on irrational attachment to brands. Make people defend corporations that don't care about them.
brand_loyalty.image: Logo-creatures that attach to humans like symbiotes.

consumer_entertainment.name: Consumer Entertainment
consumer_entertainment.description: Spirits of mindless consumption—binge watching, doom scrolling, endless entertainment.

cultural_appropriation.name: Cultural Appropriation
cultural_appropriation.description: Spirits that hollow out meaning from cultural practices. What remains looks similar but lacks soul.
cultural_appropriation.image: Seemingly normal spirits wearing cultural elements like costumes—wrong somehow.

digital_game.name: Digital Game
digital_game.description: Spirits of video games. Can be friendly or dangerous depending on their origin game.
digital_game.image: Pixelated or rendered figures from games, ranging from cute to horrifying.

downtown_train.name: Downtown Train
downtown_train.description: Enormous train spirit from deep underground. Noble, protective of the vulnerable. Can transport groups via Moon Bridge.
downtown_train.image: Endless 1920s train with warm reddish glow. Cannot see either end from any point along its length.
downtown_train.notes: Patently against bullying. Will help noble causes but becomes enemy if abused.

lenocinor.name: Lenocinor
lenocinor.description: Spirits feeding on frivolous purchases. Attach to advertisements and grow fat on resulting sales.
lenocinor.image: Business-suited figures with briefcases (physical); discount coupons and ads (Umbral).
lenocinor.notes: Madison Avenue is the largest known Lenocinor—Incarna-level spirit of American advertising.

old_is_new_again.name: Old Is New Again
old_is_new_again.description: Weaver guerrilla—adds value to old things to keep them from junkyards, reducing Wyrm material and Wyld space.
old_is_new_again.image: Iconic examples of bygone eras—idealized cowboys, 1950s housewives, things that never quite existed.

pervium.name: Pervium
pervium.description: Net-Spiders pushing data through the Pattern Web faster. Attach to high-traffic sites, make connections faster. Ultimate goal: download users as data packets.
pervium.image: Business casual humans (physical); colored energy frequency waves (CyberRealm).
pervium.notes: Glass Walkers bind them as fetishes for faster internet. Purpose unclear.

polyteron.name: Polyteron
polyteron.description: Spirits anchored to 4+ dimensional objects. Only exist in Deep Umbra where such objects can be. Serve Celestines.

charm_details.time_rend: Costs 2 Essence. Attacks target's time/essence. Each Health Level that would be dealt instead removes 1 permanent Rage, then Gnosis, then Willpower. Complete depletion = death.

polyteron.image: Multifaceted constructs beyond mortal comprehension. Can shift to 3D to avoid driving observers insane.
polyteron.notes: DANGEROUS. Do not engage lightly. Capture Garou for study. Exist in different time/space.

silver_screen.name: Silver Screen
silver_screen.description: Spirits of movie theaters and film. Once fed on hope and inspiration; many now corrupted by escapism.
silver_screen.image: Flickering silver screens showing scenes from classic and modern films.

skepticism.name: Skepticism
skepticism.description: Spirits feeding on and encouraging denial of the supernatural. Useful to the Veil, problematic for spirit interaction.
skepticism.image: Stern figures with crossed arms, rolling eyes made of question marks.

truck_guardian.name: Truck Guardian
truck_guardian.description: Spirits protecting long-haul vehicles and their drivers. Loyal to their trucks.
truck_guardian.image: Chrome-plated guardians shaped like hood ornaments come to life.

anonymous.name: Anonymous
anonymous.description: Spirits of anonymous collective action. Unpredictable allies—might help, might cause chaos, might both.
anonymous.image: Masked figures (Guy Fawkes, etc.) that flicker and multiply.

beleben.name: Beleben
beleben.description: Pure life-energy spirits. Healing, growth, renewal. Sought for their restorative properties.
beleben.image: Soft green glows, sprouting plants, heartbeat sounds.

chirurgeon.name: Chirurgeon
chirurgeon.description: Spirits of medical healing—sometimes brutal but effective. Cut to cure.
chirurgeon.image: Figures with scalpel-fingers and scrub-mask faces.

creepypasta.name: Creepypasta
creepypasta.description: Spirits born from shared internet horror. Feed on fear and retelling. Some are surprisingly real.
creepypasta.image: Varies wildly—Slenderman-esque figures, haunted file icons, etc.

farm_to_table.name: Farm-to-Table
farm_to_table.description: Spirits of sustainable food practices. Allies to Gaia, but can be elitist.
farm_to_table.image: Healthy produce with glowing auras, farmer figures made of vegetables.

gmo.name: GMO
gmo.description: Controversial spirits—Wyld creativity through Weaver methods. Neither side fully claims them.
gmo.image: Plants and animals that look almost right but subtly wrong.

made_me_do_it_devil.name: Made-Me-Do-It Devil
made_me_do_it_devil.description: Spirits of giving in to impulse. Not truly evil—just chaotic. Excuse for bad decisions.
made_me_do_it_devil.image: Tiny devil figures on shoulders, whispering suggestions.

stood_ground.name: Stood Ground
stood_ground.description: Spirits of standing one's ground—defense that might cross into aggression. Complicated morality.
stood_ground.image: Defensive postures with weapons ready—guns, knives, fists.

superhero.name: Superhero
superhero.description: Spirits of superheroic ideals. Feed on belief in heroes. Can be inspiring or dangerously naive.
superhero.image: Cape-wearing figures in bold colors, poses of heroic determination.

urban_art.name: Urban Art
urban_art.description: Spirits of unauthorized creative expression. Rebellious, colorful, territorial.
urban_art.image: Animated graffiti, paint-splatter figures, living murals.

you_only_live_once.name: You-Only-Live-Once
you_only_live_once.description: YOLO spirits encourage risk-taking. Sometimes inspiring courage, sometimes encouraging stupidity.
you_only_live_once.image: Adrenaline-junkies mid-jump, figures leaping into the unknown.

consciousness.name: Consciousness
consciousness.description: Banes of information bombardment. Incite rage through overwhelming, incoherent messaging. Often short-lived—victims kill them.
consciousness.image: Jumbled information—garbled screens, overlapping broadcasts, wet mashed newspapers.

flame_wars.name: Flame Wars
flame_wars.concept: Online conflict and breakdown of discourse
flame_wars.description: Spirits of conversations turned toxic. Pre-internet were rare; now proliferate. A drop of blood kills them.

charm_details.brother_against_brother: Rage roll vs each target's Willpower. Successes cause escalating conflict: 1=argumentative, 2=refuses cooperation (+1 Rage), 3=insults/threats, 4=throws first punch, 5=berserk vs other targets, 6+=attacks everyone including bystanders.

flame_wars.image: Turbulent air sphere. Within 10 yards, whispered insinuations. Within 10 feet, screaming insults.
flame_wars.notes: Useful bound into fetishes to sow discord among enemies.

reroute.name: Reroute
reroute.description: Banes of digital hiding. Cloak Weaver spirits, help them escape or attack from hiding. Look like oily Pattern Spiders.

charm_details.obscure: Roll Willpower. Area (Gnosis x 5 feet) becomes bland, boring. Perception/Investigation must exceed successes to notice anything. +Gnosis dice to hiding.

reroute.image: Oily black eight-legged creature resembling Pattern Spider. Wires under exterior.

obscenity.name: Obscenity
obscenity.description: Spirits of irrational disgust used to denigrate and control others. Related to objectification and dehumanization.
obscenity.image: Figures that provoke instinctive revulsion for no clear reason.

Pledge of the Battle Mate.description: Dedicate two warriors who have fought together as sisters/brothers in arms
requirements: Two werewolves who have fought together for some time
Ritemaster assessment of relationship (mindful of Litany)
Pledge of the Battle Mate.performance: Ritemaster chants battles fought together (victories and defeats). Participants cut themselves, mix blood with hallucinogenic brew. Under drug effects, ritemaster appears as monster they must fight (restraining Rage to not kill). At culmination, recite blood oath: never leave the other behind on battlefield; never fail to come to other's aid in need; never betray other to enemy.

system.success_effect: Ancestor-spirits recognize the bond. As long as neither violates oath: each gains 1 Willpower and 1 Rage per scene fighting together against common foe, and 1 point temporary Glory Renown when victorious.
system.violation_effect: Both instantly know of betrayal. Both lose 5 Honor Renown and 1 dot of Willpower. Betrayed mate makes Rage roll.

Pledge of the Battle Mate.notes: Ritemaster should assess for inappropriate closeness (Litany concerns). Some tales of battle mates are tragedies.

Rite of Memorial.description: Dedicate a memorial or shrine to a sept's greatest heroes
requirements: Physical memorial or shrine in caern
Deceased of Rank 4+ or exceptional heroic deeds
Varies by tribe/caern (Children of Gaia sing lullaby; Get of Fenris sacrifice symbolic animal)
Rite of Memorial.performance: Form varies by tribe and caern type. Common elements: circle around shrine, invocation of hero's deeds, asking for blessings on living.

system.success_effect: Hero's accomplishments reflect on comrades. Each septmate present gains 1 temporary Glory Renown; each packmate present gains 1 additional Glory.
system.restriction: Considered offensive for Rank < 4 unless deeds were unquestionably heroic on sept/tribe scale

Rite of Soul Sending.description: Protect a soul from becoming trapped as a ghost in the Dark Umbra
requirements: Corpse dead no longer than (ritemaster's Gnosis) hours
Participants who know the deceased's name
Rite of Soul Sending.performance: Ritemaster bathes corpse in clean, cool water to calm any spirit wrath. Dances in circle around body while attendees drum/stamp feet and recite deceased's name repeatedly. Begin loud (attract spirit's attention), gradually softer until whispered away into the wind, never to be spoken among them again.

system.success_effect: Spirit does not linger as ghost or appear in Dark Umbra
system.botch_effect: Dead spirit immediately rushes in and becomes a wraith then and there

Rite of Soul Sending.notes: Wyrm-tainted corpses reject the rite automatically

Call to the Lost.description: Call a wandering soul back from the Umbra to where it belongs
use_cases: Werewolf injured and stranded in distant Realm
Garou with Harano who has walked among spirits too long
Pack that strayed from spirit guide's path
Return Stargazer's mind from Astral Umbra (over body with ochre/blood glyphs)
Call to the Lost.performance: Build fire scattered with fragrant herbs, burn incense, smoke pipe of tobacco/herbs - create strong-smelling smoke. Drum and howl, beating mother rhythm, calling out long and loud. Searching call echoes across Umbra seeking wanderer by name.

system.success_effect: If target doesn't fight the call, they arrive at rite site (may need ritemaster's help crossing Gauntlet). Target experiences symbolic visions of call and journey.
system.from_physical: If performed from physical world, ritemaster must also roll to pierce Gauntlet for target

Call to the Lost.notes: Higher Gnosis = longer ritual and harder difficulty (stronger spirit connection harder to break)

Call to Arms.description: Wake a werewolf from the lupus Gift: Hibernation
Call to Arms.performance: Identical to Rite of Spirit Awakening

system.side_effect: Target makes Rage roll at +1 difficulty from being awakened

Rite of the Shadow Play.description: Call on Blood Lunes (spirits of lunar eclipses and the moon's far side) to learn secrets through shadow theater
requirements: Full moon with light shining on a surface
Physical representation of inquiry subject (hair, finger, carved bone, photograph, sand, etc.)
Rite of the Shadow Play.performance: Sacrifice nocturnal animal, ingest hallucinogen, place token on ground, let shadow fall on moonlit surface, dance. Shadow acts out questions in symbolic gestures. Repeat until shadow separates and acts out its own story, joined by other shadows presenting enigmatic tale.

difficulty_by_obscurity.well_known_or_broad: 7 - Rituals (Garou Nation, World War I, the Weaver)
difficulty_by_obscurity.slightly_narrow_or_obscure: 8 - Rituals (particular mountain range, Silver Fangs tribal lore, corporate merger)
difficulty_by_obscurity.very_narrow_or_arcane: 9 - Rituals (lost tome, unknown individual, private spirit agreement)

system.success_effect: Learn one secret per success about subject's past, couched in mystery and symbolism. More successes = easier to interpret.

limitations: Blood Lunes only retain secrets, not common knowledge
Does not summon Blood Lunes to material world, only draws them close
Subject must be something with secrets to learn

Rite of Excoriation.description: Forcibly strip the totem bond from a werewolf or pack
Rite of Excoriation.performance: Paint glyphs representing totem bond and specific totem on subject's body. Higher totem dots = more coverage required. Carefully flense skin beneath glyphs, wait for regeneration to heal wounds. Burn bloody painted scraps to ash (oldest versions: cast into molten silver).

system.difficulty: Total totem points invested (if > 9, extra successes required per point over 9)
system.on_individual: Strips that werewolf from pack. Lost totem points handled per Old Blood rules (see modules/pack.md).
system.on_pack_totem: Dissolves pack bond completely. Totem points held 'in trust' until pack reforms bond or finds new totem.

Rite of Excoriation.notes: Dreadful rite typically used as punishment. Can be performed without target's consent.

Rite of Spirit Union.description: Ancient rite allowing Garou to merge with a willing spirit, becoming divine warrior being
requirements: Fast for one day and one night
Scribe glyphs on body with own claws (blood symbols, opened flesh as spirit gateway)
Petition spirit in person (not summoned or commanded)
Spirit must agree of own free will
Rank determines maximum spirit: 1-2 = Gaffling, 3-4 = Jaggling, 5 = Incarna
Rite of Spirit Union.performance: Petitioner (or accompanying ritemaster as mediator) persuades spirit. If spirit accedes: pact made - spirit inhabits petitioner's body lending strength, werewolf agrees to take no actions against spirit's nature. Merged being takes fantastical mixed appearance.

system.roll: Extended and resisted: Charisma + Rituals (diff 7) vs spirit's Gnosis (diff = werewolf's Gnosis)
system.initial_damage: Aggravated damage at rite time: Gaffling = 1, Jaggling = 3, Incarna = 5
system.success_condition: Accumulate successes = spirit's Willpower before spirit accumulates successes = werewolf's Willpower
merged_benefits: Distribute spirit's Gnosis rating as dots among Attributes (no Attribute > double Homid rating)
Access all spirit's Charms (spend Gnosis instead of Essence)
Can spend spirit's Gnosis, Rage, and Willpower as own
system.ban: ST assigns Ban similar to totem spirit Ban
system.ban_violation: Spirit immediately rips free. Werewolf suffers unsoakable aggravated damage = spirit's Rage.
system.instability: Every scene after first: roll Rage at cumulative +1 difficulty. If frenzy results: after frenzy ends, suffer unsoakable aggravated = own Rage, spirit expelled forcibly. Likely lose Renown and spirit's goodwill.

Rite of Spirit Union.history: Lost for centuries, recently rediscovered by pack venturing into Deep Umbra seeking allies

Rite of Succession.description: Formal rite when Garou takes position of authority within sept
Rite of Succession.performance: Sept gathers to witness. Ritemaster recites successor's credentials and accomplishments. Successor brings appropriate human or animal sacrifice, kills it before ritemaster. Everyone present eats piece of sacrifice. Ritemaster carves glyph into bone from carcass as position signifier. Sept howls honor to the sky.

system.predecessor_bonus: If predecessor present and performs proper role: +Rank bonus dice
system.success_effect: Successor gains 1 temporary Honor Renown per 2 successes (round up)

Calling the Directions.description: Reorient spiritually, affirming balance with all of Gaia
Calling the Directions.performance: Beginning with East, howl or sing in language of the Wild to each of four cardinal directions.

system.requirement: Perform every morning upon waking for one lunar month
system.benefit: Gain 1 bonus die to rite rolls as long as continuing to perform each morning

Honoring the Ancestors.description: Pay respects to beloved tribe ancestor at caern shrine or memorial
Honoring the Ancestors.performance: Ritual howl and a few drops of own blood at ancestor's shrine.

system.requirement: Perform for five consecutive nights; moon phase of ancestor's auspice must be visible at least once during period
system.benefit: 1 additional die to next social interaction roll with other tribe members

Greet the North Star.description: Similar to Greet the Moon, but for the North Star
Greet the North Star.performance: Howl greeting when North Star first appears after sunset.

system.requirement: Howl greeting each night for eight consecutive nights
system.benefit: 1 bonus die to all navigation rolls until lapsing in nightly greeting

Rite of Cleansing.description: Purify person, place, or object of Wyrm taint
Rite of Cleansing.system: Charisma + Rituals (difficulty varies by taint level)

Rite of Renunciation.description: Renounce tribal membership to join another

Voice of the Jackal.description: Mark an oathbreaker for all to see

Moot Rite.description: Open a moot, call spirits to witness

Rite of the Opened Bridge.description: Open a Moon Bridge to another caern

Rite of Caern Building.description: Create a new caern at a place of power
Rite of Caern Building.system: Extended action; extremely difficult and dangerous

Last Blessing.description: Allow dead metis to take human or wolf form

Rite of Binding.description: Bind spirit to service or create talen

Rite of Growth.description: Allow plants to grow in unusual places

Rite of the Cardboard Palace.description: Make flimsy shelter into decent dwelling

Rite of Talisman Dedication.description: Allow objects to shift with Garou

Stone of Scorn.description: Bind spirit of shame to wrongdoer

Rite of the Omega Wolf.description: Strip wolf of all rank and status

Voice of the Jackal.description: Mark oathbreaker's voice to sound jackal-like

Rite of Boasting.description: Declare intent to perform deed for Renown

minor_rites.Bone Rhythms: Drums and percussion for pack bonding

wyrm_rites._note: Rites practiced by Black Spiral Dancers and other Wyrm servants. BSDs also use corrupted versions of standard rites.

Dance of the Black Spiral.description: The BSD rite of passage. Cub descends nine circles of the Black Spiral Labyrinth in Malfeas, each stripping away Gaian beliefs. Survivors emerge as Wyrm servants, often with derangements.
Dance of the Black Spiral.system: Extended contested rolls vs. Labyrinth; approximately 60% survival rate
Dance of the Black Spiral.location: Black Spiral Labyrinth in Malfeas, or physical representation in a Pit

Rite of the Balefire.description: Light the corrupted sacred fire in a Pit. Balefire empowers Wyrm rites.

Rite of Feeding.description: Ritual presentation of kills to superiors and totem.

Rite of Wounding.description: Self-scarification to honor the Wyrm. Many BSDs are covered in ritual scars.

Rite of Denunciation.description: Formally declare another Garou an enemy of the hive. Pack is expected to hunt them.

Rite of the Totem (Wyrm).description: Standard totem binding, but binds Wyrm totems instead of Gaian ones.

Rite of Corruption.description: Systematically corrupt a location over time, turning it into potential Pit material.
Rite of Corruption.system: Extended Manipulation + Rituals over weeks/months; area becomes Wyrm-tainted

Rite of the Flayed God.description: Strip a spirit of its identity, leaving a hollow 'skin' a Theurge can wear to disguise themselves spiritually.
Rite of the Flayed God.system: Gnosis vs spirit's Willpower; costs 5 Gnosis; lasts one lunar month per success
Rite of the Flayed God.use: Infiltrating Gaian caerns disguised as nature spirits

Rite of the Shrouded Glen (Corrupted).description: Makes an area impossible for Gaian Garou to find. They lose their way and wander in circles.
Rite of the Shrouded Glen (Corrupted).system: Wits + Rituals (difficulty 8); lasts until deliberately ended or area purified

World-Strangling Ways.description: Method for corrupting nature spirits into Banes over time.
World-Strangling Ways.process: Expose spirit to corruption gradually, weaken ties to Gaia, complete with Wyrm-spirit intervention
World-Strangling Ways.duration: Weeks to months depending on spirit strength

meta.description: The Astral, Dark, and Deep Umbrae beyond the Membrane

the_membrane.description: Barrier separating Middle Umbra from other Umbral layers

astral_umbra.name: Astral Umbra
astral_umbra.nature: Realm where thoughts, concepts, and principles take form

characteristics.time: Subjective—hours can pass in moments or vice versa

penumbral_reflection.name: Periphery of Thought
penumbral_reflection.locations: Universities, libraries, places of learning and imagination
penumbral_reflection.appearance: Hazy, dreamlike buildings. Impossible geometry. Space exceeds physical dimensions.

travel_methods.inward: Journey into one's own thoughts and dreams
travel_methods.meditation: Deep focus can shift consciousness Astral-ward

conceptual_spirits.interaction: Perspectives so broad they're hard to understand
conceptual_spirits.chiminage: Often want exploration of their concept

mages.attitude: May see Garou as intruders or curiosities

hazards.disorientation: Conceptual thinking required; instinct-driven Garou struggle

story_seeds.before_harano: Find cause of elder's spiritual depression in Astral reflection

dark_umbra.name: Dark Umbra
dark_umbra.also_called: Low Umbra, Shadowlands, Land of the Dead
dark_umbra.nature: Realm of ghosts, death, and the unquiet deceased

characteristics.physical_laws: Mirrors physical world but decayed, dark

penumbral_reflection.name: Edge of Darkness
penumbral_reflection.locations: Cemeteries, hospitals, battlefields, anywhere death is strong
penumbral_reflection.appearance: Shadows deeper, colors muted, cold creeping in
penumbral_reflection.transition: Death-associated places can slip toward Dark Umbra

travel_methods.deaths_door: Hospitals, execution sites, places of murder

spectres.description: Ghosts consumed by their Shadow, serving Oblivion
spectres.danger: Actively hostile, seek to spread despair

ancestor_spirits.description: Garou dead who chose to guide descendants
ancestor_spirits.location: Can exist in both Middle and Dark Umbra
ancestor_spirits.aid: May be trapped here needing rescue

hazards.spectre_attacks: Aggressive dead seek to drag living down

story_seeds.stemming_the_tide: Spectres invading through weak point—stop incursion
story_seeds.ancestral_rescue: Free trapped ancestor spirit from Dark Umbra prison

wraith_crossover.note: Dark Umbra is the Shadowlands of Wraith: The Oblivion
wraith_crossover.deeper: Labyrinth leads to Oblivion (related to Wyrm?)

deep_umbra.name: Deep Umbra
deep_umbra.nature: Vast cosmic expanse beyond Near Realms. Home of Celestines.

open_void.theory: May be whatever is needed at the time, created by need
open_void.travel: Scent of concepts, following meaning rather than direction

celestine_domains.examples: Moonlit vistas, sun-drenched beaches, web-covered lands
celestine_domains.danger: Can be anchored against will if approach too close

celestines.danger: May not notice you; attention can be overwhelming

triat.description: Wyld, Weaver, Wyrm in purest forms
triat.location: Deep Umbra hosts their ultimate essences

bunyip.description: Rumors persist that Bunyip spirits survive here

polyterons.danger: EXTREME—study captured Garou, attacks sever time/essence

disconnection.description: Risk of losing connection to physical world
effects: Difficulty returning
Physical body weakens
Eventually permanent exile

abandoned_post.summary: Meros (Pluto's Incarna) abandoned post after dwarf planet reclassification
abandoned_post.task: Find him in Deep Umbra, convince him to return
abandoned_post.stakes: Wyld spirits invading his abandoned realm, Shantar (Neptune) asking for help

new_celestine.summary: New celestial body spotted in Penumbral sky past Pluto

trial_and_error.task: Navigate Deep Umbra trials to earn audience
trial_and_error.stakes: Vital information or aid for war against Wyrm

anchorheads.creation: Rite of Anchoring the Divide (Level 3 Mystic)

dimensional_portal.description: Created by powerful rites for specific destination

river_rapids.description: Near death-associated rivers; crossing feels like drowning

briar_patch.description: Tangled thorny growth; each thorn a stabbing thought

celestial_stair.description: High places, observatories; climb toward stars

meta.description: Special locations and phenomena within the Penumbra

blights.description: Urban corruption hotspots where truth is laid bare. What the city hides becomes visible.

uses.training: Live-fire boot camp for cubs under elder supervision
uses.framing: Crossing into Blight = point of no return in stories
uses.perception: Jaded elders see Blights everywhere—it's not hallucination, just trained pattern recognition

chimares.description: Places where metaphor becomes physical reality. Symbolism has teeth.

characteristics.examples: Drowning in work → actual drowning; climbing ladder → literal climbing
characteristics.trigger: Usually activated by presence or action matching the metaphor

creation_elements.manifestation: How does the metaphor become real?

hospital.spirits: Healing spirits vs death spirits in open war

office_building.manifestation: Literal vertical climb required for advancement

epiphs.description: Spirits of concepts and phenomena rather than physical things. Abstract ideas given form.

characteristics.location: Often near places of thought—libraries, universities
characteristics.interaction: Alien perspectives; may answer questions with questions

conceptual.description: Spirits of pure concepts—justice, entropy, mathematics
conceptual.interaction: Perspectives so broad they're hard to comprehend

chimerlings.behavior: Fragments of dreams that achieved permanence

epiphs.chiminage: Often want exploration/acknowledgment of their concept

glens.description: Places of Wyld purity within the Penumbra. Sanctuaries of untouched nature.

the_woods.features: Ancient trees, clean water, peaceful wildlife

wyldings.description: Zones of primal, uncontrolled Wyld energy. Reality doesn't apply.

characteristics.elements: As they were in Pangaea, untouched by time

wylding_spirits.finding: Guaranteed in Wyldings; possible in Glens

genius_loci.description: Locations with overwhelming Triatic resonance that affects visitors.

characteristics.awareness: May have semi-sentient response to visitors

st_jacintas_medical_center.metaphor: Fighting for life is literal combat

clayton_city_park.status: Urban green space under development pressure

festival_market_town.dynamic: Consumer spirits vs joy spirits contest

tall_pines_cemetery.gauntlet: May have thin spots to Shadowlands

panacea_pharmaceuticals.theme: Medicine as both cure and poison

wild_reclamation.manifestation: Abandoned buildings being consumed by spiritual growth

meta.description: Methods of traveling through and within the Umbra

stepping_sideways.description: Basic werewolf ability to cross the Gauntlet into the Penumbra

gauntlet_ratings.9: Inner city cores, heavily Weaver-influenced zones

getting_stuck.trigger: Botched roll or very high Gauntlet
getting_stuck.experience: Wyrm's madness—visions of earth roiling, cataclysms, hatred
getting_stuck.escape: Another werewolf can pull them free

moon_bridges.description: Permanent connections between caerns for safe, fast travel

requirements.pathstones: Both caerns must have maintained Pathstones
requirements.rite: Rite of the Opened Caern performed simultaneously at both ends
requirements.establishment: Previous proper rite to create the Bridge

characteristics.appearance: Luminescent tube arcing through Umbral sky
characteristics.feel: Soft rubber, gelatinous water, not wet but shimmering
characteristics.apex: Passes through Aetherial Realm—safest place in existence

safety.luna_guards: Avatar of Luna oversees every journey through Aetherial
safety.no_attacks: No enemy has ever successfully attacked a pack on Moon Bridge apex
safety.tainted_beings: Wyrm-corrupted attempting to cross face Luna's wrath

moon_paths.description: Shifting pathways of moonlight, less stable than Bridges

characteristics.appearance: Silver light paths flecked with starry dew, mist-shrouded
characteristics.feel: Very soft, spongy ground—like walking on clouds
characteristics.stability: Can bear any weight but paths shift unpredictably

availability.variation: Shift from phase to phase, even night to night

no_moon.challenges: Path may vanish underfoot, nearly invisible

crescent_moon.challenges: Riddles and enigmas from Lunes and spirits

half_moon.challenges: Triatic spirits vie for control of Path
half_moon.danger: Most dangerous time—forced into spirit conflicts
half_moon.tactics: Play factions against each other, make temporary alliances

alpha_swap.tradition: Some packs let auspice-moon werewolf lead during their phase
alpha_swap.reason: Moon phase dictates challenge type; best-suited leads

airts.description: Spirit trails and scent-paths through the Umbra

nature.conceptual: Following meaning rather than physical direction

following.concept: Seeking death leads toward graveyards, then Dark Umbra
following.symbols: Signs and analogies point the way

experience.keen_nosed: Some can smell the past itself (events within days)
experience.conceptual_scent: Joy might smell 'blue'; CyberRealm smells of solder
experience.direction: Sound echoes strangely, hard to locate sources

spirit_gates.description: Fixed portals between specific Umbral locations

characteristics.destination: Usually link specific Near Realm to Penumbra
characteristics.guardians: Often watched by spirits who may demand chiminage

spirit_gates.finding: Knowledge of location required; some are well-known, others secret

spirit_trains.description: Massive transport spirits like Downtown Train

downtown_train.ability: Can transport groups via Moon Bridge
downtown_train.requirement: Cause must appear noble; opposes bullying

pattern_web.description: Following Weaver strands toward digital/technological destinations

trods.description: Ancient fae pathways threading through all realms
trods.origin: Created by Fair Folk during their travels

characteristics.destination: Often lead to or near Arcadia Gateway

gnosis_as_food.description: Shapeshifters can survive on Gnosis instead of food

rates.moderate_activity: 1 Gnosis per week (2 for large creatures)
rates.demanding_activity: 1 Gnosis per day (2 for large creatures)

shapeshifter_respect.description: Spirits respect shapeshifters as part flesh, part spirit
shapeshifter_respect.contrast: Human sorcerers may face disdain; Garou command respect
shapeshifter_respect.birthright: Walking in spirit world is their right

dedicated_items.function: Work but unreliably, prone to flickering
dedicated_items.duration: Batteries last normally; need Umbral power source after

cell_phones.exception: Near awakened cell tower reflection, weak signal possible
cell_phones.gauntlet: Strongest Gauntlet prevents any cross-realm signal

computers.exception: Fetish computers work; rumored Glass Walker server rooms
computers.controversy: Online moots rumored; most Garou doubt, Red Talons call blasphemous

vehicles.function: Work if fueled and road available
vehicles.reaction: May anger Wyld spirits with noise and emissions

weapons.note: Few werewolves use guns, but they function

meaning_made_manifest.description: The Umbra operates on symbolism—meaning becomes literal

navigation.seeking_death: Following death symbolism leads toward Dark Umbra
navigation.seeking_cyberrealm: Pattern Spider lair → silver paths → destination
navigation.quest_trails: Signs point toward destination; coincidence is meaningful

appearance.rank_effect: Higher rank = more pronounced mythic appearance
appearance.examples: Silver Fang's coat gleams with moonlight; Fury's shadow storms with rage

meta.description: The 13+ Near Realms of the Middle Umbra

arcadia_gateway.name: Arcadia Gateway
arcadia_gateway.description: Not Arcadia itself, but possibly a pathway to it or an echo of fae presence on Earth. Pulses with Wyld energy that seeps into human dreams.

regions.seelie_court: Summer realm, growth, light, capricious kindness
regions.unseelie_court: Winter realm, cold, darkness, cruel honesty

inhabitants: Fae emanations (believe they are real fae)
arcadia_gateway.notes: Collapsing as ancestral memories of fae fade. Inhabitants growing panicked.

flux_realm.name: Flux Realm
flux_realm.description: Pure Wyld energy. Reality shifts constantly. Nothing stays the same.

regions.the_cocoon: Protective barrier formed by travelers' belief in stability
regions.the_coil: Deeper chaos where even perception breaks down

flux_realm.notes: Even entering the Cocoon requires strong will. The Coil can unmake unprepared visitors.

pangaea.name: Pangaea
pangaea.theme: Prehistoric Earth, the world before humanity
pangaea.description: The world as it was millions of years ago. Dinosaurs, megafauna, primal wilderness.

regions.elder_serpent_territory: Realm of the great serpent Incarna

cyberrealm.name: CyberRealm
cyberrealm.description: The spirit world's reflection of technology and the internet. Home to Net-Spiders and digital spirits.
cyberrealm.notes: Glass Walkers have strongest presence. Rumors of online moots.

scar.name: Scar
scar.description: Where the Weaver's drive for order meets resource extraction. Industrial nightmare.

malfeas.name: Malfeas
malfeas.description: The Wyrm's domain. Pure corruption and destruction.
malfeas.warning: EXTREMELY DANGEROUS. Do not enter without overwhelming force and specific purpose.
resources: Intelligence on Wyrm plans (if you survive)

the_abyss.name: The Abyss
the_abyss.description: The path downward into Malfeas. Multiple routes with different dangers.

atrocity_realm.name: Atrocity Realm
atrocity_realm.description: Where the Wyrm breeds its worst creations and preserves its victories.

regions.breeding_pits: Where fomori and worse are made

erebus.name: Erebus
erebus.description: Where those seeking forgiveness come to purify themselves. Not punishment—healing.

process.the_unforgivable: Some things cannot be forgiven—Erebus shows this too

erebus.notes: Changing Breeds each have different relationships with Erebus.

summer_country.name: Summer Country
summer_country.description: Garou heaven. Where honored warriors go. Beautiful, peaceful, perfect.
summer_country.notes: Living visitors are rare and must be exceptionally pure.
