Corpse in the Monster.description: A rare Cappadocian path focusing on the physical corruption of undeath. Practitioners learn to weaponize their own deathly nature and manipulate the corpse-state of vampires.
Corpse in the Monster.practitioners: Cappadocian survivors, some Harbingers of Skulls, rare Giovanni

1.name: Trace the Rigor
1.description: The necromancer can sense the presence and approximate age of corpses (including Kindred in torpor) within a radius.
1.system: Roll Perception + Occult (difficulty 6). Each success extends range by 10 yards and provides more detail about the state of corpses detected.

2.name: Rigor Mortis
2.description: Induce temporary paralysis by awakening the corpse-nature within a vampire's body.
2.system: Spend 1 blood, roll Manipulation + Occult vs target's Stamina + Fortitude. Success freezes target for 1 turn per success. Target may spend Willpower to act at +3 difficulty.

3.name: Corpse Tongue
3.description: Force a vampire's Beast into temporary slumber, leaving only the corpse. The target becomes docile and suggestible.
3.system: Spend 1 Willpower, roll Charisma + Occult (difficulty is target's Willpower). Success puts the Beast to sleep for one scene. Target cannot frenzy, but also cannot spend blood for physical enhancement.

4.name: Awaken the Monster
4.description: Conversely, this power rouses the Beast to extreme fury, pushing a vampire toward immediate frenzy.
4.system: Spend 1 blood, roll Manipulation + Intimidation vs target's Willpower. Success forces target to immediately check for frenzy at +2 difficulty per success.

5.name: Shroud of the Antediluvian
5.description: The necromancer becomes corpse-like enough to be mistaken for truly dead, even to supernatural scrutiny, while remaining fully aware.
5.system: Spend 2 blood and 1 Willpower. For one night, appear utterly dead. Auspex and similar powers detect nothing. Can observe surroundings but cannot move or act. May end the effect at will.

Grave's Decay.name: The Grave's Decay
Grave's Decay.description: A path focused on entropy, rot, and the inevitable corruption of all things. Particularly effective against the material world.
Grave's Decay.practitioners: Cappadocian survivors, some Samedi, Giovanni with morbid interests

1.name: Decay's Touch
1.description: Accelerate the decay of dead organic matter with a touch.
1.system: Touch the target, spend 1 blood. Non-living organic matter (food, leather, wood, corpses) ages years in seconds. Number of years equals successes on Stamina + Occult (difficulty 6).

2.name: Corruption's Caress
2.description: Cause living organic matter to wither and rot, dealing damage.
2.system: Touch target, roll Dexterity + Occult (difficulty 7), spend 1 blood. Each success deals 1 level of lethal damage as flesh rots. Vampires soak normally.

3.name: Worm's Feast
3.description: Summon grave insects (worms, beetles, flies) to consume a corpse or harass the living.
3.system: Spend 1 blood, roll Charisma + Occult (difficulty 7). Insects arrive within minutes, enough to strip a corpse in hours or provide distraction/horror (+2 difficulty to all actions for victims for scene).

4.name: Unmake the Works
4.description: Extend decay to non-organic matter—metal rusts, stone crumbles, plastic becomes brittle.
4.system: Touch target, spend 2 blood, roll Intelligence + Occult (difficulty 8). Successes determine scope: 1=hand-sized, 3=door-sized, 5=car-sized. Objects become useless and fragile.

5.name: Entropy's Embrace
5.description: Project an aura of decay that withers everything nearby, including vampires.
5.system: Spend 3 blood and 1 Willpower, roll Stamina + Occult (difficulty 8). For one scene, everything within 10 yards suffers decay. Living beings take 1 bashing per turn (lethal for plants). Vampires must spend 1 additional blood per turn to avoid losing 1 blood to accelerated decay. Objects crumble.

koldunism.name: Koldunism (Koldunic Sorcery)
koldunism.description: The ancient blood sorcery of the Tzimisce, practiced by Old Clan members who never accepted Kupala's corruption. Unlike Vicissitude-tainted Koldunic Sorcery, true Koldunism binds the practitioner to specific lands through unique kraina (paths). Each koldun's primary kraina reflects the spirit of their native territory.
koldunism.source: V20 The Black Hand: A Guide to the Tal'Mahe'Ra
koldunism.learning: Always learned as out-of-Clan Discipline. Primary kraina develops through trial and error, tied to land where koldun must rest. Secondary kraina limited to highest level of primary.
koldunism.system_base: Tribute blood to earth/river/sky (usually 1 blood point), roll Attribute + Occult (difficulty = power level + 4). Difficulty reduced by 2 if within primary kraina. No blood cost if within the region associated with the kraina.

Kraina of Enoch.description: Pioneered by Old Clan Tzimisce Embraced in the Underworld who claimed Enoch as territory. Unique in that it requires sacrifice of body parts rather than blood—the koldun becomes one with the lands of the dead.
Kraina of Enoch.special: In the Underworld, koldun with this kraina always know Enoch's exact location within the Tempest.

1.name: Shroud of Oblivion
1.description: Tear out a piece of the Underworld's fabric to wrap yourself and surroundings. Everything beneath appears muted—black-and-white in physical world, deeper darkness in Underworld.
1.system: Skin turns to ash and crumbles; plunge hands into earth to wrench forth sheet of inky night. Radius 5ft/2m per success, duration in turns = successes. In mortal world: sunlight damage becomes bashing. In Underworld: faint sun deals no damage. When duration expires, lose 1 blood per turn until spending blood to rejuvenate skin.

2.name: Spectral Cloak
2.description: Harness sight of the dead to conceal yourself and drive away observers in terror.
2.system: Pluck out eyes and crush them; pulp turns to dust on eerie wind from empty sockets. Invisible to standard vision (Auspex: see 'Seeing the Unseen' rules). Blind to anything outside power's radius. Others in radius roll Willpower (diff = kraina rating + successes, max 9) or gain Deathsight Flaw and flee in terror for turns = successes. Radius 10ft/3m per success. Blind until spending 1 blood to heal (indefinitely sighted in Underworld despite missing eyes).

3.name: Pond of Malevolent Dread
3.description: Form a shaft to the Sea of Shadows—an ocean of souls on the precipice of annihilation—and release its doom.
3.system: Thrust hands deep into abdomen, expel entrails onto ground. Bowels bore through earth into Underworld's depths, taking root in Sea of Shadows. Discharge waves of despair as pool of writhing spectres. Radius 15ft/5m per success, duration = turns. Locked waist-down until power ends. Those in radius: speed reduced to 1/4, Willpower roll each turn (diff = rating + successes, max 9) or lose 1 permanent Willpower. When duration expires: 2 unsoakable lethal damage, lose blood = half successes rounded up (no blood loss in Underworld).

4.name: Wrath of the Tempest
4.description: Summon the death rattles of all you've vanquished, pricking a hole between worlds to unleash the metaphysical storm of the Tempest.
4.system: Lift head to sky, open mouth—choir of voices issue deafening cry as storm clouds gather. Silence, then roaring hurricane explodes around you. Rise 30 feet into air as eye of funnel descends into your mouth. Full system details in source book.

5.name: Vrykolak
5.description: The apex of Kraina of Enoch. Full details in source book.
5.system: See V20 Black Hand p. 173

Kraina of the Well.description: Reserved exclusively for Old Clan Tzimisce who are members of the Order of Moloch. Deals with binding and controlling demonic entities.

meta.description: Major Kindred landmarks, strongholds, and significant domains

gaslamp_district.name: Gaslamp District
gaslamp_district.background: When Tara betrayed Anarchs to become Camarilla Prince, Anarchs rioted. Sabbat from Tijuana seized opportunity.
plot_hooks: Sabbat pack using chaos as cover
Anarch revenge plot against Prince Tara

lodins_boardroom.name: Lodin's Boardroom
lodins_boardroom.background: Prince Lodin died in Lupine rampage mid-1990s after declaring Blood Hunt on werewolves. Half of Chicago's Kindred perished.

rumored_contents.description: Mystic Domesday Book listing every Kindred since Caine
13th-century, bears True Name of Brujah Methuselah Menele
Grants Brujah Maxwell first right of Praxis

current_state: Some suspect rumors are Jyhad bait
plot_hooks: Methuselah awakens when True Name invoked

dr_netchurch_laboratory.name: Dr. Netchurch's Laboratory
dr_netchurch_laboratory.background: Malkavian bioeschatologist studies scientific realities of Kindred condition. Pioneer of 'posthumous sciences.'
features: Volunteers often Caitiff from nearby domains

succubus_club.name: Succubus Club
succubus_club.background: Original appeared in Chicago early 1990s. Now nomadic like carnival.
features: Rarely stays more than one night
current_state: Known Tal'Mahe'Ra assassin used as cover

prime_chantry.name: Prime Chantry
prime_chantry.background: Ultimate bastion of Tremere authority. 'Called back to Vienna' instills dread in Warlocks.
rumored_features: Possibly oldest surviving structure in Vienna
City built upon it at Tremere direction
Information evolves and communicates instantly among Tremere

catacombes_de_paris.name: Catacombes de Paris
catacombes_de_paris.background: Vast ossuary with 6+ million deceased. 300km tunnels; only 2km open to public.
features: Hosts secret deals and masquerade fêtes

current_crisis.event: Tourist group exsanguinated and arranged in Kindred court poses
current_crisis.response: Joint police/Kindred investigation; closure blamed on vandalism
current_crisis.threat: Something dwells there that hates mortals and Kindred

tomb_of_patriarch.name: Tomb of the Patriarch
tomb_of_patriarch.background: The Dream of Byzantium - Cainite utopia - was shepherded by Methuselahs. Patriarch fell to diablerie during Crusades.
features: Replica of Hagia Sophia beneath true Hagia Sophia
Academic riches rival Library of Alexandria
Contains verifiable history and prophecy clues
current_state: Lies at forbidden center of hostile entente
The Dream is all but broken

alamut.name: Alamut
alamut.background: Ancestral Assamite home. Stony fortress over 1,000 years old, beneath mortal hashishin ruins.
features: The 'Old Man' directs clan affairs from beneath
current_state: Rival Methuselahs may vie for power

pyre_of_moloch.name: Pyre of Moloch
pyre_of_moloch.background: Romans found human sacrifice when sacking Carthage. Punic Wars stretched Masquerade - open Jyhad between Ventrue and Brujah.
features: Hidden among UNESCO World Heritage Site
Great brazier surrounded by tiny bones
Buzzes with flies, crawls with maggots
current_state: Spawned Kindred know songs of Pazuzu

utgard.name: Utgård
utgard.background: Remote island where Kindred believe Ragnarök passed. Named for Norse realm of giants.
features: Mortals exist only to serve and feed
Not far removed from Dark Ages jarls
current_state: Close to terror of First City
Isolation maintained by geography and belief

grand_masquerade.name: The Grand Masquerade
grand_masquerade.background: Early fall gathering where 1,000+ Kindred descend on 'the vampires' city.' Prince reluctantly opens domain.
grand_masquerade.notes: Cut from main book for being too 'meta'/fan service, but included for Storyteller use

_meta.description: The Tal'Mahe'Ra (True Black Hand) sect organization and rules
_meta.source: V20 The Black Hand: A Guide to the Tal'Mahe'Ra

overview.founding: 3,000+ years ago, originating with Idran death-mages who discovered Enoch in the Underworld
overview.headquarters: Enoch (the First City, now in the Shadowlands)
goals: Guard the sleeping Antediluvians in Enoch
Maintain balance between Camarilla and Sabbat
overview.ideology: The Antediluvians will rise and consume all Kindred, then perish. The Blood of Caine will vanish, and humanity (Children of Seth) will be free. The Tal'Mahe'Ra works to ensure this occurs correctly.

Del'Roh.description: The ultimate authority, though rarely seen by most members

Seraphim.description: Ancient vampires (often 4th-6th Generation) who direct sect operations. At least 600+ years old.

Wazir.description: The Wazir council advises the Del'Roh and authorizes major sect actions including sanctioned diablerie

Dominions.description: Oversee operations in specific territories, coordinate between Fingers and Palm

Palm.description: Full members who have proven loyalty and capability

Fingers.description: Sub-organizations within the Hand, each with specific focus (Bahari, Order of Moloch, Idran, etc.)

Bahari.description: Worship Lilith through pain, transformation, and feminine mysteries. Multiple sub-sects: Azicithra, Red Midwives, Thorn Garden, Lilin Witches.

Order of Moloch.description: Hunt demons and infernalists. Core membership is Old Clan Tzimisce. Possess extensive lore on binding and destroying demonic entities.

Idran.description: The original mortal cult that discovered Enoch. Now includes Nagaraja and practitioners of Itarajana sorcery. Guard the Guarded Rubrics.

Royal Order of Edenic Groundskeepers.description: Nearly 500 years old, neutral territory in 30+ domains. Wealthy Kindred who believe Earth is bountiful paradise threatened by Antediluvian 'pests.' Mostly unknowingly controlled by the True Hand.

character_creation.notes: Tal'Mahe'Ra characters come with significant baggage—their inclusion implies a history worthy of notice and recruitment.

rules.diablerie: Forbidden without express permission of the Wazir council. Those responsible for destruction of Antediluvians or unjustified diablerie are forbidden membership.
rules.thin_bloods: Disdained. Creation of any Kindred greater than 10th Generation is discouraged. 13th-15th Generation vampires seen as signs of Gehenna but also targets for purging.
rules.infiltration: Members maintain cover identities in Camarilla, Sabbat, or as Independents. The Hand behind the Curtain operates through manipulation and proxy.

_meta.description: The Bahari (Cult of the Dark Mother/Lilith) within the Tal'Mahe'Ra
_meta.source: V20 The Black Hand: A Guide to the Tal'Mahe'Ra

overview.focus: Worship of Lilith through pain, transformation, and feminine mysteries
overview.doctrine_source: The Lilith Cycle—fragments of texts recording the Dark Mother's stories from Genesis to Final Nights

core_doctrines.equality: The lowest neonate and mightiest elder are the same before the Dark Mother. Bahari avoid initiatory degrees and don't string along adherents with promises of greater secrets.
core_doctrines.tree_of_knowledge: As lover to the Serpent, Lilith gave Eve fruit from the Tree of Knowledge. Women who join Lilith's cult germinate these seeds within and inherit her legacy.
core_doctrines.many_faces: Lilith is equal to the Elohim, maker of many gardens, lover of gods, creator of monsters. The Triple Goddess, Durga, Nuwa—all equally valid accounts of the Dark Mother.
core_doctrines.mother_of_monsters: Lilith gave birth to all monsters and night-wisdom. The cult should accept any of her children and foster cooperation between supernatural beings.
core_doctrines.pain_of_transformation: To become Bahari, one suffers and must inflict suffering. Pain is a teacher. Lilith's cult transforms pain into insight.

bahari.gender_doctrine: The cult centers on feminine power. Male Bahari can earn respect but never more than a woman from the same sect. Gender refers to sincere identity, not biology—many common sex differences fall away after the Embrace.

rite_of_two_trees.description: All Tal'Mahe'Ra Bahari undergo this initiation demonstrating commitment to gnosis through suffering. Tailored agony that takes people beyond withdrawal into their psyches.
rite_of_two_trees.system: May emerge with Physical/Mental Flaws balanced by equivalent Merits. Example Flaws: Tic/Twitch, Disfigured, One Eye, Open Wound, Lame, Nightmares, Phobia. Example Merits: Bruiser, Daredevil, Common Sense, Iron Will, Magic Resistance, Oracular Ability.

Azicithra.focus: Reconciliation between Bahari and Noddist factions
Azicithra.doctrine: Caine was born of Lilith (as the Serpent) and Eve. Caine is both man and woman—the 'mark of Caine' refers to twin-sexed nature Adam concealed. In Final Nights, Lilith will reconcile with Caine and they will judge Kindred together.

additional_sins.9: Tolerating any holy figure being raised above Lilith
additional_sins.8: Failing to subvert the works of Noddists
additional_sins.4: Sacrificing fellow Bahari to achieve your goals

Red Midwives.doctrine: Worship Lilith as Mother of Monsters. Seek to inherit her divine fertility—allow vampires to conceive human children, shape the Embrace, Embrace without Generation loss. Study Thin-Blooded legends and dhampir myths.

additional_sins.8: Failing to attend a nearby birth or Embrace if other assistance would not be forthcoming
additional_sins.3: Hindering your childe's search for gnosis and power

Thorn Garden.doctrine: Combine ancient study of pain with sense of justice. Suppress revenge urge in favor of enforcing Black Hand law. Dream of reviving the Dark Mother's paradise D'hainu.

additional_sins.10: Failing to recreate the Garden of D'hainu in Enoch
additional_sins.2: Destroying an enemy expediently without instructive agonies

Thorn Garden.role: Often trusted to punish wayward Hand members. Frame torture so wrongdoers learn from experience.

Lilin Witches.doctrine: Adapt beliefs of Awakened followers, emphasize death in natural cycles and Dark Mother's influence in Goddess cults. Seek out Bahari scriptures, artifacts, and magical arts.

additional_sins.9: Failing to cultivate the Dark Mother's religion among mortals
additional_sins.7: Failing to protect faithful followers of Lilith
additional_sins.2: Destroying magical secrets and Bahari scripture

Lilin Witches.special: Many are mortal sorcerers, not vampires. Long association with True Hand Bahari.

thaumaturgy_path.name: The Blessings of the Great Dark Mother
thaumaturgy_path.description: Bahari-specific Thaumaturgy path. See V20 Black Hand pp. 86-90 for full details.

_meta.description: Enoch, the First City, now in the Shadowlands
_meta.source: V20 The Black Hand: A Guide to the Tal'Mahe'Ra

overview.location: The Shadowlands (Underworld), specifically in the Labyrinth above the Abyss
overview.description: The legendary First City built by Caine, now a vast necropolis in the lands of the dead. Headquarters of the Tal'Mahe'Ra and resting place of sleeping Antediluvians.

nature.physical: A great chaos of stone and bone rising from the floor, twisted to form walkways, rooms, chambers, staircases. Names carved into stone so old none who walk the halls saw them carved.
nature.reality: Disorienting and ever-shifting. The way back changes while not looking. The sensation of being constantly watched pervades all visitors.
nature.light: No sun exists in the Dead City to mark time's passage. The faint Underworld sun deals no damage to vampires with proper protections.
nature.access: Requires crossing the Tempest (endless sea of tormented spirits) or powerful Necromancy rituals.

Black Citadel.description: The Dread Palace Ghemal, seat of the Del'Roh and Wazir council

The Libraries.description: Vast collections of books, scrolls, and palimpsests
The Libraries.contents: History, lore, Guarded Rubrics, words of forebears in ink and blood, magic, tales of lupines and changelings

Antediluvian Tombs.atmosphere: Overwhelming sense of danger, shadows that rise and creep along walls and ceilings
Antediluvian Tombs.warning: Do not slow down, do not turn back

The Labyrinth.description: Twisting passages throughout Enoch connecting to deeper Underworld
The Labyrinth.dangers: Easy to become lost, inhabited by various entities

inhabitants.Nagaraja: Flesh-eating necromancers who serve as primary stewards
inhabitants.Harbingers of Skulls: Lazarenes who found refuge here after escaping the Shadowlands
inhabitants.Old Clan Tzimisce: Core of the Order of Moloch, practitioners of true Koldunism
inhabitants.Yamasattva: Deathless magi who guide the Idran and appear as Vedic deity aspects
inhabitants.Chatterlings: Children taken young and trained as servants—taught to smile like normal people by ghosts

Aralu.description: The forgotten inhabitants of the ancient Necropoli

the_guarded_rubrics.description: Ancient texts given by Inauhaten, distillation of necromantic praxis over millennia
the_guarded_rubrics.contents: Touch upon Books of Nod but possess eschatological bent eclipsing Caine's accounts. Do not record existence's beginning but precisely detail the end.
the_guarded_rubrics.significance: Signs of Gehenna include Caine's brood coming home to Enoch. Those who control Enoch control the apocalypse's course.

access_notes.vampires_in_underworld: Cannot feed on ghosts normally. Must use Parting the Veil ritual or similar to lure mortals across.
access_notes.travel: Requires crossing the Tempest—many are consumed by endless sea of tormented spirits. Alternatively, powerful necromancy can open portals.
access_notes.koldunism: Kraina of Enoch practitioners always know Enoch's exact location within the Tempest.

_meta.description: Reference data from V20 Children of the Revolution
_meta.source: V20 Children of the Revolution by Justin Achilli et al.

book_contents.description: Collection of 18 elder character profiles, each Embraced during historical 'revolutions'
book_contents.theme: Kindred Embraced in 'interesting times' often become catalysts or casualties of future upheavals
book_contents.use: Pre-generated NPCs, elder character creation examples, historical setting hooks

_meta.description: Setting information for the Anarch Movement

glossary.Baron: Leader of an Anarch domain who exercises more or less absolute power, whether officially or by common acknowledgment
glossary.Chancellor: Executive of a parliamentary democracy, usually chosen by prevailing faction. Similar to prime minister. Domain may have multiple Chancellors. Not to be confused with Camarilla Chancellor who records boons.
glossary.Compact: Randomly chosen group of citizens who stand collective surety for each other in civic matters. Used in domains with weak central law enforcement or to integrate rival factions. Also called frankpledge, cumann, circle, posse, krew.
glossary.Free State: Inconsistently applied term generally meaning Anarch domain. May also mean: Anarch domain without Baron, California's Anarch Free State, or all Anarch domains worldwide. Lack of specificity reflects Movement's decentralized nature.
glossary.La Libertad: Domain's anniversary celebration. In California usually Cinco de Mayo; elsewhere corresponds to local revolution date. Often includes swearing-in of new citizens and rewards for brave exploits.
glossary.Legate: Agent of powerful Anarch domain (especially major California cities) sent to allied domains as liaison, spy, and strongarm. Less polite term: Cheka (after Lenin's secret police).
glossary.Molotov: Traveling agent provocateur for hire, employed to harass neighboring Camarilla or Sabbat domains into negotiations while the hiring domain denies responsibility.
glossary.President: Head of executive branch in democracy with strict separation of powers between executive and legislators.
glossary.Reeve: Head of law enforcement, loosely equivalent to Camarilla Sheriff. In democratic Anarch domains, powers are less summary - must seek warrants/permits for searches, seizures, and arrests.

Convention of Thorns.summary: Ended the Anarch Revolt. Anarchs enjoined with Camarilla with full rights and privileges. Most atrocities forgiven. Assamites agreed to Thaumaturgical curse preventing diablerie of other clans, paid ransom of 2000 pounds gold, banned from blood hunts. In return, Alamut's independence guaranteed.

parties: Camarilla (Ventrue, Tremere, Toreador, Nosferatu, Gangrel, Brujah, Malkavian)
Treaty of Tyre.summary: Supplemental treaty. Assamites submit to Tremere ritual making Kindred blood poisonous to them. Assamites restricted to historical territory, may not travel outside or have retainers do so. Alamut defenses must be dismantled. Princes may call Blood Hunt on any Assamite without reason. Camarilla agrees to cease action against Assamites and not employ them as assassins.

principles: Declaration of freedom and independence from any creature or organization
Ability to rule selves with no Prince, Primogen, or other ruler except chosen ones
Kinship with oppressed Kindred everywhere, offering home to all who dwell in harmony
Responsibility to assist oppressed Kindred in their own struggle
Recognition of responsibility to maintain the Masquerade
Establishment of Status Perfectus and recognition of duty to all Kindred

Red Question.description: Mysterious faction spreading Anarch philosophy through enchanted information networks. Use digital Disciplines and disinformation tactics.

Digital Draculas.description: Most (in)famous Hacktivist Thaumaturgy coterie. Created Fangchat and other secure vampire communication tools.

Comancheros.description: Brujah-dominated Anarch gang. Originally had idealistic goals including making Bakersfield into 'new Carthage.' Over decades devolved into criminal enterprise focused on drugs, gun-running, and prostitution.

Jeremy MacNeil.description: Legendary Anarch Baron, founder of the California Free States. Older and more conservative than many assume.

Smiling Jack.description: Legendary Anarch elder known for guerrilla tactics and 'head-busting tradition.' Creator of Smiling Jack's Trick combination Discipline.

Tara.description: Anarch figure representing loyal opposition to established Anarch leadership.

SchreckNet.description: Secondary Internet built by Nosferatu that piggybacks on main Internet architecture. Accessible only through special login procedures impossible for non-Kindred. Originally clan-only, now includes select outsiders.
SchreckNet.notable_outsider: Hurricane (Bobby Weatherbottom) - Ventrue hacker, first non-Nosferatu to post on SchreckNet

Fangchat.description: Secure chat/text program created by Digital Draculas. Freeware for Kindred. Still recommends typing as though a Nosferatu were standing over your shoulder.

_meta.description: V20 Archetypes for Nature and Demeanor
_meta.note: Nature determines Willpower recovery. Demeanor is the face shown to the world.

Architect.description: You seek to create something of lasting value. Your immortality is a chance to leave something behind.
Architect.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you create or establish something of importance—a building, a business, a new vampire.

Autocrat.description: You want to be in charge. You seek power and control for their own sake.
Autocrat.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you achieve a position of significant leadership or authority.

Bon Vivant.description: Life is shallow and meaningless, so you've decided to enjoy it. You live for pleasure.
Bon Vivant.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you truly enjoy yourself and can express that pleasure.

Bravo.description: Strength is all that matters. Might makes right, and you have plenty of might.
Bravo.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you achieve a goal through force or intimidation.

Capitalist.description: Everything has a price. You understand that money makes the world go round.
Capitalist.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you close an important deal or acquire valuable resources.

Caregiver.description: You protect and comfort others. You need to be needed.
Caregiver.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you successfully protect or nurture someone.

Celebrant.description: You take joy in your passion. Whether it's art, battle, or study, your enthusiasm sustains you.
Celebrant.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you pursue your passion and achieve something meaningful.

Chameleon.description: You adapt to every situation, becoming whoever you need to be.
Chameleon.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you successfully adopt a necessary new persona.

Child.description: You are immature in personality, preferring to have others care for you.
Child.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when someone takes care of you or protects you.

Competitor.description: Every situation is a challenge to be won. You live for victory.
Competitor.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you win a significant competition.

Conformist.description: You follow the strongest leader. You're happiest supporting others' causes.
Conformist.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when your group achieves a goal due to your support.

Conniver.description: Others exist to do your work for you. Why get your hands dirty?
Conniver.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you trick someone into doing what you want.

Creep Show.description: You shock and disgust others with 'evil' behavior. It's all show, but it works.
Creep Show.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you successfully shock or horrify someone.

Curmudgeon.description: Everything is flawed and people are fools. You're a critic of everything.
Curmudgeon.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when someone follows your cynical advice and it proves correct.

Deviant.description: You don't fit in, and you don't want to. You reject mainstream morality.
Deviant.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when your unconventional approach succeeds where normalcy fails.

Director.description: Nothing is worse than chaos. You organize and direct, bringing order from strife.
Director.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you organize a group to accomplish a goal.

Enigma.description: Your actions are bizarre and inexplicable to everyone except yourself.
Enigma.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when someone discovers that your strange behavior had purpose.

Eye of the Storm.description: Chaos and havoc follow you wherever you go, despite your calm appearance.
Eye of the Storm.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you survive a crisis you inadvertently caused.

Fanatic.description: Your cause consumes your existence. The end justifies any means.
Fanatic.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you accomplish something that advances your cause.

Gallant.description: You live for attention and glory. You're the center of attention whenever possible.
Gallant.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you impress someone or are the center of attention.

Guru.description: You have wisdom to share, and others should benefit from your enlightenment.
Guru.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when someone benefits significantly from your advice.

Idealist.description: You believe the world can be better and work to make it so.
Idealist.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when your idealistic actions make a real difference.

Judge.description: You seek to improve the system through rational analysis and fair judgment.
Judge.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you solve a problem rationally or unite dissenting parties.

Loner.description: You prefer your own company. Others are burdens at best.
Loner.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you accomplish something alone that benefits others.

Martyr.description: You suffer for your cause, believing your pain will improve others' lot.
Martyr.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you suffer for your ideals or another's immediate gain.

Masochist.description: You test your limits through pain and suffering. You define yourself by endurance.
Masochist.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when your suffering leads to tangible gain.

Monster.description: You are a creature of darkness and act accordingly. Evil is your tool.
Monster.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you indulge in your particular brand of monstrousness.

Pedagogue.description: You know things and must share them. Others need your wisdom.
Pedagogue.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when someone benefits from your teaching.

Penitent.description: You must atone for your sins. Your existence is penance.
Penitent.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you achieve absolution for a transgression.

Perfectionist.description: You demand flawless execution in all things, from yourself and others.
Perfectionist.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you accomplish a goal flawlessly.

Rebel.description: You hate authority and challenge it whenever possible.
Rebel.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when your rebellious actions adversely affect your opposition.

Rogue.description: You look out for yourself first. Others can take care of themselves.
Rogue.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when your self-interested actions benefit you at another's expense.

Sadist.description: You enjoy causing pain in others. Suffering amuses you.
Sadist.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you cause someone significant suffering.

Scientist.description: Knowledge is the greatest treasure. You pursue understanding of all things.
Scientist.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you make a significant discovery or solve a mystery.

Soldier.description: You follow orders and serve the cause. You're a good soldier.
Soldier.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you achieve an objective through discipline and obedience.

Survivor.description: No matter what happens, you endure. Self-preservation is paramount.
Survivor.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you survive a dangerous situation through your own abilities.

Thrill-Seeker.description: You live for the adrenaline rush of danger and excitement.
Thrill-Seeker.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you successfully take a major risk.

Traditionalist.description: The old ways are best. Change is dangerous and should be resisted.
Traditionalist.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you protect established traditions or order.

Trickster.description: Laughter is the best medicine, especially when you're the one laughing.
Trickster.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you trick someone and escape the consequences.

Visionary.description: You see what could be. Your imagination shapes your actions.
Visionary.willpower_recovery: Regain Willpower when you convince others to believe in your vision.

_meta.description: Additional Paths of Enlightenment from Lore of the Clans
_meta.note: These supplement the core V20 paths

path_of_entelechy.name: Path of Entelechy
path_of_entelechy.ethics: Master the Beast through philosophical discipline, achieving enkrateia (self-mastery) and sophrosyne (moderation).
followers: Idealists seeking to control their rage
path_of_entelechy.origin: Developed by Brujah who sought to reclaim their Clan's philosophical heritage and overcome the curse of rage through Stoic principles.

hierarchy_of_sins.9: Failing to pursue a philosophical discussion
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Acting on emotion rather than reason
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Allowing rage to influence your actions

special_rules.fury_focus_merit: Followers may purchase the Fury's Focus Merit (3 pts), allowing controlled frenzy actions.
special_rules.degeneration_bonus: Followers may reduce degeneration check difficulty based on Fury's Focus successes.

path_of_ecstasy.name: Path of Ecstasy
path_of_ecstasy.ethics: Enlightenment through indulgence. Experience all sensations to transcend the flesh and achieve divine understanding.
path_of_ecstasy.origin: An alternative Setite path focusing on Set's aspect as liberator through pleasure rather than corruption.

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Refusing to share pleasure with others
hierarchy_of_sins.9: Failing to ride the wave in frenzy
hierarchy_of_sins.8: Failing to pursue a new experience
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Failing to tempt another into pleasure
hierarchy_of_sins.4: Placing another's needs above your pleasure

path_of_the_warrior.name: Path of the Warrior
path_of_the_warrior.ethics: Physical perfection and violence as holy offerings to Set. The body is a weapon to be honed; combat is worship.
path_of_the_warrior.origin: A militant Setite path emphasizing Set's role as defender and warrior-god.

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Refusing to defend a temple or clanmate
hierarchy_of_sins.8: Failing to challenge a worthy opponent
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Using deception when strength would suffice
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Failing to improve your combat skills

path_of_paradox_western.name: Path of Paradox (Western)
path_of_paradox_western.ethics: A nihilistic, self-destructive variant of the Eastern Path of Paradox. Reality is illusion; hasten its end through chaos.
path_of_paradox_western.origin: Developed by Western Ravnos who lost connection to Eastern philosophy, interpreting maya as meaninglessness rather than sacred illusion.

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Failing to foster chaos when opportunity arises

path_of_paradox_western.note: This darker variant lacks the spiritual depth of the Eastern Path and often leads followers to self-destruction.

meta.description: Backgrounds specific to ghouls and revenants

domitor.name: Domitor
domitor.description: Relationship with vampire master. Higher rating = more powerful but less caring domitor.
domitor.notes: Not recommended for independent ghouls, Sabbat ghouls, or revenants.

double_life.name: Double Life
double_life.description: Maintaining connections to former mortal life while serving domitor.
double_life.notes: Pairs well with Alternate Identity. May create vulnerabilities (hostages).

ratings.title: Keeping up Appearances
ratings.description: Distant contact with former acquaintances; occasional favors

ratings.title: Keeping a Lover
ratings.description: Romantic relationship maintained with master's permission

ratings.title: Staying Close to Family
ratings.description: Family connections with cover story; may not live with them

ratings.title: Possessing a Mortal Life
ratings.description: Full mortal life maintained: job, relationships, apartment

family_elder.name: Family Elder
family_elder.notes: Titles are honorific, not necessarily blood relationship. Responsibilities vary by family.

ratings.title: Big Sister/Brother
ratings.description: Keep younger members in line; pass along orders; run errands/missions

ratings.title: Aunt/Uncle
ratings.description: Supervise siblings; check in regularly; lead missions

ratings.title: Mother/Father
ratings.description: Advisor; shape younger members' futures; intervene in family matters

ratings.title: Grandmother/Grandfather
ratings.description: Oversee estate; manage other elders; handle visitors; report to Matriarch/Patriarch

ratings.title: Matriarch/Patriarch
ratings.description: Head of family; ultimate authority; recognized by Clan sponsor; handles external politics

majordomo.name: Majordomo
majordomo.description: Chief steward position commanding other servants on domitor's behalf.
majordomo.notes: Variant of Retainers. Impossible for independent ghouls (requires trust). Rare among Sabbat.
benefits: Servants may be ghouls or mortals

allies.ghoul_use: Fellow organization members, mortal contacts retained from former life

contacts.ghoul_use: Information network in mortal or ghoul communities
contacts.revenant_use: Family intelligence networks, external business contacts

mentor.ghoul_use: May represent relationship with domitor or senior ghoul

resources.ghoul_use: Often provided by domitor; may be personal if Double Life

retainers.ghoul_use: Only for Majordomo; commands domitor's other servants

status.ghoul_note: Ghouls cannot hold Status in vampire society. May have mortal Status.
status.revenant_note: Revenants cannot hold Clan Status but may have family Status equivalent.

_meta.description: Backgrounds available to Vampire characters in V20
_meta.note: Some backgrounds may be pooled among coteries

Allies.description: Friends and associates who will help you, though not unconditionally

scale.2: Two allies or one influential ally
scale.3: Three allies or one powerful ally
scale.4: Four allies or two powerful allies

Allies.notes: Allies are genuine friends who help willingly, unlike Retainers who are bound to you

Alternate Identity.description: A false identity with documentation and history

scale.4: Complete separate life with credit history

Alternate Identity.notes: Essential for maintaining the Masquerade long-term

Contacts.description: Information sources across various fields and communities

scale.4: Extensive network

Contacts.notes: Contacts provide information, not direct assistance

Domain.description: Territory recognized as yours by Kindred society

scale.3: A gas station/convenience store or nightclub
scale.4: A shopping mall or truck stop
scale.5: A major airport or train station

Domain.notes: Domain provides hunting grounds and territorial rights

scale.4: National fame

Fame.notes: Fame makes maintaining the Masquerade more difficult but provides social leverage

Generation.description: How far removed from Caine you are in the blood

scale.4: 9th Generation

Generation.notes: Affects blood pool maximum, blood per turn, and trait maximums

Haven.description: Your daytime refuge and sleeping place. May be individual or shared with coterie.
Haven.poolable_note: Characters may choose to keep Haven as an individual Background rather than pooling it with coterie members.

Luxury.description: Quality of appointments and amenities inside the haven

scale.1: Furniture from dumpsters or fell off a truck
scale.2: Modest decoration with modern basics (First World standard)
scale.3: Relative comfort with a host of amenities
scale.4: Luxurious oasis, unique in design and appearance
scale.5: Opulence usually reserved for the extremely wealthy or celebrities

Size.description: Amount of living space in the haven

scale.1: Small apartment or underground chamber (1-2 rooms)
scale.2: Large apartment or small family home (3-4 rooms)
scale.3: Warehouse, church, or large home (5-8 rooms or large enclosure)
scale.4: Mansion or network of tunnels (9-15 rooms or chambers)
scale.5: Sprawling estate or vast tunnel network (20+ rooms)

Size.notes: Players may be creative - an open warehouse layout, blacked-out skywalks, etc.

Security.description: How difficult the haven is to breach

scale.2: Reinforced doors, barred windows, or guard dog. Secure from commonplace threats.
scale.3: Modern locks, bars, alarm systems, security cameras. May be remote or have controlled access.
scale.4: Governmental/prison-level: reinforced walls, sectionalized access, panic rooms, hidden chambers.
scale.5: All previous features plus unique protection: extreme remoteness, geographical boundaries (island), or possible occult protections.

Security.mechanics: Each dot either adds +1 difficulty to penetration rolls OR adds +1 to successes required (agree before play begins)

Haven.allocation_note: Players divide dots among the three subcategories (Luxury, Size, Security)

Herd.description: Mortals from whom you can feed without fear

scale.4: 30 vessels (+4 hunting dice)

Herd.notes: Each dot adds one die to hunting rolls

Influence.description: Pull in mortal community through wealth, politics, or manipulation

scale.1: Moderately influential; factor in city politics
scale.3: Position of influence; factor in regional politics
scale.4: Broad personal power; force in national politics
scale.5: Vastly influential; factor in global politics

Influence.notes: Can be used in place of Abilities for bureaucratic matters

Mentor.description: A Kindred who looks out for you and offers guidance

scale.1: Mentor is an ancilla or equivalent
scale.4: Mentor is Prince or Archbishop

Mentor.notes: Mentors may expect something in return for patronage

scale.4: Wealthy, rarely touches cash

Resources.notes: Vampires primarily need Resources for luxuries and maintaining Influence

Retainers.description: Servants, assistants, or other loyal companions

scale.4: Four retainers

Retainers.notes: Retainers are typically ghouls or dominated mortals who require maintenance

Status.description: Standing and reputation in Kindred society

scale.4: Powerful elder

Status.notes: Status determines social standing in Camarilla, Sabbat, or other organizations

Rituals.description: Access to ritual knowledge, grimoires, and libraries containing magical procedures beyond your current capabilities

scale.1: A handful of minor rituals or a single uncommon text
scale.2: A small collection of rituals or access to a minor library
scale.3: Significant ritual library, including some rare procedures
scale.4: Extensive grimoire collection with unusual or forbidden rituals
scale.5: Major occult archive, potentially including ancient or unique rituals

Rituals.notes: This Background represents access to ritual knowledge rather than known rituals. Useful for blood sorcerers (Tremere, Giovanni, Assamite Sorcerers) and those seeking specific procedures. May require study time to actually learn rituals. Common among Tal'Mahe'Ra members and those with Necromancy.

Armory.description: Access to weapons stockpile for your gang or coterie

scale.1: Excellent starter armory with legal weapons common to your region
scale.2: Enough legal weaponry to outfit a street gang of 10
scale.3: Small militia level. Can outfit 5 individuals with gray-area weaponry civilians couldn't easily obtain.
scale.4: SWAT-team level including military-grade hardware. Enough for a 10-man team with advanced weapons. Risk of official scrutiny.
scale.5: Paramilitary-envy level. Tools to clean/repair almost any weapon. Significant quantity of weapons illegal in most countries, enough for a platoon. Discovery means Final Death.

Armory.notes: See V20 pp. 280-281 for specific weapon mechanics

Rituals.description: Knowledge of Sabbat ritae and ability to perform them

scale.4: Expert ritualist

Black Hand Membership.description: Standing within the Black Hand subsect

scale.4: High-ranking officer

Status.note: Standard Status background with Camarilla titles

path_of_caine.name: Path of Caine
path_of_caine.ethics: Caine is father of all, seek his teachings, prepare for Gehenna

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Failing to seek Noddist lore when opportunity arises
hierarchy_of_sins.9: Failing to instruct other Cainites in the ways of Caine
hierarchy_of_sins.7: Refusing to offer aid to another Noddist
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Failing to ride the wave when in Frenzy
hierarchy_of_sins.4: Failing to diablerize when the opportunity presents itself
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Refusing to defend Noddist lore or other Noddists
hierarchy_of_sins.2: Failing to pursue signs of Gehenna
hierarchy_of_sins.1: Denying Caine's power or your blood's heritage

path_of_cathari.name: Path of Cathari
path_of_cathari.ethics: Flesh is corrupt, spirit is pure; indulge to transcend

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Failing to seek out new experiences
hierarchy_of_sins.9: Refusing to share knowledge of pleasure with others
hierarchy_of_sins.7: Failing to indulge a new desire
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Acting for the benefit of another
hierarchy_of_sins.2: Refusing to explore a new sensation

path_of_death_and_the_soul.name: Path of Death and the Soul
path_of_death_and_the_soul.ethics: Death is transition; study it to understand existence

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Showing fear of death or final death
hierarchy_of_sins.9: Failing to study death when opportunity arises
hierarchy_of_sins.7: Refusing to share knowledge of death
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Showing aversion to corpses or death
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Failure to fully understand a death witnessed
hierarchy_of_sins.4: Making a decision based on emotion
hierarchy_of_sins.2: Preventing a death for emotional reasons

path_of_honorable_accord.name: Path of Honorable Accord
path_of_honorable_accord.ethics: Honor above all; keep your word, protect the weak

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Failing to show respect to your peers
hierarchy_of_sins.9: Failing to show respect to your enemies
hierarchy_of_sins.8: Failing to be hospitable to those deserving
hierarchy_of_sins.7: Breaking your word to a peer or enemy
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Allowing an insult to go unanswered
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Allowing a dishonorable act to go unpunished
hierarchy_of_sins.1: Breaking a sworn oath or blood oath

path_of_power_and_the_inner_voice.name: Path of Power and the Inner Voice
path_of_power_and_the_inner_voice.ethics: Power is truth; the strong rule the weak

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Failing to pursue a potential gain
hierarchy_of_sins.8: Failing to take advantage of an opportunity
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Acting against your own best interests
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Placing another's interests before your own
hierarchy_of_sins.1: Accepting defeat when victory is possible

path_of_metamorphosis.name: Path of Metamorphosis
path_of_metamorphosis.ethics: Transcend flesh; the body is clay, evolution is purpose

hierarchy_of_sins.9: Failing to experiment with new forms
hierarchy_of_sins.8: Allowing a conviction to stand without testing
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Retaining a shape for sentimental reasons

path_of_night.name: Path of Night
path_of_night.ethics: Darkness is truth; embrace the monster, corrupt the world

hierarchy_of_sins.9: Acting on impulse rather than calculation
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Allowing the Masquerade to be breached accidentally
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Leaving a victim alive and unafraid
hierarchy_of_sins.4: Failing to corrupt another when opportunity arises
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Failing to instill fear in those around you

path_of_the_feral_heart.name: Path of the Feral Heart
path_of_the_feral_heart.ethics: The Beast is ally; civilization is weakness, survival is law

path_of_blood.name: Path of Blood
path_of_blood.ethics: Haqim's children are judges; diablerie purifies weak blood

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Failing to seek the blood of elders
hierarchy_of_sins.8: Failing to destroy a vampire who offends Haqim's code
hierarchy_of_sins.7: Allowing personal feelings to interfere with duty
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Killing a mortal except in self-defense
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Refusing to offer hospitality to a clanmate
hierarchy_of_sins.2: Failing to destroy a target contracted

path_of_typhon.name: Path of Typhon
path_of_typhon.ethics: Set will return; spread corruption, weaken enemies of Set

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Pursuing personal desires over Set's wishes
hierarchy_of_sins.9: Failing to undermine the current social order
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Failing to pursue knowledge of Set
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Refusing to corrupt a useful mortal
hierarchy_of_sins.4: Consuming a substance other than blood or Set's gifts
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Refusing to undermine another for Set's glory

humanity.name: Humanity
humanity.ethics: Retain human morality despite vampiric nature

meta.description: Revenant family data for character creation

bratovich.name: Bratovich

weakness.description: +2 difficulty to resist frenzy. Cannot spend Willpower to avoid frenzy (can spend to end it).

character_creation.notes: Consider isolation level and remaining humanity

bratovich.history: Former Eastern European nobility; fell from grace after Convention of Thorns; reached America via privateering
bratovich.quote: You know where you are and you know who I am. So cut the bullshit.

dhabi.name: D'Habi

character_creation.notes: Centuries of abuse have broken their spirits

dhabi.history: Served Methuselah Nergal in Mesopotamia; betrayed and scattered after Baali Wars; enslaved by surviving Baali
dhabi.quote: I know it hurts, but you broke the rules. I warned you.

ducheski.name: Ducheski

character_creation.notes: Engineering, metalworking, computer science focus; complementary occult knowledge

ducheski.history: Originally Krevcheski, created by Tzimisce; defected to Tremere; closely monitored for loyalty
ducheski.quote: I don't know what circumstances would require you to perform an encephalectomy in thirty seconds, but I can assure you my invention will exceed your expectations.

enrathi.name: Enrathi

weakness.description: May not have Humanity higher than 3 or Conscience higher than 2

character_creation.notes: Must follow Path of Enlightenment; considered more brutal than Bratovich

enrathi.history: Etruscan traders (6th century BCE) turned slavers; manipulated by Tal'Mahe'Ra
enrathi.quote: My, you are a cute one! Would you like to meet your uncle now?

grimaldi.name: Grimaldi

weakness.description: Must make Willpower roll (diff 7) to avoid bragging about family superiority. Most are blood bonded to Sabbat vampires by Regent order.

character_creation.notes: Heavy Backgrounds investment required; retain Humanity; punish those who don't

grimaldi.history: Italian nobility tricked by Tzimisce; maintained wealth and influence
grimaldi.quote: Who am I? Oh, just the mayor's highly-paid and well-respected advisor.

kairouan_brotherhood.name: Kairouan Brotherhood

character_creation.notes: Retain Humanity; compete with ghouls for favor; Middle Eastern descent

kairouan_brotherhood.history: Created in 12th century from captured Tzimisce revenants by exiled Sorcerer Caste
kairouan_brotherhood.status: Smallest surviving family; fragmented between Castes
kairouan_brotherhood.quote: We may be few, but we remain unbroken.

obertus.name: Obertus

weakness.description: Obsessive-Compulsive Derangement. Narov line: Megalomania Derangement.

obertus.secret_goal: Believe they are next stage of human evolution (Homo obertus)
obertus.history: Byzantine monks serving Symeon and Gesu; merged with Narov family
obertus.quote: I hold the keys to knowledge. I know which doors to unlock.

oprichniki.name: Oprichniki

weakness.description: Haunted Flaw (permanent, cannot be removed; ghosts replace each other)

oprichniki.history: Ivan the Terrible's secret police (16th century); rescued by Oradea League
oprichniki.quote: I am compelled to fight, like a moth is drawn to the flame.

rafastio.name: Rafastio

weakness.description: Discipline difficulty varies by moon phase: +2 new moon, +1 waxing/waning, -1 full moon. Cannot be Embraced (dies, corpse desiccates instantly).

character_creation.notes: Occult and magical focus; include mortals and hedge witches

rafastio.history: Po River witches (pre-Roman Italy); claim to be oldest revenant family
rafastio.structure: Includes mortals and hedge witches, not just revenants
rafastio.quote: The owls hear my whispers, and the crows take to the sky. These are good omens.

rossellini.name: Rossellini

weakness.description: Deathsight Flaw (see death on everyone). -2 difficulty vs Appearance-based rolls. +2 difficulty on Perception rolls. +1 difficulty on Social rolls.

rossellini.creation_note: Made through unknown necromantic ritual (not Vicissitude)
rossellini.secret: Giovanni hide that they can create revenants (not just Tzimisce)
rossellini.history: Italian necromancers subjugated by Giovanni (16th century)
rossellini.quote: It does not matter what you devise, you cannot escape death.

servants_of_anushin_rawan.name: Servants of Anushin-Rawan

weakness.description: Compelled to protect any vampire descended from Anushin-Rawan as if blood bonded. Duration: 10 nights minus Willpower. Only one descendant at a time.

servants_of_anushin_rawan.secret: Most Ventrue think they're regular ghouls; Anushin-Rawan uses 'ghoul academies' to replenish bloodline
servants_of_anushin_rawan.history: Created by Ventrue Methuselah on island infused with fae/infernal magic
servants_of_anushin_rawan.quote: Of course, my lord. Whatever you need. She will be pleased, I'm sure.

zantosa.name: Zantosa

weakness.description: Willpower roll when exposed to pleasurable experience or become addicted/obsessed. Cannot spend Willpower to resist supernatural pleasure compulsion.

character_creation.notes: Entertainment industry; addictive personalities; con artists

zantosa.history: Originally Szantovich; fell from power after Anarch Revolt
zantosa.quote: If I can snort it, I will. If I can't, I'll try anyway.

katayama.name: Katayama
katayama.status: Less than a dozen members, third generation

_meta.description: Bloodline-specific Merits and Flaws from Lore of the Bloodlines
_meta.note: These Merits and Flaws are restricted to specific bloodlines unless noted otherwise.

The High Price.description: You've sacrificed part of your soul for greater power.
The High Price.system: Physical Attributes capped at 4 (cannot use blood to exceed). Costs 1 Willpower each evening upon rising. In exchange, gain +2 dice to all Discipline-related rolls.

Simply Waiting.description: You've accepted the end of the world is coming and remain unmoved.
Simply Waiting.system: All Social rolls against you are at +2 difficulty. You've resigned yourself to fate and cannot be swayed from your path.

Carrion Presence.description: Pestilence is attracted to you constantly.
Carrion Presence.system: Flies circle you, rats follow you, vultures watch overhead. Cannot be dismissed. +2 difficulty to social rolls with non-Baali. May reveal your nature.
Carrion Presence.notes: Some Baali wear this with pride

Dark Aura.description: You seem somehow wrong to everyone you interact with.
Dark Aura.system: +2 difficulty to all Social rolls except Intimidation. Those using Auspex see your aura as thin red mist with occasional watchful eyes.

Plague of Demons.description: Demons constantly seek you out for favors and attention.
Plague of Demons.system: At inconvenient times (Storyteller's discretion), demons approach you seeking favors, whispering demands, or causing disturbances. May interrupt feeding, combat, or social situations.

Chorus Trained.description: You've learned to harmonize with your sisters for greater effect.
Chorus Trained.system: At 3 points: +2 dice to Melpominee pools when using power with another character with this Merit. At 5 points: +2 dice to ANY action performed with a partner who has this Merit.
Chorus Trained.notes: Requires coordination with other Chorus Trained Daughters

Fugue Instinct.description: You can hear warnings and gain insight by listening deeply to the Fugue.
Fugue Instinct.system: Forego one action to listen to the Fugue. May defend but take no active actions. Gain +2 dice to whatever dice pool you use for your next action.

Banshee-in-Waiting.description: The Fugue is driving you toward madness.
Banshee-in-Waiting.system: If temporary Willpower reaches 0, gain a permanent, incurable Derangement. Can gain up to 3 this way. Fourth time this happens, you become a Banshee (NPC under Storyteller control).
Banshee-in-Waiting.notes: Extremely dangerous for characters with low Willpower

Stillness of Death.description: You can remain perfectly still like a statue.
Stillness of Death.system: +2 difficulty for any searches to find you when staying perfectly still. Excellent for hiding in plain sight as statuary.

Heavy Hands.description: Your hands have hardened into weapon-like appendages.
Heavy Hands.system: -1 difficulty to all damage rolls using unarmed attacks.

Stone Tongue.system: +2 difficulty to any Social rolls requiring speech. May have clumsy tongue, tusks, or beak-like mouth.

Blood Weakness.description: An ancestor's weakness manifests in you.
Blood Weakness.system: At 4 points: Gain either Gangrel weakness (animal features from frenzy) OR Tzimisce weakness (native soil requirement). At 7 points: Both. Also: One of your four Disciplines is treated as out-of-Clan for XP costs.
Blood Weakness.notes: Warrior Gargoyles with Gangrel weakness may gain both stone and animal features

Disciple of Lazarus/Japheth.description: You follow the teachings of one of the legendary Harbinger elders.
Disciple of Lazarus/Japheth.system: Recognized by other Harbingers as having special authority. +1 die to Social rolls with other Harbingers. May gain access to restricted teachings.

Styx Baptism.description: You've been ritually immersed in the rivers of the Underworld.
Styx Baptism.system: +2 dice to resist wraith-based powers. May perceive the Shroud between worlds more easily. +1 die to Necromancy rolls.

Half-Life.description: You exist partially in the lands of the dead.
Half-Life.system: Can perceive and interact with ghosts as if you were one of them. Can step sideways into the Shadowlands for brief periods (1 scene per night maximum). Very dangerous - ghost enemies can affect you normally.

Unsanctioned Embrace.description: You were Embraced without the approval of Harbinger elders.
Unsanctioned Embrace.system: -2 dice to Social rolls with Harbinger elders. May be viewed with suspicion or denied access to secrets.
Unsanctioned Embrace.notes: Can potentially be overcome with great service

Shadow Scarred.description: Your time in the Underworld left visible marks.
Shadow Scarred.system: Pale, translucent skin that shows bones beneath. Spectral features become more prominent under stress. +1 difficulty to all disguise attempts.
Shadow Scarred.notes: Evidence of extended time in the Shadowlands

Prized Collection.description: You possess an impressive collection of value to scholars.
Prized Collection.system: At 1 point: Collection of mild interest. At 2 points: Valuable to the right buyer. Visiting Kiasyd or experts are more likely to treat you favorably to gain access.
Prized Collection.notes: Could be books, blood vintages, artifacts, etc.

Alien Perfection.description: Your beauty is unsettling in its perfection.
Alien Perfection.system: -3 difficulty to Appearance rolls. Anyone in your presence for longer than one scene must make Stamina roll or feel nauseous and leave.
Alien Perfection.notes: Beauty so perfect it disturbs mortals

Paranormal Link.description: You're linked to another supernatural society.
Paranormal Link.system: -3 difficulty to decipher hidden rites, languages, and codes of one specified society (fae, mages, werewolves, etc.).
Paranormal Link.notes: Choose the linked society at character creation

Skin of Porcelain.description: Your skin has a ceramic-like coating.
Skin of Porcelain.system: Stamina roll (difficulty 8) allows converting up to 3 points of fire aggravated damage to lethal before soaking. Effect dissipates for rest of story.

Vitae Mutation.description: You've drunk so many strange substances your blood has mutated.
Vitae Mutation.system: Each night, Willpower roll (difficulty 7) to manifest 1 temporary dot of Auspex, Chimerstry, OR Dementation. Can add to existing ratings. Vanishes next night.

Lightweight.description: You cannot drink blood from non-standard sources.
Lightweight.system: Can only feed from mortals, ghouls, and vampires. Drinking from fae, werewolves, mages, etc. causes immediate expulsion with no sustenance.
Lightweight.notes: Ironic for a bloodline known for blood cocktails

Illiterate.system: At 1 point: Temporary - can be remedied with patient teacher. At 2 points: Permanent disability. Will be ostracized by other Kiasyd if discovered.
Illiterate.notes: Deeply shameful for the scholarly bloodline

Refined Palate.system: Like Ventrue weakness - blood outside your preference is unpalatable. Point value depends on restriction narrowness. 1 = broad (only young), 2 = medium (only wealthy), 3 = narrow (only redheads).

Dreadful Mara.description: Something you drank lives within you and hates you.
Dreadful Mara.system: Each night, Storyteller may convert 1 rolled success into a 1 (potentially causing botch). Entity may whisper insults or bad advice, increasing difficulty on concentration.
Dreadful Mara.notes: An angry spirit or fae essence

Extra Sharp.description: Your teeth are particularly well-suited for flesh-eating.
Extra Sharp.system: -1 difficulty to bite attacks. Can consume flesh more quickly and quietly.

Speed Eater.description: You can consume flesh more quickly than normal.
Speed Eater.system: At 2 points: Consume required flesh in half the normal time. At 4 points: Can eat flesh equivalent to 1 blood point in a single combat round.
Speed Eater.notes: Essential for feeding in dangerous situations

Wolverine's Palate.description: You can consume any flesh, not just fresh.
Wolverine's Palate.system: Can eat preserved, cooked, or even rotting flesh without penalty. Useful for disposing of evidence.

The Largest Maw.description: Your mouth has adapted to flesh-eating in obvious ways.
The Largest Maw.system: Mouth is disturbingly large or filled with unusual teeth. +2 difficulty to pass as human when mouth is visible.
The Largest Maw.notes: Difficult to hide without covering mouth

Body Trail.description: You leave behind more evidence than typical Nagaraja.
Body Trail.system: Always leave some evidence when feeding - bones, blood, etc. +2 difficulty to hide feeding evidence. Hunters may track your pattern.

Scent of the Other.description: Your third eye closes tightly and your blood doesn't reveal your Clan.
Scent of the Other.system: May be mistaken for Caitiff or another Clan. Tremere and Salubri hunters cannot easily identify you without witnessing Obeah/Valeren use.

Sight Beyond Sight.description: Your third eye occasionally pierces illusions.
Sight Beyond Sight.system: When third eye is open (via Auspex or Obeah), may occasionally see through Obfuscate, Chimerstry, or fae glamour. May glimpse ghosts or other hidden things. No control over when this activates.

Warrior's Heart.description: Adonai's resurrection has stirred your warrior nature.
Warrior's Heart.system: May learn Valeren at current rating x6 XP. If you know first two dots of both Obeah and Valeren, +2 dice when using either's first two powers. However: suffer Precept of Samiel - lose 1 Willpower per week spent in same location.
Warrior's Heart.notes: Combines healer and warrior aspects at a cost

The Eighth.description: Your sire is one of the Seven - the diablerist Golconda-seekers.
The Eighth.system: Constantly hunted by Tremere AND by your sire and their followers who want you to continue the diablerie chain. Must be at least 9th Generation.
The Eighth.notes: Extremely dangerous - hunted from multiple directions

Permanent Third Eye.description: Your third eye remains permanently open.
Permanent Third Eye.system: At 2 points: Eye is merely open, can be closed for a scene with effort. At 4 points: Cannot close eye at all. Obvious to all observers.

Death Grip.description: You gain insight by touching corpses.
Death Grip.system: When touching dead body, roll Wits + Alertness (difficulty 7). Success: Know how body died. Failure: Suffer illusory version of wound, lose 1 Willpower. Botch: Your body mirrors the wound, taking lethal damage equal to final blow.

Stitcher.description: You can reattach severed body parts easily.
Stitcher.system: When body parts are removed by damage, roll Dexterity + Medicine (difficulty 7) to sew them back. Success reduces healing cost by 1 blood point.

Brittle Body.system: At 2 points: +2 difficulty to all Physical rolls due to fragility. At 4 points: Also, dice penalties from damage remain until next evening even if health levels are healed.
Brittle Body.notes: Bones break and skin tears easily

Mortal Flashbacks.description: Your body remembers your death every night.
Mortal Flashbacks.system: Each night upon rising, your death wound reopens and you relive dying. Lose 1 Willpower automatically each evening.

Advanced Tech.description: You possess improved technology from True Brujah labs.
Advanced Tech.system: Devices work better than normal counterparts: -1 difficulty to use, half chance of mechanical failure. Point cost depends on how many items and how powerful they are.
Advanced Tech.notes: True Brujah improve rather than innovate technology

Fatalist.description: Your study of time has convinced you destiny is fixed.
Fatalist.system: -2 difficulty to all degeneration rolls for Humanity or Path of Enlightenment. Easier to excuse your worst actions as predestined.

True Celerity.description: You've developed a variant form of Celerity that slows time.
True Celerity.system: May learn True Celerity (functions as Celerity but feels like slowing time around you). Treated as in-Clan Discipline for XP costs. Cannot be taught to anyone without at least 1 dot of Temporis.
True Celerity.notes: Useful for posing as regular Brujah

Out of Phase.description: You perceive too many layers of alternate timelines.
Out of Phase.system: +2 difficulty to all Perception rolls as you struggle to separate real from potential timelines.

meta.description: Merits and Flaws specific to ghouls and revenants

mental.name: Eidetic Memory
mental.description: Perfect recall of events and information

mental.name: Light Sleeper
mental.description: Wake easily; +2 dice to awaken from sleep

social.name: Prestigious Sire/Domitor
social.description: Well-known master grants +1 Status in dealings

physical.name: Vicissitude Modifications
physical.description: Fleshcrafted body modifications. Requires Monstrous Flaw (Appearance 0).

modifications.name: Circular Vision
modifications.effect: Eye in back of head; bonus to rear Perception
modifications.drawback: -2 dice to depth perception and ranged attacks

modifications.name: Iron Stomach
modifications.effect: Digest any organic material; +2 Stamina vs ingested poison

modifications.name: Spurs
modifications.drawback: Hard to conceal; may limit mobility

physical.healing_note: Cannot heal modifications naturally or with Blood; requires Vicissitude user with level higher than original modifier

supernatural.name: Pale Aura
supernatural.description: Aura appears vampiric. Vampires with Auspex may assume you're a vampire unless they get 5+ successes on Aura Perception.

supernatural.name: Clear-Sighted
supernatural.description: See through illusions; +2 dice to resist Obfuscate and similar powers

mental.name: Nightmares
mental.description: Disturbed sleep; -1 die to all actions next day

mental.name: Phobia
mental.description: Irrational fear causes dice penalties. 2pt=common trigger, 3pt=rare but severe.

mental.name: Short Fuse
mental.description: +2 difficulty to avoid frenzy from anger

mental.name: Hunted
mental.description: A hunter is actively tracking you. Major threat to Masquerade.

mental.name: Problem with Authority
mental.description: Compulsively argumentative and disobedient. Dangerous for servants.

mental.name: Fugitive
mental.description: Wanted by authorities or Sect. Companions may become suspects.

social.name: Dark Secret
social.description: Hidden fact that could ruin you if discovered

social.name: Enemy
social.description: Someone actively opposes you. Points reflect enemy power.

social.name: Isolated Upbringing
social.description: Difficulty understanding modern world and social conventions

social.name: Sire's/Domitor's Resentment
social.description: Your master dislikes you for some reason

social.name: Vengeful
social.description: Compelled to seek revenge for slights

physical.name: Albino
physical.description: Pale skin, red eyes. Stand out in crowds; susceptible to sunburn.

physical.name: Light Sensitive
physical.description: Progressive sunlight sensitivity. 2pt=discomfort, 4pt=cannot function normally, 6pt=1 bashing per 15 min exposure.
physical.notes: Common with Setite domitors. May worsen over time.

physical.name: Cannibal
physical.description: Compelled to consume human flesh. Risk of disease if blood withdrawn.
physical.notes: More common among revenants. Discouraged for Camarilla ghouls.

physical.name: Hemophiliac
physical.description: Wounds don't stop bleeding. Additional bashing every 5 minutes until dressed. Blood cannot help.

physical.name: Seizures
physical.description: Frenzy roll in stressful situations or suffer seizure. Critical failure = grand mal (fall and thrash).

supernatural.name: Beacon of the Unholy
supernatural.description: Supernatural creatures notice you easily; harder to hide from them

supernatural.name: Touch of Frost
supernatural.description: Cold touch noticed by mortals; may cause discomfort or suspicion

_meta.description: V20 Abilities - Talents, Skills, and Knowledges
_meta.allocation: Prioritize categories as Primary (13), Secondary (9), Tertiary (5)

talents.description: Intuitive abilities that cannot be taught, only learned through practice. No penalty for untrained use.

Alertness.description: Noticing things that go on around you, even when not actively looking

Athletics.description: Basic athletic ability, training in sports or rigorous activities

Awareness.description: Instinctual reaction to the presence of the supernatural

Empathy.description: Understanding the emotions and motivations of others

Expression.description: Getting your point across clearly through conversation, writing, or art

Intimidation.description: Coercing others through threats, force of personality, or physical presence

Leadership.description: Inspiring and directing others, presenting yourself as someone to follow

Streetwise.description: Understanding urban environments, crime, and underground culture

Subterfuge.description: Concealing your own motives and uncovering others' hidden agendas

skills.description: Abilities learned through training and practice. +1 difficulty if no rating in a Skill.

Animal Ken.description: Understanding animal behavior, training and calming beasts

Drive.description: Operating vehicles including cars, motorcycles, and boats

Etiquette.description: Knowing proper behavior in social situations

Firearms.description: Using guns and ranged weapons effectively

Larceny.description: Physical manipulation associated with criminal activity

Performance.description: Artistic endeavors like singing, dancing, acting, or playing instruments

Stealth.description: Avoiding detection while hiding or moving

Survival.description: Living off the land and enduring harsh conditions

knowledges.description: Academic and intellectual pursuits requiring study. +1 difficulty if no rating in a Knowledge.

Academics.description: General education in humanities, social sciences, and liberal arts

Computer.description: Programming, hacking, and understanding computer systems

Finance.description: Understanding money, markets, and economic systems

Investigation.description: Finding clues, analyzing evidence, and solving mysteries

Law.description: Understanding legal systems, codes, and procedures

Medicine.description: Understanding how bodies work, healing, and diagnosis

Occult.description: Knowledge of mysticism, curses, magic, folklore, and vampire lore

Politics.description: Understanding political systems and power structures

Technology.description: Understanding electronics, hardware, and sophisticated devices

_meta.note: Optional abilities used with Storyteller permission

_meta.description: Merits and Flaws for V20 character creation
_meta.note: Merits cost freebie points, Flaws grant freebie points.

Acute Sense.description: One sense is exceptionally sharp. -2 difficulty on Perception rolls using that sense.

Ambidextrous.description: No off-hand penalty. Multiple action rules still apply.

Bruiser.description: Intimidating appearance. -1 difficulty on Intimidation rolls against those who haven't proven physical superiority.

Early Riser.description: Treat Humanity/Path as 10 for determining when you rise each evening.

Eat Food.description: Can eat food and savor its taste, though must eventually vomit it up.

Friendly Face.description: -1 difficulty on appropriate Social rolls with strangers on first meeting.

Blush of Health.description: Look more hale and healthy than other vampires. Skin retains living color.

Enchanting Voice.description: -2 difficulty on rolls involving voice to persuade, charm, or command.

Daredevil.description: +3 dice on risky non-combat actions (difficulty 8+). Negate one botch die.

Efficient Digestion.description: Gain extra blood point for every two consumed (does not exceed blood pool max).

Huge Size.description: Over 6'10" and 300 pounds. Extra Bruised health level.

Common Sense.description: Storyteller may warn you before stupid actions.

Concentration.description: Ignore distraction penalties on extended rolls.

Language.description: Fluent in one additional language per purchase.

Time Sense.description: Innately know approximate time of day or night.

Code of Honor.description: Follow strict moral code. +2 dice to resist temptation.

Eidetic Memory.description: Perfect recall. Difficulty 3 Intelligence + Alertness to remember details.

Elysium Regular.description: Comfortable in local Elysium. -1 difficulty on Social rolls there.

Harmless.description: Seem too harmless to be a threat. Others underestimate you.

Prestigious Sire.description: Your sire has high status. -1 difficulty on social rolls with those who respect them.

Prot\u00e9g\u00e9.description: Your sire still watches out for you.

Former Ghoul.description: Understand ghouls and Kindred society better than most neonates.

Mole.description: Spy within enemy organization feeding you information.

Old Pal.description: Elder owes you a major favor.

Clan Friendship.description: Another Clan looks favorably on you. -2 difficulty on friendly social rolls.

Peacemaker.description: Reputation for good judgment and keeping your word. Asked to mediate disputes, even between sects. -2 difficulty on social rolls to keep peace or mediate honestly.

Prized Patch.description: Member of an Anarch gang with violent, effective, or impressive reputation (possibly centuries old). -2 difficulty on Manipulation rolls with Anarchs who know your gang, unless they have historical animosity.

Soapbox.description: Special forum (zine, secure blog, podcast, social media with many followers) to spread opinions beyond your normal social circle. -2 difficulty on Expression and Subterfuge rolls with vampires who read/follow your Soapbox.

Sugar Daddy.description: Personal relationship with high-ranking member of a different sect. May invoke their name to lower Manipulation difficulty by 2 against members of that sect for smoothing problems or acquiring minor favors. Sugar Daddy expects similar treatment.

Hidden Diablerie.description: Black veins of diablerie don't show in your aura.

Magic Resistance.description: +2 dice to resist magical effects (even beneficial ones).

Medium.description: Can see and communicate with ghosts.

Oracular Ability.description: Receive visions of the future at Storyteller's discretion.

Spirit Mentor.description: A wraith advises and assists you.

True Love.description: Found your true love. +1 Willpower once per session.

Nine Lives.description: Fate protects you. May survive up to nine situations that should kill you.

True Faith.description: Possess genuine religious faith that repels vampires.

Short.description: 4.5 feet or less. Difficulty reaching things, half running speed.

Smell of the Grave.description: Exude damp, earthy odor. +1 difficulty on Social rolls with mortals.

Tic/Twitch.description: Nervous habit that reveals stress. Spend Willpower to suppress.

Bad Sight.description: +2 difficulty on sight-based rolls. 1pt if correctable with glasses, 3pt if not.

Fourteenth Generation.description: Can only use 8 blood points for powers/healing. Cannot raise Disciplines above 4.

Disfigured.description: Hideous scarring or deformity. +2 difficulty on Social rolls.

Dulled Bite.description: Fangs didn't develop properly. Need double successes to feed.

Infectious Bite.description: Bite causes infection in mortals. Victims take 1 aggravated level from infection.

One Eye.description: +2 difficulty on perception and ranged combat. No peripheral vision.

Permanent Wound.description: One wound that never heals. Always at -1 Health.

Slow Healing.description: Blood heals half as much damage.

Addiction.description: Addicted to substance in victim's blood. -1 die when deprived.

Monstrous.description: Appearance 0. Nosferatu cannot take this Flaw.

Fifteenth Generation.description: Even thinner blood. 6 blood points usable. Disciplines limited.
