Thin Blood.description: Blood is too weak. Discipline difficulties +1. Cannot blood bond or Embrace.

Blind.description: Cannot see. Automatic failure on sight-based rolls.

Deep Sleeper.description: -2 dice on rolls to awaken during the day.

Impatient.description: Hate waiting. +1 difficulty on actions requiring patience.

Nightmares.description: Plagued by nightmares. Difficulty 7 Willpower roll to rest or lose 1 die next night.

Prey Exclusion.description: Refuse to feed on certain type of prey.

Shy.description: +2 difficulty on social situations in crowds or with strangers.

Soft-Hearted.description: Cannot stand to see others suffer. +2 difficulty to degeneration rolls.

Speech Impediment.description: Stutter or other speech problem. +2 difficulty on verbal communication.

Amnesia.description: Cannot remember your past before the Embrace.

Lunacy.description: Affected by phases of the moon. Frenzy difficulties change with lunar cycle.

Phobia (Mild).description: Mild fear of something. +1 difficulty when confronted.

Territorial.description: Must protect territory. Frenzy if intruded upon.

Vengeful.description: Must avenge slights. Willpower roll to let offenses pass.

Phobia (Severe).description: Intense fear. Must flee or be incapacitated.

Botched Presentation.description: Flubbed your presentation to the Prince. Fear you're hated.

Dark Secret.description: Secret that would make you a pariah if uncovered.

Expendable.description: Someone in power wants you gone and can maneuver you into danger.

Incomplete Understanding.description: Don't fully understand how your Sect works.

Infamous Sire.description: Your sire is disliked, and so are you by association.

Mistaken Identity.description: Look like another Kindred with a bad reputation.

New Arrival.description: Just arrived in the city, know nobody.

New Kid.description: Latest Embrace in the city, at bottom of social ladder.

Sire's Resentment.description: Your sire dislikes you and wishes you harm.

Enemy.description: Someone or group seeks to harm you. Points reflect enemy's power.

Failure.description: Once held a title but failed catastrophically. Now ostracized.

Hunted.description: Hunted by vampire hunters or similar enemies.

Blood Hunted.description: Under Blood Hunt. 4 points if local, 6 if widespread.

Expiration Date.description: Wanted in several domains for minor crimes (like exsanguinating the Seneschal's favorite ghoul). Not bloodhunted yet, but one more mistake signs your Final Death warrant. +2 difficulty on social rolls to acquire help, except Intimidation.

Black Sheep.description: Belong to prestigious lineage paragon of another sect before joining Anarchs. Sire, grandsire, and broodmates want to bring you back or make things uncomfortable for you and any Anarchs who shelter you. Combines Sire's Resentment and Hunted Like a Dog (cannot take those separately). Additionally, +2 difficulty on social rolls with fellow Anarchs who distrust you as a double-agent.

Cast No Reflection.description: No reflection appears in mirrors. Lasombra cannot take this Flaw.

Grip of the Damned.description: Feeding causes pain rather than pleasure. Victims may struggle.

Touch of Frost.description: Plants wilt and die at your touch.

Beacon of the Unholy.description: True Faith affects you more strongly. +2 difficulty to resist.

Eerie Presence.description: Mortals sense something wrong with you. +2 difficulty on social rolls.

Repelled by Crosses.description: Crosses repel you regardless of wielder's faith.

Can't Cross Running Water.description: Cannot cross running water unless by bridge or boat.

Haunted.description: A ghost follows and plagues you.

Light-Sensitive.description: Sunlight does twice the normal damage. Bright lights cause discomfort.

Dark Fate.description: Doomed to a horrible end. Storyteller determines when and how.

_meta.description: Clan-specific Merits and Flaws from Lore of the Clans
_meta.note: These Merits and Flaws have clan restrictions as noted.

Sectarian Ally.description: Close friend in one Kindred sect (Camarilla, Sabbat, or Anarchs). Ally helps navigate their sect but may want favors.

Thousand Meter Killer.description: Member of elite sniper club. -1 difficulty on sniping rolls. Double normal sniper rifle range.

Fury's Focus.description: Spend Willpower at frenzy onset, roll Entelechy rating (difficulty = original frenzy roll +1). Control actions for 1 turn per success. Reduce degeneration difficulty by successes (minimum 4).

Dynamic Personality.description: Natural charisma draws mortals. Can purchase Allies, Contacts, Herd, Retainers with XP at current rating cost at end of each story.

Drug Resistance.description: Unusually resistant to substances. -2 difficulty on all rolls to resist effects of alcohol, narcotics, and similar addictive substances.

Addictive Blood.description: Your blood is the perfect drug. Anyone who tastes it must spend Willpower or suffer +2 difficulty to Mental/Social rolls when they see you again. Easier to blood bond victims.

Setite Initiate.description: Formally inducted into Setite religion despite being another Clan. Access to Serpentis and Setite Blood Sorcery (at out-of-Clan costs). May study Setite Paths of Enlightenment.

Controllable Night Sight.description: Extraordinary night vision you can toggle on/off. While active, no darkness penalties. In well-lit conditions while active, suffer inverse penalties.

Mortuario.description: Embraced via Ferryman's Recall ritual after death. Ashen complexion like Harbingers of Skulls. +1 die to all Necromancy rolls.

Spectral Connection.description: +2 dice on all rolls to interact with or affect wraiths and spirits.

Court Favorite.description: Skilled at swaying Courts of Blood decisions. Bonus or penalty (whichever favors you) equal to Merit level on rolls affecting Court decisions.

Eyes of Shadow.description: Something dark and dangerous in your eyes. Reduce Intimidation difficulty by Merit level (minimum 2) when making eye contact.

Bigger Boys Came.description: Override opponent's Contacts. Roll Manipulation + Contacts (difficulty 8). If you get more successes than opponent's Contacts rating, their contacts fail them.

Call of the Sea.description: Feel at home on the ocean. +1 die to all dice pools (except Disciplines) when on a boat in ocean or river.

Secret Stash.description: Hidden resources, sleeper agents, or followers in reserve. Each level above 2 grants one unassigned Background point you can reveal instantly to increase Allies, Contacts, Herd, Influence, Mentor, Resources, or Retainers.

Aura of Command.description: Born commander. -2 difficulty when using Leadership to get others to obey.

King or Queen of Shadow.description: Draw strength from empathy. -2 difficulty on Humanity degeneration checks.

Long-Term Planning.description: Everything is carefully considered. Once per session, declare an action is 'part of your plan' and reduce difficulty by 2. Storyteller may veto.

Instrument of God.description: Divine purpose empowers you. +3 dice to resist powers of True Faith, including soaking True Faith damage.

Distracting Aura.description: Your psyche creates a confusing aura. +2 difficulty on all Aura Perception attempts against you.

Prophetic Dreams.description: Have dreams during daysleep that sometimes come true. Spend Willpower upon rising to receive a prophetic dream from Storyteller.

Cold Read.description: When meeting someone for the first time, spend Willpower points (up to your Perception). For each point, ask Storyteller one question about the character. Must answer truthfully or refund the point.

Foul Blood.description: Blood tastes vile. Drinkers must roll Willpower (difficulty 6) to avoid gagging. Diablerists need 3 Willpower rolls (difficulty 9). Cannot be used to create ghouls.

Lizard Limbs.description: Can detach limbs by spending a blood point. Useful to escape bonds/grapples. Limbs must regrow (days for hand/foot, week for limb). -3 dice penalty to actions requiring detached limbs.

Long Fingers.description: Unusually long, graceful fingers. +1 die on fine manipulation and grappling.

Monstrous Maw.description: Oversized tusks or mouth full of sharp teeth. +1 damage on bite attacks. +1 die to Intimidation when smiling.

Piscine.description: Comfortable in water. -1 difficulty on swimming and underwater movement rolls.

Slimy.description: Secrete disgusting ooze. Opponents need 2 extra successes to grapple you. -1 difficulty to soak fire damage.

Spawning Pool.description: Maintain a spawning pool of tainted blood. Grants Merit level as bonus dice to Animalism with vermin in home city. Requires 2x level blood points weekly to maintain.

Tunnel Rat.description: Adept at navigating underground. +1 die per Merit level on navigation, escape, and tracking in known sewers/tunnels.

Sleep Unseen.description: Lock Obfuscate while sleeping. Costs 1 blood point, lasts through day's rest. Auspex can still detect you.

Tough Hide.description: Thick, tough skin. +1 die on soak rolls. Does not apply vs. fire or sunlight.

False Reflection.description: Obfuscate affects cameras and recordings. People see what you want in photos/video. Computers see real face for recognition software.

Patagia.description: Leathery flaps between arms and legs. Can glide short distances with height and wind. May require Athletics roll to land.

Rugged Bad Looks.description: Still Appearance 0, but might pass for human in right light. Not immediately seen as freak or trauma victim.

Antitoxin Blood.description: Immune to all drugs and poisons, including supernatural venoms and toxins.

Brahmin.description: Priest, artist, or teacher caste. Once per session, immediately reroll a failed Academics or Expression roll.

Kshatriya.description: Warrior/ruler caste. Once per session, regain 1 Willpower when successfully executing a combat maneuver.

Legerdemain.description: Expert at sleight of hand. -2 difficulty on Subterfuge for physical trickery, shell games, card tricks, etc.

Mute Devotion.description: Animalism leaves lasting impression. +2 difficulty for others to use Animalism on creatures you've previously controlled.

Vaishya.description: Merchant/influence caste. Once per session, use one Background as if you had +1 dot (max 5).

Critters.description: Animals adore you. +1 die on Social rolls with small animals. Animal companions occasionally bring useful items or information once per session.

Heart of Needles.description: Jaded and hard-hearted. +2 difficulty for powers and challenges attempting to manipulate you emotionally.

Indelible.description: Body modifications persist after Embrace (hair dye, tattoos, piercings). 1 pt for cosmetic only, 2 pts for utilitarian (e.g., RFID implants). Spend Willpower to revert to tabula rasa.

Impressive Restraint.description: Blood's call is weaker. -2 difficulty on Self-Control rolls to resist hunger. Cannot take if using Instinct.

Master of the Masquerade.description: Never forget to breathe or lapse into statue-like stillness. -1 difficulty on Social rolls with mortals.

Slowed Degeneration.description: Strong moral core. +2 dice on Conscience rolls. Lost if you ever adopt a Path.

Embraced Without the Cup.description: Never drank from the Tremere blood in Vienna. Not blood bound to Clan. Must hide this fact.

Attuned Taste.description: Taste blood to determine details: creature type, relative health, presence of drugs/disease, emotional state.

Double Agent.description: Spy for another organization within Tremere. Access to both sides' resources but risk exposure.

Bioluminescence.description: Can grant glowing skin via Vicissitude. Control color and pattern. Can be used for communication or illumination.

Pain Tolerance.description: No wound penalties at Hurt or Injured. Full penalties at Wounded and below.

Dracon's Temperament.description: Fluid sense of self. Choose a new Nature at the start of each story. Regain Willpower and respond to powers per new Nature.

Haven Affinity.description: Connected to your haven's earth. +1 die to all pools in primary haven. Can sense direction to haven with Perception + Survival (diff 6, +1-2 if very distant).

Revenant Disciplines.description: Use your revenant family's three Disciplines as in-Clan instead of Tzimisce Disciplines.

Promethean Clay.description: -2 difficulty on Vicissitude powers on self. Can activate Vicissitude reflexively at full pool. No physical sculpting needed for first 3 levels on self.

Paragon.description: Embody Ventrue ideals. +3 dice on Social rolls with those who share or admire Ventrue values.

Personal Masquerade.description: Convinced others you're a member of a specific Clan. Ignore usual Caitiff social penalties with those fooled. Risk severe backlash if discovered.

Outcast.description: Rejected the ethos of your caste. +2 difficulty on Social rolls against your own caste members.

Broken Antitribu.description: Assamite antitribu still under Tremere Curse. Cannot perform diablerie, can only partake of Kindred vitae via Vaulderie. +2 difficulty on Social rolls vs. Sabbat.

Multiple Curses.description: Suffer an additional Assamite curse beyond your normal caste curse (e.g., vizier with Baali Curse).

Obvious Predator.description: Innate rage always shows. Mortals sense menace. +2 difficulty on Social rolls vs. mortals (except Intimidation).

Scales.description: Reptilian scales mark you. 1pt: small hidden area. 2pts: whole limb. 3pts: face. +2 difficulty on Social rolls when visible (not vs. Setites).

Venomous Bite.description: Always inject lethal neurotoxin when biting. Fatal to mortals (Kindred unaffected). Must feed via other means to avoid killing.

Forked Tongue.description: Flickering, reptilian tongue. Masquerade complications. Does not deal aggravated damage.

Heartless.description: Heart removed via Heart of Darkness and lost or in enemy hands. If possessed by Cainite, must obey their commands. If missing, +1 difficulty to Willpower rolls from anxiety.

Aura of the Typhon.description: Something in your essence draws Lupines. They stalk you, getting closer every night, for unknown purposes.

Uncontrollable Night Sight.description: Night vision always on. Suffer inverse darkness penalties in bright light. Even well-lit rooms are uncomfortable.

Insubordinate.description: Can't stand following orders. Must roll Willpower (difficulty varies by superior's importance and task danger, typically 7) or do opposite of what you're told.

Unproven.description: Haven't proven worthy of the Lasombra name. -3 dice on Social rolls vs. other Lasombra. Cannot sit in judgment in Courts of Blood.

Paper Trail.description: Records in institutions (prisons, asylums). Information is hard to eliminate, may endanger Masquerade, and can be used against you.

Stigmata.description: Phantom wounds that bleed. Costs extra blood point at dusk. 2pts: hidden wounds (hands, side), +1 Social difficulty. 4pts: obvious (bleeding eyes), +2 Social and +1 to one Attribute.

Infectious.description: Madness in your bite. Mortals gain a temporary derangement for every 3 blood points you take. Lasts until blood is restored.

Overstimulated.description: Easily distracted by sensory input. +2 difficulty on all Perception rolls.

Dead Inside.description: Feel only pain and numbness. Once per session, Storyteller may cancel any Willpower gain.

Stench.description: Even worse smell than typical Nosferatu. -2 dice on Stealth rolls as your presence is preceded by odor.

Dangerous Secret.description: Know something dangerous (Prince's haven, infernalists, etc.). Those implicated want you silenced. May be implicated yourself.

Anosmia.description: No sense of smell or taste. Auto-fail Perception rolls requiring those senses. Not immune to gas/poison, just can't detect them.

Parasitic Infestation.description: Crawling with ticks, lice, and leeches that feed on your vitae. Reduce blood pool by die roll each night. Cannot be removed.

Chandala.description: Lowest caste, responsible for corpse disposal. +2 difficulty on Social rolls vs. other Ravnos.

Flawed Reality.description: Illusions contain notable flaws. -2 difficulty for others to disbelieve your illusions.

Oathbreaker.description: Broke a properly sworn oath. Sickly red slash in aura. Cannot spend Willpower to resist vice. No Willpower from Nature.

Lost Svadharma.description: Failed your destiny when it mattered. -1 permanent Willpower. Cannot spend Willpower when other Ravnos are directly involved.

Tortured Artist.description: Nothing is good enough. +1 difficulty on Social rolls when being praised, complimented, or treated with respect.

Private Life.description: Completely separate life no Kindred know about (mortal family, YouTube channel, etc.). Could be seen as Masquerade breach if discovered.

Thaumaturgically Inept.description: Cannot learn Thaumaturgy, any paths, or rituals. Severely limits advancement in Clan hierarchy.

Unblinking.description: Eyes never close. +1 difficulty on friendly Social interactions with humans and Kindred on Humanity.

Ancestral Soil Dependence.description: Require Eastern European soil in addition to personal soil. Voice of Kupala punishes your day sleep otherwise.

Faceless.description: Face changes randomly each sunset. Roll 1d10: 1=no change, 2-3=minor, 4-8=unrecognizable (may change ethnicity/gender), 9-10=inhuman features. Affects Backgrounds requiring stable identity.

Privacy Obsession.description: Extreme respect for privacy. Willpower roll (diff 6) to enter uninvited. Self-Control/Instinct (diff 7) to avoid frenzy when disturbed by uninvited guest.

Revenant Weakness.description: Suffer both Tzimisce Clan weakness and your revenant family's weakness.

Consumption.description: Something devours you from within. 1 lethal damage each evening, cannot soak or heal with blood. Must consume 1/10 body weight in human flesh to counteract.

Uncommon Vitae Preference.description: Extremely specific feeding restriction (e.g., 'Korean War vets', 'Federal Court Judges'). +2 difficulty on all hunting rolls (max 9).

Clan Weakness.description: Inherited parent Clan's weakness despite being Caitiff. Can help maintain Personal Masquerade Merit.

Fangless.description: Fangs never developed. Must use knife or other means to feed. No natural way to inflict aggravated damage.

Ignorance.description: No instruction from sire. Start with zero knowledge of Kindred abilities, customs, or politics. Must learn everything the hard way.

Bulimia.description: Can't hold blood down. Stamina roll (diff 8) after feeding or vomit it up. Blood taken in frenzy absorbs normally.

_meta.description: Tremere Chantry Rating System from Lore of the Clans
_meta.source: V20 Lore of the Clans (Tremere chapter)
_meta.note: Chantries are rated by five traits, each rated 1-5. Characters don't purchase these as Backgrounds; they describe the chantry they belong to.

chantry_system.description: Tremere chantries are rated across five categories that define their resources, defenses, and capabilities. A character's access to chantry resources depends on their rank within the Pyramid.

Guardians.description: Supernatural guardians and ghouls protecting the chantry.

ratings.1: A handful of trained ghouls or one minor supernatural guardian.
ratings.2: Competent ghoul security force or a few supernatural guardians.
ratings.3: Professional ghoul security with minor supernatural backup, or a significant supernatural guardian.
ratings.4: Elite ghoul forces with multiple supernatural guardians; gargoyles likely present.
ratings.5: Fortress-level security with multiple powerful supernatural entities and elite ghoul forces.

examples.1: 3-5 ghouls with Security 2, or one trained attack dog ghoul
examples.2: 8-12 ghouls with Security 3, or 2-3 minor spirits bound to service
examples.3: 15+ professional ghouls, or a single gargoyle, or bound elemental
examples.4: 20+ elite ghouls plus 2-3 gargoyles or equivalent
examples.5: Small army of ghouls, multiple gargoyles, bound demons, or worse

Library.description: Access to Thaumaturgical knowledge, rituals, and research materials.

ratings.1: Basic ritual library. Access to rituals up to level 2.
ratings.2: Decent collection. Access to rituals up to level 3. -1 difficulty on research for common topics.
ratings.3: Substantial library. Access to rituals up to level 4. -1 difficulty on most Occult research.
ratings.4: Impressive collection. Access to most known rituals up to level 5. -2 difficulty on Thaumaturgy research.
ratings.5: One of the great libraries. Access to rare and unique rituals. -2 difficulty on any magical research.

Library.mechanics: Difficulty reduction applies to extended research rolls. Higher library ratings may grant access to restricted paths or unique rituals at Storyteller discretion.

Research.description: Laboratory facilities for creating magical items, developing new rituals, and experimentation.

ratings.1: Basic lab. Can create simple talismans.
ratings.2: Functional lab. -1 difficulty on creating permanent magical items.
ratings.3: Well-equipped lab. -1 difficulty on ritual development. Can attempt most known item creation.
ratings.4: Advanced facilities. -2 difficulty on item creation. Can attempt experimental work.
ratings.5: State-of-the-art. -2 difficulty on all lab work. Capable of breakthrough research.

Research.mechanics: Research rating adds dice to extended rolls for developing new rituals or paths.

Sanctity.description: Magical defenses protecting the chantry from supernatural intrusion.

ratings.1: Basic wards. +1 difficulty for hostile magic targeting the chantry.
ratings.2: Solid wards. +2 difficulty for hostile magic. Alarm wards on entrances.
ratings.3: Strong defenses. +2 difficulty for hostile magic, +1 difficulty for supernatural abilities used within by non-residents.
ratings.4: Powerful wards. +3 difficulty for hostile magic. Scrying is nearly impossible. Intruders may trigger automatic defensive effects.
ratings.5: Near-impenetrable. +3 difficulty for all hostile supernatural effects. Multiple layered defenses. May be partially phased from reality.

Sanctity.mechanics: Sanctity rating is added to the difficulty of any scrying or location magic targeting the chantry or its residents while inside.

Stores.description: Equipment, components, and material resources available.

ratings.1: Basic ritual components. Equivalent to Resources 2 for magical supplies.
ratings.2: Good stock. Equivalent to Resources 3 for magical supplies. Common components always available.
ratings.3: Well-stocked. Equivalent to Resources 4 for magical supplies. Rare components often available.
ratings.4: Extensive stores. Equivalent to Resources 5 for magical supplies. Can obtain most components within days.
ratings.5: Legendary hoard. Unique and priceless components. Can obtain nearly anything magical given time.

Stores.mechanics: Stores rating can substitute for personal Resources when acquiring ritual components or magical equipment.

access_by_rank.description: A Tremere's access to chantry resources depends on their rank in the Pyramid.

ranks.Apprentice (1st Circle): May use library with supervision. Limited lab access. Cannot requisition from stores without permission.
ranks.Apprentice (2nd-3rd Circle): Library access. Lab access with permission. May requisition common components.
ranks.Regent: Full library and lab access. May requisition any available components. Commands guardians.
ranks.Lord: Full access to all chantry resources. May command resources from subordinate chantries.
ranks.Pontifex: Can demand resources from any chantry in their region.
ranks.Councilor: Effectively unlimited access to Clan resources.

Small Town Chantry.description: A modest chantry in a small city, adequate for basic work.

Regional Chantry.description: A significant chantry serving as a regional center.

Vienna Chantry.description: The seat of Clan Tremere's power, unmatched in resources.

chantry_creation_guidelines.starting_points: Storytellers may assign 10-15 points to distribute among the five traits for a typical starting chantry.
chantry_creation_guidelines.minimum_ratings: Most functioning chantries have at least 1 in each trait.
chantry_creation_guidelines.specialization: Some chantries specialize (research chantry, militant chantry, etc.) with uneven distributions.

_meta.description: V20 Generation - Blood potency and limits
_meta.note: Generation determines maximum blood pool, blood per turn, and trait maximums

15th.notes: Thin-blooded. Can only use 6 blood points for powers. May have Thin Blood Flaw.

14th.notes: Can only use 8 blood points for powers/healing. Disciplines capped at 4.

13th.notes: Default starting Generation for most neonates.

9th.notes: Ancillae territory. Can spend 2 blood per turn.

5th.notes: Methuselah. Rarely active in modern nights.

3rd.notes: Antediluvians. The founders of the Clans. Near-godlike.

generation_background_cost.xp_note: Generation cannot normally be raised with XP except through diablerie

blood_spending.heal_aggravated: 5 blood points and 1 day per health level
blood_spending.raise_attribute: 1 blood point per die bonus (lasts one turn)
blood_spending.appear_human: 1 blood point per hour (blush of life)

meta.description: Kindred titles by sect with point values and privileges

prince.description: Enforces and interprets the Traditions; word is law in domain

justicar.description: May overturn any Princely decree; answerable only to Inner Council
justicar.notes: One per clan; activist Justicars may veto all but suggested policies

archon.description: Serves Justicars and Inner Council; above domain law
privileges: Cannot be held accountable for Tradition violations
Take necessary steps to stabilize wayward domains
archon.notes: Abuse of privilege risks Inner Council judgment

primogen.description: Clan representative; counsels Prince on domain matters
privileges: Force Prince to recognize vote on significant topic
primogen.notes: Failed forced vote = -1 Status for one month; two consecutive failures = permanent Status loss

sheriff.description: Enforces Prince's law; may violate Traditions with Prince's license
privileges: May breach Traditions under Prince's authority
sheriff.notes: Tradition-breaching Sheriffs may have effective Title Status of 1

harpy.description: Social arbiter; tracks boons and Status
privileges: Declare boons satisfied or still owed
Grant +2 Status (favor) or -1 Status (disfavor) for scene

optional_system.limit: One effect at a time per Harpy

alastor.description: Hunter of the Anathema; immune to governance while hunting
privileges: Not subject to Prince or Justicar declarations when hunting Anathema
+1 Status with elders who appreciate anti-thin-blood efforts
scourge.notes: Often unpopular with neonates; seen as elder lapdog

keeper_of_elysium.description: Host and security of Elysium; authority within those halls only
keeper_of_elysium.notes: Authority ends at Elysium boundaries; sometimes punitive appointment

privileges: Act in Prince's name when absent

regent.description: Overall Sabbat leader; ultimate sect authority

privileges: Authority over all packs in region

archbishop.description: Rules city or diocese; local absolute authority

priscus.description: Clan representative; advisory role to leadership

inquisitor.description: Roots out infiltrators and heresy within Sabbat
privileges: Authority to question any pack member

del_roh.description: Ultimate True Black Hand authority; rules from Underworld stronghold
privileges: Access to infinite vitae from thralls while in stronghold
del_roh.notes: Rarely sees physical world; focused on Underworld concerns

seraph.description: Physical world leaders; half in deep cover
seraph.notes: About half are deep-cover agents in Camarilla/Sabbat; wise Seraphim cultivate Alternate Identity

lich.notes: Former mages who used soul-excoriating rituals; Embrace extinguished magic but not knowledge

qadi.description: Judge interpreting millennia-old True Black Hand policy
qadi.notes: Heavy politicking behind scenes; old, terrible monsters

rawi.notes: Quasi-monastic tradition; Guarded Rubrics sometimes conflict with Book of Nod

shakar.description: Fanatical assassin seeking elevation through killing
shakar.notes: Feared by outsiders; little respect outside sect due to blind faith

quli.description: Enslaved Kindred laborer; retains will but broken by fear
penalties: -1 social dice pools with those who know title
Must slavishly follow orders in stronghold
quli.notes: Perform cruel tasks: kidnapping, murder, slave collection; often insane

monitor.description: Observes domain from concealment; may be most prominent local figure
privileges: May claim Praxis in some domains
monitor.notes: What Monitors who reveal themselves are up to is unknown

equite.notes: Name recalls Roman patrician cavalry; may be ironic or historical

emissary.description: Negotiator and diplomat for Anarch interests

privileges: Respect from those who value Golconda
transcendant.notes: False claimants pay half cost; discovered pretenders lose all benefit

consul.description: Cultural diplomat between sects or factions
privileges: Apply home Status in diplomatic domain
consul.notes: May be stranded if home revokes status; trust paramount

warden.description: Border patrol; beats boundaries against intruders
warden.notes: Overzealous Wardens who kill recognized Kindred face consequences

mystic.notes: Tremere and Tzimisce may resent; may be charlatan

status_benefit.description: Tie Status to title; lose title = lose Status
status_benefit.effect: High-stakes political aspect; meritocracy not always appropriate

titles_as_status_bonus.effect: Add title point value to Status dice pools for scene

negative_titles.description: Detriment titles that cannot be bought off
negative_titles.effect: -1 social dice pools with those aware of title
negative_titles.discovery: Concealed title if revealed may have worse consequences

meta.description: Prestation system - boons, debts, and favors among the Kindred

trivial.description: Easy to perform with little downside

minor.description: Requires going out of one's way; may have small permanent downside

major.description: Can alter domain affairs; significant personal risk or investment
examples: Convincing Prince to rescind hunting grounds
Casting opposite of expected political vote
Providing someone's police Allies with incriminating info

life.description: Sworn in dire circumstances; rarest and most valuable
examples: Some honor-bound Kindred die to fulfill
life.notes: Most often promised on moment's notice despite gravity; cannot be purchased with XP

requirements: Formal domains may require Elysium witness
Very formal domains require public declaration

rules: Affected party must be notified of transfer
No formal system in most domains - negotiated individually
trading.example: Katherine owes me, so I'll have her help you if you handle Pavel

verification.description: Methods to confirm boon status in heavy-handed domains

cheating.abuser_risk: Pattern damages reputation; powers may intervene
cheating.principle: A Kindred is only as good as her word

murder_for_debt.rationale: Elders hold most boons = most likely targets; must deter

implications: Can't keep promise = can't keep Masquerade

characteristics: Status heavily tied to boon networks
Elders accumulate vast networks over centuries
Temple of obligation underlies all society
Too much like the Ivory Tower
Pack members naturally watch each other's backs
No formal boon trading between individuals typically

clan_variations.tzimisce: Find prestation odious; masters grant privilege, not owe
clan_variations.antitribu: Necessary evil; learn rules, take advantage

characteristics: Tech-adept Anarchs use social media tracking
Online reputation systems like auction site ratings
Blood oaths currently fashionable for solemnity
anarchs.irony: As Anarchs become authority, prestation becomes subversion tool against them

characteristics: Status from unearthing secrets, solving mysteries
Complex fealties and internal secret societies
Assumes members help each other (fanatical devotion)
Deep-cover agents cultivate prestation in other sects
Outside obligations taken seriously for cover

known_example.text: The power of Christ shall strike me dead should I stray in this faith
known_example.notes: Whether florid phrasing or expected outcome unknown

assamite.exceptions: May use to establish long-term domain presence

giovanni.specialty: Offer 'exchange rates' - buy favors for liquid resources
giovanni.concern: Elders wary of Necromancers cornering market

ravnos.problem: Often on receiving end of screw-jobs

setites.preference: Payment on own terms; blood mastery

inter_sect.rationale: Rogue who breaks promise to one may break promise to you
complications: May lose Status or titles for 'outside' dealing
May need to tithe vitae or accept blood bonds
Liberal domains may pave way for others

examples: Gangrel, Malkavian, Brujah may close ranks
Disenfranchised clans value Blood over sect

_meta.description: V20 Clans - All 13 Clans plus Caitiff

Assamite.weakness: Due to the Tremere blood-curse, consuming another Kindred's blood causes one automatic level of unsoakable lethal damage per blood point. Diablerie causes aggravated damage equal to victim's permanent Willpower; no benefits gained.
Assamite.organization: Hierarchical, ruled by the Old Man of the Mountain from Alamut
Assamite.description: Silent assassins who hire out to other Kindred. Devoted to Haqim and the pursuit of lowering their Generation.

Brujah.weakness: Difficulties to resist or guide frenzy are two higher than normal. May never spend Willpower to avoid frenzy (though can spend to end one in progress).
Brujah.organization: Loose, divided between Idealists and Iconoclasts
Brujah.description: Rebels and provocateurs, passionate and quick to anger. Once philosopher-kings, now revolutionary rabble.

Followers of Set.weakness: Light-sensitive; add two to difficulties for actions in bright lights. Sunlight does an extra level of aggravated damage.
Followers of Set.description: Corruptors and tempters devoted to their dark god Set. Seek to release all beings from the chains of morality.

Gangrel.weakness: Each frenzy leaves a permanent animal feature (ears, claws, snout, etc.). After five such features, Social Attributes begin to drop.
Gangrel.description: Feral survivors and loners. Close to the Beast, often wandering the wilderness.

Giovanni.weakness: The Kiss causes excruciating pain rather than pleasure. Victims take an additional two levels of damage from feeding.
Giovanni.description: A family of necromancers and financiers. Embrace mostly from within the mortal Giovanni family.

Lasombra.weakness: Cast no reflection in mirrors, cameras, or other reflective surfaces. This makes maintaining the Masquerade difficult.
Lasombra.description: Shadow lords and leaders of the Sabbat. Masters of darkness itself.

Malkavian.weakness: All Malkavians are insane; each has at least one permanent derangement that can never be cured.
Malkavian.common_backgrounds: Either broad and shallow, or few and deep
Malkavian.description: Seers cursed with insanity. Their madness often grants terrible insight.

Nosferatu.weakness: Appearance 0 permanently. Cannot raise Appearance with experience. Breach the Masquerade merely by being seen.
Nosferatu.description: Hideously deformed information brokers who dwell in the sewers and shadows.

Ravnos.weakness: Each Ravnos has a specific vice they must indulge. When opportunity arises, must roll Self-Control/Instinct (difficulty 6+) or succumb.
Ravnos.description: Tricksters and illusionists, compelled by their blood to indulge vice.

Toreador.weakness: Entranced by beauty. When encountering something truly beautiful, must roll Self-Control/Instinct (difficulty 6) or become captivated.
Toreador.description: Artists and aesthetes, passionate lovers of beauty in all forms.

Tremere.weakness: All Tremere are one step blood bound to the Council of Seven. Additionally, their blood is easily identified and tracked by other Tremere.
Tremere.organization: Rigid pyramid hierarchy based in Vienna
Tremere.description: Blood sorcerers organized in a strict hierarchy. Created their immortality through forbidden magic.

Tzimisce.weakness: Must rest with at least two handfuls of native soil (from birthplace or Embrace site). Without it, halve dice pools each day.
Tzimisce.description: Alien flesh-shapers and former lords of Eastern Europe. Masters of the horrific art of Vicissitude.

Ventrue.weakness: Can only feed from a specific type of prey (chosen at character creation). All other blood is vomited.
Ventrue.description: Aristocratic leaders and would-be kings. The self-appointed rulers of vampire society.

Caitiff.weakness: No Clan support. -2 on all social rolls with Clanned vampires who know their status. Cannot take Generation Background. Higher experience costs for Disciplines.
Caitiff.description: Clanless vampires whose blood is too thin to pass on Clan characteristics. Despised outcasts.

_meta.description: V20 Bloodlines - Nine bloodlines from Lore of the Bloodlines
_meta.source: Vampire: The Masquerade 20th Anniversary Edition - Lore of the Bloodlines

Baali.weakness: Vulnerable to faith and holy symbols. Characters with True Faith can damage Baali with holy symbols, dealing their Faith rating in aggravated damage per turn of contact. Additionally, Baali carry an aura of corruption that attracts pestilence and vermin.
Baali.origin: Founded by brothers Nergal and Moloch who consumed the blood of the 'First People' - beings buried by God before humanity.
Baali.description: Demon-worshipping vampires bound to dark entities beyond the veil. They seek to hasten the end of the world and profit from the chaos. Despite their reputation as devils, they claim to be more anti-God than pro-Devil.
Baali.organization: Covens led by high priests, often structured like cults or pyramid schemes

stereotypes.Camarilla: Fear us as bogeymen, which suits us fine
stereotypes.Sabbat: Useful pawns who think they understand darkness
stereotypes.Tremere: Their blood magic is a pale imitation of true power

Daughters of Cacophony.weakness: Constantly hear 'the Fugue' - an ever-present background music that only they can perceive. This can be distracting and may eventually drive them to madness.
Daughters of Cacophony.origin: Originally created by the Tal'Mahe'Ra as weapons to drive Camarilla leaders mad through song. The experiment went awry, creating something new.
Daughters of Cacophony.description: Masters of the supernatural voice who can entrance, madden, or destroy with song. Most maintain neutral political stances to avoid drawing attention.
Daughters of Cacophony.organization: Loose, often solitary. Some gather in small groups (Choristers) or form industry networks (Quiet Celebrities)

factions.Choristers: Group performers who work together to amplify their powers
factions.Sisters of the Fugue: Mystics who listen deeply to the Fugue for insight
factions.Quiet Celebrities: Control entertainment industry, create identities for famous Daughters

stereotypes.Toreador: Respect our abilities, but we are not merely artists
stereotypes.Malkavian: Share our madness, but express it differently
stereotypes.Tal'Mahe'Ra: Our former masters watch silently - we keep their secrets

Gargoyles.weakness: Susceptible to mind control; Willpower is treated as 2 lower when resisting Dominate, Presence, or similar powers. Many also carry additional weaknesses based on their variant type.
Gargoyles.parent_clan: Created from Gangrel, Nosferatu, and Tzimisce blood
Gargoyles.origin: Created by Tremere mage Virstania in the 12th century through the ritual 'At Our Command It Breathes.' Originally slaves, they won freedom after Virstania led a revolt.
Gargoyles.description: Stone-skinned vampires created through Tremere blood magic. Capable of flight and incredible durability. Many still serve the Tremere, while others fiercely guard their freedom.
Gargoyles.organization: Often attached to Tremere chantries, or independent broods. The Montmartre Pact of 1489 granted them freedom.

creation_methods.Ritual: Created via 'At Our Command It Breathes' - requires multiple corpses and alchemical process
creation_methods.Embrace: Can Embrace like normal vampires, creating true Gargoyle childer

Scout.weakness: Health penalties from injuries double as body turns to stone

Sentinel.weakness: All dice pools halved when truly alone without master/ally/friend

Warrior.weakness: Body part turns to stone during frenzy, causing automatic failures on related rolls until next evening

stereotypes.Tremere: Our creators - some serve them still, others never forgive
stereotypes.Gangrel: Part of our blood, they understand our bestial nature
stereotypes.Nosferatu: We share their curse of appearance

Harbingers of Skulls.weakness: Their flesh is rotted and corpse-like, stuck in various stages of decay. Appearance cannot exceed 0. They must wear masks or concealing clothing to interact with mortals.
Harbingers of Skulls.origin: Survivors of the Giovanni purge of the Cappadocians. Trapped in the Underworld for centuries, they returned seeking vengeance.
Harbingers of Skulls.description: Skull-faced vampires obsessed with death and revenge against the Giovanni. Many follow Lazarus, a mysterious figure who may be a Cappadocian elder or something else entirely.
Harbingers of Skulls.organization: Loose association bound by hatred of Giovanni. Some follow the teachings of Lazarus or Japheth.

stereotypes.Giovanni: They destroyed our Clan and will pay for eternity
stereotypes.Cappadocians: Our true lineage, betrayed and murdered

talmahra_notes.enoch_presence: The majority of Harbingers who escaped through the Shadowlands found their way to Enoch. They were treated as hallowed guests, wronged by their Giovanni cousins.
talmahra_notes.role: Trade safe harbor and freedom to study the Labyrinth's mysteries for maintenance and defense of Enoch. Act as spies, peering through the Shroud to observe Kindred meetings.
talmahra_notes.lazarus: The Methuselah Lazarus led them to Enoch and now directs campaigns against targets—particularly Setite locations—creating shadow bastions for the Tal'Mahe'Ra.
talmahra_notes.parting_the_veil: Developed a ritual allowing them to lure mortals into the Shadowlands for feeding, even while trapped there.

Kiasyd.weakness: Vulnerable to cold iron - contact causes 1 level of aggravated damage per turn. Additionally, they are compelled to count or organize scattered small objects.
Kiasyd.origin: Founded by Marconius, who entered the Abyss with his sister Hrotsuitha and emerged transformed by drinking fae blood and other substances.
Kiasyd.description: Tall, pale scholars with solid black eyes and elongated features. Obsessed with knowledge, collection, and experimentation. Practice blood alchemy, creating cocktails from supernatural blood.
Kiasyd.organization: Loosely connected through 'Great Symposiums' - gatherings where they share knowledge and blood cocktails

special_rules.alchemy: Can create blood cocktails with temporary supernatural effects
special_rules.necromancy_option: May take Necromancy instead of Dominate, but gain Clan Enmity (Giovanni) and Clan Enmity (Harbingers of Skulls) without freebie compensation

stereotypes.Lasombra: Our parent Clan looks down on us, but we've surpassed them in knowledge
stereotypes.Giovanni: Threatened us over necromancy research - we officially never practiced it
stereotypes.Ravnos: Share our interest in dreams and illusions

Nagaraja.weakness: Must consume flesh as well as blood. For every blood point consumed, must also eat an equivalent amount of flesh (roughly one pound). Feeding is always lethal and extremely messy.
Nagaraja.origin: Death mages in ancient Enoch who used Cainite blood to transform themselves into beings of both life and death, serving as keepers of the First City.
Nagaraja.description: Cannibalistic vampires who must consume flesh as well as blood. Secretive members of the True Black Hand, they possess knowledge of death and the spirit world.
Nagaraja.organization: Part of the Tal'Mahe'Ra hierarchy, often working as agents or scholars

special_disciplines.vitreous_path: A Necromancy path focusing on ghosts and the Shadowlands

stereotypes.Giovanni: Think they invented necromancy - they merely rediscovered our arts
stereotypes.Samedi: Some say we created them - we make no such claims

idran_philosophy.creation: Ancient Idran realized they needed vampire necromancers answering only to them to safeguard Enoch. They magically altered Setite blood (supposedly cleansed of Sutekh's influence) to create the Nagaraja.
idran_philosophy.wheel_doctrine: Idran believe Enoch represents the Wheel of Life and Death. If evil claims the Basalt Throne, Gehenna becomes unleashing of Naraka-hells on Earth rather than liberation.
idran_philosophy.yamasattva: The deathless magi (yamasattva) claim that according to the Guarded Rubrics, the Nagaraja have been entrusted with Enoch's secrets and sent forth with enigmatic tasks.
idran_philosophy.setite_enmity: Fall on Followers of Set as anonymous executioners, refusing to ever speak to them. They know mystic sympathies once broken can be remade.

Salubri.weakness: Third eye opens when using Disciplines or in presence of those in pain/distress. Eye weeps blood when feeding (1 blood point lost per feeding). Known Salubri are hunted by Tremere.
Salubri.origin: One of the original 13 Clans, descended from Saulot. The Tremere diablerized Saulot and began a pogrom that nearly exterminated the Clan.
Salubri.description: Healers and warriors marked by a third eye. Seek Golconda and protect humanity. Divided into Healers (Obeah) and Warriors (Valeren). Most hide among mortal communities.
Salubri.organization: Small, scattered groups. Mentorship-based Embrace. Various factions include Healers, Warriors, Wu Zao (Eastern), al-Amin (Islamic), and the controversial 'Seven'.

Warriors_Antitribu.focus: Combat, protection, led by Adonai in Sabbat

Wu_Zao.focus: Eastern branch, divided into Scholars and Thieves

al_Amin.focus: Islamic covenant, formerly part of Ashirra

stereotypes.Tremere: Usurpers who diablerized our founder and hunt us still
stereotypes.Camarilla: Endorsed our genocide - we hide from them
stereotypes.Sabbat: The antitribu have found a place there, but at what cost?

Samedi.weakness: Appear as rotting corpses regardless of age or blood consumed. Appearance may not exceed 0. The decay is real - they smell of death and rot.
Samedi.parent_clan: Unknown (possibly connected to Baron Samedi, a loa)
Samedi.origin: Emerged from Caribbean voudoun traditions. May have been created by Baron Samedi himself, or may simply honor him. Possible connection to Cappadocians or Nagaraja.
Samedi.description: Putrid vampires who appear as walking corpses. Strongly connected to voudoun traditions and death imagery. Often work as mercenaries or in death-related industries.
Samedi.organization: Loose, often solitary. Strong presence in Caribbean, New Orleans, and areas with voudoun traditions

special_notes.giovanni_relationship: Complex relationship - possible shared origin with Baron, mutual interest in death
special_notes.necromancy_option: Some have a knack for Necromancy, others find it difficult (varies by individual)

stereotypes.Giovanni: Our relationship is complicated - possibly family, possibly rivals
stereotypes.Harbingers of Skulls: Offer to teach Necromancy, but their strings are tangled

True Brujah.weakness: Cannot frenzy - but also cannot spend Willpower to achieve automatic successes on any roll. Their emotional detachment makes them seem cold and alien.
True Brujah.origin: The true descendants of Brujah before Troile diablerized the Antediluvian and spread his passionate, rage-filled blood. The True Brujah have been in hiding ever since.
True Brujah.description: Time-manipulating scholars who claim to be the original Brujah bloodline. Emotionally detached and dedicated to study. Work to preserve knowledge and stay out of the Jyhad.
True Brujah.organization: Part of Tal'Mahe'Ra, maintain secret vaults of knowledge across the world

factions.Unmakers: Seek to destroy the 'traitor Brujah' and undo Troile's treachery
factions.Guardians: Preserve lore in hidden vaults protected from time itself

special_rules.true_celerity: May learn a variant Celerity that slows time rather than speeding the user
special_rules.infiltration: Often pose as regular Brujah within Camarilla or Sabbat

stereotypes.Brujah: Traitors who murdered our founder - some seek vengeance, others patience
stereotypes.Followers of Set: Honest about their dishonesty - useful information brokers

Maeghar.weakness: Three-part weakness: (1) Rolls to recognize Maeghar as otherworldly are at -1 difficulty. (2) Cold iron weapons deal aggravated damage and trigger immediate frenzy/Rötschreck roll. (3) Must drain victim's blood into a clean container before consuming—cannot feed directly from warm humans.
Maeghar.origin: The Maeghar are not a true bloodline but a collection of accidents—mixtures of vampiric blood and fae-blooded wyrd. When the Kiasyd purges began during the Renaissance, these scattered individuals fled and abandoned their old name.
Maeghar.description: Disenfranchised wanderers who stay nowhere long, own little beyond cherished collections, and maintain ties to neither humans nor other Cainites. Many have become so disconnected they focus solely on the world of ash and death. Each carries a physical mark exposing their wyrd nature—from subtle (snow-white skin) to obvious (six arms).
Maeghar.organization: Solitary by nature. When two Maeghar meet, they engage in non-committal but exceedingly polite discourse to determine if exchanging information or boons is worthwhile. Many have allied with the Tal'Mahe'Ra for mutual benefit.
Maeghar.embrace_notes: A Maeghar rarely Embraces—she feels little need for companionship. If she does, it's for a specific skillset; the childe is either destroyed or freed when the purpose is met. To create another Maeghar, the sire MUST embrace a fae-blooded mortal; otherwise the childe is always Caitiff.

special_rules.discipline_choice: Player chooses Mytherceria OR Necromancy as first in-clan Discipline at character creation
special_rules.physical_mark: Every Maeghar carries a physical mark of their fae nature—work with Storyteller to determine appropriate Merit/Flaw (e.g., Eerie Presence, Ambidexterity for extra limbs)
special_rules.collections: Typically owns a large collection of small, often disturbing items (finger bones, children's teeth, tattooed skin, broken dreams)

stereotypes.Camarilla: Lofty ideals and pretenses. Such a thin veneer. 'All Cainites are Kindred?' We know better.
stereotypes.Kiasyd: Not our fight. Give Marconius and his brood a wide berth. Do not even let them know you exist.
stereotypes.Nagaraja: We might learn a lot from these powerful necromancers. If only their feeding habits weren't so revolting.
stereotypes.Old Clan Tzimisce: Very polite. Good grasp of etiquette. An appreciation for the fineries of life.
stereotypes.Sabbat: Stay away. Not only are they unmannered and crass, but this is Marconius' playground.
stereotypes.Tal'Mahe'Ra: A collection of old relics steeped in death. Yes, this will do nicely for us.
stereotypes.True Brujah: Scholars. Excellent academics. Just a tad boring, but they are forgiven for that.

Maeghar.source: V20 The Black Hand: A Guide to the Tal'Mahe'Ra

Old Clan Tzimisce.weakness: Same as Clan Tzimisce—must rest with at least two handfuls of native soil or lose dice from all pools cumulatively each night away. However, Old Clan LACK Vicissitude and view it as a demonic corruption from Kupala.
Old Clan Tzimisce.origin: Before Kupala corrupted the Clan, the Eldest found a well in a city venerating entities like himself. He educated their kine and was enlightened in turn. The Old Clan descends from those who never accepted Kupala's Vicissitude, viewing it as a demonic crutch that weakens true mastery.
Old Clan Tzimisce.description: The Old Clan believe Vicissitude is the Eldest's test—a trap to separate wheat from chaff. Those who depend on it will be consumed when the Eldest gathers the Clan. True Tzimisce mastery comes from understanding flesh, bone, and land without supernatural shortcuts. They practice Koldunism (the original kraina sorcery) rather than Vicissitude-enhanced fleshcrafting.
Old Clan Tzimisce.organization: Central core of the Order of Moloch within the Tal'Mahe'Ra. The Oradea League loosely confederates independent Eastern European Old Clan adhering to the Tradition of Hospitality. They pity main Clan Tzimisce as 'vessels of the Eldest' rather than individuals.

philosophy.vicissitude_view: A crutch preventing true enlightenment; a cheat bypassing genuine comprehension of living matter; the Eldest's trap to identify the unworthy
philosophy.kupala_view: A demon whose corruption spreads through Vicissitude; the Old Clan never betrayed their kraina to bow to this demon-god
philosophy.clan_role: Tzimisce are the land and rule it—all who tread upon it belong to them. The Eldest's art; they are his work, not his students

special_rules.no_vicissitude: Old Clan Tzimisce cannot learn Vicissitude. If exposed to Kupala's corruption, they may resist with a Willpower roll or begin transformation into standard Tzimisce.
special_rules.koldunism: May learn Koldunism (Koldunic Sorcery) as out-of-Clan Discipline. Primary kraina tied to their native land.
special_rules.order_of_moloch: Most are members of the Order of Moloch, the Tal'Mahe'Ra's anti-infernalist arm

stereotypes.Bahari: The dissonance in your comprehension does not mean it is not so. Those who know, do. The point is to understand.
stereotypes.Harbingers of Skulls: Gratitude is the key to unlocking all doors.
stereotypes.Nergali: We know who controls the Ivory Tower. A sewer drain rejects nothing and accepts everything.
stereotypes.Order of Moloch: The housekeeper's irony: others notice only when it is not done.
stereotypes.Tal'Mahe'Ra: It is important for the left hand to know what the right hand is doing. Always bite the hand that feeds you and extend it to the other.
stereotypes.Tzimisce (main Clan): Vessels of the Eldest, not individuals. We speak at them, not to them—direct communication with the master.

Old Clan Tzimisce.source: V20 The Black Hand: A Guide to the Tal'Mahe'Ra

Cappadocian.weakness: The pallor of the grave marks all Cappadocians. They appear corpse-like, with sunken features and waxy skin. Reduce Appearance by 1 (minimum 1) at Embrace, and social rolls with mortals who notice their deathly mien are at +2 difficulty.
Cappadocian.origin: Founded by Cappadocius, the Cappadocians were scholars of death who sought to understand the afterlife. They were systematically destroyed by the Giovanni in the 15th century during the Conspiracy of Isaac.
Cappadocian.description: The Clan of Death were scholars and priests obsessed with understanding mortality and the great mysteries of what lay beyond. They studied the Shadowlands, communed with ghosts, and sought answers to the ultimate questions. Their destruction at the hands of their own 'guests,' the Giovanni family, remains one of the greatest betrayals in Kindred history.
Cappadocian.organization: Monastic and scholarly, with major holdings in Anatolia and the Middle East. The Cappadocian monastery of Erciyes was their spiritual center.
Cappadocian.historical_note: Destroyed circa 1444 CE. Survivors include the Harbingers of Skulls (escaped the Shadowlands) and rare individuals like Apacia who evaded the purge through circumstance.
Cappadocian.feast_of_folly: In the 13th century, Cappadocius instituted the Feast of Folly, judging his clan and sealing those deemed unworthy in the tomb-city of Kaymakli. This weakened the clan before the Giovanni betrayal.

stereotypes.Giovanni: Our destroyers, who we foolishly invited into our home
stereotypes.Harbingers of Skulls: Our survivors, driven mad by centuries in the Shadowlands
stereotypes.Sabbat: Some of us found refuge among the Sword of Caine

notable_survivors.Apacia: 6th Generation, Embraced ~500 BCE. Survived through association with the Sabbat.
notable_survivors.Lazarus: Ancient Methuselah who led the Harbingers from the Underworld

Discerning Palate.description: Your selective palate allows you to discern specific traits in blood samples. With a taste, determine potency, freshness, species, contamination, and attempt to identify Generation, age, and Clan of vampires.
Discerning Palate.system: Roll Perception + Awareness (diff 8). 1 success: relative potency/freshness, known species, Generation within 2 steps, age over/under 100 years, same Clan. 2 successes: contamination by disease/poison, Generation within 4 steps, age within 50 years (if <300), any previously tasted Clan. 3+ successes: specific contaminants previously sampled, Generation within 6 steps, age within 25 years (if <600), any Clan and family previously tasted.

Methuselah's Thirst.description: You can no longer sustain yourself on mortal blood and must feed on Kindred or other supernatural creatures with potent reserves (lupines, faeries, etc.).

Grand Library.description: You've amassed an exquisite collection of books. Choose 3 Knowledges per 2 points (or 10 Knowledge dots for 7 points). While working in your library, difficulty for rolls involving those Knowledges reduced by 2.

Berserker.description: You can willingly enter a berserker state for a scene. While berserking: ignore wound penalties, reduce difficulty of all combat rolls (except dodges) by 3. Cannot take complex actions other than combat, dodging, or running.

Arcane.description: You slip from notice with an aura of forgetfulness. Those trying to remember you experience jamais-vu. Each dot subtracts one die from pools to locate you or recall you from memory. Can 'turn off' at will. Doesn't help in combat or overt stealth. Ceases to function while you have Status or Fame.

Entrepreneur.description: Making money comes naturally. All rolls involving acquiring money through business dealings have difficulty reduced by 2.

Paragon.description: Others find you particularly compelling. Select one Background from: Allies, Contacts, Domain, Fame, Herd, Influence, Mentor, Resources, Retainers, or Status. Receive 1 free dot in that Background, and your maximum rating may exceed normal Generational limits by 1.

Vulgar.description: Tact is foreign to you—you're famous for being abrasive and unpleasant. Rolls involving social graces or delicate situations suffer +1 difficulty.

Oathbreaker.description: You once swore fealty to a lord/organization or made a binding contract, then broke it publicly. Difficulty of Social rolls to convince someone of your trustworthiness increased by 3. Even coterie members may have reservations.

Apostate.description: You've been inducted into the Nergali Baali through their initiation rite. Replace one in-Clan Discipline with Daimoinon, but gain Baali Clan weakness on top of your standard weakness. Can still pass for former Clan. Any childe you Embrace is indistinguishable from standard Baali. Cannot take if already Baali.
Apostate.system: Initiation: drained completely by Baali nest-master, who extracts still-beating heart from mortal, fills with his blood, buries in Well of Sacrifice. Initiate swims through gore to find and consume the heart.

Without a Trace.description: In wilderness, earth fills in your footprints. You leave no noticeable traces, not even scent. Normal tracking attempts automatically fail. Supernatural tracking attempts at +2 difficulty.

Psychic Leech.description: At cost of 1 Willpower, feed on victim's Willpower from a distance. Consumed Willpower becomes temporary blood points (dissipate at night's end). Can be spent like normal blood but cannot be lost to damage/drain, don't affect hunger frenzy rolls, cannot create/sustain blood bonds or ghouls. Requires: target has at least 1 of your blood points in system, eye contact.

Kiss of Death.description: If you drain a mortal completely, within minutes of heart stopping the corpse rises as a free-willed, hostile zombie that cannot be directed without sorcerous/necromantic means.

Devil's Mark.description: You bear an anatomical aberration manifesting demonic taint—bestial eyes, hooves, horns, scaly skin, sigil birthmark, parasitic infestation, claws, misshapen teeth, extra limbs, etc. Cannot be removed or 'improved' though magic/Disciplines can hide it.
Devil's Mark.system: Lower maximum rating in one Attribute by 1; cost to raise that Attribute increases by 1. If mark visible/known to mortal: -1 difficulty on Intimidation, +1 difficulty on all other Social rolls with them.

Lord of the Night.description: Lights dim in your presence, tiny flames extinguish, shadows cling to you or move with surreal unlife. Impossible to pass as human. Your shadow is a malicious entity—lashes at friends and enemies, tears at scenery, snarls at passers-by. Suppress for a scene by spending 1 Willpower.

Vassal of the Clan.description: You bear permanent blood bonds to lower-Generation clanmates: 1-point bond to those 1 Generation lower, 2-point to those 2 lower, 3-point (full) to those 3+ lower. These override any other blood bonds. Extremely dangerous for Hand members as it forces allegiance to potentially risky or heretical vampires.

Via Hyron (Path of the Hive).bearing: Justice - Abelenes carry an atmosphere of divine retribution. Bearing modifier affects rolls to convince others of the righteousness of their actions.
basic_beliefs: The true enemies of Creation are the Children of the Outer Dark (Sleepers)—demons, devils, fallen angels trapped by the One Above
Invoking the blasphemous names of these entities rouses them from slumber
The Sleepers must be appeased through chaos and destruction—burn half the world or watch all Creation erupt in flame
Via Hyron is NOT infernalistic—it opposes infernalism as the most dangerous threat
All vampires are children of Abel (not Caine), angels of vengeance blessed by the One Above
Via Hyron (Path of the Hive).abelene_heresy: Contends that Abel showed Caine the way of blood sacrifice. Caine sacrificed Abel and was cursed. The One Above resurrected Abel as an immortal angel of vengeance with a beast's heart. Lucifer cursed Abel to the night out of jealousy.
ethics: Be the Angel of Vengeance—exact Abel's toll from Caine's children
Combat institutional religion—all are masks for Lucifer's church, including the Book of Nod
Always be within a Nest—the Hive structure counters the infernal
Destroy infernalists and all trace of Sleeper names from Creation

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Extinguishing a mortal life for no purpose
hierarchy_of_sins.9: Asking for something in return for services
hierarchy_of_sins.8: Refusing to aid those who have not served the Children of the Outer Dark
hierarchy_of_sins.7: Failing to ride the wave in frenzy
hierarchy_of_sins.6: Breaking your word to another Cainite
hierarchy_of_sins.4: Failing to tend the Sleepers through sacrifice
hierarchy_of_sins.3: Failing to destroy an infernalist or infernal artifact
hierarchy_of_sins.2: Allowing an infernalist to survive or go unpunished
hierarchy_of_sins.1: Actively serving the Sleepers or accepting infernal power

Path of the Scorched Heart.bearing: Cold - The Unforgiving are utterly emotionless and calculating. Bearing modifier affects rolls requiring detached analysis.
Path of the Scorched Heart.followers: True Brujah, scholars, those seeking to silence the Beast through pure reason
basic_beliefs: Emotion is the sole tool of the Beast, its only avenue of control
Reality can be understood and quantified when not clouded by emotion
Right and wrong are atavistic emotional concepts—favor ethics over morality
Trust only what you can verify; assume nothing
Knowledge is never wasted—learn all you can to predict others' actions
Path of the Scorched Heart.history: Conceived by True Brujah Rathmonicus in the 14th century. He compiled philosophies on quieting the Beast into the Book of the Empty Heart. Only three verified copies of the original Greek survive.
ethics: Quench all emotion by drowning it in frigid waters of reason
Trust only what you can verify—draw no conclusion without proof
Learn all you can; knowledge is never wasted
Define the nature of all relationships explicitly—never presume honesty or loyalty
Be honest to a fault—truth is a weapon, wield it

hierarchy_of_sins.10: Failing to acquire knowledge that is safely and readily available
hierarchy_of_sins.9: Committing to any action without purpose
hierarchy_of_sins.8: Sacrificing when you gain less than you lose
hierarchy_of_sins.7: Relying on others when you could act alone
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Acting rashly without observation and calculation

Path of Self-Focus.bearing: Balance - Internalists carry an atmosphere of tranquil peace. Bearing modifier affects rolls to avoid confrontation or calm others.
Path of Self-Focus.followers: Nagaraja, Eastern Hand members, those seeking harmony with the Beast
basic_beliefs: Purpose is an illusion; the universe proceeds of its own accord
Attempting to change a thing will only change you
Conscious inaction and acceptance of all things quiets the Beast
To be free of the Beast, one must welcome it or invite misery
Questions point to the way; answers are an end, and the universe is a way
Only the ever-present moment holds the way of things
Path of Self-Focus.history: Emerged in 6th century CE from cultural exchange between Asian and Middle Eastern vampires. Zen Buddhism and Laozi's Wu Wei concepts merged in Ashirra courts. The Nagaraja nurtured these concepts within the Tal'Mahe'Ra.
ethics: Exist only in the moment—pay no mind to past or future
Nothing is exclusive or separate—know yourself and the Beast utterly
To mourn suggests the universe is wrong—when hungry, feed; when threatened, kill
Better to be underestimated than overestimated
Meaning is invention of the heart; actions are the language of the universe
A being's responsibility is to itself, not others

hierarchy_of_sins.8: Laziness (an ant on the move does more than a sleeping elephant)
hierarchy_of_sins.7: Interfering in the universe's natural course
hierarchy_of_sins.5: Failing to treat others as you would be treated
hierarchy_of_sins.4: Preventing others from acting according to their natures
hierarchy_of_sins.2: Placing excessive value on a single being or thing
hierarchy_of_sins.1: Attempting to change the fundamental nature of something

_meta.description: The three castes of Clan Assamite

Warrior.role: The executioners and soldiers of the clan. They carry out contracts and defend Alamut.
Warrior.notes: The most numerous caste, and what most Kindred think of when they hear 'Assamite.'

Vizier.role: Advisors, scholars, and craftsmen. They serve as diplomats and strategists.
Vizier.weakness: Compelled toward perfectionism. Must roll Willpower (difficulty 6) to abandon a project or accept imperfect work.
Vizier.notes: Less common than Warriors, Viziers often serve as the public face of the clan.

Sorcerer.role: Blood mages who practice the ancient arts of Dur-An-Ki. They divine the future and work rituals.
Sorcerer.weakness: Haunted by visions and omens. -1 to all dice pools when acting against a vision's guidance.
Sorcerer.notes: The rarest caste. Their blood sorcery predates Tremere Thaumaturgy.

assamite-castes.antitribu_note: Assamite antitribu in the Sabbat belong to the 'Lost Tribe' and maintain caste distinctions. The most ancient, Dastur Anosh, was a Vizier caste Seraph of the Black Hand.

_meta.description: Guidelines for creating elder characters (8th generation and below)

Elder.notes: Major powers, significant Backgrounds, extended Discipline ratings

Methuselah.notes: Rarely playable. Often suffer from ennui, mental degradation, or long torpor cycles

elder_trait_guidelines.attributes: Elders often have multiple Attributes at 4-5, with some at 6+ for low generations
elder_trait_guidelines.abilities: Specialties become common; many Abilities at 4-5 with historical skills that may be anachronistic
elder_trait_guidelines.disciplines: Extended ratings (6+) common for clan Disciplines; multiple out-of-clan Disciplines
elder_trait_guidelines.backgrounds: Extensive networks. 4-5 dot Backgrounds are common. Many elders have 6+ effective dots through multiple investments

torpor_considerations.description: Long-lived vampires often spend centuries in torpor, which affects their memories and adaptation to the modern world
torpor_considerations.memory_loss: Extended torpor may cause Amnesia (Flaw) or lost memories of mortal life/early unlife
torpor_considerations.culture_shock: Elders waking from torpor often struggle with modern technology, social norms, and political structures
torpor_considerations.example_from_book: Lados (8th Gen Malkavian) spent ~2000 years in torpor, waking to a world utterly alien to him

npc_profile_template.source_note: Based on character profiles in V20 Children of the Revolution

_meta.description: New Thaumaturgy and blood sorcery paths from Rites of the Blood

Path of the Levinbolt.description: Control over electricity. Practitioners cause static, flickering lights, and power surges.

1.name: Flicker
1.effect: Shut down electrical device for 10 min/success

2.name: Spark
2.effect: Touch discharge: 4L damage, shorts ungrounded electronics

3.name: Illuminate
3.effect: Electrical aura: power device OR 8L touch damage

4.name: Thor's Fury
4.effect: Ranged lightning: 1L/success, Perc+Science vs 6+range

5.name: Eye of the Storm
5.effect: Electrical barrier: immune to ranged, 2 agg to touch

Path of Spirit Manipulation.description: Control spirits (Umbrood) through Hermetic methods. Spirits are not truly sentient.

1.name: Hermetic Sight
1.effect: See spirit realm overlay, 1 hour + 30min/success

2.name: Astral Cant
2.effect: Speak spirit languages, 15min + 15min/success

3.name: Voice of Command
3.effect: One command to spirit, contested Willpower

4.name: Entrap Ephemera
4.effect: Bind spirit into vessel, extended contest

5.name: Duality
5.effect: Exist in material and spirit simultaneously, 1 scene

Mastery of the Mortal Shell.description: Control physical bodies, both dead and living.

1.name: Preserve
1.effect: Halt decay, 1 day/success

2.name: Animate
2.effect: Simple corpse motion, 1 hour/success

3.name: Sculpt Flesh
3.effect: Minor reshaping, permanent

4.name: Transfer Essence
4.effect: Possess prepared corpse, 1 hour/success

5.name: Usurp the Shell
5.effect: Possess living mortal, contested Willpower

1.name: Iron Will
1.effect: +2 dice resist mental influence, 1 scene

2.name: Perfect Recall
2.effect: Eidetic memory since last sunrise

The Hunter's Winds.description: Track and pursue prey across any distance. Assamite signature path.

Path of Phobos.description: Make victims' fears appear real. Infernalist preferred path.

Fires of the Inferno.description: Summon balefire from Hell. Green, malignant flame.

1.name: Lighter

Azrael.note: Prefers feminine form, tricks victims into service

Arsenal of the Beast.effect: Grow weapon (claws/fangs/horns/etc). Str+2L, WP for agg

Enmity Purge.effect: Touch+blood: dredge up bigotry, act on impulses

Essence to Ash.effect: Spend permanent WP to heal 2 agg

Telepathic Worm.effect: WP: mental pain when target thinks of specific person, 1 month

_meta.description: Sabbat Auctoritas and Faction Ritae

ritae.Irad's Wall: Block spirits/astral forms from area until sunrise
ritae.The Renunciation: Initiation, +1 die Self-Control/Instinct for faction goals

ritae.Atra Sacramentum: 2 agg damage, no Clan weakness for 1 night
ritae.The Last Rites: Know when Vinculum-linked target dies, reclaim soul

Loyalist.philosophy: Freedom, minimal hierarchy, Native American influences

ritae.Martyr's Eyes: Permanent warning when blood-linked in danger
